Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, probably wouldn't visit again!”
Reviews.Author: helloanniekitty
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, myself and two friends stayed at the Royal National Hotel on 6th March 2012 for two nights. We booked a quad room at £288 in total for the two nights in the room and continental breakfast (these are the new rates, as we were informed after we booked the hotel that the prices will be increased after April 2012). The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from Euston station or the nearest tube station is Russel Square. When checking into the hotel, we had quite a long wait at the reception desk before we were seen to, and the lobby area was very busy with various groups of teenagers - most likely on school trips. The staff at the desk weren't overly friendly, they looked bored and weren't very helpful. Our room was fine, quite basic and decor is quite dated, but clean and acceptable. Bathroom was nice and shower was good. The water flow from the taps was quite irratic; sometimes when you turned the tap on nothing would come out, then a second later it would spit a load of water at you and you'd be soaked! The beds were changed on our second day and our tea and coffee supplies were replenished. The breakfast is basic, in a large canteen style room with lots of school hall type tables. Breakfast included a choice of 4 cereals, fruit juice, tea and coffee and fruit. Cooked breakfast is available at an extra cost. After our second day in London we returned to our room and our keys were not working. We had to go back down to reception, and they issued us all with new keys which then worked. The staff had no problem changing our keys, which gave the impression that this has happened before - but I don't know! All in all, our stay at the Royal National was average, the hotel is in a good location and the rates are reasonable. The hotel is huge, I would say there were thousands of rooms, because of this the whole experience felt very impersonal, and if I were to stay in London again I would opt for a smaller hotel with a more thoughtful and personal touch. But if you're looking for convenience, Royal National should do you fine!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, basic but don't expect too much sleep”
Reviews.Author: Lenswift
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on Saturday and Sunday night. 15 mins walking from Kings Cross, just round the corner from Russell's Square Tube. Room dated and basic but adequate. Breakfast in giant canteen like restaurant, again nothing to shout about. Lots of noise from road on first visit so asked for courtyard facing room second time and there was noise up until early hours from buses arriving and people smoking out side.Had to call concierge at 1:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “A fair hotel for a fair price, with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: baznoble1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Thomas Cook !Superbreak! to take in a Rugby international at Twickenham. Having read some of the Tripadvisor reports I was a little apprehensive. After my stay I can't understand why previous tripadvisors were so negative. The reception staff were polite and helpful. Not able to check in before 2pm (I think this about normal). we were able to leave our luggage, free of charge with the conciege. When we did check in we found the room to be clean, plenty of towels, tea/coffee. The flatscreen tv reception was poor. I was able to improve it by re-fixing the coaxial plugs. A job for maintenance crew really. The included Full English breakfast set us up for the day. For a hotel of this size the caterers managed the numbers very well. At check out we left our suitcase with the conciege, this time for a charge of just 50p. I will definately stay again if I am visiting the capital. We used Kings Cross terminus which is just one stop down the Picadilly line. An ideal hotel for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient budget accommondation”
Reviews.Author: ExAgentTam
Reviews.Content: Firstly, don't book here if you are looking for a romantic stay or luxury accommodation or a contemporary hotel - Full stop. Do consider this hotel though if you are looking for a well located hotel providing a place to rest your head at a decent price. I did not personally book this hotel (and would not have chosen myself) but stayed here with my Mum and Sister as part of a theatre break (went to see Jersey Boys - Fantastic) This hotel claims to be the largest in London and it's not hard to believe. It is vast and crazy busy at all times with people permanently checking in. There was often a wait for lifts. As a result of this though there is a good multi-national buzz going on. The staff we encountered were polite, helpful, professional and smiley. As part of our deal we got dinner on the first night included. You could eat at various places belonging to the chain. We were very short for time as dashing off to theatre so chose the hot buffet within the Royal National. Basic nosh, but tasty and plentiful for re-fuelling. Breakfast was also included and there was hot and cold options. Breakfast did feel very much like being in a canteen but again, on this occasion it was just a means to an end before hitting the city. Oxford Street is within walking distance, but wear comfy shoes!! The rooms are basic, a very average 3* but It has all that you need for a short stay in london. Lets face it, you don't go to London to sit in a room do you? As the hotel is so vast it is easy to get disorientated in corridors etc. The corridors also look rather worse for wear, but it is understandable in such a large establishment which will have huge daily occupency turnover. I would recommend this hotel only if you are not too bothered about the standard of accommodation. Look elsewhere if looking for a bit of a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Run away as fast as you can!”
Reviews.Author: pauliasi
Reviews.Content: I couldn't stay more than 1 hour in this hotel even if I had a 4 nights reservation, the room was very small, dirty (dust all over the place, you couldn't even breath properly), the faucet was broken and the service very poor. The only good thing about this hotel is the location (5 minutes from British Museum) but I wouldn't stay there even if it was for free, honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Gee01
Reviews.Content: The Royal National Hotel receives a very mixed bag of results on Trip Advisor, from my personal experience, having stayed at the hotel twice, I have nothing but positive things to say. If you consider yourself to be fussy about hotels, or have particularly high-standards, The Royal National probably isn't for you. If, however, you are looking for a no-frills hotel with breakfast included this is perfect. The hotel's location couldn't be better, located close to tube and bus routes providing easy access to all tourist attractions. The room was clean and the staff were nothing but pleasant whenever we required help. Any time that I return to London, I won't even consider a different hotel. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good staying for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Bruno_Marinho
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, clean, location, price. Downsides: reception service, breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel yes Staff no”
Reviews.Author: Anthony F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights, location great, room very good, cleanliness excelent....staff very unfriendly. First morning into restaurant I let fly a cheerful goodmorning to the forign looking member of staff on the door, he was giving some dirty looks, I was lucky...he just ignored me. One morning as I left the hotel and was on the tube I realized that my 18 carat gold braclet was missing. Back to the hotel in the afternoon I informed reception and was told to go first floor to the housekeeper in the hope that it might have been found in the room. As I was half way explaining to the forign phlippine looking houskeeper she abruptly arrogantly in a harsh voice told me that her maids do not take things from rooms. I never accused anyone, I might have lost it outside on my way to the tube, I just wanted to ask if it was found in the room, thats all, the housekeeper's attitude made me feel like I was trying to steal something which was not the case as my insurance does not cover such an eventuality and I never intended to claim. Down to reception I went to complain about the attitude taken by the houskeeper, a big guy from the office behind reception was as helpful as an ambrella in a tsunami, so I just did not bother, HOTEL YES.....STAFF NO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that is it”
Reviews.Author: katlat29
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice. The first time was in 1997 and I was 22 and not too far from dorm life. The second time was in November 2011. The rooms that they show on the website are available as well as in room hairdryers. I was placed in a room that was clearly a closet at one point in time. I went back downstairs and complained and they changed my room after the issue with the hairdyer. They wanted 20 pounds in cash as a desposit on the hairdryer. After a transalantic flight that did not sit well. I was moved to another room but given a 6 inch pole with the key attached. The dryer was worth the sacrifice of having to leave the key. Even if the wait at the front desk was 20 minutes or more. The breakfast was basic continental. The customer service was extremely poor. Although I feel that London has very expensive hotel rooms I was able to reserve a different hotel, I was much happier at the second hotel. This hotel is cheap, no frills and the service is basic at best. Pro's the price, I think it may be the cheapest hotel in London since BA uses this hotel as part of it's promotions. The location is great, the tube is walking distances within two stations. The British Museum is around the corner and it is located in a safe area. I also never felt that my belongings were at risk and they do try to accomodate travelers that have traveled overnight with early check in.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a no frills city break”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaD80
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a city break deal including rail fares, if you are just looking for a place to sleep while visiting London it is fit for purpose. Decor, furnishing, towels and bedding all very tired and dated. Window was dirty and dressing table covered in dust. The height of the bath in the room I was in could prove problematic for less able bodied travellers, I found it very difficult/dangerous getting out of shower. Cooked English breakfast with fruit & cereal available too was very fair for the Â£4.50 being charged. Leave yourself plenty of time to check out or even get down for breakfast, there were large queues for lifts and at reception at peak times. Located less than 5 mins walk from Piccadilly Line so very handy for getting out and around London.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in...”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed_Hammad
Reviews.Content: I'm from Egypt & came to London for about 9 days,, staying in the Royal National Hotel,, it's neat & clean , staff are helpful & friendly , it's situated in a nice place in central london near russel square tube station , the only pitfall is breakfast.it's very poor , otherwise it's a very nice place to stay in...

Reviews.Title: “Stay in royal national hotel Russell square”
Reviews.Author: Eddie C
Reviews.Content: Under no circumstances would I recommend anyone to stay in this hotel. This is supposed to be a 3 star hotel. Wouldn't,t put my dog in it. Feel sorry for the foreign visitors who are put in this hotel as part of trip packages. If you are reading this review to stay as part of a super break package stay in London choose another hotel. We were supposed to be in this hotel for 2 nights, decided to change hotels after 1 hour. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: Mette B
Reviews.Content: This is easily the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at. The best thing to say about this place is that it is cheap. The room was stuffy and not very clean. It feels like "hotel machine" as it is ENORMOUS. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: meld33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a cheap break. The check-in process was painful in part because every school kid from Spain seemed to have arrived at the same time as us. The room was okay, but like the rest of the hotel very tired. The room was clean and the house keeping staff did a good with towels etc. Can't fault the location. A short walk to a tube station and 5 minutes to the British Museum. My advice is to skip breakfast as it was like a riot, possibly to do with aforementioned school kids. Instead go to the nearby Russell Square where there is a fantastic Italian cafe that does sausage ciabattas to die for. Avoid the pub next door to the hotel there are lots if much nicer ones close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for few nights”
Reviews.Author: Jayjay638
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location, a one minute walk from tube station which is just one stop from kings cross, and two stops from covent garden. Good for if your going to be out all day and will just be sleeping in it. Get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: terets57
Reviews.Content: arrived to find the courtyard and reception area full of coaches and students. Checking in was chaotic with the man telling us that our friends were already in their room when we knew they were at a show.We were given a triple room which was quite large compared to some in London. Rooms were basic, towels were tiny and at night our room was noisy from the traffic and people shouting out in the street until 5am. Breakfast was ridiculous the large dining room was full of students. It was difficult to get a table which were not set up. You were expected to collect your breakfast on a tray and sit and eat it at the table on the tray. No table mats or cloths.We would not use this hotel again. Good location but that is the best part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: 94Andys
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to be given a voucher for a three course meal upon check in We were even more surprised when we tried the food it was dreadful and left after the soup. Next day at breakfast there were no seats and I defy anyone to try eating bacon and eggs standing up whilst trying to balance with two walking sticks I asked one of the many Eastern European staff who the manager was and the reply was Oh! he's the Chinese looking one which narrowed it down to about anyone out of 800 billion please give this hotel a wide berth Â£99 per night

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night.”
Reviews.Author: bagin1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is normal. Rooms are quite decent, well-cleaned. in the room - kettle, cups, constantly put the tea bags and coffee. The hotel itself is very similar to an anthill - always someone leaving, coming, breakfast funny - the same tea, coffee and jam. It is convenient - not far from the center. Most importantly - clean, comfortable room. Ideal for students and seniors, for undemanding travelers. Easy access to all the sights of London on foot and by subway (100 meters from the metro station Russell square).

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient to stay before & after Contiki tour”
Reviews.Author: nardz01
Reviews.Content: This place is more like a hostel... Only a decent one. Rooms are average, meals are average but if like me you are about to start a Contiki tour it's great because the meetings are held there the night before and most fellow travelers stay there as well. My room was good...couldn't complain at all but i did see some other people's rooms and they were a bit average. The place is like a maze so be prepared to get lost at least once

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great location”
Reviews.Author: Hollie1106
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very basic and very small but the location makes up for this. The rooms needed a refurb but were clean enough although smelled a little damp. Generally the hotel was good especially considering what you pay for it. It's in easy walking distance to a tube station or if you're doing London on foot it's a great base for getting around too. If you're sightseeing and won't be spending much time in your hotel room the Royal National is great. For me as long as the rooms are clean and you're in a good location that's most important.

Reviews.Title: “Good central London hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAVEJD
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in a family room which was a good size for us. The hotel has a lot of groups of students staying but they did not bother us and noise was kept to a minimum. Breakfast can be very busy but there was a good selection of both hot and cold items. We got a free meal in one of the four restaurants as a promotion and chose the indian buffet which was excellent. The hotel is in an ideal location within walking distance of Kings Cross and Oxford Street. Buses are very frequent right outside of the hotel. Overall the hotel was good value for money and I would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraFamily
Reviews.Content: We bought a package deal (train+hotel+evening meal) for 2 nights stay at this hotel (we've stayed here before) We find this hotel to be in an excellent location (you can easily walk into Covent Garden). We stayed in room 3289 and the room was clean and lovely, the only draw back was we could hear the traffic outside even with the windows closed. The shower is like a jet wash...really powerful and if you're having a bath, don't walk away from it, as the water pressure is so strong, if fills very quickly. The cooked english breakfast is very good indeed, but there is also a vast choice for those who don't do cooked breakfasts. The breakfast room gets very busy around 8am, so maybe try 7am (quite peaceful then) or later to avoid queues. Russel Square tube station is close by and you can get one day travel cards there for Â£7.00 to cover central london for a whole day, well worth buying, as you can get on and off the tube trains and red buses all day, so getting about is cheap, quick and easy. Can't knock this hotel for value for money.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Bryan”
Reviews.Author: Bryan W
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights, sightseeing and show. great location, too big of a hotel, rooms dated but clean, ended up itching and came out in a rash due to bed sheets. Being a light sleeper kept be woken by guests return and shouting until 3.30am and then from 5am coaches arriving. food ok,it filled you up.

Reviews.Title: “Should be Royal International”
Reviews.Author: Pat S
Reviews.Content: Hotel central to Piccadilly line and Russell Square tube 2 minutes walk,so you can get to Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Piccadilly circus within a short time,we used the central line change once to get to Oxford Street. You can get off at the Piccadilly circus for TOP SHOP or Marble Arch for PRIMARK whatever you choose be prepared for a very busy street and about 1and a half mile walk in between. We also went to Buckingham palace on the Piccadilly line. Now the Hotel, Basic nae free shampoo etc just soap rooms comfy enough but no double glazing and tour buses arriving late at night and picking up from 5am. There is a central courtyard with a bar a pizza place and a tour shop where you can buy tickets for attractions. Taxies and rickshaws on hand for alternative transport. With 1600 rooms the hotel has a massive cattle market room for breakfast,once you show your yellow ticket you get in and help yourself to the usual Continental array of cereal and juices,then make your way to the FULL ENGLISH have to show your yellow ticket again and a very pushy oriental lady gives you a plate and tells you to work your way from centre to outside,and you get sausage bacon fried egg scrambled egg baked beans plumb tomatoes boiled egg and pre made toast which is cold and chewy,then you go to get coffee and the machine has a pile of napkins underneath because it leaks. The room was basic,old tube type telly bolted down,why would anyone want to stuff one of those on their suitcase is beyond me.They advertise twin or double from Â£99 I am so glad we booked through a travel short break company as I would not give them 99pence for a room. I think we were the only English speaker guests in the Hotel,I am so glad I am Scottish as no one could understand us anyway so as far as the other guests were concerned we were foreign too.If you are going don't let this review put you off as it's OK really.

Reviews.Title: “A bar with no beer?”
Reviews.Author: RP-HebdenBridge
Reviews.Content: Initially booked for 3 nights with my wife but due to Ofsted ended up there for one night on my own! However it was clean with my room on 7th floor overlookingthe university buildings and Post Office tower. Everything worked though a little dates possibly. Hotel is frequented by groups (schools, students etc) and budget weekenders like me. Staff pleasant and helpful - left luggage service very useful. A good base for exploring - walking distance of British Museum and only 20 mins walk from Aldwych or theatres etc. Had a good deal with included evening meal which you could eat at ony of the chain's hotels -though the food wasn't particularly fantastic. I was really pleased I had booked a deal with Superbreak which allowed cancellation but will certainly go back when my wife is able to join me! Oh and the no beer - went to the bar only to find the pumps were all dry apary from a lager one. Barman said they let then run down and got new stock in on Mondays: this was Friday evening so rather a surprising policy?

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for a shopping trip to London due to its low cost and location. It is located close to Russle Square which has a tube station in it. The hotel is massive and you are just a number over there but its ok if you are in London to shop around. I think that when I'm in London I don't really care about the hotel as long as it is clean, safe and cheap! So I recommend this for London visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Hostel for 80 pounds per night!”
Reviews.Author: krole4ka
Reviews.Content: It`s not really a hotel, it looks more like a big hostel. Plenty of students everywhere, old furniture, dirty towels. For breakfast you can take only tea/coffee and bread with jam. If you want full english breakfast (edds, sausage, etc.), you should pay for it. Anouther topic is corridors, they are eternal, you are lost all the time (especially the first day it`s very difficult to find your room). The only good thing about this hotel is location, close to British museum and metro. Oxford street is in 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: andyscotland88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, on arrival staff were friendly and we were checked in quickly. rooms are nice clean and suitably furnished. Location is excellent with Russel square tube just round the corner.Ideal hotel for a break in London. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in London”
Reviews.Author: HartlepoolBob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to London to see a couple of West End shows. The hotel was cetrally situated (Russell Square) and handy for main line stations.Kings Cross,St.Pancras,Euston were all within a ten minute walk. Bus stops and Uderground stations close to hand.Taxis were plentiful both ousie the hotel and in the hotel courtyard The hotel was very clean, the bedroom had en suite facilities and had lifts to all floors. Dinner in the itegral Pavilion Resteraunt was buffet style but the food was mediocre; breakfast in the Widsor Room was also buffet style but with a good selection of English breakfast items and was more than adequate. The Breakfaast room itself was very basic, the layout almost like a works canteen. The hotel was part of a complex with an Indian Reasreraunt,the Pavilion restaurant as above, the "British Pub" all with avess from and to the hotel from the main road. Overall it was adequate for our requirements for the three day break

Reviews.Title: “A good balance between quality and price”
Reviews.Author: carla3010
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel almost in the center of London, just a couple of stops from Piccadilly Circus. The cleanliness was acceptable. The Hotel was a bit chaotic and crowded because it is used mostly by schools and large tourist groups. The breakfast was basic, if you wanted something hot and cooked you had to pay extra. We had little interaction with staff but they seemed professional and polite. There is also a small souvenirs shop in the foyer. Check out is in in the morning and if you have an afternoon flight you can leave your bags with the hotel's staff for small fee. It has a good balance between quality and price. I would stay in the Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Basic but clean.”
Reviews.Author: Greenbee3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and cannot fault this hotel. Easy to find. We arrived late on Friday and by time we arrived back after day out on Saturday, room had been cleaned again with fresh towels. Breakfast was very busy as you would expect with a hotel this size, but was ideal if you only need a light breakfast. Option was there to buy a cooked breakfast if desired. Unlike other reviewers, we had no issue with noise. Would use again if looking for somewhere central in London. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Room for many”
Reviews.Author: Lilja70
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. We went there just to have roof over our heads and breakfast, we were about 30 collegues that did London over the weekend. It was clean, we got fresh towels every day, the rooms were small, but hey it was London.

Reviews.Title: “good for just sleep... (turkish) uyumak icin guzel ve guvenli...”
Reviews.Author: optic2000
Reviews.Content: thanks to all other reviewers, we took our breakfast with us and kept our expectaions low... And had no problem. Even if it was off season, the hotel was crowded. Being close to russel square underground station is a good thing. Take Piccadily line directly from heatrow and no change, you can get to russel square station... As i said, good for just sleep.... (turkish) diger tum yorumculara tesekkur ederiz. Bu sayede kahvaltimizi yanimizda getirdik, surme peynir ve zeytin iyi geldi. Aksi durumda cok kotu gecebilirdi kahvaltimiz. Uyumak icin yeterli guvenlikte ve lokasyonu iyi. Heatrow havaalanindan bir metro ile (picadilli line) direk olarak russel square duraginda gelebiliyorsunuz, yukari cikinca da (lutfen asansoru kullanin) otele 5 dakikalik yurume mesafesinde.... Dedigim gibi uyumak icin guvenli ve temiz....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in London, well priced”
Reviews.Author: jumping55
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if I liked this hotel but thinking back it was not too bad! Stayed here one night for work, rooms were very small but comfortable, a little noisy but not too bad! I would not say the rooms were clean, and previous guest had written all over the walls! Fantastic location and paid a great price! I really enjoyed the breakfast, there was lots of staff on duty and were all reallyniche and had no Problems visiting my room when i coukd not work the heating. I have no complaints and would be happy to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the best budget choices in London, UK”
Reviews.Author: Hank R
Reviews.Content: I visited this Royal national hotel once again with a friend from Jan. 20-23, 2012. We got a room on 7th floor, #7088, very nice and clean, and in very good shape. Very hot inside so the window was open. However I just found the refrigerator pipe and cut off the heating and so that small problem was solved. We could close the window and have a nice temperature. This time we had the pleasure of English breakfast! Nice bacon & eggs and beans etc. We had booked thru internet agency and was suprised it was stamped on our breakfast cards, E.B. You should be aware of the fact that on the web you can sometimes find better prices that booking directly thru the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay is what you get!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaCyprus
Reviews.Content: This is a Hostel like Hotel with basic amenities and perfect location. I was told that the building used to be the Student Halls for University of London (which makes sense). It is very big and busy and most of the visitors are groups of students. The rooms are BASIC, decent size but not the cleanest (at least ours wasn't). If you are allocated an outside room, prepare for noise from the street. The breakfast is a joke and the staff treats everybody like they are naughty students. We stayed there for a week and found it very convinient as we had access to the tube and buses, which are 3 minutes walk from the hotel. You can also walk to Bruinswick Mall which is a small mall with many eateries and cafes and get a decent coffee. Although my first impression was totally negative at the begining, location made the difference. After all.....what you pay is what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: kirk30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very utilitarian but not the worst choice as some reviewers say. Our room was clean and quiet. We found all the staff to be extremely polite and helpful. The location is excellent, near Tube and taxis always available. Bar pretty horrible but at least prices are reasonable. No its not at all luxurious but I've stayed in more expensive London hotels with smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It was nt that bad!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dogarse
Reviews.Content: Hi. Just come back from a few days in London, We stopped at this hotel because it was part of the package deal we were on. Had read the reviews and some of them were that bad I dare nt tell my wife!! BUT to be honest it was nt that bad. ok so we were lucky top floor nobody above us but the noise leval was minimal when we were there and yes there were hundreds of guests in and out on a daily basis. Our room was fine clean and warm and was thoughly cleaned when we had breakfast! Breakfast? This is what it is--------- The food is typical big hotel nosebag It IS NT a five star Yorkshire Dales B and B! Fill your plate up eat the lot and magically you won t be needing another big meal that day. Simple really but if you don t understand cheap massive London hotels don t bother. Staff were all good wherever they were. And yes I would go back. ps great location.

Reviews.Title: “Too exprensive for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie_loves_to_trav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old and hasn't been renovated for a long time. The bathroom and the room in general looks really bad. The bed was very unconfortable and old. I was very disapointed. The only good thing is that it was a great location. I wouldn't go there again...

Reviews.Title: “Basic and busy hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: AshleyDriedger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a huge, plain and very busy hotel! It is used as the meeting point for all contiki tours, so there is bus fulls of young people coming in and out constantly. The staff inside were friendly and helped us find the right tours for us. Breakfast is a basic cereal and toast sort of deal. The rooms, again, are plain. However, the location is great! An easy walking distance of the train station for those coming from Paris etc, and easy to walk to great restaraunts, national gallery, trafalgar square etc. If you are okay with the business and plainess of this hotel, there is absolutely nothing wrong with it!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: SalmaKadim
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have I met this amount of rude ppl in one place!! The staff starting from the reception lady to the concierge person and of course the rudest of them all are the waiters in the restaurant. The breakfast was awful very plain and stale, a twin room is the size of a sardines tin (we had to shuffle to pass) and no one is helpful at all. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bex1189
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night on the 19th january. The hotel is in a really good location, 2 minutes walk from Russell Square Tube Station. Rooms were clean and had everything u need from hair dryers to tea and coffee facilities. Breakfast was good as well had a good selection of cereals you can pay extra for a fry up. IGNORE the bad reviews i couldnt fault the hotel. Will definately stay here again. Perfect for Theatre Breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms nice, service terrible”
Reviews.Author: annoymous p
Reviews.Content: The hotel its self is nice but the service that we recieved was horrible, breakfast is a complete and utter joke there version of a continental breakfast is a bread and cereal and toast ( which is far from cooked), the rooms are ideal if you are there for one or two nights but any time longer would be horrible the location is ideal for shops and close to the tube but i would advice you choose a diffrent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It may be alright”
Reviews.Author: Tomitronic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal National Hotel for four consecutive days. Rooms are basic, but still better than the cheaper London style, meaning: Rooms are small You have a private room Bathroom is clean Beds are hard Of course no minibar, trouser press, or anything else. Breakfast room is a joke. Nothing but white bread and marmelade. It's also extremely busy, and staff don't have a clue how to serve guests. Some don't speak English. A simple thing as getting a table, can become complex and frustrating. This quality is replicated at Reception, where queues are very long, and service is non-existent. It took me 20 minuttes before I was checked in. That's just not good enough. I realize that this Hotel has a lot of rooms - but when you have a lot of rooms - then why don't they bother to balance the services to the demand? OK, go here if you want a cheap hotel with a premium location in London. If you want anything close to comfort and/or service, I suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel close to tub station”
Reviews.Author: SuViseu
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of students to this hotel as it was cheap and decent. I personally did not hear any noise at night, but some of my students said that there was a lot of noise in the corredors at night, as there are many groups of students staying there. Hotel rooms were clean and it was enough for us to sleep at night. It was a 3 minute walk to the tube station. Breakfast was poor. Overall, if you are looking for an economic choice, this is a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Royal.....should be trash national”
Reviews.Author: Della J
Reviews.Content: worked in the area years ago so wanted to stay in that area, how that hotel is still opened never mind making money is well beyond be, , rooms were grubby and smelly, carpets were stinking, and as for breakfast you were like inmates eating off your trays, thats if your lucky enough to have food edible in the beginning. DONT GO THERE . dont say you were't warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “More like a travelodge”
Reviews.Author: SheilaNewark_Notts
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and had newly refurbished bathroom. Facing into quadrangle meant it was nice and quiet especially as we were on 7th floor- not all would be. Ideal location as just 3mins from tube. Very big hotel catering for large groups and buses of foreign tourists. Very disappointing breakfasts- more like a Butlin`s canteen and very busy at weekends. Good price so no frills.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: lynne s
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a great weekend break. Hotel was what it was. We found it clean and staff that we dealt with were helpful. A great base for a lot of the attractions/shows. Would definitly use again. If you want 5* hotel then pay 5*hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: annem187048
Reviews.Content: it was our birthday weekend when we stayed at the royal national , looking forward to a nice weekend no such luck. could not eat anything at breakfast it was like cattle market, we sent for room service on saturday teatime we gave the waiter the right money he asked for more he was asking for a tip. saturday night we went to a show, when we came back to the hotel we went to the restaurant sorry i mean canteen, the meal awful and the staff was arguing all the while we was there i reported this what a bad birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for seeing London”
Reviews.Author: Ashes0F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my partner. This is your typical super large hotel. Staff were nice but not overly friendly! Check in a bit of a nightmare, it was crammed (no structure ie no lines) and rushed, the man didnt welcome us or tell us anything about the hotel, what time check out was, that we need to go to the housekeeping for a hair dryer, that there is 2 ironing rooms on different floors, things that would be have been helpful to know, now there is a page in the room that will tell you some of the above. He also didnt inform us that we would need the yellow pages that he gave us on check in to get into the breakfast room! Breakfast was fine. The room is ok its clean which is the main thing! Decor is very dated and shabby looking!! The hotel is a bit of a maze it has 7 floors & 2000+ rooms. On a plus the hotel is near the Russel Sqaure tube station & the National Museum! The area is nice & close to pretty much everywhere! We i stay here again: No! I will stay in Russel Square for sure again but the hotel was so impersonal, no atmosphere, not friendly, its missing 'love' & 'care'!The hotel needs lots of love!!! I suppose this hotel is good for business people!

Reviews.Title: “Abismal”
Reviews.Author: katsimpson1
Reviews.Content: Complained of being woke up and banging due to staff room nxt door to bedroom... no joy. customer service - non existent. cattlemart queuing for breakfast.. didnt bother in the end. this hotels an embarrassment and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Travellinganne1965
Reviews.Content: The location is a great plus.. easy for the underground, points of interest within walking distance and a couple of EXCELLENT restaurants next door and across the street ... Cons.. really does need some maintenance... a bit of peeling paint.. hallways look run down.. terrible soundproofing (on the other hand parents should control their children and not allow them to run screaming up and down the hallways!!) But for the price you get what you pay for.. few amenities but a reasonable location.. front desk staff not particularly helpful day or night.. but not overtly rude or ignorant.. Only access for internet is from the lobby.. slow ...slooowwww....slllllooooowwwwwww zzzzZZZzzzZZZ continental breakfast was so-so..toast paper thin and barely warm..but it is "free" The hot breakfast Â£4.50 was not hot..was lackluster and really not worth it unless you are severely malnourished and bout ready to faint dead away...lol I would stay there again as I was busy doing the tourist thing.. but if I was there much longer than 5 nights I would probably stay elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Location"”
Reviews.Author: 515George
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for New Year and will definately come again. The location was central for everything we wanted to do. We bought an Oyster card which worked out at 23 pounds each and used it everywhere for the 4 days as the underground station was a minute away from the hotel. Euston station is only a short walk away and we were able to leave our bags at the hotel. The hotel was very large and there were lots of people coming and going but we were on the 5th floor and there was no noise at all. The room was clean and our beds were made for us every day and the towels changed. And the shower was very powerful, and hot!! Breakfast was adequate and plenty of it. If I had listened to the bad reviews I wouldnt have booked here but all I can say is try it yourself. We will definately stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location next to the underground and bus stations.. But bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Laila T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location , 2 mins walk to bus and underground stations and about 20 mins walk to Oxford . We stayed in a room that had bed bugs, after we complained they changed the room but we found the other room to be even worse. Then they moved us from the whole building and gave us a third room that was ok. I recommend this hotel if someone wants a low budget hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Rafael F
Reviews.Content: it is unfortunate the attitude of workers in the hotel, in fact, all of the united kingdom.from spain

Reviews.Title: “twice...coming again”
Reviews.Author: avieilat
Reviews.Content: we have been there twice already ,a budget hotel,clean,well planned,central & busy area,near to all locations,but try for the higher floors as it can be a bit noisy...

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anth_Spiteri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a very good and busy area, quite close to many interesting places. Hotel is big, and sometimes it can be quite noisy if the room is over the coaches parking space or out to the main roads.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: holidayaddict1989
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the royal national for new year..and we loved it! Okay the hotel is not amazing but we found our room clean, comfortable and warm. The beds were very comfy, and the bathroom was lovely. The location of the hotel was brilliant, we tended to walk everywhere as it was easier than waiting for a train/bus. Only problem we had was the long wait for check-in, and we were a bit early on arrival but couldn't check in early. Not really an issue as we just sat in the hotel bar and had a drink while we waited :) breakfast each day was always hot and tasty- me and my boyfriend had a full english every day! Also 15-20 minute walk to kings cross station, we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: albert_bonello
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. At check in the receptionist could not find our rooms but then she called her superior and managed to find our rooms. We booked a double bed and found a twin room. Our room was in a desperate need of a refurbishment especially the bathroom. The water was sometimes cold and sometimes warm...it seems that this was dependant on the other rooms consumption. Having said this the room was relatively clean and warm. The continenatal breakfast is very basic. The best thing for this hotel is that it is centrally located and the price paid was reasonable for a hotel in central London. As a conclusion, this hotel is in a desperate need of a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make the place!”
Reviews.Author: Sleeplessinthesqaure
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over 3 nights and it has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The location next to Russell square underground is excellent however this is where the positives end. I will start with the staff - they all stand round reception like it is a Samaritans convention, you would think they are completing a community service order rather than providing a service. Del boys 3 wheeled van had more life in it than these people and they made Anne robinson look like stacey Solomon in terms of cheer and personality! 2 of the staff who were given the job of securing luggage before check in gave us the welcome a field full of cows would give Ronald McDonnald, you would have thought I had asked then to pay my bill and chauffeur us around London for 3 days not just lock our bags in a room for a couple of hours! The rooms reminded me of a former army barracks we stayed in during a school camp one time, an after 3 nights in those beds (3 single beds as opposed to the double we booked) I felt like I was a war veteran! We received one visit from the maids in 3 days, no new towels and bizarrely some hotel objects dissappeared! The court yard outside constantly seems more populated than Oxford street on boxing day and provides more noise than a jedward concert.

Reviews.Title: “Royal”
Reviews.Author: gordieallan
Reviews.Content: A very large hotel in Bloomsbury, London. The Royal National is a handily pleced budget hotel. I found the single room I was allocated was clean and tidy and had a good view of the London skyline. The hotel is conveniently placed for Russell Square tube station and indeed most major sights can be walked to in reasonable time. The size of the hotel bring with it a drawback. Check-in and out is a time consuming task with long queues in the foyer. In addition the hotel seems to cater for a large amount of school parties which brings with it noise at late hours and disturbed sleep for the older amongst us. However if you can live with these drawbacks then price, cleanliness and convenience make this a good choice for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “not good. (keep away)”
Reviews.Author: thinbil12
Reviews.Content: stay away from this hotel (went for a drink at the bar carpet was very dirty,chairs were slashed) stayed one night only booked bed and breakfast thank goodness. the staff had no idea of where the location of the show was, breakfast was the worst that myself and wife had ever experienced coffee tea machines both not working. eggs sausages unedable, what a waste of food as a lot of uneaten plates of food still left on the tables. A lot of staff but simply not able to meet the satisfaction of customers. Not enough training. The lady overlooking the serving of english breakfast was only interested in taking Â£4.50 supplement. A better trained person would see that the breakfast looked unappertising, eggs turning black sausages looked pink and bowls of them just left , as a former caterer that tells you that improvements need to be made. people were left standing waiting for people to finish, this made them late and the staff had already cleared away breakfast toast cobs. No drinks except juice.I can see that you are able to fill your hotel with guests but i would like to know how many of those guest go away feeling satisfied with the service. You could learn alot by observing a better standarded of customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Room adequate, FEB not so good”
Reviews.Author: AntonM99
Reviews.Content: The TV power socket had a mind of its own (fortunately there were other sockets within reach), only one blanket was supplied for our twin room (but we asked for another), no "Do Not Disturb" sign provided (we could ask for one), and housekeeping was eager to get in at 8am. That said, the room was clean, smelt fresh, and the bathroom facilities worked well. We were on a package deal with a show thrown in, as well as Full English Breakfast. Don't bother with the latter -- it was disagreeable, and repeated on me unpleasantly until the following night. It's quite a feat to keep me away from tucking in to a FEB, but next time (if there is one) it's definitely the orange juice and croissant for me. Just the sight of it was enough for me -- I had a fried egg and a small finger sausage in the faint hope that it couldn't be all that bad. It was.

Reviews.Title: “great location for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: krisadams
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a triple room at a reasonable price is not that easy, Myself and two girlfriends wanted to spend a couple of days in London and this is why we chose the Royal National Hotel, on reading the reviews we were a bit concerned but to be honest it was ideal for what we wanted room was clean, Three single beds enough floor space and ample size wardrobe. check-in was quick,Breakfast was like a school canteen but edible. The only downside was the noise of the traffic from our room but the hotel is located very close to an Ambulance station so sirens all through the night is expected but for a couple of nights it was ok would not stay at this hotel longer. Location great easy for trains and buses and easy walking distance to the theatre we wanted to go to in soho

Reviews.Title: “horrible and low standard and discousting breakfest!”
Reviews.Author: loketoke
Reviews.Content: dont stay at this hotel! Horrible breakfest, the rooms was not nice pure seventies, but the hotel had an indian resturant that was great! Next time i stay in london i will be very careful wich hotel i choose!

Reviews.Title: “There is better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ben e
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal National for a night either side of a Contiki tour. The rooms are tiny but the shower at least had hot water but there are no comforts. The only thing you have is a kettle so no cooking/heating/refridgerating services are available. Both rooms we had were in poor condition, tv remotes badly damaged and non-functioning, had issues with the tv, the kettle and the room temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again even if i was given money!”
Reviews.Author: tsyxoulaki
Reviews.Content: First of all,we checked in in a flash,even though the time was just 10 in the morning,and that was positive. Another positive was that it was a warm room,the days i stayed were too cold. The bad ones? Where can i start.. 1. The hotel and the corridors smelled like a huge kitchen. When they didn't smell like that,they smelled like an old hospital. The rooms smelled less. 2. The whole hotel is quite old. The corridors and the rooms need a serious renovation so they don't look deserted. 3. I stayed there 5 nights,and though i had everyday clean toweks,the bed sheets and the pillows were not changed ever! And the blankets had holes everywhere! 4. It was noisy. Drunk people hitting doors and making noise at 2 o'clock,was something that happened often. 5. The breakfasf was the worst ever and i was mad when i realised that i had to pay extra for english breakfast,which was also hideous. 6. There was no wifi 7. It was not that central located.. 8. I was quite astonished when i was informed that i had to pay half pound a bag,in order to leave to their store room for luggage,our luggages because we had a late flight. They even charged a tiny back pack! And all these for 70 pounds per night?? I think not! This hotel has to charge at least....10 pounds...

Reviews.Title: “London Crash Pad”
Reviews.Author: theenglishfamily
Reviews.Content: Check in & out fast, friendly & efficient. Luggage could be left on check-in at no charge, then on check-out for just 50p per bag. Breakfast a pleasant surprise - you can really fill up on pretty decent grub till evening if you like. Location superb as within easy walking distance of theatre district, shops and Euston station. Rooms VERY BASIC and noisy with traffic on street-side, but perfectly adequate if all you want is a crash pad for a short London break. Paid Â£139 for a quad room, bed & English breakfast and think you can't expect Ritz standards for such a price!

Reviews.Title: “London mini two night break”
Reviews.Author: johnny24519356
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 night B&B break in london for 3. We stayed at the Royal national in Russel square. The first night we were offered a free 3 course meal in 1 of 4 restraunts located within 5 mins walking distance to the hotel. The hotel is huge, but the staff are excellent and very helpfull. Ther is an attraction office attached to the hotel for any attraction or show in London at good prices. The nearest underground station is approx 6 mins walk (Russel sq.) taxi from/to kings cross rail station was Â£6. Breakfast in hotel is loads of toast coffee cereal fruit juice tea and bread. Cooked breeky is Â£4.50 extra, but who wants that these days.... We visted every, and i mean every attraction in an action packed two day visit cost a fortune but the underground day pass is excellent and the staff are very, very helpfull. Recommend london eye, bus tours and harrods for tea. Hamleys is great. Back to hotel our room was a triple with 3 single beds, great shower freeview tv and the norm coffee and tea stuff. Very clean an excellent base to explore london, we are going back in the summer booked with superbreak at Â£300 for 3 people which inluded train travel from northern england !!! Great

Reviews.Title: “theatre breaks”
Reviews.Author: anne m
Reviews.Content: have stayed here a few times, must have been a good hotel in its day,however for the mone ou cant complain really,the place is clean rooms more like travelodge style has what ou need,the breakfast is buffet style and is ok some of my keys keep missing , its owned b the london imperial hotel group i think they have 3 other hotels close by have also staed at the lmperial,which is better than the national

Reviews.Title: “Laziest Hotel in London?”
Reviews.Author: Ben R
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine and at first glance the room as good enough for the price. The bathroom however was pretty filthy though with previous guests hair on the tiles over the bath and feces splashed on the tiles near the toilet. I raised the complaint with reception who refused to get a manager to hear my complaint. So I filled in the form and they told me they would respond within 28 days (I stayed one week ago and no response to date). They did send housekeeping to clean the bathroom which I was pleased to see was fairly clean when I returned from my meeting. Problem is, this only highlighted how filthy the bathroom was and that one can only assume that they don't thoroughly clean the rooms as a matter of course. You get a clean room if you complain. Breakfast at the restaurant is pretty poor and I single out cooked breakfast and toast for a special mention. Both are kept warm (not hot) under halogen lamps so you end up with an unpleasant warm breakfast on a cold plate and a slice of VERY dry toast. Restaurant staff walk around but as they failed to take a single used plate or cup off my table they acted more like security guards and created a very unpleasant atmoshphere. The woman at reception didn't even both to ask what my complaint was, she just gave me a form to write my complaint on. An unpleasant stay due to a dirty hotel and lazy staff that don't care if your stay is pleasant or not. I think that's everything. Oh watch out for people who try to beg money off you outside.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: judith_styche
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week end break at the Royal National(my husbands first and last time of choosing a hotel). It is absolutely the worst hotel in London.The noise from the guests in the central courtyard and in the hotel itself throughout the night was truly appalling. We had no sleep for two nights!!! There was no fridge, safe or hairdryer in the room. The bathroom was minute, with black mould on the ceiling and you had to manouvre around the toilet to get into the bathroom. The concierge refused to book us a taxi to take us to the theatre,there were cobwebs in the bar and the restaurant where we had breakfast resembled a 'truckers cafe'. I do not know where this hotel got its three star rating but it certainly does not deserve any. The hotel needs a total refubishment. I cannot believe that anybody would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jovik
Reviews.Content: This is a very good family hotel, and its cheap. Very cheap. There is too many cheap and bad hotels in London, but this one is good. Dont expect 5 stars, but if u want to use your money on others than hotel, but have a desent stay. This is it

Reviews.Title: “Like a Hall of Residence!”
Reviews.Author: englanderin186299
Reviews.Content: I should preface this review by saying I had planned to stay at the Hotel Rusell - so this hotel was not quite my thing! Reception is large, unwelcoming with lots of vending machines. receptions appeared staggered that they actually had to check people in, That said the conceirge guys were helpful and a credit to the hotel. The room was warm, had hot water and thankfully clean sheets but little else going for it. The corridors were grim and needed redecoration and repair. Breakfast! Like a canteen or university refectory - take a red tray and help yourself to soggy toast, rolls, saled butter, tinned grapefruit or orange, watered down juice and coffee. Very noisy - never had a breakfast like it. Hotel is is cheap - you get what you pay for - I'd rather pay more for something civilised,

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anice_j
Reviews.Content: We visited London on December 2011 till the 7th, and we can say that London is great, but the Hotel is VERY terrible. First of all the problems were that the room we were in 5209(practically all the rooms are the same), you could hear every step that is being made on the outside of the hotel, people talking and shouting and this is something one should keep in mind and you won't sleep comfortably at all. The ''food'' at the breakfast station was like eating remains from a farm. We took the ''continental breakfast'', and the choice is only cereal, butter, jam, coffee or tea, juices, and the worst TOASTED bread on earth one could take. The toasted bread was ready toasted and prepared in baskets and one would take as much as he/she desires, but they were cold, streched like a dead skin and tasted like rubber. Just look at the picture I posted and you could see youself. And forget about some hot chocolate, they just won't give you.When we asked about hot chocolate, a pakistani staff acted as if we were asking for a space shuttle. And the last thing is the staff. To communicate with them it's like talking in dog language. They just don't understand your question correctly. It's either because of their nationality ( because nearly all the staff are not English ) or for any other reason which I couldn't understand. And don't ask about the weather report to know the condition for the coming day because the answer we took was, 'A little bit of everything, some sun,snow,rain, and some wind. Just a bit of everything' . And by the way, the following day the weather was sunny and nice. So my conclusion is DON'T VISIT, as you will be wasting money and peaceful rest. Just try any other hotel. You can't go worst than choosing this hotel. The only one good thing is it's location.

Reviews.Title: “"what a dump"”
Reviews.Author: harvey w
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel experience I have ever had. My wife and I needed 3 room changes upon check in, just to get two decent mattresses on our beds. Rooms smelled of cigarette smoke. My blankets were shoddy and ripped in places. The bath Towels were thread bare and there was mold on the bathroom ceilings. Noise could be heard from room to room. The hotel was two steps below a youth Hostel

Reviews.Title: “The Staff are a Credit to this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daisy_Long_Legs
Reviews.Content: I went for a weekend in London with my mother and sister and had booked a triple room. We had a bit of a shaky start - our room definitely had not been cleaned properly. There were drinks bottle caps on the window sill, ring marks on the worktop, the cups were dirty as was the toilet. We did alert the reception to this and by the time we came back from our evening out, the room had been cleaned. We opted for the 'English Breakfast' option which was very nice. The only negative is that the hotel is so very big and busy, it made for a very big and busy dining room. On the first day we had to walk around for a while with our food searching for a table, eventually we had to sit seperately or the food would have been cold. The hotel is situated in Russell Square on a busy street, about a 2 minute walk from Russell Square tube station, very easy to find and an ideal location for anyone wanting to do some shopping. We all just bought Oyster cards and topped them up as needed. The staff... well, I think this has to be the friendliest hotel I've ever stayed in. Rarely did I pass a member of staff without them saying 'good morning/ afternoon/ evening'! This hotel is exceptionlly busy yet that didn't seem to make a difference to how polite and efficient they were. I am very pleased with the service from the staff, I think they all deserve a raise!

Reviews.Title: “Centraly Located”
Reviews.Author: Malta2009
Reviews.Content: I went for a week at Royal National Hotel it is very centraly located close to bus terminus and to Rusell Square Station and you can also go by walk to Oxford street. We had a triple room which was very spacious and a well sized bathroom and the rooms were clean as well.The only thing that I was unsatisfied with was the breakfast .But still I recomend cause it is in a good place and if I go to London again I go there again

Reviews.Title: “Average but well situated”
Reviews.Author: raptjim
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. Pros: -Clean -Well situated - steps to an underground station and within walking distance (10-15') to Soho and West End Cons: -Insufficient breakfast (continental breakfast included only toasted bread, soft rolls, juice, jam, salted! butter, milk and cereal - had to pay extra Â£4,7 to have English breakfast) -No hair drier/plug adaptor in the room - had to pay Â£25 for insurance to have them (refundable on returning them) -No shampoo/shower gel in the bathroom - had to go and pick it up ourselves when we asked for some from an office that was open only 9-11am daily!!! -Once forgot to leave the "do not disturb" card outside of the door and was awaken twice by the cleaning staff at 8am and 8:20 am... Not satisfied in general and would not recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Good location.. Thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: Jenski-Bob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and will not be staying again. The rooms were over priced but thats the price you pay for staying in London! As soon as we stepped in the room after check in.. a staff member tried to walk in our room! I opened the door and she walked past me to check the room and asked if we were ok, which was strange! Same thing happened again 10 minutes later with a different member of staff! The view out of our hotel looked like a prison exercise yard and there was burn holes in the sheets. The hall way was noisy as.. But its only for 2 nights thank god!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels for value”
Reviews.Author: korky116
Reviews.Content: take a party of approx 16 every sept. cant go past it. very central, one of the cheapest in london and one of the largest. central for everywhere. wouldnt stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: sallyannethomas
Reviews.Content: The Royal National Hotel is huge!!! If you don't mind staying in a large impersonal hotel which is heaving with people day and night, but does have pleasant rooms at a good price this is for you. At 2,00pm check in time the reception was heaving! I was a little worried that I would miss the matinee show I had booked at 3.00pm - We had to check in, drop the bags off and run to make it. The rooms are clean and comfortable but because of the amount of other guests it is very noisy with talking late at night and early morning. But London is very expensive and this hotel does offer great value. The location is great within walking distance of everything in the west end and minutes away from the tube station. The hop on hop off tourist bus stops directly outside the hotel which takes you everywhere. Breakfast was a travesty! Toast not quite brown, cold and soggy and not much else. Large overcrowded dining room and unfriendly staff. Give it a miss. The bars at the hotel are busy and good value as is the food. Onceagain, good value average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mrso88
Reviews.Content: we went to london for a theatre weekend and stayed at this hotel. we found the location perfect for the tube just a short walk from the tube station. rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was great

Reviews.Title: “Busy , central, good value”
Reviews.Author: MartinDNottingham
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here, and both were pretty similar. It's a huge hotel that packs in lots of people at a reasonable price. I stayed over the Armistice weekend and there were very few cheap deals on Priceline so I ended up here! I couldn't moan about the room at all - it's utilitarian, a bit like my student room was at Uni many years ago. However it was clean and comfortable - I was only in the room to sleep. It wouldn't be a place I would advocate staying at if you were going to spend time in the room, but as most people are tourists it's just a base. If you accept that it is going to be basic you won't be dissapointed, enjoy the location it's great for walking, tube and bus routes. The Breakfasts can be a zoo at times - I didn't bother going - my Brother did, it was extremely busy, but he said the food was ok, which is the main thing. Go with an open mind and enjoy a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “ok not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: WelshMurphy
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a short break in London. The hotel for us was in a good position. 5 mins walk from Euston train station. Traveled with daughter and granson. Had a room on 7th floor. Clean but tired looking. Window would not close properly, Room cleaned but tea tray not cleaned or replenished . First morning had breakfast, dining room very busy, took a while to get somewhere to sit. Cooked breakfast was cold and toast cold and soggy. Second morning 9.30am went down for breakfast a queue of perhaps 200 +people waiting to go into breakfast, so didn't bother. Went to ask at reception for some tea/coffee sachets so we could at least have a hot drink and where told not possible. The other good point was that the hop on hop off bus stopped right out side which was great. Probably would not stop at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people make it out to be”
Reviews.Author: becca147
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal National beginning of November and surprisingly had a good stay! After reading reviews I was quite sceptical but ended up having a lovely time. Yes...it's basic, don't go expecting too much, but for a central hotel and an excellent base I wouldn't hesitate recommending it. Breakfasts were lovely. The hall can get busy and there are a lot of people pushing you about but the food itself was spot on. We had a triple room and there was more than enough space for what we needed. There were Tea and Coffee making facilities, flat screen tv, power shower and towels were changed every day. Check in also isnt as busy as expected. Don't know if this is because we went midweek. There are always people coming and going but just request a quiet room and you don't hear a thing. Tube station literally round the corner, loads of places to eat around the hotel and also in the courtyard. Apart from the reception staff, the rest could do with being a bit more friendly. Overall good value for money, ideal location and would more than likely return.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulinacollins
Reviews.Content: 5 nights in the royal national...never again,was the worst hotel i have ever stayed in.The most basic room ever,5 floors up and still very noisy outside.The breakfast staff were really bad,you were hearded in to the buffet like a pack of cows!a bit manic because of so many people,and got shouted at from the chineze woman in charge of the till.The staff were miserable,lazy,clotty and would swipe things away without asking were you finished..the hot!! breakfast was cold and bland..The bedroom facilities were so poor,no iron r board in your room,u had 2 go 2 a room 2 do it in a sweat box with no air!the hairdryer had 1 setting!cold ....!i had 2 ask for extra pillows which took half an hour 2 get!i was glad 2 get out of there after 5 nights..brutal bad...the best thing about the hotel was the tube station was a 5minute walk away.. .

Reviews.Title: “It's all you require, clean, friendly and very central”
Reviews.Author: dance4lynne
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time my friends and I have stayed here. We booked with Superbreak and got a really good deal. This hotel is clean, friendly, very central and has a full English buffet breakfast. It is all you require for a weekend trip or a few days in London. The corridors are a bit scruffy but the rooms are neat and immaculately clean. There are a few really good restaurants nearby and the tube station is diagonally accross the road. We are going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such a crowded hotel it was amazing the amount of people, the room was tired dated but clean, very very basic they do not provide anything other than a few cheap bars of soap in the bathroom so no shampoo if you want to wash the London grime out of your hair. I have never experienced anything like breakfast, a huge queue to get in and then confronted by a scene reminiscent of a factory canteen it was then a battle to find a seat with no system to show you to an empty table it was a free for all of wandering around hunting for a spare table. Our plan at check out was to put our cases in an hospitality room and go for a walk around London but the queue for this facility stretched the entire length of the lobby and that is a long queue so we left and wandered around cases in tow. In short it is a good location everything else is a minus

Reviews.Title: “Why not hide the damp with a child's cot?”
Reviews.Author: paulmillington
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated, tired and just very uninspiring to look at. On top of that our room smelled of damp. It was only just before we were about to leave that we realised that they had hidden the damp in the corner of the room with our babys cot. The carpet was soaking. I complained and was asked to fill out a form. The supervisor didn't even have the courtesy to apologise. The food was poor and the restaurant totally overcrowded. Don't book here whatever you do.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaun1young
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay at the royal national.. I'll keep this review short.. Hotel spot on location spot on!!!! Busy but hey this is London!!!!! Enjoy yourselfs and get out and about!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lane2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room and were on a Short Break trip. The room was clean but basic, while the location was good for most attractions. Free Wi-fi was only available in the reception area.Dining room reminded me of school dinners where you have 10 people seated to a table.Good hotel if you are on a short break and only want a base. If you want luxury this one's not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprising”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed in the Royal National for 2 nights bed and breakfast as we were booked as a package with train included.In read reviews before we left and didn't like what I saw but when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. I found this hotel to be ideally situated to see all London attractions .10 mins walk to Covent Garden, 20 mins walk to oxford street and all the shops. The tour bus stop was also situated right outside the hotel so was very handy to jump on and off. The staff at the hotel were very welcoming, the room was clean and pleasant but the breakfast was very basic if you were having continental and the room was a little bit school hall so wouldn't bother with breakfast if I stayed again as cafe just down the road .Room was cleaned every morning with clean linen and towels provided. The lifts came very quickly and being on 7th floor was great.On the second night we decided to stay in after being worn out from the days events and ordered a pzza from poppadom pizza. It was delivered within 15 mins by a friendly chap with a big smile. Two pizzas and fries was 13.95 which I thought was very reasonable for London. All in all I would stay at this hotel again. It's best to try it as everyone is different with an array of expectations.

Reviews.Title: “pay and don`t ask any questions”
Reviews.Author: emilygoesworld
Reviews.Content: Good location and competitive price. And that would be it when it comes to adavantages. Impersonal service with attitude: pay-and-do-not-ask-any-question. It took me almost 30 minutes to check in! In the area there are many more cosy, friendly, family run hotels. So don`t try Royal National unless you are a robot or so tired that you just want to put your head on the pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Never was it more true that you pay for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Whoistheman
Reviews.Content: It's cheap for London and a good location, but it's also a poor hotel, too many rooms, not enough staff and low low standard of beds, furnishings etc etc. Internet is free but there are so many users you might as well not bother as it is so slow. Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: Tothemanorborn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was central and we walked to our destinations. We are reasonably fit, but there are buses on the door step if need be, plan your route. Managed to walk up the stairs at St Pauls Cathedral to the very top dome. Just to give you an idea of our fitness level. Reading the reports I actually dreaded going to the Royal National as we had not been before. It is a VERY busy hotel with people from all over the world. The only real down fall was the diningroom which had no style. On a more postive note the food was good so what more can we want.

Reviews.Title: “A cattle stockyard for humans”
Reviews.Author: kempshalltrips
Reviews.Content: The Royal National is an ugly, crowded tourist anthill that failed to live up to my incredibly low expectations. It's not so much that the rooms are barely large enough to fit two beds and two human beings or that the staff is too overwhelmed to provide anything beyond mediocre, perfunctory service. The Royal National is as unwelcoming a highway truck stop, which is to my mind the cardinal sin a hotel can commit. It's pretty clear that most of their clientele is people booked on budget tours of England, people who are going to fly into London, spend the night and leave early in the morning. So the hotel's attitude, at least from my point of view, is that if most of their clients don't book there directly and aren't going to stay very long, why put any effort into making the place somewhere people might actually want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base”
Reviews.Author: kimberley90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - just a two minute walk to the underground and in a pretty residential area, with cafes and pubs close by. The hotel itself is dated and the breakfast basic but it's fine for a base. The pub next door serves great food, so I would definitely recommend a pub lunch there, if you can. All in all, would stay there again if I wasn't looking for luxury and just wanted a base hotel to go to and from.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: phillip o
Reviews.Content: great rooms and in a fantastic location, breakfast was very busy but not bad to say how many they must be catering for.not enough bar area is the only problem here, the southside bar, though not bad isnt big enough and can never get a seat which meant we went back to our rooms, the london pub is also great but could do with much bigger bar for people to sit in on a night, otherwise the place is great

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: stozy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ten minutes walk from Kings Cross and St. Pancras rail stations, two minutes from nearest tube station and in general offers easy access to the main sights of London. Staff are helpful and were around in numbers. We requested and were given a quiet room overlooking the 'garden' which surprised us in this busy area. Booking in close to 2pm on thursday may have been to our advantage in this respect. There is a luggage room to leave bags if you arrive early, there is no charge for this. Breakfast ok. Room was clean and basic and is a true reflection on the modest price (Â£99 for twin room) for accomodation in a decent location in the capital. There are numerous bars and restaurants within the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BuBbLeGuM_kIkI
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveller i was not too keen on staying at this hotel after reading the reviews. I only stayed there because it was where my Contiki tour started. The rooms were really basic but not uncomfortable. It is in a great location.. Only about a 2 minute walk from Russel Square Station. The restaurants were also quite good. I would be happy to stay at the Royal National again. Only negative was the elavators. Only 1 worked so it took me 30 minutes to get down to the basement with my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “differing opinions”
Reviews.Author: k g
Reviews.Content: People will get what they pay and need - do the research because the locations is good for London touring It is basically modern hotel with modern prices I can see why people have differing views so it is take your choice. I would reccomend it

Reviews.Title: “lack of professionalism from staff in general. ( cold and distant)”
Reviews.Author: albixGibraltar
Reviews.Content: we were so surprised with the reaction of the receptinists and concierges and also the disrespect of the morning staff at breakfast.the beds were minatures and the room was overheated. never again.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly good location”
Reviews.Author: jeffforster
Reviews.Content: Huge friendly hotel with a good location always very busy, can be noisy and now looking a bit tired. Don,t expect the Ritz. This hotel is a great base

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not for business”
Reviews.Author: captain_gwk
Reviews.Content: Pros: - good for students, young adults - reasonably priced hotel in London - good location - breakfast - ok Cons: - rooms a bit small. - no internet in the room (only in lobbies). - there is a high possibility not to get a double room, therefore if you are a couple - you could sleep separately. - I believe the hotel was overcrowded and staff could not handle the pressure.

Reviews.Title: “'Ideal location & great value for Money!'”
Reviews.Author: Vixyc88
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have visited London and our second stay at the Royal National. The first time I visited the hotel I found it quite daunting as it is quite simply huge. I am quite suprised at the amount of bad reveiws I have read for this hotel as for the price you pay and the location it is in I believe it offers the perfect opportunity to see London with a short distance. People complaining about queues at reception??..Correct me If I am wrong but is this not one of the busiest, bustling cities in the World!?..You get what you pay for, the hotel is located roughly 15minutes from Kings Cross station in a taxi and about a 20 minute walk from Oxford street..There are various pubs and cuisines located nearby including greek, indian, chinese and italian.
