I would recommend those that like indian to try 'Popadum Express' located within the hotel, its Â£12.95pp on an evening and thats your buffett & a free naan bread, drinks are reasonably priced and the food is lovely..The London pub is also Â£2.90 a pint (A bargain in London!!). The rooms are clean & more than adequate, towels changed everyday, the breakfast is the standard continental and cooked and for those who don't have it prebooked its available at a Â£4.50 supplement. Food is lovely however would recommend an early start is it does get like a cattle marked in there and you do have to share big tables with other people..There are a couple of pubs directly down the road running opposite to the hotel as well as a little shopping centre with a river island, new look and the Gourmet Burger Kitchen which I would deffo recommend as it was great service, reasonably priced and delicious!!..For anyone who is using the taxis they are pretty easy to flag down at the front of the hotel as were advised if you book a taxi it costs more and takes 15/20 mins so for anyone that has plans for a show etc give it plenty of time to get there!.For anyone who wants to get around you can purchase day tickets for Â£6.60 which are great and can use on tube & buses..The park about 5 minutes walk is great for spotting squirrels & feeding them & the hotel is in a pretty great location to get to everywhere..Deffo recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to see this fantastic city !! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for short break”
Reviews.Author: morrock47
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself stayed here for 3 nights in October and found facilities perfectly adequate. The room was clean and had everything we needed for a short break. Location suited us as we were able to walk to most of things we wanted to do. The open topped tour bus stopped outside which was also very handy. We had english breakfast included and again this was adequate and gave us a good start to the day. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Delivered all that one would expect”
Reviews.Author: gelPiraeus_Greece
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at Luna Simone hotel after reading the good reviews from numerous tripadvisor members. Stayed at room 3 on the Luna side of the hotel. The room was small, but had all I could be looking for. Was very, repeat very clean, and I enjoyed a nice shower everyday, with the water pressure and temperature being more than satisfactory for me. Breakfast was very well executed, egg and bacon being my favorite selection everyday. The staff was very helpful and polite. Bus 24 which stops right outside the hotel was most convenient for going to the centre of London. Will definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Elainie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights and found the hotel to be a bit like a hostel. It was huge with no personal touches. There is no hair dryer in the rooms but they are available from housekeeping apparantly (if you can find it) for a Â£20 deposit. There is a tv in the room which was quite good. The hotel is very basic and reasonably clean for the size of it. The breakfast was ok, nothing to write home about though. Toast was made for you and lying soggy for customers to pick up. There was a pub in the hotel which served good bar meals at a reasonable price. There was also a pizza and pasta restaurant in the hotel which looked ok. The hotel was close to Russell Square and there were bus stops close by and the tube station is just a few minutesvwalk away so getting around from there was quite easy. Euston station was only a ten minute taxi drive away as well. There is a room to keep your bags in on the day you are leaving for a small charge of 50p per bag. If you are looking for a cheap hotel then you might consider this but I personally would like a smaller hotel with a little more personal touches next time.

Reviews.Title: “A real shocker”
Reviews.Author: mike d
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5th October for one night on a British Airways business package. Never had a problem with BA's recommendations before and this place was near my meetings. Arrived to check in at 2.00 and get to a meeting for 3.00.The reception reminded me of a very big rugby scrum: about 50 people all hanging about with 3 people on reception and no queuing system. People walking in from the side and everyone complaining. I asked at the concierge desk where there were about 10 staff hanging about if some manager could not sort out the queues and get some more staff on. I was told , very rudely , by an Irish guy that he was a manager and didn't see what the problem was- great customer service. l left and took my luggage to my meetings and returned at 9.00 pm by which time there was no queue and about 8 staff on reception! If I could have got another hotel easily I would have left then. Worse was to come: the sharp objects on the bedroom carpet were the last resident's toe nail clippings and it was a full set! The room was very basic and noisy on the longest corridors I've ever seen. Couldn't wait to get away the next day! Overall, very disappointing and not even clean. It reminded me of poor student accommodation and the attitude of the staff was the worst I have seen in years. They obviously cater for budget tourists which is fine but they should get some lessons from Holiday Inn Express or Isis. I've stayed in cheaper hotels but never one as poorly run or dirty. It was rubbish and I'd advise you to avoid it until they improve.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money....”
Reviews.Author: Jordy90
Reviews.Content: Royal National was definitely not worth the money when you can pay less for a private room in one of the many hostels in the same place for half the price and cleaner ! The bathroom was not cleaned at all and we found other people's hair still there ! We stayed there on three different occasions (as we had booked before we left on our trip) and I will never stay there again. Although the location is good and they do have a BEN AND JERRY'S icecream vending machine downstairs : ). There is free wi - fi although it only works downstairs and is sometimes really slow.

Reviews.Title: “stay a this hotel”
Reviews.Author: patlovescats_19
Reviews.Content: yet again i had a wonderful stay at this hotel staff help full room clean

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing indeed”
Reviews.Author: Moonbase599
Reviews.Content: In two words: 'don't bother'. For a three star hotel, this place sucks. A grim, austere building (ok, I could have worked that out from the pictures if I'd bothered to look), surly and unhelpful staff, dubious standards of cleanliness and a breakfast experience that could have been a scene from Within These Walls.Â  The room we had was very basic with worn bed linen - the blanket in our child's bed had a massive visible hole in it (since when is that ever an acceptable standard?). Filthy windows, two drunk Germans had vomited in one of the lifts, the corridor had peeling paintwork, and every time the people in the next door room flushed their toilet it sounded like the whole plumbing system was about to explode.Â  Breakfast the next morning matched the overall 1970s Soviet State Institution feel of the place. Warped plastic trays (the sort incarcerated prisoners have to use), mass produced congealing food (the bacon looked like it had been cooked two days earlier and had been left swimming in some greasy water to keep it fresh, and the vat of baked beans had a skin on them that could have been removed to make a handbag), and gloomy, hovering staff all made me feel depressed for the state of the British hotel industry.Â  I had never been so glad to check out of a hotel come morning.Â

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: lainebee
Reviews.Content: arrived at this hotel at 1.45pm to be told check in was not until 2pm so we sat at the bar .10 mins later you could not get any were near to check in we then waited 40 mins in the queue .we got to our room very small it had 3 single beds you had to climb over to get to each bed .on the surface was clean then i put some clothing on the radiator when i took it off the back was covered it white dust and under the beds had a lot to be desired. a lot of comments say this was a cheap hotel i did find that. the hotel pub (london pub) serves warm drinks,terrible food, and really rude staff especially the manager . the english breakfast was ok

Reviews.Title: “The worst week end accomodation ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and thought we had gone back in time to the 70's the outside was shabby and the inside was just as bad. Felt like I was in the middle of a third world country airport. On arrival at the reception the gentleman was very friendly but told us that our family room had been "overbooked" and so then we had to have two twin rooms instead with interconnecting doors which although not the same we accepted as it was getting later. However I dont think this was fair as our hotel had been booked in June this year and we have two young daughters aged 7 and 5 years old so actually this was bad. Then he said that we had to pay for them for breakfast and I had been told this was paid for by the company but he insisted we paid without checking any further. On arrival to our room we were place on the 5th floor directly on the busy main road with ambulances, police cars and all sorts making noise. I know it is London and this should be expected but my goodness it was awful. The rooms were quite spacious and it looked like the carpet had been re done but thats about all. The beds were very lumpy and there were stains on the bed covers. The bathrooms were old and shabby with damp on the ceiling. To make matters worse one of the rooms we had been given was a disabled room and had red cords everywhere which were very strange and the bathroom was specially adapted. I appreciate that this is excellent for disabled persons and please dont get me wrong but it felt more like a hospital room than a bedroom for a relaxing weekend break. We then went down to have a drink before getting some tea and the bar was literally "spilling" over with residents and prodomintaly tourists it was like an airport lounge. The bar area is disgusting and really dirty it is not fit for children to be near. Then I took my daughter to the toilet downstairs and some person or what ever it was had basically soiled the toilet from the floor to the wall it was absolutely gross. I informed the reception area. The concierge were ok but they were very moody almost like they had to work there now because they wanted to. We hardly slept a wink and woke up eventually with two very tired and upset children. Then we had heard about the breakfast which had sounded awful and yes it really was. There was a queue stretching back to the reception and then once greated or "grunted" at by the waiter it was a rubbish breakfast and rubbish service. We were grunted at most of the time by the waiting staff and none of them spoke much English. At one point a young boy was running through the restaurant saying move out of the way I am going to be sick!!! it was awful. We nearly went home there and then but stayed as we were going to see the Lion King which we had promised our kids. Never ever have I stayed in such a terrible, miserable and poor place and I would not recommend to anyone!!!! dont stay there !!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: I have now booked my third stay at the Royal National. It is absolutely perfect, if you want to spend your money on other things than on your accomodation. It is cheap and busy, but if you know that when you do your booking you wouldnÂ´t have anything to complain about. Me and my friend did spend about Â£260 for 4 nights... If you ask me - its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap? Very”
Reviews.Author: Annie475
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel at all. The room itself was ok but not great, we were round the back and had to listen to a terrible noise all night that sounded like an air conditioning unit, which we knew it wasn't as there was no air conditioning. The bathroom could have been a lot cleaner. Breakfast was fine but where you ate (Windsor Room) was more like a works canteen than a restaurant. On our last day we went to the bar on the south side and the floor in front of the bar was dirty (drink had been spilled and not cleaned up), the brass on the actual bar itself was also dirty. On a plus point the hotel is central.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy L
Reviews.Content: Just come back from this hotel and in the middle of sending a complaint to the manager. Really tired and overly big hotel which has seen better days. When we arrived in our room we found a dirty sock and 2 baby spoons on the floor. The remote on the TV didn't work and the noise was horrendous. Sirens and traffic all night through single glazed windows resulted in hardly any nights sleep. To make matters worse my partner was covered in bites from the bed (I got away with one or two!) The breakfast was a joke. We were herded into a room which can only be described as a canteen and given bad food and bad service. Terrible place - pay extra and stay somewhere decent.

Reviews.Title: “Awful noisy Hotel, Terrible Floor Plan over and poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Ellis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel mainly due to attending a conference at the hotel. However I wish I'd stayed further out!! It was cheap and this was reflected in everything I witnessed from the broken lifts, inadequate service from reception staff who's English was poor, and the most bizare floor plans I've ever seen. I spent 15 minutes trying to locate my room as did other guests. Quite frankly I can't imagine how when this hotel is full every guest could evacuate safely. It's a disaster waiting to happen. The rooms are like something out of a 1970's bed sit; and not in a cool retro way either. Bathrooms are dated and in need of repair. The hotel is over run by backpackers which is absolutely fine; however it's design means noise travels around the towers. At midnight it's still heaving with people. Sorry Royal National but your hotel is far from regal. More soiled than royal'd. Ps no way is this a 3 star, more like a 1.5.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “basic and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: a good cheap hotel well located. I use for football trips to London as bar stays open quite late. Often get trips from Arsenal & Tottenham fans coming over from Ireland. As per prev reveiw it is noisy at night as Bloomsbury Ambulance Station just around corner and on main route for Police and Fire as well but if you drink enough it won't bother you

Reviews.Title: “BA says 3 star, to me just barely makes a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: WallyFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a BA package tour, don't let the grandiose name fool you! This is a large pack them in group hotel. You'll notice some reviews say it's fine, some hated it, depending on what you expect. By U.S. standards the rooms are tiny, old and dirty and the amenities are minimal. The breakfast would be considered a joke by most people, you'll get coffee or tea, perhaps hot, and have to fight with massive crowds of bus tourists for a slice or two of chilly toast. Fruit? I never saw any, lucky to get jam/marmalade. Rooms tend to be a bit threadbare and dark and showers tiny and none too clean. Walls and windows are thin to noise. On the plus side, the toilets and hot water worked, there is the requisite hot water kettle and the location seemed reasonably safe and very close to the tube stop in a decent central location. If you don't expect too much, don't plan to spend too much time here and get a good package deal you might be OK with this choice, but don't even consider if you are harder to please or looking for something like a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good atmosphere but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: zommiebar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before my Contiki tour commenced. It is centrally located and easy to find, especially once you get off the tube. We had hot water, our beds were comfortable and it seemed clean. The pub was great for it's cheap and easy (and large!) food, and a great start to set off for the day. However, it seemed to be in a rougher part of town, and is mainly dominated by Contiki travellers. We had drug dealers hanging around the front near the driveway, The staff weren't very helpful, and the breakfast was pretty average. Me and my roomie had no issues with our room as it was on the outside of the building, but we had other friends who stayed on the inside area facing the courtyard and said it was always noisy (night time with the pub, morning with people leaving for their tour), their shower and bed's were average and their room wasn't cleaned. All in all, if you are with Contiki, use it for your pre or post accommodation. I wouldn't go here though if you are aren't about to start a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al W
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. Where do I start. The mattress' are about as old as the hotel. Security is a joke. The Concierge staff need to be educated in people skills.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic student halls!”
Reviews.Author: catpurple
Reviews.Content: Plus points: 3 mins walk from tube station (Russell Square). Really easy to find. Central location. Easy links to the whole city. Bedding and towels were clean. Shower was powerful. Plentiful hot water. Minus Points: The area seems to quite rough. Extremely noisy and busy all night long. Must be near an ambulance station similar, sirens every few mins all day and night. And no double glazing in the rooms! The windows, and indeed everything else in the premises, are really old. They are thin and weak and no the verge of being dangerous should you have youngsters with you. Nothing in the hotel is up to date. Decor, fixtures, fittings and furnishings are at least 20 years old. The beds are on wheels and move all over in the night. The wallpaper is torn or missing in parts. There was mould in abundance in the bathroom...Overall this place is very basic indeed. Reminiscent of low quality student halls. It's most definitely 2* at best and is over priced considering the standards of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lucia072
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central but this was all it has going for it. It was shabby and dirty. the bed had plastic coverings on the matresss so a good night sleep is out of the question. The breakfast was ok if you paid extra to get an english breakfast.,Also we where woken about seven o clock to the sound of building work on the building.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip”
Reviews.Author: jojo2003
Reviews.Content: Family friendly hotel. Very clean, helpfull staff and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average, acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_The_World3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel a few times. The best thing about the Royal National is its location. It is a half-block to the Russell Square tube stop (Picadilly Line) and 3 blocks (10 minute walk) to the British Museum. There are numerous restaurants (at least 25) in a 4 block area. There is a shopping center at the end of the street (2 blocks) with numerious shops, a drugstore, a grocery store, and an out-patient clinic. Breakfast is free at the hotel. It's a very basic continental breakfast: coffee, tea, milk, juice, toast (sometimes bagels), various jams, cereals, and some fresh fruit. Nothing spectacular, but acceptable. You can pay for a full breakfast if you prefer ham and eggs and such. There is no wifi in the rooms. It is spotty in the lobbies (they have two lobbies: north and south). Wifi is good in the Coffee Shop located in the hotel courtyard. Don't let the website fool you; there is no gym or pool or workout facilities. They have an agreement with a local gym nearby, but it isn't free for hotel guests. There are no business services available for business travelers. You will not have access to computers, printers, or photocopiers. You will have to walk to the end of the block to the nearest internet lounge for these services. There is also a copy place directly across the street from the hotel. The rooms: basic, very, very basic. Usually two beds, a dresser, a wardrobe, tv with basic local channels (no cable or satellite channels), a coffee pot. Rooms have radiators for heating, like most European hotels. Upper-floor rooms can get cold in the winter. Rooms, on hot summer days, can get hot and stifling--there is no central air. Most rooms have one LARGE window that tilts in or swings open a few inches, doesn't allow a lot of air flow. The beds are very "short" and "narrow" by American standards. Couples will find themselves sleeping in separate beds. Anyone 6 feet tall (or taller) will find their feet hanging over the edge of the bed. Did I mention the beds are on casters? Yes, the beds will move around. There is a pub attached to the hotel. When the weather is nice the people will hang-out in the hotel courtyard--it can get VERY noisy if your room faces the interior hotel courtyard. I prefer rooms facing the street. This is one of the largest hotels in London--it caters to MANY groups (tour groups from all over Europe and Japan and many US University groups). It can take up to 45 minutes to get checked-in if you just happen to arrive after a tour bus. The front desk staff is usually very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a romatic getaway or are on a business trip this is NOT the hotel for you. If you are looking for a hotel with a great location and you don't plan to spend much time in the room--this could be the place you are looking for (affordable and basic).

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel known to man - avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Robin A
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever been in. The people who have rated this highly must be blind or work for the place. We were put into a disabled room which was filthy. The towels were brown and smelly. The decor is hideous and the kettle was thick with limescale. A number of the staff were fine but the manager we dealt with; a Miss Fairweather (ironically) was the rudest most ignorant woman I have ever come across. Nothing in the hotel was free; the charged me Â£10 for a gym session. The breakfast was cold toast and fruit out of a can. The ONLY thing this place has going for it is location but I would NEVER consider going there again - AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateDenise
Reviews.Content: Hi stayed in the royal national hotel for just 1 night this week with full english breakfast.Twin room was quite roomy with bath and shower.It was very clean and the beds were comfy and clean.We requested a quite room and ended up on the 5th floor.Not much of a view but it was the quietest night i have ever spent in a hotel.Very near to underground so it was easy to get around london although a lot of places were in walking distance anyway.10 minutes to west end shows (we went to see we will rock you it was fantastic!)English breakfast was nice but downside was it was really busy and there we long tables where you had to sit with other people.Overall this was a good base to stay and i would stay again if i go to london.Staff were friendly.4 marks out of 5.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great Central Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 2 nights at this hotel. Read reviews and went with no expectations. Arrived, 5-10 mins check in time. Went to room on 6th floor which overlooked the main street. The room was quiet and very clean and had a lovely en suite full bathroom. Breakfast was ok, quite good. Continental (full english 4.50 extra pp). Went at 9am first day and was quite busy, but only took around 3 mins to locate a table. Second morning we went at 0745 and it was much quieter. There is a court yard where coaches pull up and I would imagine if your room overlooked this you could be bothered by noise. As the hotel does bookings for coach parties you do see ppl moaning abot noise, this didnt affect us as we were in the south building and all coach parties re in the north building, looking at signs and info it seems the hotels policy is to keep all coach parties in the North side and regular families and couples in the south. No drunken noise heard at all. The location is superb, walkable to most attractions and we surfed the tube like pros to places like Buckingham Palace and Science and NHM museum. We walked to the hotel from St Pancras (15mins) and we walked to The British Museum (5mins). Oxford street is less than 10 mins walk away. Definatley will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “royal national london break”
Reviews.Author: morag c
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic London break.Stayed at Royal National and could not have asked for more.The staff were very friendly and efficient,the room was very modern and clean.It was rather noisy overlooking the courtyard,but probably not much more than if you were on a busy road anywhere in the city anyway .Breakfast can be very busy and hectic, but the staff are very efficient, clearing tables etc.Some guests were a bit put out with staff removing plates too quickly,but I'd much rather swallow my last mouthful without a plate than have someone elses leftovers on a plate at my table for breakfast!! Food was generally good. In short a perfect base,fantastic value in a perfect location!! I had my doubts after reading some various reviews and recommend the following : Smile and be nice to reception staff,say good morning to your cleaning person............ it goes a long way!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: garymackem
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this chain a few times as it's close to central London and kings cross rooms are ok and comfortable but the breakfast is self service and not the best quality

Reviews.Title: “Two star hotel with three stars”
Reviews.Author: JohnAlmere
Reviews.Content: Low price, high volume. That seems to be the business model of the Royal National. There is nothing wrong with that but to have three stars at the same time it means that you are supposed to serve a decent breakfast (complete disaster at this hotel, in the "canteen", there is no breakfast room) and it also means that you do not furnish your rooms with stuff that looks like you bought it from a bankrupt former communist state hotel. Many people mention the great location as an upside. That may be true but at the same time London Underground takes you anywhere in no time. So, if you want to stay in a massive youth hostel, the RN is the place to go. If not, stay somewhere else. That's what we'll do next time. At the RN they don't care a bit, they are full anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: lynsh13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in september very busy hotel, check in took awhile as there are so many people checking in at the same time but there were 4 people on the desks checking people in,great service even asked us which rooms we would like.the rooms were just what you wanted a clean bed clean towels which were changed everyday, even tea/coffee were provided,we used this hotel as a base, leaving after breakfast each day and returning in the evening. breakfast is very busy between 8/9am,best to go before or after these times but the food was ok never ran out of anything.really good hotel central london we walked everywhere as its so close to tubes buses just have a map and your ok.

Reviews.Title: “We spent a full week at the Royal National in London...”
Reviews.Author: naturocean
Reviews.Content: We spent a full week at the Royal National in London and we were very enchanted by the location of this hotel. We must admit it is not a luxurious hotel but our room was situated in the inner part of the hotel. If you are willing to book for this hotel, ensure that your room is located in the inner part to avoid loud noises coming from the traffic or some Londonians partying. Our room, as well as the bathroom, were always very clean. The window was always open and never been disturbed once by our neighbors. The quality food for the basic breakfasts is always the same (cereals (with milk and sugar), toast (with butter and jam) and coffee (with cream, milk and sugar) and juices (orange and apple). You will have to pay a supplement if you want eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. The corridors are quite old and Ok. I would recommend this hotel if you are a couple or family traveling together.

Reviews.Title: “Turist's Convier Production”
Reviews.Author: YuryKim
Reviews.Content: A lot of people! Modest conditions. But clean, the staff clearly answer your questions. And most importantly it is a convenient location! Wi-Fi is free, but it's low in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “central but overprice, the breakfast is a disaster”
Reviews.Author: joe_19751975
Reviews.Content: verdict: central hotel, but for what they offer, very much overprice. the breakfast is a disaster pros: - close to a tube, or if you able to use the bus, close to the center - room are clean - good and a lot of hot water cons: - general run down place - bad isolated windows - cold as the windows are bad and the heating is not working - bed: you have to use a wool-sheet and some strange bed cover. this is never cleaned. for that price i expect much more. - breakfast1: not enough space, you have to queue frequently to get in to the room - breakfast2: very nosy, you eat with 300 other guests - breakfast3: very low cost ingredients, cheep jam, can fruits - breakfast4: disgusting dirty carpet in the breakfast room - breakfast5: bad coffee - breakfast6: it should be open until 10am, but they stop 9:45 with supplies - breakfast: it is a really sad story..... - with 1000 bed's always a noise place - slow internet

Reviews.Title: “One week stay at Royal National London”
Reviews.Author: carmelo b
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week stay at the hotel with a positive note. The hotel is well located in central London. The room was very good and specious with clean towels available every day. The hotel staff were very helpful when needed and the breakfast was acceptable. We have enjoyed our stay and will return. Carmelo/Carmen Bezzina (17th September 2011)

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: ChasBKna
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a very reasonable package for 2 nights including rail travel and tickets for a West End show, the overall value for money was fair. The hotel is extremely large, and suffers from some confusion over the proper servicing of rooms, in that whilstr there are some items that should be done, they are not always so. However, requests for dealing with these omissions were readily dealt with once the language barrier had been overcome (the majority of the staff are of foreign origin). The bedroom (on the 7th floor) was small, but adequate, and had a good view of the BT Telecom Tower, and was free from traffic and other external noise. However, the noise from the bathoom extract fan was something to behold - it sounded like a jet aircraft ready for take-off. Fortunately, the bathroom door closed sufficiently to keep the bedroom reasonably quiet, but the noise whilst using the shower etc was horrendous. The breakfast room was in all reality like a large, extremely busy, staff self service canteen, with a poor selection of offerings for the Continental Breakfast. The English Breakfast offerings were fairly standard, but the fried eggs were prepared in batches that were too large, resulting in most of the yolks being on the firm side. The tea (from machines) was very poor. The staff were present mainly to clear tables, which they did with exemplary speed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location”
Reviews.Author: Amy K
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in July. The room was very clean, had everything we needed. Basic but brill location for sightseeing. Felt very safe. Good place to stay as its central for seeing all the sights

Reviews.Title: “Great time in London”
Reviews.Author: mickeyHull
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£140 for 2 nights including B/B with rail fare from Hull through Thomson and having read some of the reviews was not put of as thought had a bargain Any way was not dissapointed the hotel is with in walking distance of Kings cross and also Soho and Chinatown What you get is a hotel for a base in a nice location for somewhere for you to sleep We never had the breakfast while we was there as this hotel has 1000 rooms and when we came down must have been 70 people queuing and was not prepared to queue This did not bother me as we just went straight out and enjoyed the day

Reviews.Title: “Royal National Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonne529
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a shortbreak staying at RNH reading reviews before we went i was a little unsure what to expect. i need;nt have worried at all.The hotel is a short walk from Kings Cross,the staff are very helpful,checkin was fast,room was large enough,rooms were cleaned each day,bedding clean,a good hot shower,towels a little old but main thing clean,quite a bit of noise from streets but hey you are in the middle of London.got into breakfast no bother,(full breakfast means cereal,toast etc not bacon eggs,if you want them there is a charge of Â£4.50.) but overall for what you pay for this hotel i think its good value thats why i have given this rating.If you want The Ritz you will have to pay The Ritz prices.will certainly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Royal National Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, 5 minutes walk from Russell Square tube station. Tesco Express at the tube, which has cash machine that doesn't charge a fee (neither did the machine in the hotel foyer). A vast hotel. check in is through inner courtyard on South side. The check in is from 2pm and gets crowded but there were quite a few staff so the queues didn't take too lone - 10 mins or so. Room, bed and bathroom were clean. Bath with fixed shower head and plug, so you could have an actual bath if you wanted. Another feature in bathroom - but not sure if it is a bidet or footbath! 1 towel per guest provided, but we had taken our own. Rooms made up each day if required. The chambermaid also replenished milk and coffee/tea sachets. Kettle in room, but no hairdryer. Pillows very flat indeed and beds on castors so when you lean back to read, the bed slips away from the wall. Bed linen clean but old-fashioned - a flat sheet and scratchy blanket with bedspread to match the curtains. Mattress comfortable but the bed could have been a bit wider - it was a narrow single one. Breakfast is continental (rolls, toast, butter, jam, cereal, tinned grapefruit / orange, fruit juice, tea, coffee, milk), also included with our package was the 'English Breakfast' (bacon, sausages, eggs, tomatoes, beans) - if not included in your package they would charge Â£4.50 per person. I thought the breakfast was plentiful and good value, although it does get crowded the later you leave it. If you leave your bags with the concierge it is free if you are arriving, otherwise 50p per item if checking out and collectng later.

Reviews.Title: “Don't give this machinery your money”
Reviews.Author: marit l
Reviews.Content: Royal National is more of a motel than a hotel. Don't go. No one over the age 18 will enjoy their stay. Old and noisy. Keys never work because of their stone age systems, overwhelming sounds from the plumming, wafer thin walls, ugly.

Reviews.Title: “Unhlepful and unclean”
Reviews.Author: j s
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Superbreak as they recommended it and I wanted somewhere central and not too expensive to take my 2 children for a birthday weekend treat away. But we were very disapointed with the hotel and the staff. In the lobby/reception the vending machines for cold drinks were never switched on(though they were stocked) probably so you would spend money at the bar while you waited for your room. The receptionists were rude, unsmiling and unhelpful at check in. The room key cards were temperamental, taking many attempts to actually open the door each time. Our room had not been hoovered, there was pubic hairs on the toilet seat, even pubic hair on the tumblers in the bathroom. Don't expect any shampoo, shower gel or shower caps. The only thing you get is tiny bars of soap and towels. The room itself was nice enough but basic and dirty. We were at the front of the hotel and there was a lot of noise throughout the night from people shoutng and carrying on in the street. At breakfast the staff patrolled the room and were quite intimidating, keeping an eye on what you're doing, watching your every move, rushing you to finish, my tray got taken even though I clearly was chewing with a still half cup of tea and piece of toast still there to be eaten which I thought was very rude. On leaving we wanted to used the left luggage room for a few hours which was fine until we tried to get it out again. There was a notice saying ask at Concierge desk, which I did, and they told me to go to the luggage room as someone was there. We went to the luggage room which was locked, reported to Concierge that it was locked, to which he disagreed and said I must have gone to the wrong door and to go again. Which I did, came back and insisted he came with me to see for himself. He wasn't busy at all, there was 4 staff behind the counter and no other residents to attend to. He went with us to the luggage room to find it locked and without a word of apology just opened it and handed our luggage in frosty silence!! 99% of the staff are like this, rude and ignorant, with the exception of a lovely nigerian lady at the entrance to the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “May be cheap, but get more than moneys worth”
Reviews.Author: CyberTraveller1391
Reviews.Content: THis is my second visit to London and by some bizarre manner we were booked into the Royal National Hotel...again. It does cater for the student traveller more, but they don't have to. The service is excellent. Room service always easily available and the staff immensely friendly. The bedrooms are clean and always tidy upon return. The bathroom doesn't need a disgusted facial expression, because it is always clean. The bath is a big plus, normally there are just showers in hotels like this one. Breakfast is delicious even if you don't pay extra for eggs and bacon, the continental is great. Concierge are not that helpful, but the cleaning staff are :-) Overall a great hotel to stay when adventuring through London that is not eating at your leisure budget.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the ant farm”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveller77
Reviews.Content: This huge hotel is well located for a number of London sites - Bloomsbury, British Museum and numerous universities - but it is like staying at an enormous ant farm with tiny minimalist cells for rooms (at least there are en suite bathrooms, the carpet is new and the curtains match the bedspreads), battered corridors and a cafeteria breakfast that is very unappetising with cold toast and dreadful coffee. The place bussles with tour buses of school students or European visitors - one doesn't hear English very often! I'm not sure of its rating but it can't be more than 2 star and I am not likely to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Gilly678
Reviews.Content: Where to start- staff could barely understand English - massive queues for check in (around twenty mins) and separate queues to store luggage which you have to pay for! Our rooms were basic as expected only a couple of lifts worked , which were always full and breakfast was dreadful, felt like cattle - mother in laws eggs were black, and bread was stale. Left my jacket in the wardrobe and housekeeping extremely unhelpful when I called the next , And no one prepared to help. No hairdryer or iron in the room! Strongly recommend you stay away from this one. Travelodge 5 mins away and much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, but.........”
Reviews.Author: Marie T
Reviews.Content: There was a group of 26 of us staying at the hotel and this is what we found. We stayed double and triple rooms and in each one, there was a bath towel for each person, but only one 'community face towel for us to share. Many in our group complained the towels had a terrible odour and one person found traces of mascara on one. It took three consecutive days of asking for extra towels for us to actually get some, but only for that particular day. The next day it was back to the 'community towel. The room wasn't cleaned properly either. On one morning, I left the room and realised I'd forgotten something, and in the 10 minutes(literally) I was gone, they'd been and gone. Soap residue still in the bathtub and wash basin; and all they'd done with the beds was to pull the sheets over the pillows. I must say it was the first time I've stayed n a hotel which doesn't provide shampoo, either. Luckily I had mine with me, but some of the other members of my group didn't. The key-cards were also a problem as they didn't always work. The dining rooms were forever running out of cutlery, crockery or trays and as another guest commented, 'They specialise in rudeness'.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Huddersfielddermot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is competitively priced in a very good location. However,the hotel is in need of a thorough overhaul decoration wise,double glazing,breakfast,furnishings Inc bed. The hotel was noisy from road noise and the beds were very,very basic. We would not go back to this hotel despite price and position advantages.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: carrieoldtrafford
Reviews.Content: Service was great. We arrived at 10am and check in was 2pm but we were allowed to check in which was good because it gave us almost a whole extra day of holiday. On check out porters kept luggage from 9am until 5.30pm for the cost of Â£1.50 again giving us another full day. Room was basic and had a tendency to be over warm and somewhat noisy with coach parties arriving and departing until late and from very early hours. Also quite a lot of noise from the bars and restaurants in the courtyard. Breakfast was plentiful although the toast was like warm bread (barely toasted). Some mornings we had to wait for an available table. Hotel is very big and has lots of guests staying there but on the whole was good value for money and I would seriously consider returning,

Reviews.Title: “Mostly ok, very basic! Bathroom huge letdown!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry___BD
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in November 2010 as part of a school group and we stayed here for 2 nights. First impression was that it looked rather grand as the reception is extremely nice and staff are polite. However when we went up to our rooms we were disapointed with the conditions of the bathroom. The bath had long hairs at the bottom and in the plughole, and the shower curtains were tinged brown at the bottom, which is disusting in my opinion.. If i was to clean the bath that would be the first thing i'd sort out!!! Comfy wise the beds were acceptable eventhough the cushions were very flat and uncomfortable and I woke up with bad neck ache!! ALSO the bed sheets did not smell fresh and i got the impression they had not been washed from a previous visiter. The worse thing is smelling that dusty smell when you're trying to sleep from a long tiring day going through all the art galleries and trecking through London! Breakfast in the morning was nice as we had a ticket to a full english, only let down was the dining area was extremely crowded and people were desperately trying to find places to sit. I felt very rushed to eat and get out, not the relaxing breakfast I was looking forward to.. Overall I dont think I would choose this hotel again, mostly because of the bathroom, major put off, wish i had complained now....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent services, clean and absolutely perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: dacarrr
Reviews.Content: Before travelling: we selected this hotel because it was one of the very few offering triple rooms at decent prices in London. Arrival: I had read it had huge waiting times to get the rooms, it took us less than 5 minutes to get ours. The room was clean, spacious for three, with coffee maker, simple bathroom but toilet in a different part of the room so it was easier to use with three people sharing the room. The lifts were horrible to use, it took forever to go down, make sure you know where the closest steps are and USE THEM The included breakfast was nothing too special, but we were not expecting much. The room was quiet, zero noise and our overall stay was really nice... and even nicer considering what we paid for the room. The location of the hotel is exceptional and you can actually reach the main attractions without bus/metro.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit ...... and we'll come here again!”
Reviews.Author: Leedsteach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap, cheerful, convenient and enormous! You most definitely get what you pay for but rooms are tidy and comfortable and they are serviced daily with all you could require. Housekeeping staff are very helpful; a quick call to their base and we were provided with extra towels. pillows and tea/coffee etc. The full English breakfast is exactly what is needed to start your day but you do have to be quite robust to survive the dining experience in this very busy canteen/cafeteria! If you travel as a couple beware losing your table if you both get up to serve yourselves at the same time! There is a good range of hot and cold food available and tables are quickly cleared by hardworking staff. Check in has never been a problem on our three visits and on both the last two occasions we have been able to go straight to our room on arrival at 11.30a.m. enabling us to unpack and head straight into the city. If the room isn't available on arrival you can leave your luggage in a secure room for no charge. At the other end of your stay there is a small charge of 50p to leave your luggage - a real boon for us as we usualy travel via Kings Cross, just one stop away from Russell Square on the tube. A good tip to avoid the noise in this 24 hour hotel is to ask for a room on a high floor and away from the lifts. On this last visit, for the first time, we had a room overlooking the street at the back of the hotel and it was significantly noisier than previous rooms despite being on the top floor. Previous rooms have overlooked the inner courtyards. Ear plugs can help if you are a light sleeper! There is a hotel bar, a pub and a pizza cafe on site with a range of other restaurants very close by. We made good use of Tesco Express opposite Russell Square tube station for sandwiches and water etc. In summary, if you want luxury and opulence during your London stay then this hotel is not for you. If you want a bustling, comfortable, cheap and convenient base then the Royal National is spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Hideous Hotel but Excellent Position!”
Reviews.Author: Zuzzu81
Reviews.Content: I Booked this hotel through a web site... Positive: The Location is simply excellent!It's near to Russel Square "Tube" Station in Bloomsbury as well as very close to the British Museum. Despite the central position however this hotel is very very cheap! Negatives: In my opinion, the hotel is too big...a real monster! (more than 1000 rooms) and quite dispersive...moreover everything inside that needs a restoration. Rooms are quite dirty and if you get a room next to the courtyard it might be very noisy! (you must try to avoid this possibility!) Besides in the bathroom there isn't the hairdryer and towels are quite stinky... Breakfast is busy and food is awful! In my opinion it is a n ugly and busy hotel but you do get what you paid for... It is absolutely not a family-oriented Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terribly noisy, ok if you can get by on 3 hours sleep per night”
Reviews.Author: Philip S
Reviews.Content: 1. avoid, like the plague 2. choose only if last hotel available 3. be prepared for rude, ignorant and uncaring staff 4. we thought we were getting an english breakfast, be had to pay extra if that is what we wanted. 5. avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Will most likely be back again”
Reviews.Author: Hank R
Reviews.Content: We stayeed there 4 nights and it was excellent as usual. You get what you pay for. Nice location near Russel Sq. Underground station makes it easy to get to Heathrow, just about 60 minutes and 22 stops... The rooms are nice and they will have a waterboiler and free coffe and tea. Breakfast is quite nice, sometimes crowded and you might have to wait in line for a minute or two... But on the whole I can recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt recommend it”
Reviews.Author: joe1954
Reviews.Content: we stayed here after booking through travel agent for 3 nights for birthday treat. when we arrived it was total chaos at reception, bus loads of people checking in at same time. the hotel is shabby and in desperate need of updating.the room was basic the toilet didnt flush the cold tap didnt turn on very well the towels smelled after using them.it was noisy through the night and from early morning.i know it was only 3 star but would not recommend it even for cheap stay in london.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel but decent location”
Reviews.Author: Broons B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our travel agent for a short break to London. Firstly the positives - the location of the hotel is decent enough. We took the tube from Heathrow to Russell Square station (takes approx an hour but cheaper than the express and gets you nearer) and the hotel is literally around the corner from the station entrance. This was really handy as Russell Square is a few stops from Leicester Square where we hopped off each day. There is also a decent leisure complex a couple of streets away with shops, bars and restaurants that are open until late which is handy. The negatives - the overall feel of the hotel is that it is tired and in need of redecoration. The rooms were also quite grotty - it seems they had not seen a thorough clean in quite some time. The hotel also seems to be more geared towards coach parties than couples. We were pleased to get free breakfast with our room tarriff, but could never get it because the dining hall was an absolute cattle market of people pushing and shoving and hogging tables. Luckily, there is a great little cafe across the street that must benefit from this fact often! Also, I was annoyed to find on our arrival that we had a room with 2 singles when we booked a double. When I called reception to see if this could be corrected they were extremely rude and unhelpful. Overall, okay for short stays (but only if the price is right!!). If I am honest I could have found the same level of service - probably cleaner - in a Premier for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Chaylaaa
Reviews.Content: Not a whole lot to say about this really. It is exactly what we expected. Lots of Contiki tour types there, it's cheap and cheerful, no frills but does the job. Good location, but would have been nice to have been slightly more central (although it's just a couple stops on the subway to picadily circus). Breakfast was nice enough, rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “no hotel but hostel - avoid”
Reviews.Author: VishalShivani
Reviews.Content: it is a huge hotel , with many checkins and staff with laid back attitude.we took more than an hour at check in, On arrival we realised that the room was pathetic much worse than what i had expected. the breakfast was horrible. long quese for the breakfast . also not a very great location .

Reviews.Title: “Decent economy family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rocket_man_in_ESA
Reviews.Content: This is a big hotel (it holds 7000 when full) and is intended as an economical place for a family to stay right in the heart of London. It's big. It's crowded. Breakfast (self-service) can be chaos, especially at peak time when it turns into the law of the jungle, although there is a good range of cereals, toast, etc available. However, the rooms are much larger than in your average central London hotel and if not luxurious, are clean and comfotable. Our family room had 3 single beds and still had plenty of space. A few years ago the hotel was looking very much the worst for wear, but has undergone substantial renovation. The hotel is well supplied with bars, restaurants and has a small shop. It is very close to Russell Square undergound station and easy walking distance from Oxford Street, the British Museum and Euston and Kings Cross/St Pancras stations. There areveral all night supermarkets near by if you want a bottle of water for the room or a quick snack. It's also a major pick-up point for daytrips and has a travel agency to arrange trips of all kinds for guests. If, like us, your idea of a London hotel is just somewhere adequate to sleep between days of shopping, museums and sightseeing, this is the place for you. Cheap. Reasonably comfortable. It's all you need when trarvelling with a family. If you want a quiet place where you can have a room service dinner and not see a soul: forget it! No room service apat from the standard tea/coffee making kit in the room and, save late at night, there is always activity, plus traffic noise, especially on the lower floors. One tip. The breakfast room serves dinner up to late each evening. There is a selection of hot and cold food at remarkably cheap prices. Don't expect a gourmet meal, but it's extremely good value and not at all crowded.

Reviews.Title: “i wanna go again !!!”
Reviews.Author: zoemarie l
Reviews.Content: i went to this hotel with my school on a dance trip. we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was fantastic, i shared a room with a friend and instead of a 2 bedroom they gave us a 3 bedroom !!! our school wasnt noisy at all and we were all in our own rooms by 11. there was lots of other school there to but i didnt hear any of them. the room was big and spacious and the bathroom was very clean. The hotel is modern and i loved it. It took us 7 hours to get there and it was worth it and would love to go again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we expected”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay and having read the reports we were dreading it, however it wasn't nearly as bad as we expected. It is a very big hotel & very busy at times. We arrived at 11.30a.m and reception was relatively quiet so we asked for a room well away from the courtyard which is VERY noisy. We were told that the rooms overlooking the garden were quiet and also there was one already available so we could take our luggage straight in - you can't expect better service than that even though a smile might have been nice! The room was a good size & clean and did indeed turn out to be a very quiet spot, so it is worth asking. Breakfast was ok - nothing special but adequate. Location is very handy for shows and it is on a very good bus route. It is a low budget hotel & you only get what you pay for. We didn't find the staff rude, just too busy to be over friendly. Don't expect too much & you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want a sleep!”
Reviews.Author: sharonf13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 1st August 11 for 3 nights and didn't sleep at all due to excessive noise from courtyard. Hotel room was clean and basic, breakfast ok. Staff not very friendly in all areas. It felt more like a hostel than hotel with so many teenagers - large european school parties. Location is excellent. Really don't stay here if getting a decent sleep is on your list of priorities. Hotel staff need to address the noise from the courtyard which went on all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: GBianchi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Royal National Hotel for a couple nights, cause it is well located and the area is quiet. The rooms are pretty decent, but I guess you can expect a bit more from a 3 stars hotel. The reception desk was very slow and not very helpful, so was the majority of the staff there. The only good part of the staff were the Portuguese cleaning ladies who covered up for the concierge by providing useful tips on London Tourism. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms but horrible reception/concierge service!!”
Reviews.Author: aRocketgirl
Reviews.Content: The cleaning staff was friendly and kept the rooms very clean. However, the reception staff was useless and unwilling to help and the concierge staff could hardly speak English and gave incorrect information. A few of them were incredibly rude and actually yelled at me for asking about a tour that was running late. We had problems with our keys so we had to get them reactivated about 4 times a day yet the staff did nothing about it. Also, the restaurant staff during breakfast are the rudest waiters I have ever come across!!!! BEWARE!! Good if on a budget but don't except good service.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: chris h
Reviews.Content: Have just had 3 nights bed and breakfast at this hotel - had a quad room which was clean and comfortable- breakfast was also good - had full english each morning - plenty there incl cereal, fruit and toast- staff were helpfull and polite - just one thing do not book taxis from hotel as it costs twice the price - had a black cab from Marylebone Station to hotel 8.00 booked a taxi from hotel back to station 16.00!!!!

Reviews.Title: “CANT BELIEVE THOMAS COOK BOOKED US IN HERE”
Reviews.Author: hetty72
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very basic and not up to standard my family of 6 had to pay for two rooms per night to accommodate,not worth the money very much like a youth hostel and not a hotel,the food in the restaurant at dinner time was atrocious and over priced,the check in area is chaotic to say the least,staff are quite abrupt and rude,most are not english,although i had paid at thomas cook for breakfast i was told i didnt and had to pay again,many students partying in the courtyard all night there is a bar and pub there,very noisy 24 hours a day,if you have very young kids dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “don't go like a hostil”
Reviews.Author: bessie2k11
Reviews.Content: just came back went for two nights with my mam and two of my neices supposed to had a family room was not a family room all they did was put a camp bed down to make it for four people now have a bad back they noise from the road was like i was sleeping on the street even with the window shut made no difference rooms are red hot some of staff where rude did not want to know had to ask for more pillows only had one each old dated horrid. don,t go

Reviews.Title: “Good value but no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: dez s
Reviews.Content: Very busy hotel however bear in mind that on hot days the rooms get so hot and sticky it gets uncomfortable Having said that a very efficient hotel with hundreds of rooms Make sure you get English otherwise there is a supplement Â£4.50 for breakfast unless your happy with continental breakfast Wellnrun hotel

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a few days break”
Reviews.Author: veram20
Reviews.Content: My friend and i have just come back from a short stay at this hotel. The only fault that i can mention is that they are needing to replace their towels. If you go to Buckingham Palace I would give the Palace Retaurant on Buckingham Palace Road a miss. The prices are exhorbitant. e.g. soup Â£6.95 chips Â£4.00 cheese toastie Â£6.95. Otherwise we had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: tomrob83
Reviews.Content: Royal National Hotel in London is a very large hotel with 1700 rooms. Me and a friend of mine were in London for the Emirates Cup 2011 and chose this hotel by recommandation. This is not a luxurious hotel nor a backyard dump. The hotel lobby is quite large and tastfully decorated with a reception, where you seldom have to wait for a long time due to the amount of people working there. Check-in was flawless with a smiling receptionist wishing us welcome to the hotel. Finding our room was surprisingly easy even though this building is large! I will say the room was of normal size, the beds were quite comfortable and the room itself was clean. There were no minibar nor a fridge. A clossy TV, a desk, closet and one "mini-bathroom" for the toilet and a bidet and another bathroom for bathtub/shower and a sink. A nice solution though both of these "bathrooms" were small. The location of the hotel is very good with a 5 minute walk to the Russel Square Underground Station (picadilly line) and a smal walk down Bedford Way where you'll find restaurants with italian, chineese and greek food and all you need from Starbucks to grocerieshops. Hotel pros: Clean, friendly staff, location and standard for a 3 star-hotel, cash-machine at the hotel, you kan keep your luggage at the hotel after check-out (costs Â£1,50) Hotel cons: No internet access in the rooms and the internet-access in the lobby worked on and off, a bit noisy since there are a lot of people there and some traffic outside. The most dissapointing factor with our stay was the continental breakfast. Not good at all. You could buy an english breakfast for Â£5,50.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than made out to be”
Reviews.Author: Wilsons128
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from the royal national hotel today after a very enjoyable 2 day break. The hotel and our rooms were spotless, and there was definately no bed bugs or any other creatures in our rooms. Although rooms were basic you got what you paid and we had no arguements or problems. The english breakfast was also very nice, however i would recommend you went before 8:00am or after 9:00am as the restaurant get very full. We would also recommend a lovely small chinese restaurant opposite the irish bar which is about 500 yards walk from the hotel. Overall a very enjoyable break and would both revisit and recommend The Royal National Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sound the alarm,... A horrible hotel: Incomprehensible why anyone give this one than one star...”
Reviews.Author: Northwatersalso
Reviews.Content: A three-star hotel? It is to laugh. Perhaps MINUS three stars should be its rating. This hotel is a mess and a truly bad experience from the first impression to the last. It should be your hotel of last choice in London, despite the fact it is well-located close to the Russell Square tube station. To liken it to a youth hostel is an insult to youth hostels. We have travelled on 4 continents in some fairly dodgy places, but have never seen the match of this when it comes to filthy surroundings, shabby mould-filled rooms and inept management. How such a place can exist (and apparently thrive) in a modern capital is a mystery. Can such a large hotel be supported by purely by students whose only alternative is sleeping under a bridge? In any event, would the bridge not be preferable? Check in is an abomination. You will listen for 30 minutes while groups of guests ahead of you advise management that this is the worst hotel they have ever stayed at. Soon you will agree. The rooms are truly filthy and will do not match what you have been promised, but the house phones to the front desk don't work anyway, so unless you want to line up again for another half hour you are stuck with what they give you. The breakfast is retchingly bad, eaten at tables still strewn with the refuse of those who rose earlier. I would write more, but I simply refuse to bring to mind further this horrible experience. Pay any price or travel any distance to stay elsewhere. If you stay there you will remember it as the worst hotel experience of your life. Avoid this shameful excuse for a hotel. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “good for the money”
Reviews.Author: SimonandToni
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a top notch hotel because you will not get it but you are not paying top notch prices!!! stayed here now a couple of times for weekends in London and does us fine, room spacious and even though breakfast is like a canteen there is enough choice.

Reviews.Title: “maybe it was top notch in the 70-ties”
Reviews.Author: SvetLanaL1959
Reviews.Content: Great location - next to tube station Russel Squre - walking distance to many attractions. Not so great inside. Old and shabby rooms, no conditioner, windows opens 1" . Very hot and noisy in summer. Bathrooms have no mixers for the hot and cold water - you are supposed to mix it in a small airplane-like sink. TV has 4 channels which turn on by a switch on a wall - great great grandfather of a remote control. Breakfasts are either eggs, ham and bacon with warm peeled tomatoes and beens in some red sause (this was 9 pounds extra for 2 of us or you could choose some cerials with milk, prunes and some canned grapefruit and mandarine oranges. Very crowded in the breakfast rooms if you go there after 8 am

Reviews.Title: “we had a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jarvy667
Reviews.Content: We would just like to point out that we had a very bad experience when we booked this hotel and the service we got from the staff was terrible. We had booked a room for the night for me, my husband and our granddaughter when attending a concert. we arrived to early to book into the room so they told us we could leave our luggage in the secure area until we returned after the concert. When we got back at 11.30pm we found that they had cancelled our booking and relet our room to someone else, they said there was nothing they could do as they were fully booked they did not try to find us alternative accommodation so we had to walk the streets with our grandaughter until we could get our train th next day, the would not even let us sit in the reception this was disgusting and i would not recommend anyone to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for sightseeing and Theatres”
Reviews.Author: Dave140633
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently whilst visiting London on a special offer which included two nights bed and breakfast and return rail travel from the North East of England costing Â£128.00 per person.This was excellent value, the room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast adequate. The hotel is well placed for sightseeing, only about twenty minutes walk from Trafalgar Square, and within easy walking distance of most of the main theatres. There are excellent bus services readily available from just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: NFamilySweden
Reviews.Content: Close to the subway, only a few stations to Picadilly and no changes if you come from Heatrow. The hotel was otherwise basic, small rooms, short beds, simple breakfast (if you dont pay extra) and a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The armpit of the world!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunlunlad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before ,but never,never again! There are not enough negative words in the english language to fully describe what a truly unpleasant place this is. I will however endeavor to give some examples,RUDE,DIRTY,SMELLY,UNHYGIENIC,UNCOMFORTABLE,NOISY,the list goes on. As for those people who have awarded this dosshouse 5 stars,I'd hate to see the homes they live in. Yes it is centrally located,but so are many other hotels of equal price,and far superior standards.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location.”
Reviews.Author: budway1942
Reviews.Content: We live in Canada and go to London every year and stay at the Royal National for a week.We are seniors and our trip usually coincides with the childrens half-term break.The hotel in early March has about 2,000 students it seems from the chaos. BUT that does not deter us. Room and breakfast for 99 quid a night in the Center of London with the tube five mins away and Oxford street a fifteen minute walk makes it worthwhile.The breakfast is fine and well organized by staff.Early bird gets the hottest. There is a bar on the ground floor and a pub and cafe across the central square. The hotel has 1200 rooms and is always busy.For those folks who complained in other posts,you have to realize this is not a five star hotel.This is a practical place to sleep in the center of London..if you want perfection go and pay 200 quid a night somewhere else..For visitors is fine. If you need a hair dryer ask at reception. no charge. We have b een there five times and are booked for next year after we return from Portugal.Hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: hazel241
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here now on a couple of occasions and I have overall been very impressed with the staff, room size and value for money. I think this a great hotel for central London at a great price. I have struggled to find anything similar. The room and bathrooms are very clean and of a good size. It is great that triple rooms are avaliable with 3 single beds too! The fact that a full english breakfast is included when booking on the hotel website is a bonus!! I have found the staff friendly and helpful. I am already planning to stay here again in September.....and with only 1 tube stop away from Kings Cross and the avaliability of a store room to leave luggage in I'm looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “was reasonably good,would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ttarra123
Reviews.Content: not as bad as reviews make out,was close to all kings cross about Â£6 in a taxi,we were able to walk into covent garden/theatreland,in about 45 mins.staff were very helpful,when i asked for directions.i visited london with my mum and daughter to see the lion king and visit some sights, stayed for 2 nights breakfast was busy as you would expect as hotel is so big,but we never had a problem.room was fine and clean and bathroom too,we weren't in very much as to much to do, but the time we were we never had any bother and we slept very well,i would stay here again! i dreaded it after some negative reviews on here!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: ERH9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few hotels over some years now, in various countries. Royal National is perhaps the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Be warned: This hotel should be avoided. There were three positive factors during our stay: The hotel is fairly central, although not unique in that way. The bathroom was quite big. The water pressure in the shower was very good. The downsides are numerous: Almost half of the staff were quite disinterested in helping us when we needed information. (For instance about distance to a train station.) One man almost turned his back at me instead of answering me. (I was fairly polite.) Our room wasn't clean upon arrival, and although this was adressed, namely a downright dirty wardrobe, it was just as dirty when we left after four days. There were mold spots in the bathroom ceiling, partially painted over. There is no wifi in the room - thought we were told so while booking. (This might be British Airways' fault.) There was no safe deposit box in our room - thought we were told so while booking. (This might again be British Airways' fault.) The breakfast was terrible. Slightly toasted slices of bread and marmelade. To get eggs & bacon we had to pay an additional Â£4.95 each day!?!?!? The overal impression of this hotel is so negative that anyone considering a stay there ought to be warned. Do not stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised - Very Good”
Reviews.Author: bash41
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 years ago but after reading recent reviews I was worried about returning. Paid Â£100/night through superbreak for a quad room (childrens breadfast extra) which in central London I thought was excellent. No problem with check in took 10 mins but no buses had arrived at that time. Room was clean with 1 double and 2 proper single beds (no roll out as is often the case). We liked that the toilet was separate from bath /shower although it would have been handy to have an extra wash hand basin in loo. Admittedly the shower/bathroom could have done with a coat of paint but the shower was great with plenty of hot water. Location is fab - 10 min walk from Euston Station & 5 mins to Russell Square tube. We had no problem with the 50p per item left luggage charge on check out day.. Breakfast was busy but to be expected in a hotel this size at the price we paid we would have been happy to eat out for breakfast but it was fine for us and staff were helpful & friendly. We particularly liked that the self service restaurant was open till late so we could have something to eat after getting in from a show. Drinks/food well priced didn't feel like rip-off.. Room was quiet had no problems with noise from other guests. Maybe we are easily pleased but we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “shocking”
Reviews.Author: im_a_manxy
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel on a school trip to london to see three west end shows and some shopping as well, when we got there a women on the reception desk asked our two guides (teachers) to give a Â£20 pound behaviour bond, even though it was just for students, then after that the same women spoke to the main teacher in a rude way. When we got to the rooms, my friends rooms were just simply shocking...they all said me and my room mate had the best room out of everyone, one of my closest friends on the trip had bed bugs, dead spiders, no towels, marks up the walls, black spots on the duvets, and itchy blankets for extra warmth and in one room there was a mouse trap under a bed. I also found that there was a hole in my sheet, and you have two seperate bathrooms, one for a shower/bath and a sink and the other for just a toilet. to be honest I found hardly any thing right with the hotel. On the first morning after our first night in the hotel, when I managed to get my cooked breakfast, I found the beans extremelly runny and there where only spoons and knifes available so I couldn't have had any breakfast that day, as there was no forks, so I didn't have as much energy as I should have got.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness and Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Manxman34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and very big. Some of the staff (housekeeping) are pleasant. The greeting at reception was disgraceful. The duty manager was rude and aggressive when we booked in a school party. She demanded 'good behaviour' bonds from the teachers, saying that it 'concentrated the minds' of visiting teachers. This was only the start. Our students found sheets covered with a mystery black substance, showers didn't work and taps revolved. There was dreadful noise on our floor until after 1.30 am, door banging and drunken voices. Many of our children were frightened. Breakfast was an industrial affair best avoided. Several of our party suffered bites from wildlife in the bedding. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: flipperty_10
Reviews.Content: I was booked in here through work, and was apprehensive given a lot of the other reviews. The reception area felt like an airport check-in desk. Large groups of people everywhere with suitcases and a lot of queuing. The decor is very tired. The stale smell in the corridors (left from pre-smoking ban days?), is only partially masked by air fresheners. The room itself was at least clean. However, the bed was hard and creaky and the pillows very flat. I did not have problems with noise, although you could hear people in the corridors, so I think I was lucky to be located where not too many people were going past. I was on the 2nd floor and in the morning could hear plates clanking, which I thought was odd given how far I was from the restaurant. When I left my room I discovered that the staff breakfast room was at the end of the corridor, and that the door was left open. This was typical of the hotel. Small things which could be easily corrected to improve the guest experience were not done. I had the cooked English breakfast, which was ok, but I dread to think how long the toast had been sitting under the heat lamp. The orange "juice" was horrible. In its favour, the location is convenient and if you read the worst of the reviews before you go, you are likely to be pleasantly surprised that it's not as bad as you feared.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - well located for visiting the British Museum/Theatreland”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetbean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night at very short notice as there was no availability elsewhere in the area at an affordable price. The hotel is a vast complex and doesn't look special from the outside. The queues at reception were off-putting so I was beginning to wonder whether I had made a mistake. I waited about 20 minutes to check-in but I was delighted with my room - South wing, top floor, facing a side courtyard therefore away from traffic noise. It was clean and comfortable. There is a bar that serves reasonably priced drinks, and my full English breakfast included with the room was just what I would expect. The staff were friendly and helpful but the biggest bonus is that the hotel is perfectly situated if like me you want to visit The British Museum and also a lot of the Theatres are within easy walking distance. I can live with paying 50 pence to leave my bags at the hotel after check-out!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - friendly staff, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: katiemciver
Reviews.Content: I travelled to London for a trip with my Mum and my Sister for a 3 night break to watch a couple of shows and do a bit of sightseeing. We arrived at the Royal National at about 13.50 and went to check in (check in time is at 14.00) we waited for about 10 minutes and checked in. There is a little queue but not too long to wait. After reading reviews on here, we were a little worried about what the room would be like. We needn't have worried as the room was very clean, had plenty of room and the bathroom was spotless. Towels were changed daily as were sheets on beds. The room was cleaned every day and tidied. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. Breakfast was fantastic - Full English (which was included in the price we paid, some people could only have continental) for the 3 days we stayed and the bacon was delicious as were the scrambled eggs, you could also have baked beans, tomatoes, fried eggs and sausages. On the 3rd day I opted for a continental breakfast and after reading the reviews on here they are totally wrong. Included in the continental breakfast is Toast, Rolls with jams, marmalade, choc spread, butter, a variety of cereals, fruits, fruit juice, coffee and tea - eat as much as you like. The staff at this hotel were ALL very friendly and helpful at all times and smiled a lot. I believe if you are friendly and polite to people they will be the same back. You are not ripped of for the drinks at the bar or the vending machines (a glass of wine is Â£2.00, packet of crisps 60p, bottle of water Â£1 - these are all very reasonable.
