In actual fact I would find it hard to find a bar in Brighton that sells a glass of wine for Â£2.00). Room service is fantastic too. You can get a meal for Â£6.50. If you are going to this hotel - please do not be put off by people on here - I have stayed in 3 star hotels in this country and abroad and this is a very good 3 star hotel. You get what you pay for and it is very good value for money. I will definately be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd Looked on TripAdvisor Before Booking”
Reviews.Author: Sanjra11
Reviews.Content: The day before arriving in London my boyfriend and I had a quick look on TripAdvisor to see how popular this hotel was with others. We had a good laugh at all the bad reviews and were prepared for the worst, this also made us laugh! We arrived via Paris on the EuroStar which the final destination is at the St Pancras train station. Only a $5-$10 taxi ride (depending on traffic). Took a while to check in as there are well over a thousand rooms. This is also the hotel where most Contiki and TopDeck tours meet, so if your planning a Contiki or TopDeck tour and would like to stay in London a few days prior to your tour... you may as well stay here to avoid packing and repacking. Location in Bloomsbury was ok, very close to supermarkets and convenient stores. If you like coffee there is Starbucks EVERYWHERE - there are 2 very close to the hotel. Internet was free and available only to use in the lobby, but it was also very slow. When asking questions at the concierge they seemed to only half listen and not really care about your request. Vending machines in the lobby were well priced, only problem was they didn't work half the time. Souvenir shop is over priced and the lady is rude plus there are loads of places to do shopping outside of the hotel. Beds were horrible, and creaked every little movement you made while sleeping. Pillows were non-existant. If we had used a towel as a pillow we would have gotten better support. Windows do not open very wide, and the hotel is non-smoking. Thing I hated most - After a last night, around 8:30-9:00AM I heard a knock on the door, even though our Do Not Disturb sign was showing. It was a cleaner, who told me when I was ready to turn the sign around to show that the room was available for cleaning.. I thought 'Thank you, I know how the sign works & it says do not disturb do you know how it works?' Didn't bother eating breakfast at the hotel after reading the other TripAdvisor comments, you can buy a full English breakfast from most cafes anywhere from $5-$15. There is also a Pizza restaurant in the courtyard of the hotel, displaying free wifi DO NOT EAT HERE! My boyfriend owns a pizza shop so we like to see what is out there, and this was by far the worst pizza we have ever eaten. We only ate 2 slices and left the rest. The only thing i liked was that the hotel was located about a 15min walk from Soho and about 30mins walk to Oxford Street. When I go back to London I will definitely find accommodation closer to these areas.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as bad as made out !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Devinemissm87
Reviews.Content: I was travelling from Glasgow for an over night stay to see the Glee LIVE concert. I read reviews the night before I travelled and it began to worry me. HOWEVER the hotel was in a fantastic location and easy to find for first time tourists. Me and my niece occupied a double room which was very clean and well kept. The hotel staff where outstanding and where more than happy to help out with any query I had. It was a very busy hotel but nothing like train stations as one reviewer claimed. the only downfall I found was the breakfast was like something out of a microwave but all in all it was a good hotel and i would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel,couldnt wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: maisie018
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my friend who sadly had never heard of trip advisor.It was more like a hostel than a hotel.The room was reasonably clean but smelt of sweat,the bed was the most uncomfortable i have ever slept in and the pillows were so hard they actually hurt my ears.The bathroom had no shower gel or shampoo but to be honest it was so grubby looking i didnt want to use it anyway and the towels had an odd smell about them and were grey and hard.At breakfast time we were herded like cattle from one restaurant to another because the one was full,so we had to go outside in the pouring rain to cross the qaudrangle to the other side of the building to be faced by a hidious canteen with food so unappealing i couldnt eat it.The orange juice tasted of onions and the coffee was the worst i have ever tasted.We were only there for 1 night,if it had been longer we would have gone elsewhere.The staff struggled to speak english with a couple of exceptions and quite clearly couldnt care less anyway about customer service.A truly awful hotel,yuk!

Reviews.Title: “Crap”
Reviews.Author: Clacer
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Poor quality Inept / gormless reception Not a hotel but a roof over your head Be prepared to itch from bed bugs Noisy airless rooms Recommend you pay more to get better

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: stefandrich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and were very pleased with the service and the hotel.Having read some previous reviews we were rather worried about what it would be like but found everything to be fine.We did notice however that the North side of the hotel seemed to be a little scruffier than the South side where we were but that was in the corridor we didn't see in any of the rooms.We had the full breakfast and there was plenty of it, we were in a party of 9 and sat together every morning and the staff were always at hand to clear away dishes and help out.All in all we had a lovely stay and would return without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location ,cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cathygour
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and the price was very good.The continental breakfast was nothing special at all ,no fridge or hairdryer in rooms and the state of the rooms was average.Just centrally located and very close to tube.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martijn_Zikking
Reviews.Content: First thing to say is that the Royal National Hotel is a budget hotel and that is what you get. The Rooms are clean, the bathroom is big enough, there is tea, coffee and a TV but itâ€™s not a room to stay in the whole day and the food is edible but not great. The idea is to sleep there, eat breakfast and enjoy London for the rest of the day. If you donâ€™t seek more than that then this is the place to go to while staying in London. The guests can be a bit loud sometimes as there are many organized trips and they arrive by busses and if you are unlucky to be situated on a floor where a busload of teenagers stay too then I hope you are as sound a sleeper as I am. Iâ€™m pretty sure that theyâ€™ll move you to another room if you ask them as the staff is very helpful but I never had to ask them.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gill190832
Reviews.Content: Having read all the previous reviews, i was getting a little worried about what i had let myself in for, i have just got back today and felt i had to write a review on the hotel. I LOVED IT!!! The staff were friendly and very helpful, the room was very clean, towels were replaced every day as was bedding, there were tea and coffee in the room every day and bars of soap left in the bathroom. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: roxycakesreen
Reviews.Content: Where do I even begin? -utterly useless concierge service/non-friendly staff -no fans or air conditioning in the rooms whatsoever. the window barely opens and the evenings got so hot that we had to prop a suitcase against our door to keep it open so that cool air from the hallway would come in. the bathroom has no fan either -horrible shower. you have to crouch in the shower because the shower head is so low, plus you have to stand a certain way in the tub so you don't fall over -no hand towels or bathmat was given, even when we requested them -the room was covered in dust, no dusting had been done at all during our stay - the worst beds i have ever slept on. the pillows are as thin as cardboard and all you can feel are the bed springs. all i wanted was to be back in my own bed at home -the walls are paper thin. the first two nights we couldn't sleep because the room next to us was full of students who were screaming and yelling and running through the hallways. -the food was garbage. they have a cafeteria where the food would sit under a heat lamp all day until someone slopped it onto your plate there are more problems with this hotel and this is the worst hotel experience i have ever had. i am a frequent traveler and have in fact stayed at many motels that are so much nicer and better than this horrible place... i would not recommend this at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate”
Reviews.Author: FanabeFans
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've been to an hotel without checking Tripadvisor first and won't do it again!!!! I stayed here with my wife and 7 year old son. We stayed Friday and Saturday night. This is a massive hotel with 1000 rooms. The reception was like a busy train station. You cannot check in until 1400hrs. We arrived at 1320hrs, asked if we could 'check in' to be told "No, you must come back at 2pm" I did and was greeted with 4 lines of people, some 10 deep waiting to check in. Took about 15 mins to get to the desk. We booked this hotel via an agent. There was a sign saying 'continental breakfast only' with the price of room. I enquired about Englsih breakfast, to be told there was a Â£4.50 supplement per person, which you have to pay for in the restaurant before selecting the breakfast. Because we had booked through an agent, we could only have the continental breakfast. We like full English breakfast, so decided to pay the difference in the morning. We got to the room, which backed onto Woburn Place. We had to open the window to get some fresh air in there. It was adequate for 2 nights sleep. The beds were very comfortable but the room was not the cleanist. There was black mould around he plug hole which I cleaned off and we found a pair of socks and an umberella case under the bed. We were on the 6th floor. The traffic noise was very bad, there seemed to be an endless flow of emergency vehicle sirens going down Woburn Place the 2 nights we stayed there. We went down to breakfast at 0830hrs, to stand in a queue of about 30 people waiting to get into the restaurant. Once inside, there was a guard around the cooked food. You did have to pay Â£4.50 per person first. In all fairness the English breakfast was good, but not a massive choice. I am glad we did not have the contintental, as all I saw were bread rolls, toast and jam. On a good point.....The hotel is in a very good location, near to all attractions....Would we go back there? A definate MAYBE if every other hotel in London was booked.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: iresx
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a worse hotel than this! The towels were smelly and dirty. There was no fridge in the room and no hair dryer as it says on their site. The staff at the reception desk were rude to a friend of mine. The corridors of the hotel looked like prison corridors. The breakfast could not be eaten and you had to pay extra if you wanted English breakfast- bacon and eggs. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone not even to my enemies!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING AND OVER PRICED!!!!!!!! DONT STAY HERE NO MATTER WHAT”
Reviews.Author: TAgent88
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most DISGUSTING Places i have ever seen and stayed at. For what you pay its shocking WAY OVER PRICED for what you ger. I ONLY had to stay here as i was going on contiki. I would never ever recommend any one to stay here. The walls were falling apart the carpets were like mush yuo have to walk with socks on and then disinfect them later. THE BATHROOMS ARE DIRTY THE BED HAD HAIR IN IT, SHEETS WERENT CHANGED AND THE PILLOW CASES WERE DIRTY OBVIOUSLY FROM THE PREVIOUS PEOPLE. I Cannor believe that a hotel still runns looking like this!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It looks as though it hasnt been cleaned in months, Everything is dirty! I Would rather have stayed at another hotel and caught an early train to get to the contiki bus

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service. Would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Kkkkkkllll
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel with my mum sisters and friend and I can honestly say it was a great experience. The breakfast was lovely,the staff were helpful& friendly especially the lady serving at the hot food till. No problems leaving our luggage before checking in (as we arrived early)&after checking out- just charged 50 pence for this which we felt was reasonable. Very comfortable beds and very clean. Definitely exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and full of out of control students”
Reviews.Author: lynneh72
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just returned from a 3 night stay at the royal national hotel, this was our 4th visit to the hotel and while in the past we have enjoyed our stay ( apart from noise levels but not too much to upset us ) this time we hardly slept for the noise off students running up and down the corridors shouting and banging doors with no respect for other residents there, we were also warned off taxi drivers of this problem all beit to late to do anything about it, however, in the hotels defence when we finally summoned up the courage to complain the hotel security were on the ball and did their very best to quell the noise which was effective thank god

Reviews.Title: “One step up from a Youth Hostel and be careful of thieves in the lobby - hold on to your bags!”
Reviews.Author: Grumpathome
Reviews.Content: If you don't have lots of teens (as in bus loads) with you - stay away. We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. If we had not been prepaid, we would have moved. We were probably the only adults in the place that were not there chaperoning large groups of students. Which may be why our group was targeted by a thief while we were checking in. The lobby was full of people, two of our 6 were standing by our bags, and the rest were trying to resolve a problem with our rooms. During this time, a man (seen on tape later) removed my friends backpack which was looped through her suitcase pull and walked out with it. This was in the middle of the morning, Apparently, security was not on duty at this time. DO NOT TAKE YOUR HANDS OFF YOUR BAGS! We were naive and trusting. During the rest of the week, I watched others checking in and not watching their bags and can imagine that it is a thief's paradise. I did not see security patroling the lobby during the week. They did take a police report, for insurance purposes, but that was all. Reception didn't even seem to care that we were robbed. Not even a "I'm sorry". Again we are middle-aged travelers used to better. Our friend who booked it had stayed there 12 years ago and was shocked at the difference. Beds were miserable (springs coming through - probably from 12 years ago), 4 of 8 Elevators were not working (leaving only 2 at each end), so impossible to get on in the morning. TEENS everywhere. Let me repeat this: TEENS EVERYWHERE. Towels that I would use as rags at home. Very run down. Continental breakfast was plentiful, but crowded and what you would expect at a rundown high school or camp cafeteria. Check in staff did not care what we had booked on-line and we finally took what the had. Working on pipe renovations but didn't seem to care about broken elevators (not touched during the week we were there) The positive for this hotel is that it is an easy walk to Russell Square tube stop. Good water pressure, but tended to spray down the bathroom, Free wi-fi in the lobby. Cleaning staff kept the rooms clean, but the halls were full of dirty towels and trash while they were cleaning. Definitely a no frill hotel and a good value if you are not expecting comfort, quiet or anything. Rooms would be hot in summer. The interior atrium rooms are quieter than the street rooms. Try for a higher floor for quieter street noise, but only if you are prepared to walk down flights of stairs, if elevators are full at busy times. Probably one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. If you are over 20, pay a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mhe57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night while attending an event at the hotel. Its definitely not the best hotel I visited but it was probably the cheapest, especially for a nice location not too far away from commercial area (had to pick up some gifts for family in Oxford and Regent Streets). So if you have to stay for one or two nights and expect to be most of the time out of your room, that's perfect. Probably not if your are looking for a honeymoon location !

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jester757
Reviews.Content: The Royal National is your basic no frills hotel. Don't expect chocolates on your pillow or even little shampoos in your bathroom. This hotel is in a great location. Russel Square Tube a few minutes away was super convenient, walking distance to restaurants, pubs and shopping Our room was worn slightly but CLEAN, which after reading others reviews worried me a bit. The room we stayed in was a twin but you could easily move the beds to make a double. Ask for a room in the North building on the west side as it has less traffic noise than the east side which runs parallel to busy Woburn Place. A higher floor gives you a better view including the BT Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel clean and comfortable with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: carolyncrayford
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my young daughter and a friend and her son. We found the hotel to be clean, our room was spacious and comfortable with maid service and clean towels daily. The breakfast was very good and enough of it. No complaints would stay there again as it was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, stay AWAY... Poor quality and service !”
Reviews.Author: tl2960
Reviews.Content: Royal National Hotel is NOT a cozy hotel. Neither is it a hotel with good service. It is a "stay-over-night-factory". At first it sounds like reasonable price. But the service is absolutely non-excisting. When we arrived we were no less than 4 couples argueing with the reception. It felt like the guest against the reception ! The rooms are very poor. We had mold on the bathroom ceiling, dirty closet, no hairdryer, no shampoo, beds where we could feel the springs, awful breakfast. We even experienced that we had to pay extra for an extra bed, even though we had booked just like we were supposed to and received a confirmation. The same happened to 2 other families (they had booked on www.bookings.com). So you cannot even be sure that the Royal National even wants to deliver what they actually sell you on the website. Even though our family has travelled quite a bit around the world, this is the worst thing I have ever experienced ! Shocking.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RNY99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while attending a conference. It is not the worst hotel but I would certainly not choose to stay here. The hotel is part of a chain which runs 5 other hotels in the immediate area. (President, Tavistock, Imperial, Bedford and County) The first thing to say is that it is vast and impersonal but generally clean and efficiently run and reasonably priced for central London The room was clean and comfortable but in need of refurbishment. The toilet / shower was again clean but basic. The shower was powerful with no shortage of hot water. The biggest drawback to this hotel compared to other more expensive places is the breakfast. It is like feeding time at the zoo. There is no chance of relaxing and taking your time as you will not be able to get a table to yourself or even find two seats together You simply fill your tray at the buffet then join total strangers at a crowded table. The actual food is okay and there is plenty of it but it is not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean, comfortable... What more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: AlansVlogs
Reviews.Content: I find this hotel perfect for people on a budget. The rooms are nice and clean but in the Summer months can be very warm! So I advice taking a fan with you. The showers work just fine with easy temperature controls and ventilation to clear the steam. The room is very well lit with controls for the lights by the main bed. The room also has a HD TV but this can vary between rooms. The breakfasts are very nice with lots of variety are are served piping hot! The drinks are watered down slightly which can taste horrible. But are quite nice and there is also a small variety on offer. On my last visit the bathroom door didnt have a lock on it. What made it worse it was a sliding door. If you were using the loo or taking a shower. It would be very easy for people to see inside! Overall! Fantastic hotel, would use again and I am in July! GET BOOKING! :D

Reviews.Title: “Basic Tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: JG-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Royal National with group of friends in March for a weekend break After reading about bed bugs etc was really worried having organised it for a party of 8 friends, Need not have worried Rooms were decent size and pefect for a couple of nights. Found no evidence of dirt and bugs al beit the view left a lot to be desired. Kept the curtains closed most of the time as all rooms looked directly onto one another around a courtyard Hotel does get busy and as others have stated, get up early for breakfast to miss the madding crowds. A few negative points Only one lift worked Hundreds of European students congregated in the foyer each morning resulting in long lines at reception. Hotel would not check anyone in before 2.00pm (arrived 1.45pm) hence mad rush to check in and a wait of 45mins Positive points 10 mins walk from Kings Cross Station Hotel only 20 mins walk to central London Decent pub attached for a late drink before retiring Plenty of bars and restaurants in the area . If you just want a clean, budget hotel to rest your weary head after a great days sightseeing, then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and good value for money... but what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: BreakfastTV
Reviews.Content: I'm an 18 year old media student. I've stayed at The Royal National hotel twice. I've had no problems at all. The hotel is basic and clean but what more do you want? You don't go to London to stay in the hotel all day long. I'm booked to go back in July and I'm very much looking forward to it. This hotel is very close to Russell Square tube station which is a 5 minute walk away, there's also a nearby Tesco's which is handy for buying milk and food for the room. The breakfast's at this hotel are also nice, there's a lot of variety. I would give this hotel an 8 out of 10. If you're going in the summer months (June, July, August) I would recommend taking a desk top fan because its very warm in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Poverish and Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLee33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as they were just around the corner from the contiki basement. We found the staff at the reception desk to be difficult and rude. Both times wechecked in they some kind of drama with our reservation. We also found it a hinderance that they didnt accept cash as there were fees incurred. Our room overlooked the courtyard and it was extremely noisy at night even with the windows closed, which made for a terrible nights sleep. The bathroom in our room was very small, which was fine, but had no ventilation and water from the shower got absolutely everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not as bad as they say!!”
Reviews.Author: CasualTraveller32
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip to London and stayed over one night, in our group there was about 20 of us. I did not use any of the services within the hotel as that was all controlled by someone else in the group. We where expecting the worse having read some reviews about the hotel before, and beleave it or not we were plesently suprised, the room was clean and tidey, clean sheets and towels. Our room looked out onto the courtyard, so at night it wasvery noisy but I had no trouble sleeping. However the windows didn't shut properly, an even when shut where still very noisy!! The location was good just about 5-10 minute walk from Oxford Street. With our stay we got the full english within our deal. I wouldnt bother paying for it. The beans were tasteless and the sausages were disgusting but part from that it was ok-ish! I woud reconmend going somewhere else for breakfast. However you can get porridge, bowls of fruit e.c.t. So basically you get what you pay with in the hotel, it was clean and tidy. The only bad point I would say isthe breakfast in the moring. Part from that had a great time in London!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Okay”
Reviews.Author: ellijayjeff
Reviews.Content: Not one of the best accomadations in the world but very cheap for london and was very proud to stay there for a good night sleep. No problblems while staying there. Great location on the Piccadilly line across from Russell Park. Breakfast was so so but the hotel is huge. Stay there and appreciate the savings.. Its all cool...............

Reviews.Title: “Stay away unless you love horsed of package holiday tourists”
Reviews.Author: Redbookish_10
Reviews.Content: I usually stay elsewhere in far more friendly & personal hotels in Bloomsbury. None available at short notice however, so my secretary booked me here as I prefer to stay in Bloomsbury for business. The hotel itself is standard, if shabby. But the hordes of ignorant rude tourists makes the whole thing unpleasant. Twice I had to move breakfast tables as my things were rudely moved by people wishing to grab my table. And neither time did they apologise. Half of the lifts are out of service (for refurbishment?) and so getting anywhere in this large hotel was slow, crowded & unpleasant. Never again. I suppose you get what you pay for, but for almost Â£80 there are actually far far nicer places with fellow guests not just off the 'tourist from hell' coach.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Mini-spooky
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, asked for quiet room & ended up with constant noise of air con and kitchens for adjacent hotel. Pillows & mattresses no protectors, sheets worn and stained. Cleaning staff doing basics as hotel too big. Lifts out of order. Breakfast is bought in bulk, choice of 4 cereals, greasy cooked, toast made in kitchen and left under heating lamp, no fresh fruit. Luckily Tesco Express round corner. Waiting staff constantly hovering to take your plates. Reception staff are helpful. Would not stay again and had better experience at Â£29 a night Premier Inn. Novotel & Holiday Inn are 5* luxury

Reviews.Title: “only for school trips”
Reviews.Author: kirsas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation of travel agent was disapointed the room was OK , reception OK halls in severe disrepair. location OK not brilliant esp if you dont like the tube. Breakfast was awful just like school dinners, waiter insisted in seeing 'yellow ticket' and you had to produce it to aquire your food at the serving point , then the seating was long tables no privacy no serving even of tea and coffee not somewhere I would like to return

Reviews.Title: “Royal Scurve National”
Reviews.Author: londonmay2011
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in this god forsaken hotel for TWO weeks with a group of students I was with. My trip started with unloading our coach, and having to step over a pool of blood to get into the front doors, which really weren't doors at all, rather, they were giant sliding glass openings in the front of the building. We checked in, and waited 15 minutes for the elevator to arrive. We were on the 5th floor, which reaked of mildew through out the floor. The carpet was soaked, and there was trash by the elevator, and the walls were stripped of their wallpaper. Our room was 3 singular dirty brown twin beds, on wheels that if you sneezed a little too hard, sailed you across the room. The whole room smelt like trash and dirty feet. The bathroom was a tiny room, the door did not have a lock, and there was an infestation of black mold on the ceiling. There was no plugs in the bathroom, simply a plug for shavers only. The towels they gave were dirty, and the toilet paper holder was a slingshot, that would frequently shoot across the bathroom when touched. There was no air conditioning, instead a window that opened a crack. Depending on which side you were on you either listened to police sirens all night long, or if you were over the court yard, people in the pub attached to the hotel. The housekeeping frequently came in when the do not disturb sign was on. When housekeeping came when you were not there, they only made your bed, replace your towels, and occasionally emptied the two tiny trashcans in the room. They did not pick up any other trash around the place. They towels they replace in your room, sit on the wet moldy mildewy carpet in the hallways of the hotel, they throw them in a pile and dispurse them through out the hotel rooms. At night, there is a large gathering of teenagers in the courtyard, usually break dancing. There is two pubs, The London Pub, which is attached to the hotel, but a public pub, their outdoor seating is inside the hotels courtyard. Then there is another, inside the lobby, located in the south side, and after it closes, usually it is full of homeless people sleeping on the tables. They do not lock the doors, if it is too cold, they simply close one of the big sliding glass door panels, and leave the rest completely open. For internet, I had to go to the other side of the hotel, the north side, and I was frequently disturbed by people smoking INSIDE that lobby. The breakfast consisted of luke warm milk, watered down juice, oranges, grapefruit, cornflakes, or toast. If you paid more for the full english breakfast, that was poached eggs, bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, stewed tomatoes, or beans, all which was terrible. I started off eating that the first few days, only to downgrade to toast, and eventually skipping their breakfast all together. The only good thing about this hotel WAS it's location. There was a pub attached, and several little grocery stores around the area. The Russel square tube station was about 5 mins walk down the street and there was also a post office, a shopping mall, and the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad”
Reviews.Author: sningbat
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews on here I was seriously considering calling them to cancel or at least transfer to another hotel in the chain.We decided to brave it as it was only for one night. First check in,now having stayed at the Tavistock a few times and been able to check in early everytime we figured arriving ten minutes early would be ok but no.It was like a stand-off where we stood poised watching the clock while four receptionists stood,arms folded watching the queue growing ever longer. Finally allowed in it wasnt half as bad as I'd feared.On booking we had requested a room on a higher floor and on the road side (so many bad reviews overlooked the courtyard we wanted to avoid this if we could). Everything we had requested was met,we were put on the 7th floor.The room was on the north side,I know some rooms have been refurbished and this was one of them.It had a double bed,worn but basically clean bathroom (Im guessing the spring-loaded toilet roll holders are in every room as ours flew across the room everytime you used it),We also had a hairdrier built in.Plenty of storage space for luggage. Its pretty much pot luck which guests you are sharing a floor with but we fared pretty well.No coachloads of youths. We didnt go to breakfast so cant comment on that. With a hotel this big it stands to reason some rooms will be in better condition than others and we probably did get one of the better ones.The stay could have been better,the hot water ran out pretty quickly for morning showers and it wouldnt hurt to start letting guests in a bit before 2pm to prevent the mad scrum.Also the heating was on and it made for an uncomfortable nights sleep. All in all and taking into account the location this hotel is value for money-Ive stayed in 5 star but paid five times the amount for the privilage.

Reviews.Title: “good location for tube”
Reviews.Author: steven89
Reviews.Content: we stayed o/nite here on a theartre break organised by superbreaks.. the location was brill just 2mins from the tube station ,the hotel was nice had a lovely bar ... the room was better then expected very spacious and very clean ,not far of the premier inn style...the staff were helpful .the hotel was not noisy for us so maybe we were lucky. we were suprised how big this hotel is ....the breakfast was buffet style and ok for this hotel .... ok the only thing bad i will say is i accidently left a brand new pair of shoes in the room under the bed ....i rang as soon as i had realised this (a couple of hours later) only to be told by the non english speaking housekeeper that they had not been found...(suprising considering they were not in my case) after requesting they recheck cause i knew where they were ...i re rang bk to be told again they were not there ....i have asked a number of times to spk to the manager only to be told he is not there ,and he will not be able to help ...not very helpfull is it???? they cost me Â£16.00 and yes maybe it is a little my fault for leavin them there but a little interception from the manager would of been nice.......would i use this hotel again ...maybe but dont do as i did ...check and recheck ya room cause if ya leave anythin accidently thats the last ya will see of it ........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jennyj23uk
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from London having stayed at The Royal National hotel. I stayed here last year and on both occasions my stay has been quite enjoyable. I have read the other reviews regarding the sheer amount of guests and the fact that there are many guests under the age of 16 and in large tour groups. This is one of the downsides of the hotel as it creates noise and means that the hotel lobby is constantly busy. On this particular visit there were only 2 lifts working as the other 2 were being refurbished (however we saw no one working on them during our stay). This created many problems due to the amount of guests staying at the hotel. There weren't enough lifts for everyone which meant every morning waiting around 15 minutes for a lift because everyone was going for breakfast at the same time. I also witnessed guests arguing over the lifts. I've never been a fan of their breakfast room which is basically a canteen everyone is herded into. It's very busy and loud and you spend more time looking for a table than actually eating it! Cereal, fruit and toast is provided as standard but those wanting a full English can pay Â£4.50 which I think is very reasonable considering you're in London and everything is so much more expensive. There is a cafe/restaurant on site called Blooms which we found to be very reasonably priced, it was around Â£7 for a 12 inch pizza which again considering you're in London, is very reasonably priced. It's also convenient because if you're tired and want to stay near the hotel you can dine here and then just walk to your room. The rooms are average size, I've stayed in hotels in London where the rooms are cramped and the beds are pushed together but this is not the case here, the rooms are spacious and clean. Basic facilities are provided such as tea and coffee making facilities, a TV and telephone and all the rooms are en-suite. The location of the hotel could not be better, it's central and the nearest tube is Russell Square which is on the Piccadilly Line which is probably the most central line. To get to places like Piccadilly Circus and Harrods it's only a few stops away from Russell Square. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting London. It's brilliantly located, staff are friendly and efficient and the rooms are clean and spacious. What more could you want? The only downsides are the amount of guests, the lack of lifts (which hopefully will be resolved soon) and the lack of seating in the breakfast room. Overall a brilliant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Run Away!, No kidding”
Reviews.Author: sagfp
Reviews.Content: You should look somewhere else unless you traveling in group with more than 30 teenagers. It's extremely noisy, dirty and uncomfortable. Location is the only strong point that I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: juju016
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly adequate unless you happen to be extremely fussy or someone who only stays in 5 star luxury. Our check in was swift and polite. The room was an adequate size on the 3rd floor facing the road, The bed was comfy enough and the toilet was clean which as far as im concerned are the most important points. Its in a good location, very close to Russell Square tube station on Picadilly Line so relly close to the theatres. We slept well, were not at all distubed by noise. The TV remote did not work but so what, there's nothing wrong with getting up to change the channel. Breakfast was fine. Full English was good and the dining room was clean. Maybe I'm old fashioned, but it was fine for myself and my daughter for one night whilst we stayed over to go to the theatre

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel unless you are fond of sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: Franciscoar
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 awful nights at this hotel. First, our room looked onto the engines of the air-conditioning system. Then, the mattresses were so old that you could feel the springs all over your body. Yet, the worst came at night: scores of high school students running up and down the corridor, shouting and banging doors at any time of the night. We couldn't wink an eye. We did complain, but the hotel was full and nothing could be done to have another room. Finally, breakfast:tons of pieces of toast, butter, jam, tea or coffee in an overcrowded room. Some more details: the bathroom had two meagre bars of soap and the paintings were screwed into the wall. Surprising, isn't it. Honestly, avoid this hotel unless you are under 20 and don't mind ruining your holidays in London after some sleepless nights. I'd rather spend some more and choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness”
Reviews.Author: Emma0308
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here i was very nervous about staying here for 3 nights. We arrived on Sunday night at 11pm and it was very busy, got seen straight away and given our room key. Went up to the room I was surprised at how clean and spacious the room was!!! We were over the courtyard and didn't have any bother with noise we were on 7th floor. The staff helped me find the hospital I would be having tests in and were great!!!!! Only downside was being on 7th floor in wheelchair and lifts sometimes took a age but found out FROM STAFF we could use the service lift no wait at all!! Breakfast was Great even though I could only have it one day! My Grandma and Mum had no complaints either. Don't use this hotel if you don't like children/coach trips but I could of sat in bar watching everyone all day!! Great atmosphere with great people. GREAT HOTEL but obviously it's not the Ritz!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest hotel I have every stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: FictionWitch
Reviews.Content: I know this was an economy hotel and since someone else was paying the bill, I should not really complain, but the noise levels were completely unacceptable. The bar in the central courtyard seemed to be hosting an all night party and then at 5.30 in the morning, when I had finally got to sleep, I was awoken again by giant, throbbing tour buses assembling in the yard. The service was slightly better than might be expected and the breakfast was ok. But the general condition of the building with bashed plasterwork, dirty carpets and broken lifts was not appetising. My room was adequate, (although there were holes in the sheet and the blanket looked dubious) However everything worked, but the room of the children I was supervising had a blocked sink. Loo roll holders were universally flimsy and fell off the walls at the slightest touch, ie not fit for purpose. The walls were also very thin which meant you could hear what was going on in the room next door (if the noise outside abated enough to allow that, of course)

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought!”
Reviews.Author: Boredhw1
Reviews.Content: Was worried after reading previous reviews but was honestly not bad! We had a triple room and it was adequate, room seemed clean enough (but I didnt look under bed!). Showers were brill - lots of power and very hot! Breakfast was as expected given the volume of people they were catering for. My tips: 1. Check in was 2pm and we had to stand in a very long queue - avoid this time. 2. We went for breakfast at 8am and there was no queue, however it did get busy after this. 3. Do not get hotel to book taxi - we went to Fifteen restaurant nr Old Street and they quoted us Â£30, which we accepted. The return taxi booked by the restaurant was only Â£15!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeK32
Reviews.Content: this hotel isnt bad we stayed for a weekend. good points: ok value for amount we paid, rooms relatively clean, taxi's always waiting outside, nice pizza place at hotel (could have it delivered to room but closes at 11), drinks in hotel bar very cheap we went to theatre vodka and coke was Â£9 was only Â£2.80 at hotel bar, rooms spacious, good location. bad points: did find a bug in my bed first night, we were about the only english group there alot of tourists, fully naked student stood in corridor, very noisy all though night with traffic outside and people shouting, breakfast not worth paying for, dont lock bathroom door takes reception 20 minutes to get to you to get you out in the end we finally managed to do it ourselves with tweezers, bathroom has no ventilation makes it very steamy and unhygenic, took ages to check in each person had to fill in alot of details before got room card (which dont work properly), dont book taxi though hotel one night we got a taxi to covent garden was Â£25 the next night to the same place we jumped in a black cab outside hotel was Â£9 when we complained they said it was the booking fee!

Reviews.Title: “suitable, clean and adequate but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mcsharon71
Reviews.Content: group of 7 for a birthday weekend we had 3 rooms which were all clean and showers were brilliant. Hotel is huge and check in was very busy when we arrived but i found staff to be mannerly and helpful. Biggest complaint, the noise! my room was facing the courtyard and it was very noisy and we were on the 6th floor. take ear plugs with you. Facing the street would be better option.

Reviews.Title: “It's a very bad and dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: rg70
Reviews.Content: it is a very dirt hotel. the rooms are small and with mold on the walls. there isn't soap in the washroom (you have to buy it outside). for breakfast they offer you just milk , coffee and tea. also if you are 1 couple they give you single bed because they have only 50 double beds for almost 1000 rooms. finally the staff is very unkind. when i asked for a double bad and some soap, at the reception answered me that i could have booked to hilton!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It could have been worst.. but seriously.. 3*?!?”
Reviews.Author: GuilhermeS
Reviews.Content: BAD: Room; Noise; Breakfast; Cleaning; Too many rooms = Too many people.. seriously.. GOOD: Transportation access; Activities Agency; Bar; First you have to understand.. All rooms are very small.. It is important you can choose a room on the top floors and far from de elevators. I stayed at 2nd floor, with window, near the street, and the noise was horrible.. Many students at night are noisy and there are cars and bus passing by at 5:00-5:30am We had badluck, i think.. but we had to buy cleaning products, to clean bathtub and the privy.. There were some drops of urine. Don't pay for Breakfast. It's shamefull for a hotel of 3*.. cereals and milk.. and some fruit.. not many. If you want Sausage and eggs.. you have to pay more 4,5Â£. For that, it's better to go outside.. And you have to be there before 7am, or just before 10am, to skip de long.. long.. queu for eat such a poor breakfast. Nice location, though.. Near Metro, and Sightseeing Bus stop (green way)

Reviews.Title: “deafeningly loud all the time”
Reviews.Author: flautist1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the most sleep deprived weekend ever. No. I wasn't partying. I was laid in bed listening to the deafening noise outside until 3am each night. Our room overlooked the courtyard in the middle of the hotel. A pub and cafe spilt out onto the courtyard so we enjoyed hearing whistling, screaming and shouting all night. The windows didn't sound proof at all. The breakfast room wasn't any better. We had to shout at each other to have a conversation. Although the hotel was clean, the carpets were threadbare. After my first shower I realised that there wasn't a haridryer in the room! The hotel is hugely overpriced and overrated. The swimming pool advertised was actually at a hotel over the road and cost Â£10 pp each time you wanted to use it. Really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Apart being central hotel nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Auditt79
Reviews.Content: 100 pounds for centre of London seems a good price and it is. But when it comes to this Hotel it is very expensive for what it offers. We entered the room and we faced the wall of another part of the building. Toilet very dirty (had been used never cleaned). Dust was in the air everywhere and hair on the pillows and on bed. About breakfast, the worst ever eaten. Always luck of bread juice and milk. Very basic breakfast and tasteless

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jack1919
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for quiet luxury this is not the plave for you! If however you are looking for value for money in a great location it is. We were pleasantly suprised after reading some of the reviews for this hotel. The room was huge and very clean beds comfortable, bed linen was changed both nights that we stayed, towels were clean but could have been bigger. It is a lively place, just sitting in reception I think you could hear every language you could imagine but that we felt was part of the expereince. Lots of young people,at times noisy but always polite. We had no trouble with the lifts. Full english breakfast was excellent. Staff were all helpful and charming, we will be going back

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Convienient and Adequate for a Short Break!”
Reviews.Author: noodlesjen
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed here and I have very little to grumble about. I travel to London with my sister for weekend breaks around twice a year and always book with Superbreaks on their rail and hotel deals, paying aroung Â£120 each for rail from Newcastle and bed and breakfast. This hotel has a fantastic location, 5 mins to the Russell Square tube station and a pleasnat 15 mins walk down to Cocvent Garden. Its only a 5 min walk to the British Museum too! The hotel itself is always full of student/ children parties and very often these seem to be Italian, I can honestly say that apart from them perhaps being a little rude ( queue jumping mainly) Ive never had any problems. The rooms are clean and basic but I never spend much time in my room to be fair. Breakfast can be a bit hectic with a canteen style setting where you may have to share a large table with others but I dont see this as a problem, but there is plenty to eat, fruit, cereal, toast, tea and coffee are the basic but I always get the ful english included in my Superbreak deal anyway, if not I believe you can pay extra for the upgrade and enjoy your fill of bacon, sausage, eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms and beans. The only down points for me are 1) The hotel is huge and out of the 8 lifts I have only ever known 4 be working, however the stairs are always an option! 2) The traffic outside is very noisey, regardless of the windows being closed, unfortunately I have found this to be the case in nearly every London hotel I have stayed in regarless of rating or class so I guess ear plugs may be useful! All in all if you just want a base to explore London this hotel is fine, I wouldnt want to stay there for much longer then 3 or 4 nights but on a budget it does exactly what it says on the tin!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, poor quality food, disinterested staff”
Reviews.Author: angusquine
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay in the Royal National Hotel and would caution anyone else never to stay there. The room and bathroom & toilet (yes they were separate with no sink in the toilet to wash one's hands) were all filthy. The corridors were horrible with a fag end lying on the carpet the whole time we were there. The shower head was disgusting. The staff at check in were inept and unfriendly and at check out made no eye contact and just demanded the room number without any pleasantries or enquiries about our stay. Breakfast was awful. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel clean & tidy, beds comfortable, breakfast good start to the day. Very central for tourists in London”
Reviews.Author: beg132
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean & tidy, beds comfortable, breakfast good start to the day. Very central for tourists in London, easy to commute to & from in London. Had read very bad reviews on the Hotel, but our group of 14 had no problems at all. Will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was filthy”
Reviews.Author: p1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights because the price was reasonable and the location was great, howevre i will NOT be staying there again. We had to pay up front which im not surprised at now because im sure people have seen the state of the rooms and left. The carpets in the room where filthy. Looked like a hoover hadn't been run over them in weeks, the hot tap in the bathroom sink was broken, the toilet roll holder was broken. there was some sort of liquid splashed across the wall in the bedroom and wardrobe that could have been easily cleaned with a cloth. the wardrobe smelled musty and there was a heavy blanket just thrown in the bottom of it. if you sat on the bed it nearly wheeled across the room. the kettle was dirty & i found a dirty sock lying on the floor that was not ours. Also before we had checked out they had come in and changed the sheets whih i think is v unhygienic (the first night i found a hair in my bed that wasn't mine) Our room was right next to the street so you could hear everything. I was also woken a couple of times each night by a loud banging. Breakfast was tasty but it was like a cattle market down there, not enough room for people to sit plus 50% of the lifts where broken so we had to take the stairs in the morning. On our first night we phoned down to order a taxi to take us to a show & where put on hold for 10 minutes (and there where plenty of staff standing around when we went down). We asked the connoisseur to phone us a taxi but instead he directed us out onto the road to flag one down ourselves. We had a great wkend regardless but i would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: Harro05
Reviews.Content: Our stay was awful. it was full of students from abroad. none of the lifts worked and we were on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “does nothing more than in promises, but also does not mislead”
Reviews.Author: florida-no1fan
Reviews.Content: location 5*, get an oyester card for the duration fo your stay... tesco express over road to russel sq underground station less then 50m away from hotel ( reasonable & no que at till) may need to change for hoborne if not staing on the picadily line. Get a WINDSOR room, where you get the included English bkfast otherwise you will need to pay Â£4.5 @ the till in th mornings. Cafeteria style dining arrangement, get your food, THEN find a table. Because it is set out as a square shape layout ,even though no check in on the north side, the Toilets, seating area & breakfast arrangements Are MUCH better oln the north side. The bar either oytside or inside will stop serving if you have kids @ 10:30, and BEWARE will serve under 18yrs without asking for ID. Yes it was full of students, yes it is extreamly cosmopolitan in its clientel. Yes people do check in literally 24hrs a day-It is only Â£4.50 taxi ride from Euston Station, It is clean ( if you get a windsor room) and Kids breakfast of only Â£3.50 a day - please do not post here if you expect 5* setting & and amience - as they say Keep it real !!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and a good base for exploring London”
Reviews.Author: Aliv1979
Reviews.Content: We took a party of school children to the Royal National in April 2011. I had read the reviews on here and was worried but we were actually very impressed with the hotel. The rooms were spotlessly clean and were cleaned daily, with daily towel changes. We were on the 7th floor and they were working on some of the lifts, but there are plenty lifts to choose from. It is a massive hotel and with large numbers and an open breakfast time queues are understandably unavoidable at times. The beds were comfortable all though, if you are leaning against the head rest they do shoot across the room! Facilities in rooms were good and we were very happy. The lifts were being constantly cleaned and you could smell the polish continuously. The only drawbacks were the staff. Check in staff were not very helpful and displayed a poor attitude. Housekeeping on our morning of check out harrassed us from 8.15 when check out was not til 11am. Location is ideal. Right next to russell square and the piccadilly line. There is also plenty of local places to pick up snacks etc. You get what you pay for at the Royal National. An excellent base to stay for exploring London.

Reviews.Title: “\Donot stay in this Hotel unless you are a student”
Reviews.Author: SamNottinghamshire
Reviews.Content: The worse hotel I have ever stayed in ok if you are a student but as a couple it's awful, the noise from the kids didn't stop until 3.00am!! Didn't have breakfast on the second day as it was like eating in a school canteen, never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectations..... low”
Reviews.Author: gateshead_traveller
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel via Superbreaks so were not expecting great things - The positives - great location, 2 mins from Russell Sq tube. Massive hotel reasonably clean & comfy, does what is say on the tin. Opposite the tube station in small shopping complex that has Nandos Yo Sushi etc if you fancy a bite to eat close to the hotel. The Marquis of Cornwall pub is very nice too The Negatives - over run with school/student trips, 1000's of kids everywhere. Lifts dont all work, very slow check in. Left luggage 50p to leave your stuff in a big room then retrieve it yourself, if you can find it. Breakfast was a joke, massive queue to get in then find your own seat(s) in a canteen style arrangement. The foreign guests with their cavalier approach to queuing makes it every man for himself at the tea/coffee machine. English breakfast was $4.50 extra . Would be a better idea to find a local cafe in my opinion Would be ideal for a football trip or budget stay if all you need is somewhere to sleep/shower. Not really suited to families in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “not what i was expecting”
Reviews.Author: peter03091961
Reviews.Content: over run with kids only one lift working on 4th floor could not fined the stairs, would of thought it would have a choice of either a full english breakfast or continental breakfast not have to pay for the full english and could of done with more tea and coffe Wont bother again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE. AVOID IT!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Argentina_29
Reviews.Content: The on ly good thing about this hotel was the location: very central, easy access to the rest of the city. But thatÂ´s all. All the rest was really awfull: to start, breakfast was of poor quality, specially the fruit, which was not to eat if you wanted to enjoy the rest of the day. The room was smelly, also the corridors. There were 4 lifts, but 2 were out of order during our whole stay: imagine how chaotic can it be taking into account this is one the the biggest hotel in London! The day we left 3 out of 4 lifts were out of order: it took us more than half an hour to get downstairs to check out, as during the morning everyone is busy having breakfast, cheking in and out (imagine the chaos!). Out of service signs turn to be familiar in this hotel, not only in lifts but in bathrooms in the lobby. Finally, the hotel was crowed with teenagers, and at night the hotel seemed to be a massive pijama party, with all those kids in pijama and barefeet messing around! My biggest complain for this hotel is that nobody brings order in here, and the staff treats the rest of the passengers as if they were treating with kids, when in fact we are grown up people who diserve respect and came to this city for pleasure, work or both. Do not ever go there! If itÂ´s a question of money, IÂ´m sure there must be something better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: nikikli
Reviews.Content: Nice but impersonal hotel.Convenient.Close to tube and British museum. Helpful staff. Clean. Big bedrooms. It's just fine for London tourism. Breakfast too simple! Go to the pub which is behind the tube station-nice!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel -Great value”
Reviews.Author: Carol186411
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 3 nights at this hotel. When my partner booked this hotel a month ago and I then read the reviews I have to admit we had a stinking row! Maybe it was because we were expecting the worse that we were very pleasantly surprised! Yes the hotel is used for school trips but that was no problem at all. It seemed that the school trips were accommodated on different floors to us as we didnt see them on the coridoors. We had a refurbished room on the second floor which was excellent and a decent size.The room overlooked the entrance which is a square courtyard. My partner is a Victor Meldrew who can be irritated by a ticking clock! and yes we could hear a gentle hubbub of chattering voices from the foyer until we fell asleep but it wasnt disturbing. When arriving at the hotel we were quickly attended to by polite staff. We went down to the breakfast room at 9.30am each morning and it was very quiet so I presume that it is much busier if you go down early . I am quite fussy about breakfast but I was pleased to find muesli amongst the cereals and also a choice of 4 fruits . We had paid for an English Breakfast and we weren't disappointed .There was scrambled eggs, fried eggs, beans, tomatoes, bacon, sausage all cooked well. There was toast and marmalade of course aswell . Even though my partner was on crutches due to a torn ligament we managed to walk to Covent Garden (10 minutes) and Waterloo Bridge (25 mins) the first day. Next day we paid Â£26 each at reception for a 24 hour bus/river pass. We had a great time in the 4 days we were there. We went on the Eye (Â£19) and the dungeons which are near Tower Bridge are worth a visit -very entertaining!(Â£23). The walk to Aldwich Theatre and Drury Lane was about 20 mins.The walk from Kings Cross was 15/20 mins . We will go again and definitely use the same hotel .

Reviews.Title: “for brazil v scotland”
Reviews.Author: wellmanLanarkashire
Reviews.Content: you get what you pay for hotel was huge but never seemed overcrowed really handy for kings cross station ,soho,covent garden ect. good crash pad for a football trip breakfast not the best but ok. would use again for the same purpose

Reviews.Title: “awful service and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: LisaHew
Reviews.Content: Our partners booked this hotel for us for our business trip. It was a terrible experience. Room and bathroom are small (we stayed in triple room). Our window was looking on the main yaed of the hotel and it was very noisy all the time, because buses and cars rolled over the night. It seemed to me that staff didn't really care about their clients. Only a few mades helped us to solve some problems with room. Another question is breakfast. It was really nothing to it in the breakfast, included in the room price. If you wanted to have nourisshing meal, you must to pay extra. No wi-fi in the hotel, only in the nearby pub or pizza-house.

Reviews.Title: “DONT BOTHER”
Reviews.Author: tslly
Reviews.Content: i HAVE COPIED AND PASTED THIS REVIEW FROM THE LAST PERSON AS THEY ARE BANG ON WITH EVERY THIG THEY SAID I CAN NOT ADD ANYTING ELSEfisrt time i have ever felt the need to complain re hotel - on arrival thought we had arrived at a youth hostel and this never changed, hundreds of noisy young students with little manners when it came to waiting for lifts and boy did we have to wait, 4 lifts out of 8 working during our 4 day stay - 1600 rooms!! on arrival room was dirty, dated and stained/hard towels and the room we moved to was less dated with stained/hard towels, woken up 2 nights with kids running about corridors banging on doors. hotel itself very dated, foyer reasonable but corridors need total refurb, most carpets stained and very dirty. Gave up waiting for breakfast, queues horrendous and looking into dining room from outside looked more like old style holiday camp! Ignore 3 star rating. This was booked by family member who doesn't have access to computer to check reviews and although we certainly were not expecting luxury i did expect clean, reasonable accomodation with good breakfast and perhaps nicebar area to enjoy drink before going out for evening meal - not a chance, foyer and bar area used by young groups to meet and shout. sorry, talk to each other and we didn't spend any time other than to sleep in hotel. Previous comment about left luggage is correct - pay your money then help yourself to cases! Staff on reception helpful enough but cant be easy for them and sure i am not the first to complain by far. There are far nicer hotels to stay for the same money

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsr84
Reviews.Content: fisrt time i have ever felt the need to complain re hotel - on arrival thought we had arrived at a youth hostel and this never changed, hundreds of noisy young students with little manners when it came to waiting for lifts and boy did we have to wait, 4 lifts out of 8 working during our 4 day stay - 1600 rooms!! on arrival room was dirty, dated and stained/hard towels and the room we moved to was less dated with stained/hard towels, woken up 2 nights with kids running about corridors banging on doors. hotel itself very dated, foyer reasonable but corridors need total refurb, most carpets stained and very dirty. Gave up waiting for breakfast, queues horrendous and looking into dining room from outside looked more like old style holiday camp! Ignore 3 star rating. This was booked by family member who doesn't have access to computer to check reviews and although we certainly were not expecting luxury i did expect clean, reasonable accomodation with good breakfast and perhaps nicebar area to enjoy drink before going out for evening meal - not a chance, foyer and bar area used by young groups to meet and shout. sorry, talk to each other and we didn't spend any time other than to sleep in hotel. Previous comment about left luggage is correct - pay your money then help yourself to cases! Staff on reception helpful enough but cant be easy for them and sure i am not the first to complain by far. There are far nicer hotels to stay for the same money

Reviews.Title: “We use this as a base when site working in central London. We call it 'The Party Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: ashofbristol
Reviews.Content: I think this is the largest hotel in central London. I feel it fair to say mostly used by overseas tourist for 3/4 day whistle stop tours? Constant coach arrivals and departures, sometimes with young travellers. We base ouselves here when we have a project in London. We work on commercial catering installations. As contractors we leave early and arrive back quite late. Due to size and main client base, our times of leaving and arriving do not appear an issue to others. There is a large underground car park below, which accepts large vans, really helpful if you need to base or leave vans 24 hours. Facilities are basic, and sometimes the holiday makers can get,,, lets say 'excited' during holiday activity. However this has never affected our working stay, and there is a lot of security staff to ensure all customers are accommodated. Definitely 'no frills' but good as a contractors base.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: HillPill
Reviews.Content: Zero frills. ZERO. As in, truly basic. But, if you're in London to sightsee and will only be in the hotel to sleep and shower, then it meets basic needs. If you're looking for a hotel to relax, luxuriate, and STAY in, then it probably won't meet your needs. Yes, there are mostly tour groups who stay there. So, yes, the lobby is constantly crowded. And yes, so is the bar area. So get out of the hotel and go see the city! What are you in London for? Go find a real pub with real ale to enjoy (and that would NOT be the bar attached to the parking/loading area). For the location, it is very inexpensive. That doesn't mean it's cheap, but try to find another hotel in the London city center in a decent neighborhood at this hotel's price. You won't. Just keep in mind that you get what you pay for. The room was clean. Most rooms have twin beds, so this may be off-putting to Americans. But it's rather common in some areas of Europe. There are no flat-screen TVs, bad art on the walls, or foo-foo toiletries. It is very basic. That cannot be stressed enough. BASIC. Pluses: Location. That's about it. It's within minimal walking distance to two tube stations. A little further afoot are major tourist/cultural attractions. The British Museum is practically right around the corner. Minuses: The free breakfast left much to be desired. Coffee, tea, juice, toast, rolls and cereal. For 5 pounds they offer an English Breakfast. The fee for parking was rather high. 14 pounds or something per each 24 hours. There were only 2 or 3 computer kiosks and because of the crowds in the lobby, expect a wait. And expect to pay 1 pound for about 15 minutes. The elevators are tiny and only half were operational when we were there. Takeaway: If you're looking for a hotel "experience" with perks and little frills, you won't find it with this hotel. But, if you're travelling to London to experience London and will only utilize the hotel for it's basic amenities (sleep and showering), then this hotel might meet your needs. Just don't arrive with high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE ALL ROUND”
Reviews.Author: fion2412
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a University trip to London to attend a conference. The location of the hotel is really good, but the cleanliness was average, everything is dated apart from the reception area, the 'breakfast' area was far too overcrowded and the quality of the breakfast was very poor. It has to be said that the staff that were working in the breakfast area were extremely rude. The quality of sleep that I had wasn't great, the singular glazed windows let in a lot of road noise which I guess is inevitable in London. The obvious attraction to this hotel is the location, and maybe the fact that they state they can provide 'triple' rooms which is a bonus for any University/school trip - however I must mention that the 'triple' room consisted of two basic beds and a very uncomfortable camp bed. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but that's about all.”
Reviews.Author: thejanegirl
Reviews.Content: Full of kids, rooms grubby, layout confusing, breakfast a joke. Suitcases can be left for 50p but when we returned to collect ours, we were asked to look about the storage room to find them - not very security conscious. Breakfast was appalling - slices of bread and not much else. Luckily there are some nice cafes near by.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with lots of kids”
Reviews.Author: Bijose
Reviews.Content: the hotel is one of the largest in London and it's location in central London is great. It;s close to the British Museum, Covenant Garden and most importantly the tube stop. Our only problem was the hundreds of kids, it was spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much.”
Reviews.Author: rebecca9090
Reviews.Content: + The best thing about the Royal National Hotel was the location, 2 minute walk to Russel Square station. + The hotel was spotless, can't complain about cleanliness as housekeepers visited every day. Although the bedding I had one night was torn and a bit shabby and pillows quite small. - The hotel seemed to be used mainly by large groups of students/school visits. Who do run around the corridors, shouting, running in and out of each others rooms ALL night. The doors are very heavy and woke me up every time one was closed through the night. I was on the 7th floor, I have read that some others were kept awake by traffic noise, that wasn't our case. - The most annoying part of my stay was concerning the bloody room keys were a nightmare, one stopped working one night and when trying to get a replacement, one man on the desk said "we can't do your key, the computers not working, I'll let you in." He then looked to another member of staff and they both smirked. Fair enough if the computer genuinely wasn't working but the way he said it showed it was a complete lie. - One more thing, the lifts, only half of them were working, when really there needed to be more as there was always a group of people waiting. Did not stay for breakfast so I cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for !”
Reviews.Author: Jellifer
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights in a triple room through Superbreak for Â£91 each including train from the Midlands - bargain ! Wasn't expecting much for the price and after reading reviews on here I was really expecting the worst. The hotel is about 3 mins walk from Russell Sq tube, on the Picadilly line - an excellent location. It isn't hard to find as it is absolutely huge (1600 rooms) We arrived at 10.30 am and had no problem leaving our bags and were told we could check in any time after 2pm. When we came back the lobby was quiet and we were checked in quickly and efficiently. We were given a room on the top (7th) floor and it was huge ! It had 4 single beds, a bathroom and a separate toilet. Furnishings were a little tired but everything was spotlessly clean. On the first night our room was roasting hot, but on the 2nd we came back and it was absolutely freezing. There are massive gaps in the window frames and we couldn't get warm. The hotel is mainly used by tour groups of young people. The lobby can be overrun at times and there were lots of people running up and down the corridors at night - it felt a bit like a youth hostel. Lifts were a problem, there were only ever 2 out of the 4 working and they were often full of pyjama clad teenagers ! Breakfast was pretty basic - think school canteen, but it was included so we had our moneys worth. We also ate at the pizza place one night which was surprisingly reasonable - Â£6 for a huge pizza. If you are just looking for somewhere cheap and clean then this will do the job - if you are looking for more then I suggest you pay more and go elsewhere/

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service,easy check in.”
Reviews.Author: Annieb1965
Reviews.Content: was really worried when i read reviews about hotel, but i must say i had a enjoyable 4 night stay, no sign of any bed bugs, room clean, rooms done every day , breakfast ok. arrived at 11.45 but could check in straight away. plenty pay as you go computers in foyer. staff friendly and helpful . would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wretched place this was”
Reviews.Author: tlclla
Reviews.Content: Hotel is huge (1600 rooms or so they said), shabby, cheap everything, waaaay overpriced, with amenities listed on the website either not available or so seldom available as to be non-existent (for instance computer access, their wireless was so weak it was useless and advertised "kiosks" didn't exist). Upon check in they insisted on a 20 pound CASH deposit because we were a group (refusing to allow individuals to use credit card for this which would have preserved some of the consumer rights associated with the use thereof even though individual check in was done); and kept everyone guessing as to whether the deposit would be returned as well until the actual moment of check out. Not a good experience by any standard (and they have NONE).

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: chris_189
Reviews.Content: We stayed in London between 23 February and 2 March.We arrived in the hotel around noon.We tried to check-in BUT the employees told us that they didn't have a room reservation under our name.But we have already paid the hotel.It took 8 hours to solve the problem and the stuff wasn't helpful at all.Despite the fact,that the hotel location was great.2 minutes from the metro and bus station and near the British museum.The breakfast was not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Like a cattle market”
Reviews.Author: jackiemccarthy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here for a London theatre trip. Rooms very basic but they are clean. However there are gangs of students and children everywhere. Checking in ok and you can leave your cases for 50 pence each item. It was extremely hot in the room so had to have both windows open so traffic noise a real problem. Breakfast a night mare as hundreds of. People trying to eat at the same time and they cannot keep up with clearing the tables. Reminds me of school canteens but with more chaos. Food when you got it was ok though and plenty of choice . Only one set of lifts in operation for whole hotel which was a nightmare! We were on the 7 th floor and had no noise other than traffic outside.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located,cheap & clean but poor breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: NinaDurham
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights in London on a special break deal. We arrived just before noon and were able to check in immediately.We were lucky and arrived at a quiet time. Later several bus loads of school children arrived and it got very busy . We were given a room on the top (7th) floor.The room was adequate and clean. The only noise at night was from the traffic. Yes the towels were a bit thin but they did the job. If you want fluffy soft towels this is not the place for you. If you want somewhere to sleep which is convenient for central London, it is fine. The breakfast however is poor.A huge self service cafeteria We were advised to be down at 7am if we didn't want to queue. It was good advice. The fruit juice had a strange taste, the tinned grapefruit and orange lacked flavour and the cooked breakfast was nearly cold by the time you got back to your table as the plates were cold. Having said this, I would go back again, particularly on one of the special breaks. Just buying the train ticket alone costs more than our trip with accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: kvasten
Reviews.Content: After having read reviews here I did not know what to expect from the hotel (where I last stayed in 1995). However, the room was clean and silent, the bed okay, the staff helpful and the breakfast ordinary. I could have done with an extra blanket, and the doors (to the rooms) should be adjusted so that they donÂ´t slam. I paid 60 pounds for the single room, which I think was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Arrrgghhhh Average Hotel but never again...”
Reviews.Author: SummerHollyDay
Reviews.Content: Went for a romantic weekend away. We were after a hotel that was reasonably close to the centre and cheap. We booked with Thomas Cook and stayed for 3 nights. Hotel: Large hotel, packed reception area, close enough to city centre especially with fantastic tube links from Russell Square on the Picadilly Line. We were taken to our room straight away. Room: Basic, nothing amazing but it is what we expected. 5 channel television and hot running shower. No view out of the room but again as expected. We were on the top floor (7) so we heard no noise throughout the night unlike other guests on the lower floors whom I heard complaining. The room key was an absolute nightmare, we were locked out of our room three times in total during our stay and when we went to get our lock changed the staff: 1. Didn't believe us 2. Said we werent doing it properly 3. Changed our keys so many times we had 4 different keys 4. Wouldnt call a locksmith 5. Demanded ID (which was locked in the room) When you have had a long day around London this is the last thing we needed. After the third time we took the locksmiths number so we could call him directly as opposed to dealing with the rude concierge. Food: Appauling. It was like feeding time at the zoo. People fingering all the bacon and beans, huge queues, no tables. Twice, I ate breakfast at a cafe in order to avoid the food. The staff were horrendous, asking to see our room card around 3 times in the 20mins we were in there. We were offered a free dinner but turned this down due to knowing how appauling breakfast was, no way was i staying for tea. Only ate at the breakfast hall in the end, didn't dare venture anywhere else. Staff: AWFUL. Overall experience: Wouldn't stay again. The staff were extremely unpolite, the foreign visitors pushed in the queues for the lifts, breakfast, recpetion, concierge, which was really annoying! When i return to London I will opt to go to another hotel, as although I expected an average stay I didn't think it was going to ruin my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: thirstytours
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend.The rooms were clean and a good size for a small group(two or three people).Even though the room was fine,the shower was awful!!When you turned the hot tap on,it was boiling,and when you turned the cold tap on,it was freezing!The bathroom was ok with a toilet and a bath fitted with a shower.It was a bit small though.
