I have heard that the breakfast was terrible,but it's ok.There wasn't much selection on the Continental Breakfast,just four types of cereal,melon and pineapple,toast and bread rolls.There was a choice of an English Breakfast,but you have to pay Â£4.50.The toast was nice,soft and not to crispy,the cereals were cornflakes,muesli,rice crispies and some sort of brown coloured cornflake looking things.There was also coffee,tea,apple juice,orange juice,cold milk and water.I haven't tried the bread rolls,but they felt a bit hard. This hotel is fine if you are staying for a little while on a budget,but if you are wanting to stay for a while,then I wouldn't stay here.I hope this review helps!!8-)

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded youth hostel - consider when on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel without glamour or anything special. It is used by many student tour groups, which is especially noticeable during breakfast in the "canteen". Staff is rather weared out and only willing to do the minimum. Not a great welcome, nor a nice surrounding. Room is okay with sufficient space and services. Sleeping is okay although it can be noisy. Wifi only in the lobby. The very low set price may convince you to choose this, also because it is in central London, Russel Square (although only limited subway conections closeby). I was re-booked to this hotel by another 3-star, but I would not choose it myself for a business trip and perhaps only for a budget trip with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: angellea69
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay at the Royal National through Superbreak. The hotel is about a 25 minute walk from Kings Cross with heavy suitcases and it was pretty easy to find. The hotel is absoutely huge and the foyer was very busy, but we were seen straight away by an extremely polite and efficient receptionist. We were able to check in two hours early which was brilliant. Had we needed to wait it would've been no problem as the hotel has a traditional pub, a bowling alley attached to it, a gift shop, a coffee shop, a pizza parlour and another bar. Great facilities. We were on the 6th floor and the rooms were lovely - basic yes, but spotlessly clean. We had a kettle, three single beds, a flat screen LCD TV, spare blankets, plenty of towels, bedside tables, a telephone and a desk with a stool. The bathroom was a good size and our triple room wasn't cramped. The beds were very comfortable and we had two great night's sleep. There were certainly no sign of bed bugs at all! Room service was offered from lunchtime until midnight at an extra charge of just Â£1 per order, which was great. We also ate in the London Pub attached to the hotel one evening and the food was perfectly nice. A very small choice, but good portion sizes and brilliant value at Â£6 per meal. Breakfast in the morning was lovely - we had to queue for a couple of minutes to get into the dining room, but it was huge and we got a table straight away. We had the cooked breakfast which was really nice - bacon, sausages, fried eggs, scrambled eggs, tomatoes and beans. There was also a continental selection, which consisted of bread rolls, toast, several types of cereal, milk, fruit, apple and orange juices, butter, jams, tea and coffee. The serving staff were also very pleasant and polite, no problems at all. The Royal National is two minutes walk away from Russell Square underground station, a Tesco Express store, a pub and various shops and restaurants. The location was absolutely superb. We would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull”
Reviews.Author: jdw567
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a weekend break to London staying at the royal national was a big disappointment I did not expect it to be as bad even with the awfull reviews, the hotel is very dated and the rooms are not very clean. We were at the hotel for two nights on arrival it took a hour and a half to get checked in to make things worse our room was double booked so after a further two hour wait we were given another room. The breakfast was truly discussing and everything apart from the bacon was not fit for a dog. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to an enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Basic value and very convienient!”
Reviews.Author: BEEBEE4545
Reviews.Content: This is a very easy hotel to access from the Tube, Heathrow to the hotel directly on the Piccadilly Line. 4 minute walk w/ cases to the hotel check in desk!! We were allowed to check in 5 hours prior to the scheduled time, and even though the hotel caters specifically to large bus tours and huge school groups, it is well staffed by adults, and easy to navigate. It is crowded, they have 400 rooms. I found NO evidence of bedbugs, and I checked EVERY DAY, every way. I tore that room apart. (Yes, I am paranoid! I don't camp, or do insects.) We stayed on the 7th floor, two single beds in the room. Rooms are clean, dull, and basic. Windows do open for fresh air. TV and phone worked. Bathroom was spotless, very deep tub, great showers with lots of hot water, and anything we requested from housekeeping was granted quickly. FYI: bar soap only, no shampoo/conditioner. 40$ cash deposit for hairdryers, and cash refunded promptly upon return of said hairdryer. Plain cold breakfast, cereal, toast, juice, coffee, but it is all you can eat, and free. Worked for us! I will definatley stay there again. 6 nights, with taxes/and breakfast ran us $453.00 US, for one adult, and one teenager. Try to beat that anywhere in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: djlanceley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after booking a package break through superbreak. After reading the reviews on here i was concerned we made a big mistake! The hotel is a 15 minute walk from kings cross station (if you know where your going.... we didnt) but the building is very large and easy to spot. Checkin isnt until 2pm but we arrived in London at 11am and keen to drop off our bags we headed straight to the hotel, who had a room to hold luggage before checkin (and also after checkout) which is fantastic.. Kings Cross were going to charge Â£8 per piece of luggage but the hotel offered this service for free. The reception is large and the hotel isdivided into two parts. The receptionist are very busy but are welcoming and very helpful. Our room was on the 6th floor, long corridors, which look a bit worn and tired. The rooms are basic, but very clean, and hold everything which would be required for a short stay. Beds were comfortable, and not too much noise (guess this really depends on the kindnessof your neighbours). We went down for breakfast at 8:30 and the room was a little busy, but we managed to get a table. The breakfast is buffet style, everything is fresh and the cooked breakfast was very tasty, no complaints. Im not sure what more i could expect for the price i paid, the hotel location is fantastic, russell sq tube station is a hop skip and a jump away from the hotel entrance. I feel those people who complain must go with the intention of not liking where they stay. For the price we paid i felt this was exceptional value, those still not happy should maybe look to spend a little more next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and close too everything”
Reviews.Author: Amandasteele
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Thomas Cook, And then read the reviews for the hotel and freaked out tryed too cancell, because people made the hotel out like it was the pits!!!! Was very nervious about going !!! Me and my boyfriend were very happy with the hotel when wee arrived very clean and staff were nice there was one English member of staff so that helped!!! I would recommend this hotel!!!! As long as you dont mind students your fine the hotel is full of them all the time .

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at a great location with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Durhamfogies
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Royal National Hotel for three nights from the 21st February. Having read some horrendous reviews about this hotel, we went armed with full details of how to identify & ward off bed bugs. We went over the bed & indeed the whole room with a fine tooth comb & found nothing nasty at all - in fact our room on the 7th floor and the bathroom were spotless. We had a free meal offered on our first night & enjoyed a lovely Indian Buffet at the Poppadom Express. I laughed out loud when I read somebody elses comment about the dessert on offer, which they described as a cake with some lumpy cream beside it which had obviously gone off. That cream was actually RICE PUDDING which I had as well as the cake & thoroughly enjoyed both - with no ill effects I might add. We had good service from both Reception & Consierge staff who answered our questions about directions etc both promptly & pleasantly. We had full English breakfast each morning & yes it was rather chaotic finding somewhere to sit, but considering the size of the hotel & the fact it was half term with lots of kiddies off to see the Lion King etc, we felt all the staff did well to cope as well as they did. Our cooked breakfast was very nice & we had excellent service from an attendant who noticed that my glass of apple juice looked rather weak. He commented that the machine must need to be refilled & immediately removed my weak juice & brought me another one without me having said a word. On our last day we went for breakfast a little late after packing & there were no eggs left. The attendant was quick to offer to cook some for us & said they would bring them to our table in a couple of minutes - which they did. Finally - we were happy to find out that the Hotel will actually look after your luggage at 50p per item on your last day if you wish to see some more sights. This we felt was an excellent service. We didn't need to use it but others take note - it costs Â£8 for a similar service at Kings Cross Station. We have no complaints about this Hotel & would be very happy to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Sollerk
Reviews.Content: First off after being scared to even look at the bed - we did not get bit and there was no sign of bed bugs. (However I've heard reports of even the most expensive hotels getting these problems - if they did have a problem it seems to have been solved) Yes it is a little noisy but the hotel is huge and you can't go to London and expect peace and quiet. The breakfast was fine. The room was dated but clean. The only real problem was the size of the place and the lack of lifts as some were closed due to refurbishment. Its in a great location and you get what you pay for, and at the price I paid I was more than happy and would be happy to come again. If you do want somewhere quieter look for a smaller hotel as there were people walking around all of the time but what can you expect with a hotel this size?

Reviews.Title: “Why are people complaining.”
Reviews.Author: sillyidiot17
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine when we stayed. We stayed from the 23rd-25th Feb and the service was really good. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful not rude like people have been saying. We were checked in quite quick. We got there earlier than the check in time and we were able to store our suitcases for no charge and they were safely looked after. I will say the hotel was large but it held a lot of people. We found our room fine and found a lift closer than the one we came up. The rooms were tidy and well presented I saw no signs of mould or rubbish from previous people. There were no bugs in either mine or my mumâ€™s bed as we didnâ€™t get bit. The beds are very comfortable and very warm. We could hear the traffic during the night but it wasnâ€™t that bad. We received a free evening meal on the first night with the price we payed and the meal was very nice. The shower in the room was brilliant and you got towels and soap but had to bring your own shampoo. There was a good toiler and sink as well. In the morning the breakfast was very good toast with butter and jams, cereal, fruit and an English breakfast which was all included in the cost but you do need your yellow slip with you which is what the check in person told us as we checked in. The hotel is at most a 5 minute walk from Russell Square Tube Station it has a Tesco express and many little shops around as well to nip into if you wanted a snack. The London Bar on the hotel is cheaper than the hotel bar and has a great feeling inside as everyone is talking and itâ€™s very nice. The hotel does have vending machines and computers near the entrance Â£1 for 15 mins of internet which I thought was really good. Also there are phone and ipod chargers as well which I thought was really good. All in all I thought the hotel was a really good place and donâ€™t have a bad word to say about it and these people complaining I have no idea what they are on about because the hotel I stayed in was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Bowling Alley and Live Band until 4AM!”
Reviews.Author: Dissatisfied_MuFugga
Reviews.Content: Currently - we're having to move to another hotel because there is a Bowling Alley and Live Band until 4AM in the morning!!! We're situated on the third floor and can hear it, and the staff are refusing to move us, there are still customers checking in and the staff attitude is "Why should they be moved" Even when they aren't in the hotel yet! The Staff are not the least bit helpful and for the same price we've booked into the premier inn at Euston, hopefully it'll be much better.!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews would have you believe!”
Reviews.Author: smoosh_me
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights 16th-18th of feb. After reading reviews i was worried about staying here. On arrival we couldnt believe the size of the hotel, but the staff were friendly, we were asked if we wanted single or a double bed and shown how to get to our room. It took us ages to find our room as the corridors are like a maze, we found it funny though and it didnt put us off. On arriving at the room, i went over every inch of it looking for bed bugs or other dirt, but found nothing! it was lovely and clean and quite a decent sized room. The first time we left our room we couldnt find an exit and ended up down a staff lift and out at the delivery area of the hotel. Right away a staff member asked if we were okay and went ouf of his way to take us to the correct exit, pointing us in the direction of the underground. We had a quiet, comfy stay here (the room was cleaned and bed made for us!) and really cant complain about anything! I would definately come back as the hotel was in a great location and the room we had was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry..its fine!”
Reviews.Author: teresa040_11
Reviews.Content: I was badly let down by P&O for a trip to Brugge and I only had a week to sort out another trip for my 40th. So therefore once I had booked the Royal National there was no going back. After reading the many reviews on here I was worried to say the least but I can honestly say that the hotel is FINE! If you are going to sit in your room and depend on the food available then this isn't the place for you but if you are going to London to have fun, see the sights, eat out, see a show, then this hotel is perfect. Not overly priced, the food is ok in the selection of restaurants (we had one nights evening meal included) the room clean, shower fantastic, staff friendly and the selection at breakfast is fab. Yes it IS busy and yes the breakfast IS served in a cafeteria style but how else are they going to do it with over 1600 rooms? No different to when you go to BHS or your local super market for a bite to eat. The overall appearance is slightly tired and old fashioned and this could be addressed but it did'nt ruin my lovely wknd away. Think some comments on the reviews are very unfair. Maybe people are expecting too much from a budget priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacobean20
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews on this page, in fact one from same date we stayed, and think they had the wrong hotel. They state breakfast was poor, when in fact full english, with also choice of several cereals, toast, jam, maramlade, tea/ coffee. Only prob we had was staff not very helpful, went for wifes birthday/ valentines day and bought champagne, no body able to provise ice bucket, which seemed strange for hotel with bar and restaurant. Rooms basic but clean. In with deal we got a 3 course meal at nearby president hotel and it was brill. Would deffo go again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: dandung86
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a travel and hotel deal. The hotel is centrally located, about a fifteen minute walk from Kings Cross station. It was easy enough to find from here, even as we had never been to London before. If you did not want to walk far at night there is a selection of decent restaurants nearby, however we were able to walk to the central London amusements (Big Ben, Buckingham Palace, etc) from the Hotel easily. Nearest tube station is Russell Square, about a 2 minute walk.The London tour bus company stop outside the hotel also which we thought is a good (if cunning) idea. Our room was clean and well looked after. Did not use the restaurant as it seemed busy both mornings, however we would recommend this (very large) hotel and visit again. Also, the hotel offers a bag storage facility which was useful on our checking out day as we were able to spend a full day in London and pick them up later.

Reviews.Title: “A place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Siwalker85
Reviews.Content: The royal national was ideal for us on our weekend trip to LDN as it was pretty central and close to a tube station. The room was very basic and was left quite untidy, bin not emptied and a bottle of coke left half full in the bath room, the towels gave me a rash no my legs. Did not have mush interaction with the staff apart from check in which was quick and easy, even though they where busy. The breakfast was included and was ok, basic buffet. Wouldn't have paid extra for it as it was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great location, and despite others' reviews, good breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: BSZJM
Reviews.Content: Went to London on a theatre break with four of my family members. Found the hotel easily, couple of stops' from Kings Cross on the tube and then literally around the corner from the tube entrance. Yes, the outside doesn't look great, but once inside it is very nice. The staff were brilliant and went out of their way to get us rooms close together. Rooms were fine, clean, big enough, and served their purpose. We had a problem with our window and on ringing reception someone was with us in under ten minutes to assist and solve our problem. Staff were very helpful, very accomodating, and were always polite and friendly. Despite it being busy and housing a fair few school trips, the only problem we encountered was with two "grown men" in the hotel bar. We had initially gone accross the road to the nice little bar, where these two bafoons had started to pester us, thinking they were highly amusing. Due to them irritating us we had left and gone to the very nice- and reasonably priced- hotel bar. Unfortunately these guys were staying at the same hotel and also came across shortly afterwards. Baring in mind this was midnight, they were dressed as if they'd just walked off a building site and continued to jeer, holler and make comments towards us. When asked politely to leave us alone they became very confrontational. The guys were very drunk and unfortunately the bar staff were two lovely, but very small women. There were no 'security ' or anything to assist us. Anyway, not the hotels' fault, and it was quite clear they were wasted, and on speaking to the bar staff were under watchful eyes. Slept well, some noise but did not disturb us sleeping. Went over for the breakfast which was included with our price. No complaints, self service, as much or as little as you want. Despite reviews, we couldn't complain about the food, the service or the staff. The breakfast was more than edible and it was all freshly cooked and piping hot. Will most definitely return and stay here again. Yes if you've plenty of money and are used to fine dining, then no, this wont suit you. If you are less fussy, and want to do London on a budget then we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Royal National - has the royal abdicated from its' duties?”
Reviews.Author: RalphWiggam
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for a trip to London with the wife's mother, aunt and uncle. Unfortunately the wife's uncle had just recently discovered the trip adviser website and was all doom and gloom about the hotel even before he had set foot in the place!! We arrived shortly after 2pm and found ourselves in the middle of a hotel reception that was as busy as terminal 5 in Heathrow Airport. There was a mass of people waiting to check in and there was no orderly queues - it was a free for all just like boarding an Easy Jet flight if you haven't paid extra for the speedy boarding pass. There was a right mixture of people waiting to check in - from families, coach parties, schools, groups of aliens with either fluffy or bobbly antennae protruding from their heads and middle aged princesses with tiaras hoping to find their frog princes. When we eventually got to the reception the staff were friendly & polite and we were off to our rooms within 5 minutes. As luck would have it Mr Doom & Gloom (aka the wife's uncle) got a room that had been recently refurbished. The room was first class - it was all freshly decorated with new carpet, a new bathroom, new bedroom furniture, nice spotlights above the bed and had a lovely flat screen television. Unfortunately our room had not been part of the recent refurbish but to be fair the room was clean and tidy. Our bedroom was right on the main road which I thought would be a problem at night when we were trying to sleep but we never heard the traffic. The wife's aunt & uncle's room was located above the court yard and they were aware of the noise of people coming & going from the hotel during the night but it didn't disturb their sleeping too much. The rooms were cleaned every day even when there was no request left hanging from the door handle. Now the breakfast in the morning - if we had known that it was going to be so bad we would have stayed in bed! The breakfast room took me back to my school days - it was like our school dining hall without the school monitors. If you are up early enough then you won't have to queue in the hallway waiting for a free table. But I tell you it is not worth the wait. The food was terrible - the breakfast rolls were brick hard, the toast was far from crisp in fact it was the first time I have had chewy toast, the tea was like tar and the fresh orange juice was far from fresh. The breakfast cereals were they only thing that was edible. There was no choices of cold meats, cheese, pastries or croissants. It was very basic - cereals, rolls, toast, butter/jam/marmalade, tea/coffee/fresh fruit juice & some grapefruits. Not a good selection for what is described as a 'Continental breakfast'. I have has a lot better continental breakfasts in other hotels. One thing the Royal National does have going for it is the location. Russell Square Underground station is just round the corner, there are plenty of restaurants/cafes and shops in the area, the British Museum is a short walk away and other attractions such as Covent Garden, Oxford Street etc are within walking distance. The hotel is if anything too large. The wife's uncle actually got lost a couple of times trying to get to his room and likened it to being a rat in a maze. The rooms in themselves are fine but the hallways are shabby and are in need of some upgrading. We knew where our room was thanks to the big paint footprint at the start of our hallway. Although there was groups of school children we did not hear any noise from them as they were located in the other end of the hotel which was a relief as the wife needs her sleep! If you are looking for a short break in London then the Royal National is good value for money. What would make this a gem would be for the Imperial London Hotel Group to invest in a total refurbishment of this hotel and to improve the standand of their breakfasts. Add this to the location then the hotel would be first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price if that is more important than ammenities”
Reviews.Author: JillGW
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location near the tube and within walking distance of the British Museum, West End, and Piccadilly Circus. It was an easy train ride from Heathrow, there was a stop for the Original Guided Tour in front of the hotel, and the price was right. The room itself was just okay. The bathroom was large and clean, but the towels were very thin and the room furnishings were dated. The free breakfast was a choice of a few cereals and toast, so we only did that one morning. One set of elevators was out of service, so if you were trying to leave the hotel during peak times of the morning it could be a very long wait. I normally like to stay in hotels much nicer than this, but if your goal is a cheap, safe room in a good location this will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get enough credit!”
Reviews.Author: Leah1083
Reviews.Content: Well basically me and some of the girls went to London for a few days and we decided to stay in the 'Royal National' as it was cheap and in a perfect location for us! We read the reviews and we're expecting the worst, but for the price we paid we didn't expect any better! When we arrive although the outside didn't look amazing inside was lovely! Staff were friendly and we went to our rooms to unpack to find a rather bug triple room with a spacious CLEAN bathroom! The breakfast was lovely and this hotel was definately worth the money, I'd of happily paid more! Does not get enough credit, obviously snobby people have wrote the majority of the views!

Reviews.Title: “Great for location, but little else”
Reviews.Author: Glitterpuss
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, close to the tube, but has little else going for it. This hotel seemed to be full of coach travelling kids. Our key card failed on two separate occasions meaning we had to revisit reception, where the staff were relatively helpful. The room was small, the bathroom not very clean. The toilet roll holder was so cheap and nasty it kept falling off the wall. Our room overlooked the road, which was noisy with traffic all night, and I also kept being woken up by noisy people slamming doors and talking loudly up til 3 in the morning. We had a voucher for a meal in one of the hotel restaurants. We went to Poppadom Express, the food was okay, just not spicy and quite tepid. The hotel also has "breakfast",which very few London hotels do. Do not allow this to persuade you to book this hotel!!. The dining room is cafeteria style with very limited choice. There is juice and coffee/tea and a choice of three cereals. Toast is also provided but is not hot. If you want a cooked breakfast it is an extra Â£4.50. The first day we had cereal. The second day we went out for breakfast. We had a great time in London, but will not be returning to this hotel. It felt like a youth hotel at inflated prices

Reviews.Title: “avoid for next trip to london”
Reviews.Author: jude067
Reviews.Content: had to buy earplugs noisy buses arriving in the middle of the night .room was clean but basic no hairdryer only soap good job we brough toileteries.breakfast bit like PRISIONER CELL BLOCK H tables not cleared good job we were with friends not very romantic .staff very helpfull not their fault too many people.think more for foreign students than us pensioners.enough moaning had a great time very central saw when we were married at the garrick excellent.had a loveley meal at sophies steak house .had a brill time but maybe choose a smaller hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “great for my school trip”
Reviews.Author: planty97
Reviews.Content: i arived at this hotel late afternoon and it wasnt buisey at all we all simpley got the key of our teachers and we were trusted to go to our rooms the room was very basic but fine the shower was clean and so were beds the tv was a biut of a let down as it was fuzzy and in a forgine and our kettle did not work that is my onley conplant for the room but i have to say the brekfast was very dispointing lucky i had my own snacks over all this hotel is great for school visits to london and people not wanting to be in a lap of luxuary and not staying for very long :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: phdwsm1
Reviews.Content: When I arrives I parked my car in the underground car park but when I had parked my car and unloaded my bags I had great difficultly finding how I access the hotel from the car park, The hotel staff on reception where not very friendly but they did circle my room on the back of my room card which has a map without which properly would still be looking for my room now! When I entered the room the view from the window was across the atrium if you could see out of such a dirty window god knows when they where last cleaned. The room was very basic and not very clean, the pillow case had a hole in it and radiator looked filthy (see pictures). The bathroom was even worst with the extract grille above the bath was almost blocked with hair and dust. The bathroom floor looked like it was only cleaned in the middle of the room with the floor behind the door, toilet and sink looking dirty. The shower head had scale on it, a perfect environment for Legionella bacteria to grow. The ground floor has a pizza and Indian cafe, I decide to eat in the pizza which had few people in it but it was early evening. When I entered and asked one of the two ladies behind the counter if I could have a table I was greeted with an indignant "sit where you like and come here to order food" then they carried on with their conversation. The pizza was fine and I finished my meal and left. My room overlooked the open atrium where a lot of young people congregated in the evening with all the associated noise this continued until at least 3.30 am. I the morning I found out possibly why there where so many young people in the hotel when coaches pulled into the atrium to take them on adventure holidays as the offices for the CONTIKI travel which specialises in adventure holidays for 18-35 was in the basement of the hotel. The breakfast room was very much a cafeteria set up or more like an old army mess with piles of dry toast curling under heat lamps and tea from a machine, the cooked breakfast was made with cheapest ingredients and you had to show your room card to proof you had paid for breakfast. I certainly will not be staying at this hotel again and will advise my colleagues and our booking agents not to use this hotel in the future which is a pity as my company does have a lot of business interests in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very acceptable rooms, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Belfast29
Reviews.Content: As part of a large group, the hotel was situated in a pretty much perfect place. Less than a five minutes walk from Russel Square tube station in a relatively nice clean area of London. The rooms are en-suite with free tea and coffee waiting for you in them on arrival, which i thought personally was a lovely touch, beds are comfy if a little close together. There was no view out of the window but then suppose in London such a thing would cost a lot of money. The cleaning staff were very friendly, wishing all the group a good night and a good morning. However the down side of this hotel was certainly the staff, who seemed to forget they were being paid to make us feel welcome, they scowled as we entered, sighed loudly at us as if we were annoying them when we informed them our room key didn't work and most disappointingly they failed to stop their personal conversations with other members of staff when we needed their assistance. I would go as far to say it ruined our stay at otherwise a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: KathyIreland30
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room for myself and 2 friends for the first week-end of December 2010. The bedrooms were clean and adequate for our needs, however during the first night I had to get up to check if the window was open as I could hear people talking very clearly on the pavement 7 floors below. The window was closed so obviously the glass is only single glazed. The breakfast is set out like a huge canteen. It is self service as you would expect for such a large hotel but everything was lukewarm and inedible. We didn't even bother with breakfast on the 2nd morning and went out to Covent Garden for a proper breakfast. In all, it is a central hotel and if all you want is somewhere to put your head which is cheap this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some would have you believe”
Reviews.Author: bnmnetp
Reviews.Content: If you ignore their website and remember that you are checking in to a place with 1600 rooms where prices start at 75 pounds for single you probably won't be disappointed. Although the rooms look pretty worn and threadbare they are clean, and the shower was nice and clean with plenty of hot water. The staff that I interacted with were all very pleasant, and seemed to know exactly when I was leaving for the day, so my room was always nice and clean even if I was only out for a short time. Its a huge destination for college age travelers (especially in the summer) so you can expect some hallway noise at night. But that is nothing, compared to the street noise if you happen to be on the Russel Square side with a street view room. My advice is to request a room with a courtyard view and you will get a much quieter experience. Really, my biggest complaint is that they say you have free WiFi access. But the WiFi is very unreliable, and when it is working it is sooo slow its almost useless. After the first day I gave up and went to one of the three starbucks within walking distance, bought myself a cup of tea, and used my starbucks account. The location is great as you are across the street from the Russel Square station (on the Picadilly line) About 3 blocks from the British Museum. About 4 blocks from the British Library and Kings Cross Saint Pancras station, and Euston. If you are looking for a very inexpensive place to stay in London where you can quickly get to anywhere else this is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt stay for more than a few nights”
Reviews.Author: livinginthetropics
Reviews.Content: i stayed here before and after a contiki tour as it is the starting point for europe trips. its a good idea to stay here in this case but if i was not doing a contiki tour i wouldnt stay here. it is a noisy hotel as there are alot of young people and a pub downstairs that you can hear the noise from in the rooms several floors above. The noise goes on until about 1-2am depending on what night it is. The sheets werent clean on my bed and the rooms were quite small. The location was good as it was within walking distance to a london underground station. I would only recommend for people passing through (2 night stay max) or people on contiki tours.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: jmcurl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with a group of college students on a short term study abroad. The price did not seem that bad for where it was located. When we 1st checked it the hotel insisted we understand all the "rules" of the hotel like no making prank calls and playing with the elevators. I am 22yo so I found this very insulting. The service was absolutely horrible when I asked them to suggest a pub or restaurant near by they just mentioned the hotel bar and cafe nothing else. I had stayed in a Hotel in Berlin and they spoke more English at the Berlin hotel then this one. No WiFi in the rooms or the lobby only in the cafe across the plaza. The lobby looked nice but once I got to my room, it looked as if it had not been renovated since the 70s, I swear to god i thought the TV was older then I was. Heating in the hotel was a problem too, it was either freezing or really hot. The staff at the hotel bar were not great either, I would order a beer and they would just give it to me to get me out of the way. They would not chat me up or ask me about my stay like most pubs do in London. The one good thing I can say about this hotel is the location, but even that is not great. One last note, the morning I was set to depart I needed to remove the airline luggage tag from my suitcase. It took me 3mins for the guy to understand I wanted a pair of scissors from the front desk. He said they didn't have any and preceded to offer me a set of bolt cutters. The service at this hotel is by far the worst part.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: TheBogart
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as a large group of postgraduates on a research trip to London, and we stayed one night. Having seen some of the reviews here, I was pretty worried, especially about the cleanliness. However, it was good on that score! I went over the room and the bed obsessively looking for signs of dirt or bed bugs and there was nothing. The bedding and furniture was clean, and the bathroom was spotless. I have to give kudos to the shower as well - with 1600 rooms, the water pressure is still unbelievable! It's like a fire hose. i know it's a small thing, but if you're fed up with a dribble of tepid water being the norm in big, cheap hotels, you'll know why I think it's pretty good! You really can't knock the location either - you're walking distance from so much in the Bloomsbury area - it's fantastic. The breakfast was fine for free - stick to the cereal and avoid the coffee like the plague, but the tea is fine. Toast was cold, but jam selection was good! Nothing special, but it will do if you're not fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: posh1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for our trip to London, very central to everything and not at all like other reviews have said. It was clean& tidy and im a fussy person to please so i can asure you i wouldnt lie. We would definately use this hotel again for our next weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CompoSliema
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Royal National Hotel about 8 years running already. I never really had major complaints. The ones I had mostly were about the restaurant where the food was cold and no variety. I only had breakfast once as the eggs and beans etc were cold and unenjoyable. Not to mention the cold dry toast. I read all the reviews and usually take them with a pinch of salt. Reason is that sometimes guests blame the hotel for any small grievance they have and try giving the hotel a bad name. Giving a bad review for personal reasons is not right. But this year my wife and I were really annoyed. 1= Firstly the food problem still exists 2= while you are eating you feel like you are in a prison dining area with the waiters walking around you and they always seem to be in the way of diners. Plus they try to take your plate away before you are even finished. 3= Hate to say this but there must have been bugs in our bed as we were itching all night. This is the first time we experienced this problem. 4= Plus on the night of January 2nd at 1:30am there was what they called a fire drill. Why so late at night without a warning. People ran out in their pyjamas in the cold. The stairs were impossible to go down from the fifth floor as there were many elderly guests holding up the queue in the narrow staircase. But if it wasn't for the location of the hotel I would not recommend it. Some extra care needs to be taken care of in the hotel. I understand you only go there to sleep, wash and rest but finding bugs inb the bed just put me off. I wouldn't have believed it if we didn't experience it opurselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ako76
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the fuzz is all about.... After reading soo much bad about this hote, I almost cancelled my reservation - and I warned my friend about it, but chose to stay and glad we did! I found this hotel through a flight deal with British Airways, and thought it couldn't be so bad. And you know what? It's NOT! It is a huge hotel and one can feel a little lost and confused, but the service is good and we found everyone to be very helpful. We came early and got to put our luggage in a separate room. the check-in was a bit slow, but that was mostly due to the guy in front of us, asking a lot of strange qustions and at the same time registered all on his computer... like he couldn't do that in his room?? -Aynway, lots of people working at the desk so we were soon to our room. And the room was not to small and not to big. The bed was good, but I thought the pillow was a little too soft. But hey, it worked for me ;) But one thing: when using the shower, keep the curtain on the INSIDE of the tub... my friend kept it on the outside the first morning, and there was no drain in the floor (as we could see) so there was a lot of water on the floor, and it came out on the carpet.. so we learned our lesson. I think this has happened to many people, cause looking up in the ceiling on the bathroom one could see clear marks from water dammage. But the room itself was CLEAN and nice. It was, as several has pointed out, a bit worn and it could use perhaps some new wallpaper or paint, but it was nice and clean and just what we needed for three nights. And I have to say: 15 min walk to Oxford Street : LOVE IT :):) The downside to this was the brekfast. Stay away!! Dry dry dry buns and rolls and strange tasting jam... And what's the deal about paying extra for english breakfast? Hmm... We went to Starbucks in stead, much better. We also got help to order a taxi in the morning, and the service from the front desk was excellent. Down here I have checked for "hidden gem", because too many has trashed this hotel and I found it very nice (cause I don't need 5 stars for a shopping trip with my friends, I need a good place to sleep and drop off my shopping bags :)) and the location is just great!

Reviews.Title: “more a through-put than a guest”
Reviews.Author: HBMLeeds
Reviews.Content: If you want somewhere to lay your head that is in a relatively convenient location, then this is an OK hotel. However, it is HUGE and utterly impersonal. The corridors go on forever across 7 floors. The rooms are basic to say the least - not even a picture on the wall. Three small towels (JUST big enough to cover one's dignity) for 2 of us, only soap in the bathroom - no shower gel etc. Breakfast is a miracle of organisation to be positive - motorway caff standard at best. Avoid the sausages which most people were leaving uneaten. However, the shower was good and we were able to leave our luggage after check out to go sightseeing - 50p a bag however. Next time, we'll look for a smaller and more personal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: emmab85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a tour group and had such a good time! This hotel is a great location it is not located right in the core of london but clsoe enough to be able to jump on the tube and get around quite easily. There is a local pub around the corner called the london pub it had great food, amazing prices and a perfect way to experience a bar/pub in england. The staff at the hotel were very friendly I arrived early before check in time the person at the front desk told me that i could leave my bags there for free and they would lock them up. I was impressed the offered that as other europe hotels did not. There was also a lot of restaurants/shops in walking distances as well ast the bristish museum (which was free to enter) The hotel also offerred a lot of sight seeing options and they told you what you could do on your free time. The hotel was right across a lovely park (russell Sq). The hotel room was small but I expected that as europe seems to always have small rooms. I stayed in a one bed and a two bedroom. Both were good. Also if you are landing at heathrow you can take the tube all the way to russell sq than its about a 5 mins walk maybe less. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the WORST hotel I stayed at”
Reviews.Author: lc96
Reviews.Content: The staff there were unfriendly and rude! When I went to the room after checking in the key couldn't open the door. So, I went to the reception and asked for another key and the staff didn't believe and insisted on following me to the room and try to open the door. The room looked fine but the beds made my children itch all over and we had to request for another room. It was VERY NOISY!!! The breakfast is fine but the tea actually looks like coffee and the coffee looks like tea. When I went back to the hotel after a day of exploring London, my children's room was actually given to another guest! Thankfully there was nothing in the room... To those who are considering this hotel... DON'T EVEN THINK OF IT! IT'S THE WORST HOTEL in the whole of London!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Olivah
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the check-in was smooth, the man behind reception polite and helpful and told us where our room was etc. We got to our room, and found a leaflet saying we could order Pizza's and Panini's up to our room, which we thought was great. Rang the number to which a man with a very thick Indian accent answered, we asked to order Pizza's and were told to "Go away, he's too busy to do that" and hung up on us. We went down to Reception and asked the woman behind the desk what was up with the Pizza number to which she replied "Oh, I don't know. It's old" and threw it in the bin. Admittedly, after that she was helpful and gave us a number for a nearby Pizza shop and the address so we could go. We then went out for the evening and came back and fell asleep. The next morning, we decided to skip breakfast and the Concierge desk were very helpful with giving us directions to all the nearest Tourist Attractions. The rest of the day was uneventful, however the Restaurant on the evening wasn't the nicest so we decided to bypass this and go for the nearby Pizza Cafe yet again. The last morning of our stay, we went down for Breakfast and were asked for our "slip". Nobody had mentioned any "slip" on check-in, however we had recieved a piece of paper covered in what looked like the Terms and Conditions of the hotel. When replying we didn't know what the slip was, we were told to just go through. We got our slices of cold, cardboard-like toast and headed across to the Full English Breakfast buffet. The woman obviously working that area proceeded to shout and grunt at us and shooed us off to go sit down. As we tried to sit down, a tall Indian man who I assumed was a member of staff began saying that we can't sit where we'd sat, and tried taking our trays and moving us. I replied that I wasn't moving and to get off my tray to which he walked off and began talking to his colleagues all while pointing at us. We ate half our breakfast and left, checking out straight away. All in all this is one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Really "Cheap!"”
Reviews.Author: darren666
Reviews.Content: This is a gargantuan hotel frequentled by many foreign students. The rooms were ok - see pics. The location is good. The reception staff were good. In fact if you stay away from the restaurant and don't mind a little noise - it would all be ok. However, breakfast was the worst I have ever had. Stale, cold toast served on plastic tray. It made Butlins look 5*.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at the royal national hotel”
Reviews.Author: olivia1732
Reviews.Content: got back last night from london after 2 terrible nights at this hotel, i travelled to london with my parents and young daughter,this hotel is full of youths who did not sleep,we were continually waken by shouting,banging,alarms going off,doors being kicked because someone was locked out,singing,dancing ect.this hotel needs to be avoided at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but is a good base location for sightseeing in london”
Reviews.Author: ohhlisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend 4nights before departing on a contiki tour of Europe. If you are considering staying here before a contiki it is worth doing to avoid the hassle of checking out of another hotel then departing from Royal National anyway. It is near russel square which is a great location for sightseeing. The hotel is not luxury or glamourous in any way. It is quite busy and a bit like a youth hostel. It is great for younger travelers who are after affordable accommodation in London. The Royal National is nothing fancy but is a good base location for sightseeing in London

Reviews.Title: “I sometimes wonder what people expect”
Reviews.Author: clarets3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 3 night stay this week. I did read a lot of the reviews and have to say I was quite worried about going there but I think the moaners on here want Savoy quality at Royal National Prices so let me address the complaints people have. Check In this is a big hotel and busy all the time check in took 1 minute with plenty of staff to deal with customers Staff attitudes at no time did we ever find a member of staff that was rude and unhelful quite the opposite Rooms the room was very clean and well furnished with tea and coffee available and TV ok so it was not flat screen but who comes to London to sit in a hotel room?? Breakfast yes I would agree with most people on this choice was plentiful but due to the buffet style the English breakfast was cold and this would be the only complaint I would have Location 2 minutes from Russell Square tube could not be better There is a pub attached to the hotel which is nice for a nightcap after a long day All in all we had no problems with this hotel noise was not an issue but that may be because we were not over the main road and I would reccomend it to others at the end of the day you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: lukino6
Reviews.Content: The Royal National Hotel is a massive building that is hard to miss. Its location is excellent. The Russell Square station which is served by the Picadilly Line is just across the street, allowing a quick access to London downtown and also provides a dirent link with Heathrow Airport Terminals. Other major stations such as King's Cross, St.Pancrass and Euston are within walking distance. Post office, restaurants, pubs, drug store can all be found in the area.The check-in process might take some time due to size of the hotel and large groups of tourists that arrive constantly. Nevertheles the staff is very nice and helpful. The rooms are good, relatively big considering the London standard. Some of the rooms seem to have been recently renovated. Some basic toiletteries are provided. Flat screen TV, kettle, tea and coffee bags, hairdryer are also provided. Other items may be requested from the housekeeper or the front desk staff. The continental breakfast is included in the rate, but don't expect too much. Just toasts, eggs, cerials, tomatos and juice. English breakfast is also avaliable at an extra charge. Free wifi is avaliable in the public areas, but you may have to ask for a password at the reception. The concierge staff is very helpful and know the area well, and can arrange theatre tickets, tours, airport transfer, etc. Parking is avaliable at affordable rates. Overall this hotel is very good taken the location and price into account and I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value excellent location !”
Reviews.Author: tillyandrosie
Reviews.Content: stayed for a weekend of christmas shopping in december 2010 . my 1st impression was that it was drab exterior and could do with a lick of paint . i was plesantly suprised by the interior which was very nice. friendly helpful check in staff it only took 5 mins to check us in with no queue at all at 3pm . room was basic but very spotlessly clean. toasty warm room but the view of the back lane wasnt appealing . breakfast room was huge with school dinner like tables but breakfast was gorgeous and plentiful for 2 hungry teenagers . we ate in the indian restaurant adjoining the hotel one night and it was awful and over priced even for london. staff quite ignorant and unhelpful. woudl go back to this hotel but not the restaurant. great location and clean basic room.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Royal National - it's a youth hostle.”
Reviews.Author: apctraveller
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel. Too big. Staff is unhelpful and illequipped to handle foreign travelers. I was told via email before my trip that we could check in early. When we arrived, "no rooms available." Had to schlep our luggage accross the street to another building to be housed. Waited in line to leave luggage, waited in line to check in, waited in line for the cold toast and coffee in the morning, watied in line to check out. Waisted several hours "waiting". Room was so incredibly hot when we walked in, I immediately went to the heater to try and turn it off only to find that it is not controlled in the room. The window was open to the busy street below. When i called the front desk to ask to move to a cooler room I was told to just leave the window open as all the rooms are hot. There was a hairbrush left on the bathroom counter from the previous occupant. No ammenities in the room - no shampoo, only 1 towel. Breakfast is a joke. There were bus loads of kids coming in all hours of the night running and screaming through the halls. Wi-fi is only available at the cafe accross the street. Had to sit there to research another hotel. Checked out in the morning and moved to the Bloomsbury hotel down the street - a REAL hotel. The Royal National was kind of like the motels along rt.95 heading to Florida Spring Break that advertise on the highway billboards for $19.95 a night.

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible hotel I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Kni168
Reviews.Content: this is my first time travelled to London, but this hotel gave me the first bad impression about the city. breakfast sux, food is crappy, utensils are dirty - lip sticks mark on coffee cup and spoon!!! And they didn't let us to get a seat before queuing up for breakfast just to put down our jackets given that there were plenty of vacant seats. Porter services is ridiculous (actually it can't be addressed as services), they were rude and lazy. I will not book this hotel again next time when I go to this city.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: rleon1992
Reviews.Content: Not my favorite hotel at all but not my worst. I have travelled quite a lot. The rooms are pretty decent but they have no air conditioning. Also the corridors are extremely long! You never see the end of them. Can be a bit noisy at night if your window faces the street. The continental breakfast wasn't bad but you had to get there early or else it would be impossible to eat. Coffee was bad! I'm used to drinking excellent quality coffee.

Reviews.Title: “All good :P”
Reviews.Author: swizz83
Reviews.Content: I guess what you pay for is what you get.. I stayed there before and after my contiki tour had no problem. Can't really expect much from it aslong as it has a shower, toilet, clean sheets, fresh air its all good. Plus the location is the key, British museum, shops are near, travelex, hop on off tour buses start near the entrance, London pub, decent burgers, and free WiFi royal national nil complaints voiced. :$

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worth a gamble”
Reviews.Author: solwaydooker17
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with the review asking to "get real" with expectations. We stayed around the same time and we had a clean, quiet room ( we specified "quiet room" when we booked through Superbreak). Savings on what we normally pay in well known chain hotels went on matinee and Bill Bailey tickets, so well worth it. London hotel prices are eye wateringly high now and we visit at least once a year. This hotel is just round the corner from the British Museum, in a nice part of London. Yes, I know what one reviewer means about the foyer being reminiscent of a refugee camp and, yes, it is geared towards school groups/bus tours.It is a busy place, but despite a long queue at reception we checked in in reasonable time as they are geared up to deal with large numbers. Our twin beds reminded me of "boot camp". But really, it was OK! We were only there to sleep and have breakfast. Maybe we were lucky, but I also didn't hear mass complaints. Staff I dealt with were fine. This is not the Savoy, nor is it Guantanomo Bay. Cross your fingers and go for it if you want to pay a fair price but still enjoy my favourite city of culture.

Reviews.Title: “undrinkable tea and coffe”
Reviews.Author: nanaelaine
Reviews.Content: The rooms and location were fine but why can this hotel not provide tea and coffee that are drinkable? They must use the cheapest, poorest quality rereshments that they can source.

Reviews.Title: “let's get real - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: deecow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a train plus hotel package and I only read the reviews when we had been told which hotel we would get. I was worried! There are three things I need from a hotel. Clean sheets, good shower, decent breakfast.This hotel gave all three. This is a huge hotel in a fantastic central location. It works on economy of scale which means you can stay there cheaply.. So, firstly, the room. Fine, a triple for my husband and me. Clean sheets, tv, tea and coffee, Bathroom had seen better days but the shower was hugely powerful. No shampoo etc provided (I brought my own) There was a hairdryer. Generally clean but evidence of shoddy cleaning in those harder to reach areas, and built up grime in the overflow etc. Nothing too offputting though.Secondly, the breakfast. We went down about 8 o'clock and found seating no problem (this was a weekend) although I could see that later on it became quite bssy..I found the breakfast fantastic - they had porridge! The bacon was good quality, the toast was crisp, the coffee excellent, it really set us up for the day. I had a nice chat with the lady on duty who was lovely and she remembered us the next day! Thirdly, the noise. This hotel is in a popular and populated district which is open all hours. It is going to be noisy. As the hotel is cheap it is going to be attractive to young people who want to have a good time. I am 52 and I go to bed early, but truly, whatever noise there was did not disturb me.. Maybe we were just lucky with the room. We would stay there again.as it was really good value and a great location. If you want a bit more pampering, you could always stay in the posher hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing place...”
Reviews.Author: Panos25
Reviews.Content: Having limited choices due to late booking, we decided to spend two nights at this hotel. The rooms look a bit like boat cabins and they are as dirty as described by other visitors and even worse. It was quite impressive that from the 7th floor you could hear the road noise as if you were there! Noise was also coming from inside the hotel all the time (especially with doors banging and people chating). I can only think of the breakfast in this hotel as a bad joke!! Overall, the place is quite depressing. Difficult to believe it is a three star hotel...The location is convenient to go around the city but you can find better. The Russel Square station is old and you might need to wait long queues to catch an elevator (or go through the 170+ stairs...). My advice to London visitors is to seek for economic hotels around the Paddington area. I reckon almost all of them are better than the Royal National and even cheaper. In any case, do your best to avoid this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Massive Hotel sleeping thousands”
Reviews.Author: Janice15025
Reviews.Content: Many big tour groups stay here so it is a massive hotel and very busy but handy to London, British Museum. The breakfast was okay and military-style to cater for so many guests. It is a cold breakfast but you can pay extra for a hot breakfast, BIG BONUS-there are tea-making facilities in the rooms. First find in Europe and the UK. But no fridge..

Reviews.Title: “ok if u dont want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: muzzyanna
Reviews.Content: it is a cheap hotel room was clean. breakfast was a nightmare so busy with queues very long and they let u into a very smalll dining room compared to the size of the hotel and it was hard to find anywere to sit. i did not sleep any night i was there as there is a pub, restaurants and kareoke bar at the bottom of the hotel windows are not double glazed so you can here shouting and sirens all night.great for stag/hen parties or groups of on a night out but not good for families or people who plan on sleeping as the noise is horrendus.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but no sleep”
Reviews.Author: carley0
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for one night, the location is good, the room was good, warm, comfy beds, clean, the breakfast was very good but we had no sleep at all, the traffic noise was horrendous with no let up all night, therefore i wouldnt stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Hart1Guernsey
Reviews.Content: On our arrival the check in staff were so rude(worst i had ever come accross). They gave my sister 4 different rooms before getting it right so we wasted 2 hours tripping backwards and forwards to reception! 2 of the rooms had occupants!! My daughters room had not had the sheets changed, they were disgusting. Unfortunately she arrived late and reception/housekeeping were closed so she had to lie on towels. We complained the next day and they promised to sort it out but on our return later that day the beds had been made but still had the disgusting sheets on!!! unbelievable. When we went to pick up our luggage from the store room the concergie shouted at my Mum as she asked him where to go as the room was locked. The hotel was full of kids so the noise during the night was dreadful. i have never stayed in a place quite like it. An awful awful place where 8 of us will never ever go back to or recommend. DO NOT GO.

Reviews.Title: “The Star Category this Hotel is in is ... Misleading!”
Reviews.Author: The2ndMouse
Reviews.Content: Besides its perfect location in relation to down-town london, the airport connected Picadilly Line and the Tube in general, this Hotel is terrible. I would rate it a level above (but not higher) only if the "star" rating hotel system gave it 2 instead of 3 stars. A fact that I find hugely misleading! It might have been a 3 star Hotel years ago, bun this rating should be reviewed periodically to safeguard consumer choise accuracy! Terrible breakfast, bad odours from the lobby to the rooms, and too much noise from groups of young people using the huge premises as a youth hostel with out the hotel management being able or even trying to maintain some affordable noise standard for its remaining customers. I made the mistake and now striking this hotel out of my future options.

Reviews.Title: “OH My God - What a Disappointment !!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnGrove
Reviews.Content: British Airwats booked us into this hotel and although the price was good for London, Â£300 for 3 nights - oh my god what a place. I hasten to add not all the hotels fault, but....... It was like staying in a youth hostel or halls of residence - noisey foreign students everywhere, day and night. - mainly at night !!! The walk from the lift set the scene - dirty carpet, battered walls and doors which reflected the quality of the room. It was old and tired and every expense had been spared in its appearence. Tatty curtains and bed covers, a saggy mattress with the high point of the room being a new-ish carpet. The bathroom had mold by the shower, the water didn't drain from the wash basin and the whole bathroom and hence the whole room smelt of drains. We arrived at 13.15 and was told check-in was at 14.00. The lobby was crowded with people waiting to check-in and when 14.00 arrived there was a mass scrabble to queue, which snaked round the large lobby area. Breakfast in the Windsor Room was not a good experience. We had continental breafast included which was prunes or tinned grapefruit, cold toast and cereal - which was fine as far as it went - but what a 'bun-fight'. 15 minute wait to be seated at 8 seater tables which were dirty - then the poor food quality. I agree with many other guest, the location is excellent with good travel connections by tube, bus or taxi to all London's sights along with Heathrow and mainline stations. NEVER AGAIN will I stay in this dump of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....but go elsewhere for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: meli87
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Royal National before while I was on a trip with college it was great. Perfect for travellers and students. But when your on a cheap budget and coming down to London a few years later on a theatre break........I was not impressed! The room was clean so that was ok. Tea and coffee facilites were available in the room. One member from my party had the tea and coffee in her room but NO kettle! We went down for breakfast this morning, I payed for Full English Breakfast, I got my Nana the cereal she wanted and then I went to help myself to the bacon, eggs, sausage etc. A member of staff then asked me for my room number, so I told her and she replied that I had not paid for English Breakfast and I would have to pay Â£4.50. I told her that I had and that I had it stamped on my room card, she asked to see my room card and said 'oh ok!' I know Â£4.50 isn't a lot of money but it's the principle of the matter! Let's just say.....I WILL NOT BE STOPPING HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad really for the price. Would use again...but take earplugs”
Reviews.Author: mmd249
Reviews.Content: stayed here about 6-7 years ago and it was bad then...dirty and needing updated. I bit the bullet and tried again , mainly due to price. I was actually pleasantly surprised having read many bad reviews. The hotel i big and busy but i turned up at 11am, check in not allowed till 2pm...but they gave me a room straight away!! Check in staff in North Building were very friendly and helpful. Room was cleaner than I expected, and good enough. Although powdered European coffee was not very tasty (but I brought my own). At least they had real sachets of milk, as opposed to the powdered stuff I used to have. Bedroom was cleaned every day and if you hung the do not disturb sign on the door, the cleaning staff never bothered you. They were all friendly too. Bit annoyed that only a few irons were available for several thousand people,!!! Windows and doors are not very soundproof (massive gaps under doors) so if you want sleep then bring earplugs, which I did (a godsend seeing as how the hotel was full of drunk people who had been watching the London NFL game. The food int he pub is not exactly great. But then I got fish and chips and a pint of Guinness for less than Â£10 which is good for london so couldn't complain. Beer prices good I never attempted breakfast due to past experience and constant poor reviews, so can't comment No air conditioning, which was fine in November but must be a nightmare in summer Proximity to tube station is ideal, lots of little shops and restaurants and pubs within staggering distance and the Brunswick square shopping center just across road has restaurants and many shops (sushi, nandos, pharmacists, clothes shops etc),and Tesco metro just round corner. I'd definitely use again , and if you prepare for noise and eat elsewhere, then you cant really fault it at only Â£70 for a single room in London Oh and the shower was just great. very powerful, like a little body massage in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Make it your last choice !!”
Reviews.Author: Egyptian-Explorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 7 nights; I think the reviewersâ€™ comments covered most of the hotel conditions: very good location (but not the best) with Easy connections to Heathrow airport through the underground (Piccadilly line) or to central shopping area through the nearby buses, woeful staff (may give them some excuse for dealing with such incredible number of guests occupying more than 1600 rooms!!), therefore, you will not get the a good guest treatment or feel welcomed in this busy overcrowded hotel (The reception hall makes you feel like in an underground station, arriving and departure groups always there throughout the day!), poor breakfast if your stay is on English breakfast basis. Going to the guest rooms: average, clean enough despite the bad reviews regarding that(maybe we were lucky), having no mini-bar in most of the rooms, no hairdryer (order against deposit !!), shampoo, and shower gel (bring them with you if essential), the wash basin has two separate (cold and hot) water taps (No mixer, so, you have to use your hand to mix!!). If you will leave late and want to keep your luggage in the hotel, you have to stand in a long queue leading to the luggage room and pay 50 pence for each bag. The most important issue is the terrible sleep quality because of the continuous noise coming from the street (no wall sound insulation or double glazing for window or good accessories for room door) in addition to the noise coming from the distribution corridor either from moving or drunken guys returning very late at night, and sometimes because of the housekeeping staff shouting and moving things aggressively at the early hours in the morning. If you donâ€™t have a problem to sleep in such surroundings, try this hotel! I would go back if I have no other choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel central and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Bobby027
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights the room was very clean fresh and spacouse, we found the staff very helpful and the breakfast was a full English which set us up for the day! Reading the comments before we went I was thinking it may not be that good but believe me the hotel is very central and a fab place to stay. The prices are reasonable as well!

Reviews.Title: “If you can survive with NO SLEEP then this is the place!!!”
Reviews.Author: galloway1307
Reviews.Content: Royal National Hotel in Russel Square is in perfect location for the tourist highlights of London and their train stations. An extremely large hotel which is like a fair 24 hours a day. I have never experienced such a noisey hotel and i have stayed in alot! The room we stayed in was for 3 adults,it was a good size,fairly comfortable beds,good size bathroom but was very old and needed some repair,there was dried out damp on the entire ceiling and also some on the bath wooden panelling. Our room was situated directly over a main road which was horrendously noisy throughout the entire night, sound proof was non existant,also travellers coming and going constantly along corridors either checking in or out or just party goers returning to their rooms. I am 34 years old and was with my mother and sister so i am not an old lady complaining! Hardly any sleep was had on our two night stay which is not good when you are planning a busy sight seeing trip in London. Breakfast was nice but make sure u book the English breakfast as the Continental only consists of cornflakes and white half toasted bread! I would not recommend this Hotel. I know London is a very busy city but this Hotel was simply just chaotic and far to noisey for my liking! Royal National Hotel equals NOISE NOISE NOISE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost ideal!”
Reviews.Author: tuesday18
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend to London for my 21st birthday and as part of a package we stayed in the Royal National. Our experience of the hotel was very mixed. The location is perfect- very close to the underground and only a small walk away from the british museum etc. The staff upon checking in were polite enough- they explained where our room was. They didn't really tell us how breakfast worked but we were able to work it out. The room was pretty average- we got what we paid for and it was clean. Couldn't complain! It's ideal if you are going to be out and about all day and are just looking for a place to sleep at a cheap price. However, upon returning from our second day in London from the theatre (so lateish) we discovered a black bag full of rubbish had been left in our room, presumably by the cleaners. We were so tired we just left it and it had gone the next day. One thing that made the whole experience a bit less enjoyable was the way in which we were often spoken to by staff. On one occasion, me and my friend were walking down to breakfast and simply walking through the hall. There had been some kid of spillage and there was a yellow sign indicating this. The hallway was narrow so we did our best to avoid the spill. The member of staff however, shouted at us very rudely for walking over it. I work in a hotel and I have never once felt it would be even a little bit acceptable to shout in a customer's face. On a more positive note- some of the staff were more friendly and perhaps this was just an isolated incident. I would probably stay there again as it is hard to find such a cheap hotel in London!

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel(bed bugs no extra charge!!) only good thing was its location.”
Reviews.Author: Josie14968
Reviews.Content: We thought the location was great but unfortunately you have to compromise with the standards in the hotel. The room needed a good clean and was not too inviting, the bathroom had seen much better days and was bodged up with silicone, had damp, and a grubby bath panel. Nothing could have prepared us for the sight the next morning when we got out of our beds,,,,There were bugs crawling in the beds, like little ladybirds. We were absolutely mortified and so you would think the staff would be, think again.No apology whatsoever just another door key for another room!! This was on another floor and the standard was no different to the first room. consequently we stayed on top of the bed and bought our own fleecy blankets, just in case. we used the pizza restaurant which seemed nice and clean....at first. we found 2 hairs in one pizza, we complained and they never even apologised either.just avoided us.Really bad customer service.Definately steer clear of this one.

Reviews.Title: “OK in an emergency...central and cheap but not for families”
Reviews.Author: loulouham
Reviews.Content: Just had 2 nights in this hotel when we had to stay in London at very short notice with extended family and no vacancies anywhere. In the circumstances it served it's purpose, very central and incredibly cheap at Â£80 for a double with 'full English breakfast' (more of which later). Walking into huge crowded reception area is daunting, massive queues of young noisy tourists but staff efficient and obviously used to dealing with huge volumes of guests. Rooms very tired, pillows completely flat, towels thin & scratchy and room overall very dusty. Very noisy at night as hotel built around central squares which cause the drunken screaming and laughing of guests to echo endlessly around the walls. Plus tour buses arriving all night and reversing alarms beep beeping added to general racket. Breakfast was horrific...'full English' was rock hard fried eggs which had a green tinge (honestly), a massive bowl of sloppy cooked tomatoes, cheap beans and half cooked bacon. Continental was worse...white floppy cold toast, dusty cereal, no muffins or pastries or anything you would normally find. Restaurant absolutely packed and chaotic with staff herding more and more guests into the room when there were clearly no tables. Overall, DO NOT book this hotel for a romantic break or if you have young children or elderly relatives. It is more like a young travellers hostel. Plus points are price and location, negatives are everything else!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: lglover80
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Ad we were a little worried about this hotel. The Royal National is a massive hotel that is well maintained and perfect for accessing all the brilliance London has to offer....one stop from King's Cross...one stop from Covent Garden...perfect! Breakfast is basic and can be busy but perfectly edible! I have stayed in some very good hotels and would not describe this as plush or fancy, but it is perfect for a city break! I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient to see London if a hotel doesn't matter at all to you”
Reviews.Author: iloveit123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. As I said in my title, this place is sufficient if you want to see London and lay your head down to sleep. And at least each room has its own bathroom. But the perks stop there. First of all, the WIFI has been down for months and they don't know when it will be back. It irks me to no end when a feature is promised and it isn't available. And they have catches on other amenities too - you want a hair dryer? 20 pound deposit. I need that money to spend, not put into some deposit. You want to iron your clothes? Walk to the ghetto room where irons are, you don't get your own. This feature feels like a hostel, and i didn't pay enough attention to the iron which had something burned onto it, and it ruined my shirt. Like I said, ghetto. They tell you they have a gym - not really, it's a gym up the street, not in the hotel, and a day pass costs 10 pounds. So like i said, they tell you they have amenities, but everything has a catch. And lastly, get up early because this is the loudest hotel I have ever been in my life - and not because of the guests! The cleaning staff sound like they are kicking the crap out of the rooms! I know most people get up at the crack of dawn, but when i am on vacation, i like to take it easy some days, sleep in when i can. Bring ear plugs and brace your for your room to start shaking when they begin cleaning at 7:30 AM. Anyway, I still recommend this place as a sufficient hotel to see London, but for just that. Not the hotel itself. It's one step up from a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE! it will ruin your vist to london”
Reviews.Author: starkzz
Reviews.Content: I went to London This week on a one night stay with university, we stayed at the Royal National Hotel and I have to say it is disgraceful! it should not even be open with the problems they have! first of all the staff! the staff have to be the most rude people I have ever met they don't care about the customers at all, none of them are English either so I couldn't really understand them :/ , then we get to the rooms...... oh the rooms they are filthy!
