I very much doubt that the carpets have EVER been hovered and there are stains everywhere! the bath actually had pubic hairs in it! and the beds I also doubt they have been washed my friend had stains all over one of the sheets and all this is still after we asked them to clean it again, we had an all inclusive breakfast with our stay and after all this we were actually looking forward to a nice hot breakfast but no.... we get there and you have a bowl of OLD cereal with sour milk and then what I was guessing must of been toast but in reality was COLD soggy bread..... I strongly recommend you do not go here I believe you have wasted my money so don't waste yours, thanks

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms cleaned daily. Ignore bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: sanew
Reviews.Content: Read bad reviews before we went but hotel was clean, staff were friendly and it was very good value for money. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “try out this gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigted2879
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have just returned from a 3 night stay at the royal national and we were treated very well and very politely by the very helpful staff. our room was spotless, the breakfast was very good and very plentiful. dont be put off by the whingers who complain for the sake of it ! for such a large hotel it was run very well with plenty of staff on duty if and when you needed them. will definitely be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WHAT I EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: scotland24Scotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my friend and our 2 teenage daughters. The hotel is in a good location very near to the tube stations. When we arrived i had to payÂ£3.95 each day for my daughters breakfast and so did my friend, the breakfast menu wasn't that good as the toast was cold and hardly toasted. Some mornings it was very busy and u had to wait for ages to get a table. Room was very noisy as we were right at the front of the hotel, the first night my daughter and I couldn't sleep as all you heard was traffic outside ( no double glazing) and people shouting and singing in the corridors at about 3 in the morning. My daughter and my friends daughter were very annoyed at the fact there was no wi fi in the hotel, that they could use to get on the internet, this was because the hotel didnt pay there bills for wi fi. Luckly there were computers that you could go no Â£1 for 15 minutes. Overall the staff were very kind and helpful and the hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Most unhelpfull hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Galway_Girl17
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister stayed here for one night.We left in our bags and came back later to check in.We noticed that there was no staff at either desk that cuold understand us.None off the staff were good at speaking english.They were very rude unpleasent unhelpful and ignorant at times.I asked where they would recommend to eat and where the cocktail bar was that was advertised? They said that they just call their bar a cocktail bar eventhough they dont serve cocktails.I never heard such rubbish in all my stays at hotels.Oh and heres the best one ever I was accused by a very ignorant man called Dan (prob wasnt even his real name) working behind the desk of not been able to speak english. HaHa im from Ireland HELLO. The location was good,the room was grand.What we expected for the price.One word of advise to the hotel they should maybe consider working alot on customer service and also employee workers that can actually speak and understand english.

Reviews.Title: “fab location,good hotel, ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: cuba-1st-timers
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights friday-monday, hotel is huge but easy to find your way around. we arrived at 12pm and couldnt check in until 2pm so we just went sight seeing around london and left out bags in the baggabe room (which is free) and there is a porter there all the time to make sure there safe. russell square tube is 5 mins walk from hotel and on the picadilly line so its fab for getting everywhere u need. checked back in at hotel about 4pm and took 4 mins. i had booked a twin as there were no doubles to book but emailed hotel a few days before to see if i could have a double, and we got one! the room was on the north side, level 4 and the room was clean,bed was clean,bathroom clean so no complaints. breakfast is busy if you go between 8.30-9.30 but we only waited 10-15 mins to get a table and the food was always hot. plenty to chose from and i dont see what people moan about. there is a pizza place and pub at hotel. bar prices were ok for a london hotel about Â£2.70 pint! there are alot of bus trips that use the hotel as an overnight stay before people fly out but didnt bother us as we were not in london to stay in the hotel, just to sleep and change. i would recommend this hotel if you want a fab location and a clean room, its not the Ritz and the price reflects this but as they say you get wot u pay for and we were happy with everything.

Reviews.Title: “The Smith Family”
Reviews.Author: qdeal
Reviews.Content: Our room was not only dirty it was grimy and I have the video's and pictures to prove it, when I complained I was offerd Â£50 compensasion from the agent of the hotel which was refused by me and my family, the windows opened fully with no restrictions and some one had writen clean me in the dirty walls. we were told you get what you pay for by the agent. we have stoped in a lot of Hotels in london on short breaks for arround the same cost and at least they were basic but clean with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy disgusting room where i caught scabies.”
Reviews.Author: kentmac
Reviews.Content: I arrived late in the evening without a booking & got a single room at around 9pm.On 1st inspection of the room i noticed the stains on the bed covers & wanted to go back down to the reception & check out but it was late & i was tired.There were 2 single beds in the room & both had like a plastic type cover under the sheets.I had a pretty ordinary sleep & then was greeted to the victoria room where the breakfast(included with the room) was served.There was a long queue & i got in line like a sheep & had one look at the food & decided to just have a cup of coffee,which tasted like an ashtray of cigarette butts. My complaint is not about the breakfast,but the aftenoon after leaving this dump i started to itch all over & soon developed small lumps all over my body.The next day i seen a Dr who informed me that i had scabies.So after paying $124 AUD for the room i have now spent $150 on Dr fees & treatment.I am 100% sure i picked this up at this hotel as it was the only hotel i stayed at during my week long visit as i was staying with family the rest of the time.I would not wish this experience on anybody & it is a very scarey thought that this is such a huge hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: BG
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for the price. We found it to be very clean, the room was very clean and well set out. It was a bit noisy at times but it is smack dab in the middle of London and with all cities, you get a lot of traffic and you could always ask for a quiet room. The English Breakfast was part of our package and was really good and there was plenty of choice. As you leave the hotel, cross the road and at the bottom of the street opposite there is an Irish Bar, Callaghans, which is reasonably priced and the food was good with a good selection to choose from. We have statyed at this hotel before and will use it again. The location is ideal for getting around London as the tube station is two minutes away but if you prefer to walk, just turn right out of the hotel and walk to the bottom of the road and you will end up in the Covent Garden area. Beside the hotel there is an Asian buffet Resaurant, not cheap but the food is very good.

Reviews.Title: “great inexpensive safe accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: suebLondonCanada
Reviews.Content: Am currently at this hotel and staying 5 nites= stayed here about 12 years ago and it is MUCH IMPROVED- I have a small single room (reminds me of my student residence) but it is very clean, has great storage, flat screen t.v. and a very large tub as well as shower. Breakfast is basic (toast, fresh rolls, fruit, cereal and good coffee) but is filling, good quality and the line moves fast. Has a window seat this morning in therestaurant and had a chance to eat and read the paper with my coffee. The tube station is very close, and it is an easy walk to ,many stores and restaurants. I also have a room on the top floor which may make a difference with noise- staff have been helpful - remember to bring faceclothes but otherwise if you would rather spend your money being a tourist than on accomodations I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: LongDistanceClara99
Reviews.Content: Was staying at this hotel for 3 nights with my friend. We were really dreading staying here and contempated changing hotels after reading the reviews. Check in was a breeze and took only 10 mins and our request for a "quiet" room was met without any fuss. The room was dated but clean. The remote for the TV didn't work but room was small enough that it wasnt a vast distance to change channel!. The room was basic but carpets were clean, bathroom was clean and although beds were "lumpy" they were ok for 3 nights. Only tried the breakfast on our first morning and found it very basic but found excellent cafe in russell Sq who serve great breakfasts with a great view of the fountains in the sq. The location is perfect for the tube and even walking into the city (if your feeling energetic). Overall, the hotel wasn't as bad as I had imagined it was going to be. Unsure what the other rooms were like but we were on the 6th floor and it was quiet and a good base for visiting London.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebar78
Reviews.Content: Toilet dirty! Noisy - no double glazing One Small bar for 1600 room hotel!! Breakfast like a cattle market Simply dreadful

Reviews.Title: “Poor poor poor. 1970's concrete carpark design with peeling wallpaper and worn carpet”
Reviews.Author: lynwoodCarpentry
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in desperate need of updating along with it's staff. Luckily i only had to stay there 1 night. 1970's concrete carpark design with peeling wallpaper and worn carpet. reception was so busy with only 3 staff memebers on it took me 35 mins to queue at check-in. I had called ahead booked and left card details however when i finally got to the Check-in i was supprised to see that none of my details had been added to the screen apart from that ref number which meant i had to stand at check in and write out everything by hand. This appeared to be their method of check in as everyone had to do the same, Again outdated slow method. Lifts were small which is a concern when you struggle to fit 4 people and their cases in, corridors long, with a blandness which seemed to drag out the dread of getting to the small room. Room was hot, window only opened an inch or two and as an extra kick in balls it opened onto the court yard which was noisy both late into the night and from about 6am. will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful and friendly staff, clean room with good shower,plenty of food choice and bars.”
Reviews.Author: honeybeeBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We found staff very helpful, you can book in cases for 50p before and after night of stay, within easy walking distance of british museum. Lots of tours you can book and ticket office at hotel got us 4 tickets 5 rows back in the stalls for we will rock you( theatre was packed) at a great prize. If you are looking for plush luxury this it ain't! but good 3 star and well run for a hotel catering for 2,000 guests.Food in the london pub opposite basic, but good quality burger and did lovely salad at our request. Open top bus ride from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: spoutnik8
Reviews.Content: Be aware this hotel is probably the worst I have seen. It is ugly, dirty and noisy. I don't understand how it can be considered a 3-star hotel. To me it looks like a hostel, rather than a hotel (I actually had better hostel than the Royal National). Also, be aware if you are a couple they only have 30 rooms with double beds on the many hundreds they have. The staff is unhelpful. We ask if there was a internet access point and they refered to the lobby of the hotel next door. You are better paying a bit more an stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_lou73
Reviews.Content: We were dreading our stay after reading some of the reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was small, the toilet and bathroom were very clean (I get the feeling we were lucky!) and the beds were clean and comfortable. The only downside was that our room overlooked the courtyard and it was noisy very early in the morning and late into the evening - coaches arriving/departing, taxis and drinkers in the pub opposite. Breakfast isn't the best we've ever had, but considering the high volume of people passing through the restaurant it was fine. The english fry up kept us going well past lunchtime, but the toast tends to be cold. You can't expect 5* surroundings when you're paying 2/3* London prices.

Reviews.Title: “dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie190744
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as it was near to where we needed to be for an award we attended, I certainly do not expect to stay there again, I found urine and hair on the loo seat the bathroom floor was dirty, but I did not complain as the reception was heaving with tourists and the reception people were unfriendly and were unconcerned with most complaints as I heard them receive many as I waited for my room details.It was impossible to sleep no air con and the room was stuffy, when the window was open the fumes from traffic came in and the road nose was very loud as there was a large dent in the road outside that heavy vehicles bounced across all night,No nets at windows and right opposite a large office.Cooked Breakfast was extra to pay and the room was cluttered with unclean tables.The coffee was distgusting cheap stuff, grapefruit inedible.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: philthepoacher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 21 to 23 Sept 2010. We found the location great no far from anything really.Steak night at wetherspoons just down the road tuesday night 2 steak meals ect and a nice bottle of wine Â£15 99. Our room was fine clean and very quiet, we asked for a high floor and a quiet room(which we got) always cleaned very well for when we got back from our trips. The breakfast(full english included in the price of our room) was bacon, eggs(fried or scrambled) sausages, tomatoes, beans toast, jams, cereals. ok the toast was nothing to shout home about, but if it was not done like it was you would be queing up for hours. We found the staff very helpful and pleasant despite the different nationalities. Try staying in London for this price and this location you will be hard pushed. we have stayed in London before at the Hilton Olympia and the noise was was really bad and we had to change rooms three times. Just a couple of tips book your theatre tickets with the relevant box office and use your buy one get one free tokens fron tesco on london eye and the aquarium Philip. Lincolnshire

Reviews.Title: “good hotel bad position”
Reviews.Author: janetdono
Reviews.Content: stayed here sat. night and bedroom overlooked the quadrangle where people seemed to sit and drink until 3am plus so didnt get much sleep. If you book a triple room beware that one of the beds is only a 2ft 6in one so you dont need to be big to sleep on it. breakfast was fine and the hotel itself was fine just the position of the rooms. Very nice park just round the corner where you can get very good food at a very good price.Wouldnt stay at this one again but probably one of their other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing thats good about hotel is location”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBenp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge and with that the service and cleanliness suffer. Our room was not cleaned properly on both nights. At the end of the stay I pulled the bed away and found socks which were not ours, they looked liked they had been there a while, the only thing, the bathroom at surface dirt as well on both days. Although we reequested a double bed, we were told there was not one, they said there were only 40 double bedroom in place with over 5,000 rooms. The continental Breakfast was rubbish, it was toast or bread rolls, and a choice of 3 cereals, accompanied by disgusting apple juice or tap water. The only good thing about the hotel is its location, which is minutes from all london attractions by tube

Reviews.Title: “no where near as bad”
Reviews.Author: fatboyslim
Reviews.Content: On reading previous reviews I was terrified to go but when I got there I was pleasantly surprised. I got into the room (2011) . It was a good size for my purpose (2nights) . the breakfast was very good. The bar prices was excellent for central London (Â£3 for Lager). Perhaps we were lucky but there was not a greate deal of noise. The only dissappointment was when we got home we had to take a Belfast city airport taxi and was surprised to find the price they charged was dearer than London taxis. I travelled 5.1 miles with no traffic jams and it cost Â£13 but in london I travelled 5.4 miles for the same price

Reviews.Title: “Awful awful awful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: AOrd
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed in the Royal National Hotel from Tuesday 7th September till Thursday 9th September. On the Wednesday of our stay me and my partner left our hotel room at 8.30am for breakfast, before leaving however I moved our personal belongings and put them in the bedside table, all except a silver diamond ring which was left on the dressing table beside the television. Within the time we had been down to breakfast the housekeepers had been to our room and tidied our bedding and towels, however upon arrival of our hotel room I noticed that my ring had disappeared. I immediately reported it to reception who told me to speak to the housekeeping office on the first floor. When speaking to a lady within the office I simply asked if any of the housekeepers had came across the ring or if there was a possibility that it could have been knocked off the table into the rubbish or something along those lines. The lady assured me she would be in touch, within 5 minutes of being back at my room another housekeeper opened my door without knocking and began asking what the problem was, she then disappeared out of the room and re-entered with a blonde lady who began to be very rude and abrupt with me and my partner that she had not even cleaned or been in my room yet, however this was not true as our bedding had quite noticebly been re-arranged and our towels and cups had been put back into its original place. The blonde lady then began pulling beds around and shouting at us that she had not touched my ring. This lady's attitude was as though I had accused her of stealing my ring when this simply was not the case, however after her reaction and rudeness I am beginning to think this was not the case. Once this lady had left my room and me and my partner were alone I was shocked and upset at how she had treated me and how she had spoken to us both, aswell as pulling all of our furniture from the walls in a sort of tantrum. After leaving this hotel i still have not received any explanation or consolation for my ring nor did anyone appear to take any interest in the matter, although this would seem impossible since none of the staff appeared to speak english very well or took any interest in being nice or polite to its guest. SERIOUS LACK OF CUSTOMER SERVICE!! The bedrooms were unclean as I often found other peoples toenails, hair & rubbish on the floors. The shower curtain smelt like stale urine and there was no comfort or homeliness within this hotel. Dining was no better either as the dining area was like that of a school canteen serving cold food and stale "toast" (slightly warmed bread). AVOID AT ALL COSTS! you would be more comfortable and your belongings would be safer sleeping on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Descent for Pre Contiki Tour”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtravelers037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal National for 2 nights in August 2010 before our Contiki Tour. The hotel is HUGE! and Busy!! This is where the Contiki Basement is, and where the passengers get picked up for all Conitki Tours as well as others, so there's always lots of coaches around in the mornings and sometimes at night. Our room was descent. We had 2 beds on opposite sides of the room, I was traveling with my boyfriend so this kind of sucked but we survived. The room was small but that's to be expected in Europe. The Bathroom: The shower sucked! It had lots of pressure, thats for sure. They have a couple bars of soap and 2 towels and thats it... no stealing the shampoo to take home. The lobby was not to terribly busy when we showed up around 3 pm. We got checked in and headed up the tiny elevators to our room. We had a tour booked, and the tour company advised us that we could get the concierge to call them to confirm the pick up time. Well they wouldn't do it because we didn't book the tour through them. They also wouldn't let me use their phone to call them. I found them quite rude as well. There are a couple restaurants around the hotel. One is Blooms Pizza which is in the courtyard.... We ate there for supper one night and had a pizza. It was ok... nothing special. There is also a restaurant right in the hotel which has a buffet supper and this is also where you have your continental breakfast. For breakfast you can have cereal, oranges (cut up segments) or toast, that is cold by the time you get it (its pre toasted) and juice, milk, water, coffee, tea etc. There is also a hot breakfast section which is an additional $4 pounds I belive. It had the basics... It didn't look real great, so we never got it. There were also lots of little restaurants and pubs down the street either way from the hotel. There is a post office just down the street and the Russel Square Tube Station is only a short walk (not even 5 minutes) from the hotel. Right across the street from the Russel Square Tube Station is a Tesco store... Go there and pick up all your snacks and bottled water! We got the 1.5 L bottles of water for $0.35 pence. A great idea if your doing a motor coach tour as normally your first stop isn't for about 2 1/2 hours until you get to Dover. They also have pastries, dougnuts, muffins, salads and tons of snack foods, alcohol etc. All in all, the rooms were clean and we had no major complaints. If your travelling with Conitki, I thought the rooms at the Imperial Hotel were nicer though... And they will pick you up with the Coach from the Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JoJo198150
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 weekends this year (19 Feb - 21 Feb) and (13 Aug - 15 Aug). This hotel is in a very good location, just 10 - 15 minutes walk from Kings Cross Train Station and conveniently located across the road from Russell Square Tube Station. The rooms are clean and comfortable, although they are in need of updating as are rather old fashioned. However I think it is worth it for the reasonable price you pay for the central location of the hotel and this also included full english breakfast. If eating breakfast I would recommend getting there no later than 8.30am as it gets very busy after this time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Bathroom, very hot water, clean bed”
Reviews.Author: Nurse51brigg
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a Theatre break for two nights and the price of the hotel included Royal Dress Circle tickets for Grease. The hotel not far from St Pancras where we arrived. Central for most attractions in central london, all of a walkable distance. If you chose to go by tube Russell Square literally over the road. If you cannot walk stairs 175 of them and you dont like lifts go to another tube station. We had a peaceful location in the north building over looking a central roof. No traffic noise. But there was music somewhere in the distance. I am hard of hearing so it didnt effect me. We were only in the hotel to go to sleep not to look at the sights from a hotel window.! The water was hot at all times, the shower was almost a power shower. the rooms were clean , bed linen changed both days. We had the full english breakfast and which was lovely. Toast goes a bit soft in bulk but edible. I would have been happy with the continental breakfast also had the package included it. You pays your money and takes your choice.There were a lot of students there but had no problems with them. I wouldnt hesitate in going back. For a cheap weekend break or even mid week the hotel was in an ideal central location. I have traveled all over the world which includes New Zealand Australia and Canada, and stayed in far better hotels and some worse London is probably the biggest rip off capital in the world but my friend and I had a great weekend. I am a londoner now moved away so I know the pitfalls,pleasantly surprised that there are some very good eating places for a budget family. Got caught out twice, had a can of coke in a cafe near Convent garden which cost me Â£1.50. and the drinks in the Theatre was exorbitant. . .

Reviews.Title: “Royal National Hostel more like”
Reviews.Author: jesseliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night in London and the night before our tour, which left from right outside. In this sense it was easy to find and well located. However, the quality of the rooms is terrible. We had a triple and they were all small, uncomfortable beds with ancient linen. Having said that it was relatively clean. I personally feel calling this a hotel is pushing it and I thought the price was far far too high. If you have a tour leaving from here it is the logical place to stay, but don't stay longer than you have to - there are cheaper, nicer places to stay in london but yes, they are hard to find!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, good location and price”
Reviews.Author: NYC7777777
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, good location and price. Russel square tube station and British museum are close. Beds could be better/firmer. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “cheap , clean and central”
Reviews.Author: butzie
Reviews.Content: We booked our tip through Superbreaks and included rail travel , we got this cheap so to be honest were expecting nothing more than what we got ,The hotel is huge and impersonal but its very central , walking distance to Oxford Street and British museum and across road from Russell Street tube station . This made life easier with children as never had to walk too far and there is a Tesco express across road for anything we needed like that bottle of wine at end of a long day , The hotel is basic but whats important is it was clean and felt safe area to walk at night with the children , The breakfast was canteen style , serve yourself , again basic but organised and the waiters were always cleaning and ready with a smile . It is a great base but nothing more , the family rooms are very small , we were never disturbed by other guests but with traffic noise and police sirens are frequent at night , but it is central london . We had a fabulous trip over three days , and now we know london better would stay elsewhere but this was a good enough first base just dont expect luxury

Reviews.Title: “Ideal central location for visiting London”
Reviews.Author: TravellersTyne_Wear
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a deal for Â£119 each on a 2 night break to London. found the hotel no problem just around the corner from Russell Squre Tube station. Got there for 12.00pm and although could not check in till after 2pm hotel were very good in showing us where we could leave our bags and check in later. Went out and done some sight seeing, came back to hotel at 6.30pm and checked in with no problems. Travel agent had originally booked us a twin room but on request we were given a double without any hassle. Room was adequate, clean and tidy. (I know some have wrote bad reviews about the hotel rooms but for the price you certainly could'nt complain). Breakfast was good and English breakfast was very adequate with no complaints. All staff at hotel were extremely friendly and the staff at the consierge desk were great at pointing you in the right direction. All in all a great hotel for exploration of all the London sights and a great service from the staff there. Will definately be going back to stay here soon.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: supermickey78
Reviews.Content: Booked the trip through Travel Agent for a 3 day stay. Was told that it was near covent garden and that you could see it from the hotel, if you was superman maybe. I work in an office everyday and while I was staying in the hotel I opened my curtain to overlook offices, really relaxing. After checking in at 2pm I had to get room service to come and change the sheets on 2 beds as there were holes in them, oh and don't move too much in bed as they move around the room. The hotel provided you with soap, hand & bath towel but no face cloth so ensure that you take this with you. I found the staff very unhelpful, when I came to check out they didn't ask about the stay, they asked for door keys (which didn't work) and that was it. You have to pay 50p per item to leave at the hotel until you pick them up later in the day. If you like to be in a cattle market when having breakfast than this is the hotel for you, no one seems to know where to go or sit so by the time you have gotten breakfast it is cold. Just outside the hotel is the Big Bus Company, they say hop on and hop off at your leisure at Â£26 per person for 24 hours, but remember that the buses stop at 7pm if you are lucky, so if you miss the last bus you have to take a taxi which is very expensive, but faster. If you are staying for business and need a place to rest your head then this hotel is for you, but if you are going for longer wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as feared!!”
Reviews.Author: andyfox1628
Reviews.Content: Having booked online and then checked the reviews (I will learn) I was horrified to read some of the reviews which caused great amusement to my sister and Niece as I had not informed my partner of the hotel we were staying at and they were imagining her reaction!!!! Yes it is a huge hotel and check in took 15 mins in the queue. breakfast is chaotic and was described in aother review as similar to a Youth Hostel which is a very good comparison. However the rooms were quiet and tidy albeit basic. We did not spend much time in the hotel as we came to London to visit, not sit in a hotel room. It is idelly based, situated 2 mins walk from Russell Square on the Picadilly Line. This hotel is budget and feels as such, but if you are wanting a basic cheap hotel then it fits the bill

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan014
Reviews.Content: Went for a short break for two nights, checked in at 14.00pm to find our room hadnt been cleaned even though they checked us in and gave us our key card! Room was clean and comfortable, bathrooms clean but rather basic! Our room was facing inner square which looked down onto pub beer garden, we thought noise would stop after pub closed but it continued until after 2.00am, this was both nights! Breakfast was fine, basic amenities but satisfactory. Ideal location to visit London very near the tube station. Hotel is ideal for young travellers, backpackers paradise, not suitable for families or older couples, or really anyone wanting a quiet break.

Reviews.Title: “Basic But We Got What We Paid For”
Reviews.Author: cavogreco
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Superbreaks and didn't have any complaints for the price we'd paid. We arrived at the hotel just before 1pm and expected to leave our bags and then return later to get our room. On being served at the desk, however, we were given the key to our room even though the booking said check in from 2pm. The room wasn't huge but there was space to walk around without bumping into furniture. Again the bathroom wasn't large but perfectly serviceable. The rooms were clean and tidy with basic but serviceable furniture. My only complaint was that there was only enough milk for two hot drinks. I did request more from the desk and the staff happily handed me an adequate supply. Lesson : if you don't ask, you don't get. Our room was on the road side but wasn't particularly noisy. I'm the sort who always has some ear plugs just in case but they really weren't needed. Breakfasts were self service for the continental breakfast but there was an additional area for English breakfast (Superbreak include this in the price). The food is hardly haute cuisine but is perfectly edible and we had enough to fuel us for our sightseeing. We found all of the staff we dealt with very friendly and helpful. Everyone gave an appropriate greeting for the time of day and seemed to value guests. We selected the hotel for its location and from this point of view you can't get better. It's just round the corner from Russell Square tube station. One stop from Kings Cross and on a direct line to Leicester Square and Covent Garden. A tip is to use the card only machines. You may find large queues for the cash machines at busy periods but we managed tickets from the card machines in a couple of minutes. Whatever you do - take the lift up from the platform. Don't attempt the stairs. The steps to the top of St Pauls cathedral seemed easier than those at Russell Square!

Reviews.Title: “Industry of rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MariaPulp
Reviews.Content: Huge, impersonal, basic service. Great location, almost next to the Russell Sq tube station. It was very noisy! The room was relatively clean, but overall the hotel is rather old. We stayed there for two nights. The fire alarm set off during the first night and all the guests had to go out in the street in the middle of the night. There was no one to inform us or help us, and I mention this because the hotel is like a maze! You need a map to get to your room! We spent several minutes to reach the fire escape. No information was given after the incident, like nothing had happened and of course no apologies. Breakfast was too simple, and you had to pay extra for anything complementary like fried eggs for example...The staff is usually tired, and not very polite if I may add. Since we had some time on our hands in the day of the departure, we decided to leave our baggage to the hotel and return later to get them in order to go to the airport. However, it was a big trouble finding them among the other ones, mainly because the employee who took them, had mislabled them (when we left the suitcases, he was talking to some other guests, in Spanish, not paying much attention to us obviously). So, we had to prove the suitcases were ours by opening their locks... Anyway, next time we should save some extra money for the hotel, because London is a citty worth visiting!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: FussyBum67
Reviews.Content: Read reviews and was dreading our stay! Got a 'superbreak' deal through Thomas Cook and then wondered what I was letting us in for! Having said that, perhaps we were luckier than some who have reviewed here. Check in is 2pm so we put luggage in for storage at 11am (no charge, fairly big but quick moving queue) and went on the tourist round. Checked in at 5pm with no queues and no problems. Told a double room on booking but got a twin. Pleasantly surprised though considering most reviews, very, very small. OK that might have driven me mad had I been there longer than two nights but for a base to sleep, given the price, and somewhere to freshen up during the day, it was fine. I think it struggles for 3* rating on room furnishing but is a little better than 2*. Our room seemed to have new-ish carpets/curtains etc. but being very fussy, found bedding, room and bathroom/towels to be acceptably clean. Some reviews complain about the noise, we were way up on 7th floor in the North block overlooking a main road and not the square, so whether that makes a difference? I am usually a light sleeper but found I slept quite well - there is a continual hum of traffic (it is London!) and occasionally heard the throng of partying groups but nothing that was excessive. (My ear plugs remained unused!) Didn't find reports of staff being rude to be true, staff throughout were, although busy, courteous if you needed help/ had a query. The breakfast room does advertise Â£4.50 for an English breakfast. A voucher is issued on check-in, this is needed for entry to the breakfast room and is checked again if going for the self-service English breakfast once in there. Not sure how the pricing works as ours was included in original booking price. But there is also self-service Continental breakfast. We had the English - again I'm fairly easily put off but I'd describe it as 'far from lovingly cooked but surprisingly edible' as a morning energy boost at least! Royal National is in an excellent location, there is Russell Square underground just around the corner and Covent Garden / Leicester Square is a leisurely stroll too if you prefer the walk. We even walked from/to Kings Cross in less than 15 mins on arrival & departure. There is a London Pub (serves meals 'til 10pm but didn't try 'em) and a Blooms pizza place (limited menu but pizza was tasty!) which we found value for money, right on the hotel complex. In a nutshell, not as bad as I have read previously. If I was staying more than a couple of nights I might want something a little less basic but all in all, no grumbles for what we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Once again - ideal!”
Reviews.Author: geordieontour
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel a few times now - but it was 5yrs since my last visit. I went as part of a hen do - think we were the only hen party in the hotel (which given it's size is quite a statement!). There's lots of groups staying at the hotel but it's not noisy or rowdy at all. The rooms each of us had were clean and comfortable. Don't expect 5 star touches like all the toiletries you need etc because it's not 5*. I think it's rated as a 2* but don't be put off by the rating. It certainly does the job. Brilliant location. Breakfast was ample with plenty of choice. I will most certainly be going back for a 5th time!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Tongie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 13.15 and got checked in straight away,rooms were clean and cleaned each day.Breakfast were excellent,help yourself,i loved it,plenty of sausage,bacon,egg and beans there are other things beside.Location was great London eye,Big Ben,Buckingham Palace and Trafalger Square all with-in 30 walk mins of hotel.Evening meals were not much good but plenty of places all over you can't go wrong for food.Bedtime can be quite noisy up until about midnight but it is to be expected in the middle of the city.Travel,if you get of at euston it is about 5 min walk to the Hotel.We went to watch Lion King at the Lyceon Theatre WOW what a show.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: moletrappa
Reviews.Content: I stopped with my partner and our children aged 12 and 8 for 2 nights, and another family with children of similar age. We nearly cancelled due to reading terrible reviews but decided against it in the end. The hotel is fine if you are not expecting anything fancy. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is fine, the bar is fine and shuts at 1am. When we asked if we could leave our suitcases for a few hours on our last day they stored them for us for 50p an item which was ok by us. I think the fundamental problem is a.) there are hundreds and hundreds of rooms in this place which means possible queues for breakfast, and also limited seats in their bar when you come back on a night. b.) It seems to be advertised as a high quality hotel, which it isnt. Its a run of the mill hotel and several people seemed dissapointed with it not being all posh and fancy. If your wanting the ritz then book the ritz and have fun, but if your wanting a cheap, clean room over your head and a breakfast where you can eat to your fill but might have to share your table with a stranger then the royal national is fine.

Reviews.Title: “REFUGEE CAMP !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ron2tall
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and it really is the worst hotel ive ever stayed at. You have that gut wrenching feeling when you arrive, furthermore the thought of bedding down in the rooms just makes your skin crawl. Corridors reminded me of the film `THE SHINING' The bedroom not clean and blankets with bedspreads!!! Call me old fashioned but this place really was`nt a hotel of any star rating. more like a Youth hostel and that`s being unkind to the Y.H.A. Breakfast room, well can only say it reminded me of national disaster area for providing grub for those who have been evacuated from their homes.I love a good breakfast and i have good appetite but the food , how on earth can anybody concoct an english breakfast without taste is beyond me. Ive stayed in basic hotels esp in greece, but this really surpasses anything ive ever experienced. Can only imagine this must be like staying in a refugee camp. AVOID AT ALL COSTS !!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor everything else”
Reviews.Author: BABRAJ
Reviews.Content: We booked through a travel agent. Couldn't get check-in till 1.00PM and waited for almost 3-4 hours. Room & bathroom not cleaned properly. No good amenities and toiletree items in room. Noisy due to adjacent to main road. Average breakfast and repeated exactly same everyday. Too crowdy & noisy. Overall poor service. Only good thing was central location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but the hotel a bit old”
Reviews.Author: shirley0605
Reviews.Content: In London Zone 1, it's a very good location! just 3 mins walking distance to underground station: Russell Square. overall, the hotel is tidy and clean. Just a bit old. Rooms are big, no air-con, but the window can helps to to get strong wind, cus it is BIG!! Breakfast is average. Canteen is big for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for central london”
Reviews.Author: mitochondrial
Reviews.Content: Lets get things into persepective! It's not a 5 star hotel, but you can walk to it from Kings X, St Pancras or Euston in about 15 minutes with your case! We had a Â£99.00 weekend deal. This included return train and two nights B&B with full breakfast. The breakfast is very good considering the number of people they accommodate. It is buffett style and you can have as much as you like. The bacon is good, not like supermarket bacon! Nothing wrong with the toast, brown or white and it was warm. A good cup of coffee too. Don't expect 5 star rooms at this price, it is central London. I have stayed a many hotels in this city at more than twice the price and been dissappointed, You are 10 minutes walk from the British Museum, and 20 minutes from Covent Garden. Easier and quicker to walk than use the tube. The hotel has a pizza cafe, Indian and Chinese restuarants, bar food and best bitter at Â£2.80 a pint in the bar. It is very busy with overseas visitors. The bedrooms are adequate. Afterall, you don't spend all of your days in the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “standard accomodation, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bratz34
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the royal national hotel. what i like about the hotel is the excellent location for sightseeing or shopping, the tour bus stips right outside the hotel. The staff are very welcoming, plus having a very fussy eater with us, my son we took our own breakfast in to the dining hall without any problems. All trips and excursions can be booked in the lobby area. There are slight negatives about staying here the rooms are basic and there is no hairdryer in the room, however the rooms are clean and perfectly adequate for a stay in london when all you need is a place to comeback to after a long day sightseeing and shopping the added advantage is the bar and pub next door. The hotel is a busy tourist no frills hotel in central london and yes it is value for money The pilkington family

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but staff so welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Fosters4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend solely for tourism, I had read reviews on this hotel and was dreading going. When we arrived the hotel was huge, the staff at reception were very nice. We recieved the card for our room straight away but were disappointed to find a hole in the wall, hidden behind the bed it looked like it had been kicked in by a previous resident. We asked to move rooms and were quickly moved so we were happy, very imporessed with the staff's response to our request. Our new room was of a better standard, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would have no hesitation in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: DurhamScorpio
Reviews.Content: stayed here on two night break with a show and travel included cost 150 pounds went with friends and thought it was value for money.rooms were comfortable n clean tea n coffee provided.staff were quite friendly n helpful.little bit noise but wot you would expect in london.breakfast included and was quite nice went bout 9.30 not too busy.hotel is well situated.the pub in court yard very good n very reasonable(Â£6.00)for burger n chips really nice,drinks also cheaper than hotel.would definatley go again.our rooms over looked the court yard out the back real quiet.the reviews do not do this hotel justice.as we all found it very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: zohei
Reviews.Content: I don't know why there are so many bad reviews for this hotel. For this price in London and considering the good location of the hotel, I think this place is cost effective and not as bad as the other reviewers say. I am figuring that the quality of the stay really depends on the rooms and where it is located. My room was located on the other side of the court yard and was maybe in the newly renovated rooms. The room was rather old, but well cleaned and bathroom was very clean. The reception was not really friendly, but efficient. The house keeping staff was friendly and was quick in fixing the blown out light bulb in the toilet. Yes, the breakfast was bad, with only bread, butter, canned fruit and drinks - and I think they should just stop the breakfast service to cut the running cost down and just serve the paying customers. Don't stay here if you are on a honeymoon, but if you are going to use this hotel just to sleep at night, then I think it is well worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Vig90
Reviews.Content: The rooms seem poorly cleaned at arrival - there were hair all over the bathroom. No shampoo. The breakfast was terrible - nothing but dry bread, toast and marmelade.... nothing else - yes if you wanted to pay additionally you could get bacon and eggs etc... The noice in the cafeteria was terrible - you did not feel any urge to get back to eat at dinner time!! There was a small cafe in the yard - but it was in the middle of trafic going in and out of the hotel - not nice and relaxating - only lots of noise and smoke from cars/busses.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: MartinaD3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Kind and helpfull staff, fresh rooms, near to both grocery stores and the tube station. The breakfast wasn't the best but the rest was really good! :)

Reviews.Title: “Get your bags and run!”
Reviews.Author: monaguiar
Reviews.Content: Don't ever stay at this hotel unless you are in your late teens or early twenties and like loud, rowdy places. Specially in the summertime! No air conditioning and windows don't really open. Very noisy, very dirty, no hand towels(or toiletries), and terrible breakfast! Get your bags and run! Away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jitee1948
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a weekend at the Royal National Hotel. On checking trip advisor before leaving home, i must say i was apprehensive as the reviews on trip advisor were pretty much awful. So the good news is they are all rubish the hotel was excellent value for money with good food, clean room and excellent location. The staff were all most helpful and I will certainly have no hesitation in using it again if i were ever visiting London again.

Reviews.Title: “no good if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: northantshelen
Reviews.Content: hotel is set around a court yard where there is an outside bar open until 2 a.m. Unforntunately after this closes you have to contend not only with large groups of party goers returning but worst still, 52 people either waiting to be picked up or dropped off by coaches. Believe me, the sound carries everywhere. A shame because it could be a great base for seeing London. However after NO sleep, the last thing you want to do is sightsee! Also, chamber maid came into our bedroom(without knocking) at 8.15 on a Sunday expecting to clean.

Reviews.Title: “OK comfort but there are many cons”
Reviews.Author: semike
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the price was good so I went for it. That turned out to be something I was not too glad about. This is a gigantic hotel and it is frequented by many foreign youngsters. This makes it quite loud. The check in is crazy, it is like a factory with a large number of check in clerks. Not perhaps the friendliest people you have ever met. Room was basic but quite ok. Bathroom was also ok. Problems were that the yard was full with smoking chatting people late in the evenings. Some appeared to be shouting from room to room. This was not good for sleeping. Breakfast was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Speechless- in a bad way”
Reviews.Author: megd1
Reviews.Content: This was the first place I went upon arriving in Europe for the first time ever... didn't make a very good first impression. The first thing I noticed was that the hallways smelled like musty urine or something equally vile. (Something else that stuck in my mind was the 'ironing' room- two old ironing boards chained up to the wall, no iron in sight.) Upon opening the room door my reaction was, "We paid $120 CAD/night for this??" There were 2 small hard beds, I was suspicious of the cleanliness of the bedding, & the carpet was the quality of a cheap mat that has been sitting outdoors collecting dust for 10 years. Though there were a few tea bags & coffee, I was a bit surprised that only one miniscule bar of soap was provided. One saving grace was that the bathroom was clean. The location was great though (direct Tube line from Heathrow... although it is about a 1h15m ride). You can easily walk to St. Paul's Cathedral & Tate Museum within about 30 minutes. The pub adjoining the hotel was very cheap & quite tasty, and there are plenty of small cafes and bistros near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awful dirty hellhole”
Reviews.Author: 100_scottishlass
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at this hotel it was awful it was so dirty holes in the walls the beds were broken all holes the bedding smelt stale it was disgusting i sprayed body spray on it before i went into it ,i found toenails still on the carpet from previous people the dust on the carpets was terrible i dont know the last time they had been hoovered i wont even start on the corridors they should be ashamed of taking peoples money i think the windows hadnt been cleaned from the 60's disgusting ,and the lack of staff the fire alarm went off 3.30am i we saw one member of staff outside there was no-one around to organised the thousands of people who had to evacuate the hotel TERRIBLE .......... and the room keys never worked we were locked out our room a few times and the breakfast was shocking it was that bad we didnt go back for breakfast the next day although it was all paid for in advance anyone reading this i would stay clear of this hotel it was more like a hostel for down and outs .

Reviews.Title: “welcome to hell”
Reviews.Author: abbigailEngland
Reviews.Content: looked at two rooms both were filthy with large holes in the walls and large holes in the beds. bases of which were collapsing in. springs of the beds coming through. floors hadnt been cleaned in months, and under the beds covered in dust and litter hairgrips sweet papers food etc. bathroom just as filthy carpets were full of holes as was the corridor carpet. We then asked for a refund and were refused. after a row with the manageress she gave us two more room keys this was an hour and a half later. We looked at both rooms which we noted had been refurbished and were clean and accepted one of them. however we only stayed a couple of nights and came home as it was so noisy we couldnt sleep what with the hundreds of students and the main road outside. It will be The T ower Guorman near tower bridge next time, this is a wonderful hotel pity we couldnt get in at the time we booked, as after this experience I would rather stay at home if the hotel was not known to me,

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it like the plague”
Reviews.Author: hudson2000
Reviews.Content: We took a school party to this hotel. There were 90 Sixth Form students and 10 staff. All members of the party had to pay Â£20 returnable deposit against damage and disturbance. On the first evening a private party kept our students awake into the early hours. Interestingly, this room was obviously permanently occupied and was no longer being used as a normal hotel room. One has to ask why? For those not kept awake by the party there was the joy of the noise from the outside tables of the bar. The noise funnelled up the internal quadrangle and private conversations were easy to hear! At one in the morning things got a little better but then the tour organiser for Kontiki began shouting at her guests to get on the coaches at 6am! All this was heard with the windows closed as there is no double glazing. Thank goodness it was not too hot or it would have been even noisier with the window open! Yes we did get our disturbance money back but there was no evidence of compensation for the disturbance caused by other guests. Did other guests get charged this fee and did they lose it? I doubt it! Would I recommend this hotel? No - not even to my enemies!

Reviews.Title: “All that we needed”
Reviews.Author: tiger_the_driver
Reviews.Content: At first sight of this hotel you can tell it's stuck in the 70's . As for check in yes their was only 2 of us and we sailed straight into the room within minutes of walking through the door. The room consisted of 2 singles and they do move so sliding them together was easy, the sheets and pillow case were clean,was surprised we got room service every day we were there. Also a mini fridge, tv, tea cofffee and kettle in room. Breakfast was a lot to be desired but i think the staff managed well considering the size of the place, there was however no smiling found to be had off any of the staff. Our room was on the first floor and with the heat of London we had to keep the window open and god did we know we were in the heart of London traffic noise was immence. I read a lot of reviews about rowdy students but we encountered none of this. We did have 2 late nights so maye we missed all of this. All in all this hotel was just what we needed to lay our heads after touring and drinks around London, everything was in walking distance from here the west end ,oxford street, trafalgar square, London eye, big ben and the house's of parliament etc etc etc so it was all that we needed .

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...wouldnt recommend at all!”
Reviews.Author: ncherryHull
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible, the rooms were dark and dingy, there was constantly a funny smell?! Food was awful, unless you like cold toast and stale cereal that is. Or you could pay an extra Â£4.50 for a greasy fry-up...im not tight but i think thats disgusting considering the amount you pay to stay there. In our room someone had put a carrier bag over the smoke alarm?! Beds were like laying on bricks...towels were like drying yourself on sandpaper. And to add to it all there was a fire evacuation at 12.30am, the whole of the hotel had to leave but it was the most unorganised fire drill ive ever seen in my life...and it turned out to be a false alarm...dodgy alarm more like. All in all i would never go back to this hotel even if you paid me!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: WAYZATA55
Reviews.Content: The common areas of the hotel are filthy. The lobby floor, although surfaced in tile to accommodate the throngs of students constantly present, appears never to be cleaned--it is covered in dirt, paper, gum and other materials. The lobby walls are dented, scratched, marked up and covered with dirt. Any woodwork present is discolored by gummed off varnish and filthy. The windows of what appears to be a bizarre little solarium look to have never been cleaned. The entire area is permeated by what can only be described as body odor smell. The elevators are miniscule, accommodating no more than four persons, and are even more filthy than the lobby. They are partially lined by carpeting on the walls, swaths of which are ripped off. The buttons for floors in most (although not all) of the elevators do not light, leaving one to wonder whether you are going to reach the right floor. The elevators are mobbed in the morning and in the evening, causing five minute waits for an elevator with space. The hallways on the floors are uneven and covered with the most filthy carpeting I have ever seen in a hotel. Large pieces of molding in hallway doors have been ripped off, scratches in the wallpaper and walls are everywhere, and where the wallpaper is intact, it has been misfitted to the walls. Where the plaster on the walls has been gouged out, it is simply painted over, leaving on odd, bombed out appearance in places. Except for the carpeting, which appears to have been recently replaced, the rooms are no better. Our beds were covered in a yellow/brown faded bedspread that looks to have been washed thousands of times and to have originated in the 1950s. My bedspread was punctuated by what appeared to be about a four inch square grease spot in the center. The bed mattress is worse--mine was concave, soft, and had one spring that constantly pushed into my back. I did not dare look under the sheets--I suspect that these beds have not been replaced in decades. The built-in furniture seems to not get cleaned--there are bits of grime that appear partially embedded in the finish. The bathrooms have mildew on the ceiling--perhaps because there appears to be no exhaust vent. Our bathtub was punctuated by a large growing rust-spot of about 2 inches square in the corner, appearing like some cancerous dirt virus that you dared not touch. The drapes are of the same faded fabric as the bed. The bed linens, did appear to be clean, but were stiff and scratchy (I guess preferable to the filth otherwise prevalent in the hotel). There was no shampoo or other hygiene products provided in the room--only three very small, and somewhat malodorous, bars of soap. The bath towels were tiny, extremely rough, and some had pronounced grease marks. No hand towels were provided. Based upon the trip-advisor reviews, we brought along two tattered towels that we had previously used to dry our yellow labs--you should know that these towels were far superior to the towels provided by the hotel. To be clear, we find the linens that this hotel uses unsuitable for our dogs, let alone our children. In short, one felt like one needed to wash before, while in, and after departing these rooms. The hotel staff was rude, unhelpful, and disorganized. Upon arriving at the hotel at 12:30, we waited about 45 minutes, only to be told that our rooms were unavailable. We were shuttled into what appears to have been a meeting room commissioned as a luggage holding area. Although we suggested that some of our students might want to change their shoes, they were summarily told by the attendant that they could not open their baggage in this meeting room. The young man who was monitoring the room yelled at one of our students when she reached into her bag, prompting a reply from me. When another student tried to open her bags in the hall, another hotel staff member yelled at her that she could not do so because it created a fire hazard. In short, we were told that, after 14 hours of travel, we could not get into our baggage or into our rooms, and told in a manner that was incredibly rude. At breakfast, in one of three industrial cafeterias the hotel maintains, students were physically barred from the door and shuttled off to other cafeterias when the cafeteria neared capacity. Please know that this was done, as everything is done in this hotel, without a smile and without the use of "please" or "thank you," but instead with physical blocking of the doors, outstretched hands, and rude direction. We did elicit one smile--when my wife and I attempted to move our room from the "courtyard" (see below), we told the desk attendant that the hotel was a dump. The response was a smile and a statement that "yes I know." The hotel and rooms are so noisy that it is impossible to sleep. There is no air conditioning, and no cross ventilation or room fans, requiring one to leave the window open on warm nights. The hotel has seven floors, with rooms on three busy Bloomsbury streets, and on an interior courtyard. The courtyard is about 100 feet (30 meters) square, with the two lobbies on two sides of the first floor, a bar with picnic tables on a third side, and a pizza shop on the fourth side. Although likely first designed as a garden area, the entire courtyard has been paved over and is used as a staging ground for buses during the day. Buses arrive in sequence all day long and until midnight, belching diesel fumes into the rooms, and offloading tired and loud student groups until late at night. Worse, young people congregate in this "courtyard," and socialize in typical, excessively load voices (some screaming) until late at night--not until after 2:00 A.M. is the courtyard not thronged. In what appears to be a function of the paving and four hard walls that are seven stories high that surround the courtyard, the acoustics force all this noise into the adjoining rooms. The effect is as if one were trying to sleep in a football stadium at the height of a game. Not even with sophisticated noise blocking earphones could I avoid this noise. And strangely, although the windows appear to be double glazed, shutting the windows has virtually no effect (other than to turn the room into a sauna). It is incredibly bad. Students from many of these groups leaned out the windows smoking cigarettes, which in a hotel with inadequate elevators, poorly marked exits, and no room sprinkler systems is nothing short of dangerous and frightening. Young girls in their early teens stayed in the courtyard until late in the morning cavorting with their friends. On one night, a young man in his late teens met us in the hall just as we were returning to our room, asking us to help him find his own room because he was intoxicated. Everything in this hotel is poorly maintained. In one of our rooms, the faucet would not turn off, and attempting to turn it off caused it to run more, eventually overflowing the sink and depositing an inch of water on the bathroom floor. There was no shut-off valve under the sink and our students were forced to miss breakfast, shower in different rooms and eventually move to another room. In our room, the doorknob fell off as we were leaving one night (we placed it in my wife's purse as an extra security measure).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, it served it's purpose, we'd come back”
Reviews.Author: Allan-and-Kym
Reviews.Content: I knew what to expect from this hotel, as our daughter had stayed here when she did a Contiki Tour of Europe. The hotel is old, and there are lots of young people staying here, but the place is so large you hardly see anyone else. Our room was booked on the internet at a very good price so we weren't surprised when it was small, with two single beds (instead of a double). The beds were comfortable, the traffic noise was loud but bearable (what can you expect near the centre of London? Tea and coffee supplies were provided each day and there is a small fridge in the room. There's a supermarket nearby which sells pre-packagked salads. We found them economical and delicious. Breakfast is in the restaurant and it was great, plenty of cereal, fruit, toast, plus sausages, bacon, eggs etc all included in the "breakfast voucher". Overall it's dated, but clean and comfortable and central to everything. The tube is at the end of the street, very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awful”
Reviews.Author: ryguy70
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in London for a night after missing the last Eurostar train back to Paris. Unfortunately, this was the only hotel in the area that had a room available. The staff was pleasant and the lobby area does not begin to tell what lies behind the guestroom doors. The room was digusting. It appeared to have bedding that was 25 years old and mattresses that matched. It was dirty and digusting. For good measure, they appear to host a rave nightly in the courtyard creating an excessive amount of noise in the rooms pretty much ruling out any sleep. All around a horrendous place that I would advise you stay away from.

Reviews.Title: “save yourself, do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: gasbag11
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all, for the following reasons; the dirty socks under the bed that weren't removed what a nice surprise it was , or maybe the numerous hairs in the bath tub, or maybe the toilet that wasn't cleaned at all, with another suprise for us. It is the most unclean hotel Ive ever stayed in before.. EVER and I have stayed at quite a few hotels. I wasnt expecting anything really great, just basic clean, accommodation. We were given 2 single beds, although be booked twin. Our room backed onto the back of the hotel, which wasn't the nicest view, althought this could have been all forgiven if the room was actually clean! Totally grossed out with my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: fatcat_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly enough-especially housekeeping. Breakfast was poor.Overcooked. The worst part was trying to sleep-even with the windows shut (and is was a hot day) my young son and I didn't get to sleep until 1 am due to outside noise in the court area.It was like trying to sleep in a nightclub. There was still noise all night-though not as bad-from people coming back and forth in taxis. Hotel okay if you're young and want to stay up till 2am, but not any good for a family. I checked out a night early as couldn't stand another night with little sleep. Non of the foreign reception staff could understand what I was saying, felt like a foreigner in my own country! Needless to say I won't be staying in this hotel again when I visit London again later this month.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN CENTRAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ferndene
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 nights stay at the Royal National Hotel. After reading the reviews we were slightly dubious but had a good time. The hotel is in a excellent location for all the main attractions within a 10 min walk from Euston Station and just a couple of mins walk from about 3 tube stations. The hotel is very large so is popular with coach trips and is always very busy but didnâ€™t effect us at all. Check in was painless and the staff were all very helpful and pointed us in the correct directions and gave us a few tips on things. We arrived too early but they have a good service where you can leave all your luggage until you return later in the day. We received our keys and given direction on how to find the room. We had a large family room which was very clean and nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable and we all slept very well, we needed extra towels and tea/coffees which were brought to us within 5 minutes of ringing house keeping. We didnâ€™t go to breakfast either mornings but you can arrange for a packed breakfast to be brought to your room if required. The only time you seen bedding in the corridors was when they were turning rooms around than this was removed when all rooms were finished and we seem people hovering the corridors several times a day. Parts of the hotel look like they need upgrading but all in all we had a great time and would definitely use this hotel again. It is a budget city centre hotel but has good facilities and I have stayed in worse travel lodges. Check out was painless and again the staff were lovely. We had a great time and we would definitely use this hotel again for what we paid it was excellent value for money and so convenient for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Odd, shabby maze of a hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: BridgetJonesNI
Reviews.Content: Usually my husband and I have quite low expectations for budget hotels, especially when the price is comparatively lower than others in the area. We're usually the ones looking at all the critical reviews on these sites saying, "well what did you expect for the price?!". However in this case even we were a bit disappointed. First thing you should know - the hotel is absolutely huge! I kept getting lost on the way to/from our room. When we arrived we checked in and they gave us a twin room rather than a double. When I explained we wanted a double they said our travel agent didn't specify that a double room was required, but so far as I remember there was nowhere on the booking system she could have done so. I don't generally complain in hotels but their "why should I care?" attitude irritated me so eventually, when it was apparent I wasn't backing down, they reassigned us to a double room and pointed us towards the lifts to find our own way through the maze of corridors. The room seemed as clean as you can get a faded and well-used room but it still looked pretty shabby. It was the usual size for a budget hotel room in a big city, so a bit on the small side. The bed was just ok, not massively comfortable and a bit squeaky, and the bedding was quite scratchy. There was a small TV in the corner, 1 chair, a desk and a wardrobe in the room too, so pretty much all the essentials. The bathroom was small but had everything you need and was fairly clean. The window looked out over the courtyard in the middle of the hotel and the other side of the hotel - a bit drab. Not much else to say about it really - just a standard little room. It suited us ok as a place to sleep in between going out and about around London all day but you wouldn't really want to spend much time in there. It actually reminded me of staying in halls at university more than a hotel - it's so big that people are milling about, chatting and shouting until quite late at night. That didn't bother me too much but I know it would annoy some people. There were two good points about the hotel. One was that they let us leave our luggage with them after checkout on our last day so we could go out for the day and then come back to collect them before heading to the airport. There was a bit of a queue for the left luggage room but it was certainly convenient for us. The second is the location. You're a short walk away from an outdoor mall called the Brunswick (highly recommend lunch at Carluccio's if you're feeling a bit plush!), a Tesco Express, coffee shops, cafÃ©s, etc, and a tube station (Russell Square) to connect you to the rest of London (including a direct link to Heathrow airport on the Picadilly line). We also had breakfast in their restaurant on our last morning. The food wasn't the nicest, the restaurant was packed so we had to share a table and there's an odd ticketing system to get hot food that caused a bit of confusion (not just for us, but others in the queue who were sent back to their tables to get a ticket and then rejoin the long queue before they would be given anything to eat). Overall it wasn't the worst hotel we've ever stayed in but it was far from the best. In retrospect I would rather have paid the extra Â£20 or so a night and stayed in one of the more popular chains where you at least get a comfortable, modern room and don't have to go on a 10 mile trek to get in and out. Still, if it's all you can afford and you're only using it as a base for exploring London it will suit you ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a central location”
Reviews.Author: MsJanTiggy14
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 2 night stay travelled with my partner and 4 teenagers 15 - 19. We were more than happy, the rooms are a good size, well equipped and clean. Bath and a shower with plenty of hot water. The check in was really quick and the staff were friendly and helpful, there were plenty of eating options in the hotel but also lots of nice restaurants and bars in easy walking distance and a supermarket and off licence straight opposite. Breakfast was very nice it's a large dinning room with a lot of people in it but you didn't have to queue too long. All in all we were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Central to London”
Reviews.Author: happygalCornwall
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews was a bit worried, but a pleasant surprise. Yes was busy with students, but they were supervised, and on the whole they were there for the same as us...... Touring London. A nice shopping centre around the corner (posh shops) and a very short walk to Covent Gardens, will use this hotel again, after all when you go away all you want in a room is a kettle, place to freshen up and sleep!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: justme55
Reviews.Content: i just got back from this hotel if thats what you can call it more like a youth hostel so many rooms, and thats really being nice. i read the things written about this hotel before my trip so i was kind of prepared but nothing prepares you as your own personal experience. the room was small and the bed had wheels so it moved around the blankets were worn out and just really gross the towels were worse - i wouldn't use them to wipe the floor asked to receive an extra towel which i received and no shampoo or soap unless you ask for it. ,the carpet was also in bad condition ,the bathtub had lots of mold and the shower head is so high but the mold was the worst part. it is in central area which is mostly the only good thing about it but our group would have preferred to be outside of london than spend 4 nights in that "hotel" we got the english breakfast which consits of tea,cofee, toast,cereal ,jam. egg s bacon our room faced the side of the pub so there was noise till early morning. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone.. i wish i had taken a picture of the room to show you all.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: Regtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of this Hotel after we had booked it and were slightly worried because there are a few bad reviews. Yes there are loads of students and back packers milling around reception, and tour buses parked outside but we only waited a few minutes to check in. The room was perfect, a king sized bed and a single which was perfect for myself, my wife and 7 year old grandson. We were on the 7th floor, went to bed early and didn't hear any noise from anywhere. The breakfast was continental, which was fine with us. There was a secure left luggage room which we used. We would stay at this Hotel again. Very handy for Russell Square tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a budget hotel.... a place to put your head”
Reviews.Author: sydcarnie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine as a place to sleep in transit for the two nights on arriving in London and before leaving London. Easy to get to transport and rooms were standard enough

Reviews.Title: “Awful Place, Rude Staff- Avoid”
Reviews.Author: MarianaV_10
Reviews.Content: Travelled to London from Lisbon on a school trip and stayed at this place. 17 of us - two teachers and 15 children. Â£300 demanded from us for "good behaviour" bond money as soon as we arrived. My colleague had to put it on her credit card. Ironically, it turned out that our students were well behaved and instead were themselves kept awake all night by drunken brawls in the street outside (hotel bar was just below their windows) and drunken guests roaming the corridors at night/ early hours of the morning banging on doors. It was very alarming for the kids. I mentioned to the reception desk on checkout that their policy of assuming that every student was a "criminal" and justifying the need for the bond money was unfair, because it was the other guests who were disruptive. The reply was a dismissive "You should have used common sense madam and called the night porter." This was not the response one would expect. What about a polite "I am sorry about this". The fact is I would have called reception but I did not know about this incident until the next morning as the kids were cowering in fear. They were too afraid to leave their rooms and certainly too afraid to speak on the phone lest the lout banging on their door could hear them. There was absolutely no idea of customer service at reception. Bathroom was clean but there was rubbish tucked into the seat of the armchair and cigarette burns in bedding. Breakfast was "continental" consisting of cornflakes and soggy toast with jam. This establishment is truly one of the worst I have ever been to and that is mostly because of the staff. I have had better service for far less money. I would also certainly avoid it, especially for a school trip where one has responsibility for other people's children. The rowdy pubs and bars, with the bad language, broken glass and brawling is not conducive for children. An awful place.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a bed factory only stay there if you are a backpacker”
Reviews.Author: Gen43
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. It was full of backpackers leaving on tours. We had kids trying to get into our room (thinking it was there own) and knocking on our doors. Breakfast was terrible

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaHome
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very poor - staff unhelpful and unfriendly on reception. No English Staff. Twin bedroom consisted of 2 single beds and was very small. TV remote didn't work. No hairdryer available. Bathroom very basic - small towels, old small shower over very high bath. Small bar of soap provided. Breakfast - continental style unless you paid 4.50 for hot breakfast. No milk, just cream in small cartons for tea/coffee. Toast brought out in large stack but cold when put down. Staff not great at clearing up/wiping dpwn the tables after someone leaves - wiped crumbs onto chairs around table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hilarity2us
