Reviews.Content: spent 3 days at his hotel last year, which is the second visit. Room was clean, bedding was clean, a basic room but didn't need anymore as we were out nearly all day. It is adequate for a few days stay in London, near Oxford Street, Leicester Square and the theatres. The breakfast is like sitting in a large canteen, but there is a great choice to fill you up before you go exploring. Going back again in Sept this year.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel perfect for Shortbreak”
Reviews.Author: gillianpink30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal National Hotel recently on a two-night Superbreak Theatre Weekend with 3 other friends. We had tickets to see Dirty Dancing, which was showing at the Aldwych Theatre. I must admit after reading previous posts regarding the hotel we were extremely sceptical and wondered what we had let ourselves in for. On arrival we checked in with no problems then made our way to our rooms, which were on the fourth floor. We found our rooms to be basic but adequate linen & towels were clean and in good condition, bathroom was clean and beds were comfortable. Our rooms were not situated near the main road so we were not troubled by the noise of the traffic. We didnâ€™t have many dealings with staff but when we did found them to be pleasant enough. Breakfast was also fine no issues there. The hotel is in a great location and has lots of amenities nearby. Overall if you are looking for Luxury then this hotel isnâ€™t the hotel for you however for a Shortbreak this hotel is perfect. We had a great time and the show was just amazing. On departure we decided to store our luggage at the train station (Kingscross) rather than the hotel â€“ bad choice! We were charged Â£8 per person, this was per case any additional luggage i.e. hand luggage was also charged a hefty Â£8. It doesnâ€™t matter whether you want to store it for 1hour or 5hours itâ€™s the same price! We paid a total of Â£32 for an hour in half storage. We all agree that we would make use of the hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: AngeSep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in a triple room - 3 single beds with decent mattresses and even better pillows. Large bathroom which was spotless as was the bed area. We were booked in for English breakfast. The dining hall is huge but everything you need is there. The breakfast was great. For what we paid for the whole weekend including travel we would certainly go back. Hotel is near the tube and on the Picadilly line so it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fanann
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Rooms clean. Busy hotel, might be a bit noisy for some but I thought it was fine. Great location walking distance to most of the attractions. Overall brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reccomendable”
Reviews.Author: ALMARSTellenbosch
Reviews.Content: Nice,neat hotel with no fuzz.Near trainstations and local red busses.Nice food.Bathrooms not so good,but bedding and carpets neat and fresh.Would reccomend to others.Affordable tariffs.Had a lovely stay.For some people that goes there for a luxerious vacantion, I would not reccomend this hotel at all.This hotel is more for the backpacker-adventurers for a quick stay.We had a realy nice time and would make use of is again in the near future.Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE TO STAY, IT'S THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN!”
Reviews.Author: capital292
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on a theatre trip. It turned out to be the hotel from hell. Over 70% of their business is school trips. The hotel put us on the same floor as the kids who kept us awake all night, at 2.45am I had to insist that they fetched the teacher to come and control the children, there was about 8 or so, about 15yrs old and running riot, the boys and girls were in and out of each others bedrooms all night. Breakfast was full of screaming children, and there nowhere to sit. The bed linen looked clean but was full of holes, and there was not enough towels. when I asked why they were mixing the kids with the adults, they said they put you where they have room.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING AND UNFRIENDLY - PRISON”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandElle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 10 for 1 night at start of holiday and 1 night on return journey. It was without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. Really did not want to stay on way home but it was already paid for and we didn't get into St Pancras till 10pm so it was too late to find alternative with 2 young children. The room was smelly and the furnishings old and tired. Both myself and one of my girls woke up at 2am with FLEA BITES. Needless to say that was the end of my night's sleep. The next morning I had a shower which was surprisingly good. Big problem though I stepped out into the towel which stank of wet dog. Quickly grabbed another only to discover they all smelt just as bad. I will say though on our return trip the room was much better. I can only assume that they are refurbishing the hotel in stages. This point was actually proven at 11pm when someone started drilling a few rooms away. Just what you need to relax........ Not! We cannot comment on breakfast as after the flea incident we decided to cut our losses and get breakfast at St Pancras while waiting for Eurostar even though we had already paid for breakfast at the so called hotel. On our return trip we were 'greeted' by an English receptionist who had a terrible attitude. We had paid everything through Thomas Cook but she started demanding money for the children's breakfasts. I told her we wouldn't be staying for breakfast but she still demanded money. This went on for some time until I told her my children were only 3. It turns out 3 and under get free breakfast. It hadn't been a problem on 1st night but apparently this girl couldn't believe it possible for someone to have 2 children the same age. Anyway all in all obviously it's your choice to stay here but I just thought I'd forewarn you of our nightmare

Reviews.Title: “good for the money prety amazing”
Reviews.Author: jaythedude
Reviews.Content: i stayed their for 2 night it was well good but their are loads of kids so it s not real a palce for adults but im 16 and i enjoyed it :]

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good no-frills option”
Reviews.Author: ermintrude75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at nearby UCL. On the whole it did the job perfectly - I just cannot comment on the price as it was booked by the conference organisers. Positives: room was clean, linen and towels were clean and in good condition, decent shower with plenty of hot water, bed was reasonably comfortable, tea/coffee tray provided. Easy to get to, great location for British Museum etc., plenty of places to eat breakfast. Negatives: window only single-glazed and traffic is constant (I was glad of earplugs); kettle was faulty; bed on castors so if you try to sit up and read it scoots away from the wall; TV shows BBC World not BBC1 etc. Housekeeping moved my stuff around including putting sweaty morning run kit on top of clean clothes. Hundreds of school children in herds hanging around the foyer and crowding the breakfast room (I had to miss breakfast one day, or be late - not that that was a bad thing...). Full breakfast uninspired, cold eggs, hard toast, vile coffee - avoid.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay at hotel”
Reviews.Author: holly677
Reviews.Content: i went to london on my first trip in april 2010. i went with my mum and my dad and we travelled down by train. the national express was really good and provided excellent service and it was really comfortable. i arrived in london and got to my hotel.. i was amazed at only the first front view that i seen at first. the reception staff were really pleasant and kind. they pointed out directions for us to go to our room and it was greatly appreciated. the rooms were spotless and very tidy and clean. tv provided was excellent and bathroom was clean aswell. beds were extremely comfortable for anyone. i would definately recommend this hotel for a couple of two people to a full family its that good. not too far from all the shops and restauraunts. the restaurant for breakfast was brilliant. the breakfasts were absolutely gorgeous. i really like my visit and im going back again in july. holly hanley

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: York_Travel_Junkie
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy the hustle and busle of city life, then this hotel is perfect for you, it has an exciting atmosphere, with good facilities, in an awesome location dead close to the tube station. If your looking for a five star hotel with immaculate service, for a family holiday then your looking in the wrong place. But for short breaks, this hotel is perfect! It was a little noisey, but I think anyone expecting complete silence in a big hotel is hoping for the impossible and kidding themselves a little. The rooms were basic, but decent enough as a base for city viewing, as you do not spend alot of time in your room. But there was a telly with a range of freeview channels, and both the room and bathroom were very clean and well equiped. Breakfast was well operated with plenty of staff, and worked on a self serve basis, perfect for fueling up for a busy day! Im 18 and went away for a weekend with my mam (forty something), both the hotel bar and the London Pub, located just outside the hotel reception, were accommodating and not too expensive (Â£1.50 for half a pint). Id definitely reccommend this hotel for weekends away, but would say its ideal for groups of friends!

Reviews.Title: “Fortunately I only had to stay for one night..”
Reviews.Author: Nadia90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge, and it felt as if I was in prison. It was so impersonal and had no charm at all! The was no service at any point, I didn't even once see a member of staff smiling and we even had to pay for the hotel to store our luggage the day we left (only 50p but anyway). The rooms were small but OK, the view was into an empty yard with the view of other hotelrooms. The place was crammed with 15-year olds on trips with their classes.. I would rather skip the breakfast as it was terrible, and we even had to wait in a long queve. The hotel felt like a place where the only goal was to earn as much money as possible as quick as possible, and I do not understand why it isn't a lot cheaper, it definitely is not worth as much as they demand.. But the location was great! 150 yards from a metro station, and in the cosy and central area of Bloomsbury.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Adults”
Reviews.Author: Jeannemg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a hostel. During my stay there were hundreds of young people there. The halls were dirty. We had to ask for soap, shampoo and more than 1 towel. The young people ran up & down the halls, yelling and slamming doors all night. To borrow a hair dryer you had to leave a 20 pound deposit. At breakfast the food was fine but you almost got trampled because there were so many people trying to eat at the same time. We left the next day and stayed at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LCPSunderland
Reviews.Content: Myself, mam and sister stayed here for 2 nights over the weekend. The hotel is very large and yes there is lots of foreign teenagers/students here that can sometimes be noisy. However all we wanted was somewhere to sleep as we were out allday. We had a triple room which had 3 single beds in which we all said were comfortable. The bathroom is basic but very clean with plenty of hot water. Breakfast was buffet style but there was wide choice and was adequate for what you needed. The hotel is in a good position it was a 10 min walk to oxford street, covent garden and kings cross station. The sightseeing buses stop right outside the hotel and take you to knightsbidge, madame tussaudes, london dungeons, tower of london, buckingham palce etc You can just get on a off allday at what you want to see it was the best Â£25 spent. Overall we had a good weekend and would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “location, value, cleanliness-what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: parsimony
Reviews.Content: Cheap, shabby and clean, with endless hot water, efficient reception staff and youthful clientele. Breakfast good only for fuelling up. I understand the negative reviews, but think this hotel is addressing a different market - very well. We've stayed here a few times and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “BEEN TO ROYAL NATIONAL 7 TIMES”
Reviews.Author: hector43
Reviews.Content: royal national is a very good price in a great location, clean rooms,bathroom and bedding,food is great full english breakfast

Reviews.Title: “If service is a pre-requisite , don't stay in the Royal National Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TownsonKowloon
Reviews.Content: Royal National Hotel was the second hotel we chose for our prolonged stay in London as part of our European tour. While we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Melia White House, the Royal National Hotel was found completely out of place as a tourist hotel. It is, at best, a dormitory type with minimum facilities. Service culture is virtually non-existent in the hotel, We had to go to the housekpeeing office and pay a deposit to loan an iron and a hairdryer, and return after use.Breakfast is also a painstaking process. We had to queue half an hour to gain access into the self-help restaurant which falls short of our expectation as far as quality is concerned. No in-room internet . Although free wireless internet is available in the hotel lobby., its standard is just passable. The hotel is conveniently located in central London, just two blocks away from the British Museum. Being in a busy district, it is very noisy with busy traffic all day and all night long. Another downside is the quality of hotel guests. We suffered five sleepless nights as a few groups of Italian and Spanish teenagers (probably on study tours) staying in our neighbouring rooms played games and kept banging their doors throughout the night, causing great disturbance to their neighbours. It is really annoying. Even though we complained, they kept on the disturbance nonetheless. They even put on a hostile look and gave us a finger in the morning. What a bunch of uncivilised hooligans. If you want good service and a good hotel environment, I would recommend to stay away fromj this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No way could this be described as a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyKScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and young son. We were visiting London for 4 days and wanted a nice hotel which we could use as a base. What a huge disappointment! This was described by the webite we used as 'award winning' but that must have been when it first opened. We have stayed in cities all over the world and this is by far the worst experience we have ever had. It is just a huge youth hostel filled by groups of foreign teenagers. They weren't all bad but on two nights, groups of them were running up and down the corridors screaming and shouting. This caused great upset to my young son and meant an interrupted sleep for us all. The hotel itself is dirty and tired. Our room had mould on the walls and in the bathroom and was so dusty. My son and I are covered in spots which I can only assume came from the beds - the sheets were stained and the beds themselves were filthy. This hotel is used by lots of British holiday companies but do they ever visit it and check what's on offer for the paying guests?! We checked out other hotels in the area and most of them were of a better standard for just a bit more money and some were even cheaper. This 'hotel' is an embarrassment and gives this country a bad name. Its only positive point was that the staff were generally helpful and polite. I had read the reviews of this hotel beforehand but everyone has different ideas and standards so I thought we'd give it a go. I can only say one thing - its not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: jimboom
Reviews.Content: Purchased with package from BA as a 3 star hotel, not even a zero star. Horrible, chaotic check in process among 50-100 other people trying to get close to the reception, a bunch of high school kids work at the reception. Constant cigarette smell everywhere. Beds are rollaway beds with cheapest availible foam. Minimal bathroom amenities. Ultimately depressing, dirty and noisy. Is not worth ruining your vacation, better stay home if you cannot stay elsewhere. Ironically pretty good location and has potential if iron curtain mentallity is changed.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyBournemouth18
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the national with my mum. Overall the hotel is what you would expect for the price you pay and the location really is ideal for everything we wanted to see and the theatres etc etc. However, the hotel is very large and appears to be the hotel of choice for foreign students on trips, they arrived by the bus load each day. I have no problem with this in itself however the volumes of these students meant that moving through the hotel, getting access to a lift, sometimes even getting out the front doors was somewhat of a problem. Also had 2 very bad nights sleep due to these large parties, the students seemed to congragate in the courtyard that the hotel surrounded until all hours, screaming and singing and generally being very loud. Also running up and down the corridors and banging doors, very annoying! I'm not sure where their teachers/group leaders were, or why the hotel seems to accept this, but i suppose these groups make up a large proportion of their profit...... Overall an OK hotel but would not go back and would prefer to stay in one of the other smaller imperial hotels in russel square, having previously stayed in the imperial and the bedford they are must cosier and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Pub and Location BAD Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FergoBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We found our room door after checkin, only to find it was locked from the inside. Someone else was using our Toilet! Stayed a week and had a jack hammer in the room above us from 9 Am to 4 Pm everyday! Friend i was staying in Got bed bugs and had a terrible rash for days, nothing from the chemist would help. Radio and TV didnt work very well. They didnt even supply towels or soap for the first couple of days. We were talking to reception nearly everyday about issues we had. No sorry what so ever The great thing about the place is that they have free wifi in the lobby and a great pub. Good cheap meals and plenty of character. Enjoy your stay. We certainly didnt.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: redgiggsy
Reviews.Content: Reading all the bad reviews i was dreading my visit. My daughter and i had 2 nights b&b with train fare for Â£99. So not expecting much. We arrived at 1245 was able to check in straight away. Polite staff. Room was clean and tidy. Shower was powerful. Everything was clean and tidy. It is ideally situated. Dont be put off by the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for money”
Reviews.Author: hanket83
Reviews.Content: I was slightly apprehensive before I stayed at this hotel due to all the bad reviews, but Iâ€™m pleased to say I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived just after 2 which is the check in time and I expected to have to wait, we were checked in within 5 minutes and even had our room upgraded from a twin to double at no extra cost. The room was a nice size and clean. I was surprised to find that you can hire a hairdryer after other reviews has said this wasnâ€™t available. The staff was pleasant, but breakfast was very busy, try to avoid 8 â€“ 9 as this is the busy time, although we managed to find a seat. The location of this hotel is great, however Russell Square station can get busy, if you donâ€™t fancy walking up the 175 steps (believe me it sounds much easier to walk up then you think!) you will need to wait for one of three lifts. A good Idea is to go one stop further to Holbarn and take a 5 minute walk to the hotel. If I have to find a negative in this hotel would be that the cleaning service starts quite early, 7:30am on one day so if youâ€™re planning a lie in this may be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or Youth Hostel?”
Reviews.Author: justhitched08
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel mainly for the location and closeness to all the main areas we wanted to see and visit. All the rooms we were told were twin and on entering our room 6061 the beds were on opposite sides of the room. The room itself was clean, basic but the bed covers were very washed out and needed replacing. NO HAIRDRIERS they are available from Housekeeping on first floor for a deposite of 20 pounds. The bathrooms are very small - only room for one at a time but there was always plenty of hot water. Again the towels were in need of replacement ours were hard and scratchy and rather grey looking. Breakfast was very canteen buffet stye. No fancy trimmings just rows and rows of bare tables which were constantly cleared and cleaned for the next guests. English breakfast is available at an extra cost. Not the best of ingredients used but there was plenty of it and was topped up regularly. Continental breakfast - dont expect a variety of breads etc. or yoghurt or fresh fruit its just breadbuns, toast and jam - tea coffee and juice. This hotel seems to be the main hotel for foreign school parties - hence when we were there several coach parties of excited children checked in. There is no lounge space in the foyer only the bar area so the noise of all the children echoed around the reception area. At times you could not use the lift for all the children using them. Overall the hotel is very tired throughout - it needs money spent on decoration, bed and bathroom linen. We felt we should have been forewarned about the school parties and definitely would not pay any big money to stay there. Have stayed in alot better hotel for less money definitely only a 2 star plus.

Reviews.Title: “Royal National Hotel-avoid this dreadful place”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveler2010
Reviews.Content: Unsanitary shelter with unprofessional staff !!!!! DO NOT STAY!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Demolition the best option”
Reviews.Author: MountainMan101
Reviews.Content: This place is like a giant hostel - full of young people having a really good time. It is definitely not a 3 star experience - dirty, noisy rooms, awful decor, stuff growing in the corners, no wi-fi in the rooms, a disgrace to the British people! The breakfast room (one of several) was packed - usually difficult to find 2 seats together, very limited food choices. And all of this courtesy of British Airways!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave_1185
Reviews.Content: I work for a major high street travel agency and after hearing and reading mixed reviews, I went fearing the worst hotel imaginable. I stayed for 2 nights and found the hotel to be not as bad as what people make it out to be. The location is pretty good, only a 15min walk from Kings Cross and the nearest tube station is bout 3mins walk which is Russell Square on the Piccadilly line. This station was extremely busy during rush hour, so we often walked to either Kings Cross or Euston to catch the tube. The rooms are basic consisting of 2 single beds (which can be easily converted to a double), wardrobe, tv and bathroom. There was some noise disturbance, which came from workmen and from the kitchens, but this was only audible if the window was open otherwise there was no noise impact. The cooked breakfast was good, despite not going for breakfast till 9-30 there was still plenty of cooked food available and it was still hot. The only negative parts was the large groups that arrived by the coaches and the heating system. The rooms get too hot on a night and we had to open windows to try and keep the rooms cooler. We only used the rooms for sleeping, as we spent most of day walking around London and sightseeing. We only spent a VERY small amount in the hotel. The hotel bar drinks were very watered down, but on the front of the hotel is a pub and the prices were quite reasonable only Â£3 for a pint of lager. So we spent more time there. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I am also planning a return visit for my birthday later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good budget hotel - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: YrHarbwr
Reviews.Content: You cant fault the Royal National location - excellent, cleanliness- excellent, breakfast-ok busy busling hotel lots of young people, students, large but well organised.

Reviews.Title: “We found the hotel to be ok and would go back.”
Reviews.Author: hd991
Reviews.Content: I'd seen a lot of bad reviews after I booked this hotel so was a bit apprehenseive. But actually the hotel turned out to be fine. The only draw back is that this is a very very busy hotel which is probably due to good discounts to tour operators as there were lots of bus loads of people coming and going. We were quite lucky booking in as there were only a couple of people in front of us at reception. Later in the day though, we did see people having to queue to book in. Considering how reasonably priced this hotel was though, I wouldnt let that put me off. The rooms were clean and comfortable and we found the staff to be polite. Breakfast was very very busy and I would advise going either very early or very late (serving times were 7-10). The food however, was fresh and plentiful even when we went at 9.40 on the second morning. So if you want a quiet hotel then yes avoid this hotel, but to be honest, you're in London and everywhere is busy. We would go back again as we found the hotel to be cheap, clean , well located and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Solid low budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmark79
Reviews.Content: If you wish low budget, centrally located hotel, Royal National is a good choice. British Museum, Covent Garden and many other attractions are minutes away. Room was small, but cosy and clean. As I noticed, there are old and renovated rooms. Main minus of this hotel are many school excursions in this hotel so it can be sometimes very loud in the hotel halls. Continenatl breakfast is what we expected, jam, butter, cornflakes and toast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury, yet good value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: Eyal01
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Royal National for 4 nights during my last business trip. Great location which was very important to me - right on the Russel square underground. Booked a single room through easy click travel website, got a clean room on the 7th floor. Bathroom was very clean, bed was ok, and the price was worth it. Will consider staying there again. Oh, and you can connect to the net for free in the ground floor, which was great to find out!

Reviews.Title: “OMG never again”
Reviews.Author: ladybirdslotqueen
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 nt stay. We'd booked a break with Superbreak and all i can say is you get what you pay for, so considering we only paid just over Â£100 for 2nts & train travel, I shouldnt really be complaining but I am, cos some of you on this site will be paying alot more, so you need to know a few things!! The hotel from the outside looks horrible, the staff were ok, but wouldnt win any medals, the rooms were ok in size, but very basic & so old, plus we had a couple of 'extras' on our wardrobe door & tiles in bathroom! The hotel was full of very large groups of 14-17 yr olds, from Greece and other countries, with no respect for anyone else, ie running up & down corridors early in the morning and the most annoying thing was they all thought it was ok to parade around the bar & reception area at 1 am in their pyjamas & slippers!!!!!! Whats all that about? So for those reasons, I would not stay there again, or recommend it to anyone. It says it all when you are embarrassed telling the taxi driver the hotel you want dropping off at!

Reviews.Title: “Ok location staff need an attitude check!”
Reviews.Author: ldoll
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a london show (dirty dancing would def recommend it) arrived to about 20 recpetionists behind the desk the one that decided to serve us was ok not overly polite. rooms were ok wide enough space, but they always have heat on full blast making it very stuffy and you can open the windows but we looked over the street so if we did open the windows the noise would keep us up all night. about a 10 minute walk from the bottom of oxford street and 5min walk from kingscross/ st pancres station. we never went down for breakfast as we were never up in time. the bar across from the south side of hotel was quite nice for a drink full of students. had a rude blond girl serving which was so rude, shouted at me she wanted to see a ID i was actually older than her, I would not have minded been asked for ID as i do look quite young but her attitude towards me was terrible and horribly rude. when i came back to show her my ID another girl served me and didnt even look at my ID she just said 'sorry its ok I know your not 17, so I will tell her'. the bar in the south side reception area the girl behind the bar was seriously rude too. when it came to check out we went to the reception desk and got a dirty look from a male and female staff members for interupting their flirting, to be told 'ah you need to go across there' and back to their conversation. so we went across to the concerige desk to be told rudely 'ah you need to go around there but we won't take your bags its to packed' with that he walked away from us. so we then went to the side and the two mwn there were the first polite staff memebers we encountered, they took all our bags even though it was pretty packed luggage room, we were however charged to leave our bags there unusual as any hotel i have ever stayed in took them for free. all in all it was an ok hotel good location but they need new staff there is no need for rudeness in this day and age!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious Rooms ...good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: YFCJodie
Reviews.Content: I stayed with our young farmers club for the Royal Lord Mayors Parade in November. When approaching the hotel from the outside it looks dirty and decrepid...yet on arrival inside i was suprised at how clean and spacious our room was and the rooms of the 23 others i went with. i had to wait in a queue for at least 25mins to check in...but however wasnt bothered when i saw the room as it was so big, tidy, modern and clean. our package included dinner in one of the hotels inclusive restaurants on the first night, we chose the indian cuisine which wasnt the best but for the money we paid for the long weekend i wouldnt complain. we had continental breakfast included too which offered a good range of cereals and toast toppings and hot and cold drinks. all in all a very pleasant stay would definitly stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful experience - location might be good but there must be better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: wisemj
Reviews.Content: Just had one night and thank god only one in this awful hotel which is like a backpackers stopover. Couldnt get anywhere near the facility for leaving bags - concierge was appallingly rude. Room was shabby and the springs nearly coming through the beds. Towels in the bathroom where like sandpaper and the size of postage stamps. The shower was thankfully hot and powerful. Breakfast was in a grotty canteen like room and very average - search around there must be better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, busy, well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: geordiegirl66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights with my teenage daughter to do some sightseeing and found "it did exactly what it said on the tin". The outside of the hotel didn't look very appealing, but the reception area was nice however the corridors and rooms looked a little "worn" but were clean and perfectly fine. The shower looked basic but worked perfectly fine and there was more than enough towels. We were on the 6th floor looking into a "courtyard" and there was a little noise around 8 pm on the first night from some lads along the corridor, but they went quiet when a "lady" shouted from her room to tell them to "shut up". Breakfast was adequate, tea/coffee, orange/apple juice, cereals, toast, buns, jam/marmalade, fruit. Like a canteen but what do you want for the money and it being the LARGEST hotel in London ie around 1500 rooms!! I would definitely stay here again, great value for money and fab location.

Reviews.Title: “COMFY BEDS”
Reviews.Author: Belkin_8
Reviews.Content: Looked run down from inside, could have been modernised. Got to bedroom it was quiet ans spacious and tidy. Beds really comfy (Bedroom was facing road) Was quiet. Breakfast was busy as was reception. Good for small basic stays in London, close to tube - picadilly line (russell square station) 10min walk from Euston

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: sunlunlad
Reviews.Content: Comfortable,relaxing stay in a modern,silent room,so quiet in fact we could have been sleeping in a cottage in the Cotswolds,which is amazing considering Euston Road and St Pancras station are immediately next to the hotel.From the welcoming reception staff,to the waiters and cleaners everyone was extremely professional. Great breakfasts,good little gym,close to Euston and St pancras tube stations,and a stunning view of London from the 16th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: splodut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a complete disaster...we were situated on the upper most floor (7th floor) facing a courtyard where around 400 rooms face....the noise in this courtyard durin the night is horrible....The rooms are not sound proof at all and all noises from the courtyard (that also leads to the reception) are heard. Noises from the corridor outside our room are all heard....Even though overall the room was clean, I found a blood stain on the bath towel which was small but disgusting! The bathroom in the 1940s where better than those found in this hotel.....showers are fixed and for a tall eprson like me I had to bend to wash my hair! Breakfast is like being in a world war 2 canteen with some 'toast', butter and marmalade and some bad-tasting fruit!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: AilsaPerth_Scotland
Reviews.Content: I travelled to London with my adult son for three nights, to see a show and 'do' lots of museums. This hotel may not be deluxe but in my opinion, and I have stayed in various hotels across Europe, it represents value for money - and the location is ideal. To get a central London hotel for the prices they charge is very good indeed. What are people looking for? The room we had was large and spotless. Yes it was a bit noisy but what do you expect in the middle of such a city? The breakfast was a bit of a bun fight but perfectly adequate, although I wouldn't recommend the orange juice! The staff we spoke to were all very helpful and we certainly didn't have a problem with any of them understanding what we were asking, nor did they have trouble with our Scottish accents. We would certainly have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “So Don't Do It!”
Reviews.Author: BigDCalifornia
Reviews.Content: In the great words of Grandmaster Flash (you guess the song). The ONLY good thing about this hotel is the location. Check-in is a nightmare. Nothing is automated so you stand in line for an hour or two (and these are Italian lines aka wedges, not Germany or Spain lines) to check in. Rooms are terrible. Worse than the dorm room you remember at college. And for 200 or 250 pounds a night, not a good value. We had them change rooms for us. You may not appreciate the pictures we took, but it was a truly horrible room. The bathroom tiles had never been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “1960s Communist architecture and service: none!”
Reviews.Author: EssEffMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel's architect must have designed East German Communist apartment buildings in the 1960s. The rooms and lobby have all of the amenities of a 1955 McDonalds: no seats or anything else. Although our room was nicely trimmed with white crown molding, it was stylishly complimented with a 1970s oak headboard and desk/TV stand. There are two stainless steel room chairs suitable for a pinochle game, not a hotel room. The bed rests atop a charming $9.95 wheel chassis certain to slide, making 'falling into bed' a challenge worthy of an Evel Kneival stunt at 14" above floor level. The bath sink is conveniently located just so your companion's entrance thereto guarantees that the doorknob hits your 4/5 vertebrae. Hordes (they WERE hordes, not thongs) of 15-20 year olds arrive day and night by bus in the center 'courtyard', toward which your room no doubt faces; neither will your window close. But you won't just enjoy them face-to-face in the elevator or lobby; they will be certain to entertain you nightly in the center courtyard until they pass out around 3:30 am. But not to worry; the delivery and garbage trucks begin arriving around 5:30. And bring your cell phone: I was charged Â£6.80 for three local telephone calls. A hair dryer is Â£20 deposit. If you are lucky, 10 pence bar soap and TP are the bath amenities. As with accomodating staff, Boris Badenov and Natasha (see title of this review) train them. They have learned to respond to any service inquiry with a "you mustn't be unreasonable" attitude. Oh! It is conveniently located near the British Museum and Russel Sq. tube station.

Reviews.Title: “London Vacation 2007”
Reviews.Author: Kieran6
Reviews.Content: Although the free breakfast was not so hot, the location was great for getting in the london tube and walking to the British Museum

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again, very noisy, food terrible, hard to find someone who speaks good english”
Reviews.Author: patb912
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend package including train travel, we thought it was good value for money at the time of booking. The hotel is in a prime location but very noisy (all the time) crowds of people gather in the foyer and court yard and the noise just echos and we found it difficult to get to sleep, we were on the 6th floor but the noise from below carried even though our window was closed. People were running on the corridor and banging doors late at night, early morning. The reception staff weren't friendly to say the least. On our first morning we went to get our breakfast and asked a porter where we should go, we couldn't understand a word he was saying. I didn't meet any member of staff who was english or friendly. We had booked for english breakfast but our card wasn't stamped so we were refused breakfast, the couple who travelled with us on the same booking their card was stamped! We eventually got our breakfast but it wasn't very nice. The food was aired. Even the bacon that was brought out as I was queueing was cold! They must realise how bad it is when people don't eat it. How this hotel is a 3* I don't know, should be 2* . Next time will definately stay elsewhere. This place is good for backpackers!

Reviews.Title: “our trip”
Reviews.Author: wifey10CountyDurham
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and two children stayed for two nights at this hotel and as we wanted somewhere easy from Kings Cross and the Theatre, we found the location to be great. We had a family room which was clean and so was the bathroom. Our thoughts were it was cheap, location wise for us was brilliant, it was just somewhere to sleep as we were spending 2 days sightseeing and not returning back till late, there was plenty of choice for breakfast and yes it was busy but we didnt spend any time going round the hotel for it to bother us. If you wanted, like us, just somewhere to sleep and easy to get to then i would recommend it but if you want somewhere that is luxurious, typical London poshness and quiet then you would have to go somewhere else but also pay a lot more money so you get what you pay for really.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mitch1
Reviews.Content: Travelled last weekend with my partner and 4 friends on a Superbreak. I really don't understand the whinging of some people. We paid Â£103 each for 2 nights B & B & that included train fare. In a nutshell we got what we paid for - the room was clean if a little dated, had a double and a single bed, ample storage and wardrobe space and (despite other comments) very warm. The bathroom was adequate with plenty of towels and there were additional sheets and pillows (again despite previous reviews). If I had paid the Â£111 per night as advertised on reception I would have room to complain but was very happy with what I got for the money. The hotel is huge and was very busy especially with foreign student groups but we had no issue with either traffic or hotel noise. All in all a good weekend had by all at a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyasp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my fiance the poitives were the price and location. However, the noise level in this hotel was an issue, the walls were like paper and the windows were draughty and definatly not sound proof! Also there was no hair dryer in the room they told me if i wanted one i would have to go to house keeping but when i went there was none available on the first day, there was on the second day but i have toplay Â£20 deposit for it! The breakfast was also a nightmare it was like a school canteen very unorganised only cereal and toast (if there was any left) took a while to find a table. This hotelk was defo a no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: alice_g_russell
Reviews.Content: Just returned tonight from a 2-night stay in this hotel and do not understand all the bad reviews, there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. The only thing I disliked about it is that it is so big it was VERY busy but had absolutely no problems whatsoever. The size/thickness of the towels was hotel standard (if not happy with this take your own), two single beds, a wardrobe, loads of drawer space, and the toilet and bidet separate from the bath/shower which was ideal if someone was in the shower. Had to queue for breakfast the first morning but only for about 10 minutes, breakfast wasn't great but nothing wrong with it, just standard ie bacon, beans, tomatoes, scrambled eggs, fried eggs, rolls, toast, cereal, fruit, tea/coffee, fruit juice. The open-top bus stops right outside. I would return to this hotel, no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: shorti1105
Reviews.Content: When booking this trip the option of "early check in" was available. When we arrived at the hotel at 9am, at reception we were told they "did not have early check in". They did hold our luggage and told us to return at 2pm. Upon our return the lobby was packed with alot of groups checking in. The hotel staff was unorganized and rude. It was complete chaos. The room was small and the TV channels changed daily. Wi-Fi was available in the lobby and only in the room if you sat in one spot, if you moved you lost the connection.Three of us in a room, so we got 3 towels and 3 bars of soap. Our room faced the courtyard, which meant the noise level from people smoking and chatting was IMMENSE!!!!! My kids had trouble sleeping and reception was no help!!!! I called reception at 12:30 at night and nothing was done. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “believe all the bad reviews, do not go here”
Reviews.Author: K465
Reviews.Content: As soon as we saw the hotel, it looked as if it was about to crumble from one cause or another. The hotel was a bargain, but booking a room was a regrettable decision, we hoped not to believe the bad reviews, but they were all true. Some of the staff in the hotel; on the main desk, at the main door etc could hardly speak english, foreign students ranging from about the age of 12-16 running around the foyer throughout the day, and sitting on the floors. On the first night we stayed spanish students who were in rooms either sides of us were running around, shouting, slamming doors, calling each others rooms phones and ours!, knocking on our doors and others, kept us awake from 11pm - 4am which was ridiculous as it ruined our next day or travelling and had us all in a terrible mood. We contacted the security 3 times after such behaviour, but all the staff did was tell them they had to stop and yet they carried on after the staff had moved. The students were drunk and other hotel goers were telling them off, yet to no effect. If you can avoid this hotel, please do at all costs. If you have to fork out on a bit of extra money for a hotel that can be any more decent than this, which shouldn't be hard to find, going to this hotel will ruin your holiday. The only good points I can think of for the hotel is that it was generally clean and in a good location, other than that, nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: FluffyChristchurch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in Feb 2010. Location good, bus stops outside and near a tube.Five mins walk to British Museum. Hotel reception staff pleasant and efficient. Porters & luggage drop works well. The bedroom was basic but clean, with clean linen. Bathroom was a good size but the towels were very thin and not large enough. Could have done with some niceties ie fridge & hairdryer. Breakfast buffet was very minimal but the cooked option for an extra charge looked ok. Would not recommend the hotel to fussy people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near city center”
Reviews.Author: maristua
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms. Available for wheelchair users. The breakfast is very simple. The hotel is near the city center.

Reviews.Title: “I will not be visiting this hotel EVER again!!!”
Reviews.Author: paulandjaned
Reviews.Content: The beds were at least 30 years old. You could not regulate the heating in the bedroom. Breakfast if you could call it that was worse than prison food i imagine. The tea was made in a stainless steel cauldron. The toast was not toast it was warm bread. The untensils had not seen a good clean for months. The staff could hardle speak any English. There wasnt a croissant in sight...need i say more. I SHALL NEVER RETURN TO ANY OF THE IMPERIAL HOTELS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - will ruin your trip”
Reviews.Author: keni0924
Reviews.Content: I am here now and I can tell you all the bad reviews are accurate! There's no customer service, and at night the hotel staff allow large groups of rowdy unchaperoned teenagers to congregate and drink alcohol in the courtyard until 2am! We can't sleep a wink and when we complain, the hotel staff do nothing but shrug! STAY AWAY! There are dozens of better hotels for the same money, had I known it was this bad I would never have booked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zee1capt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night only. Won't be staying there again. It was a snowy evening in London and when I walked into my room, the window was wide open, couldn't close it as latch was faulty. Rang Receptionist and was told that were only 2 members from the housekeeping team working and they could possibly get someone to me later in the night to fix it. I told them the room was freezing and wanted a different one. About 30 minutes later a member from the housekeeping team did turn up(and they were nice and friendly), but they just spent 5 minutes banging the window and until it shut! Was made to feel a nuisance by the receptionist staff.

Reviews.Title: “Need to improve their customer service!”
Reviews.Author: n_traveller_fun_9
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is awesome and that might be the only good thing about it! The staff at the hotel were not cooperative or helpful. they seemed to have hundreds of guests waiting to check in and very little time for you. The rooms's heater did not work and when reported, it did not get any better. They could do much more as the hotel draws a lot of guests thanks to the location and conitki. A polite smile could even do the tick :)

Reviews.Title: “I was satisfied,Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: marandkay
Reviews.Content: I really dont know why there are so many bad reviews about this hotel.We arrived from heathrow after 11 in the evening and went straight in to the reception where we where given the room cards in minutes after checking in,the room was warm and clean with heating on full blast,not much space in the room to leave 2 suitcases but we managed.The furniture looked new,had nice and warm blankets and maids came everyday to clean.Russel square tube station is 2 minutes walk away. Hint: Dont leave your oyster cards in the same pouch with the room cards as we couldnt open the room s door on one night,we where told that the oyster cards are magnetic and damaged the cards so i assume they would even damage your bank cards. All in all was a nice stay,would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We were very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: eddy_and_gisele
Reviews.Content: First of all, do not believe most of the bad reviews. We, too, were very apprehensive about 52% of bad reviews. We arrived early in the morning of Feb. 1. about 7:00 AM and were very tired after a noisy overnight flight. We had requested an early check-in but were told it was denied. Hm, not too happy about that. at 12:00 noon my husband again approached the check-in desk and told them I was close to dying, lol and was told we could get a room with 2 single beds. I thought that was what we wanted in first place. We got room 5063, on the 5.th floor. It was clean and tidy. The chambermaid was a lady from Bangladesh, her name is Shereen (or sounds like ) and she was ever so helpful. The concierge was most helpful, also. We always arrived for breakfast between 7:00 and 8:00 AM and there was no problem with seating and the food was still warm and great. (we always got the full English one) and for a supplement of 4.50 GBP per person, very good value. The six nights we stayed were quiet and peaceful. Excellent value for thr money.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling hotel - believe the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: yorkshire038
Reviews.Content: I travelled to this hotel with my girlfreind through superbreaks and I think it should be taken from their brochure. The room we had was cold and dirty. I actually slept in my jeans and tee-shirt. There was only sheets on the bed and it was a cold weekend, 29th January. The radiator was on but barely aired the room. Although it is only a 3 star and you don't expect anything luxourios you do expect cleanliness. The only good thing to say about the hotel is that it was in a good location. It is not worthy of a one star! and would not recommend this hotel. I am not a fuddy duddy person but a 22 year old who has travelled with work in this country and holidayed in places ranging from Australia, to Amsterdam. and have never stayed in a place like it!

Reviews.Title: “Central London”
Reviews.Author: omer1825
Reviews.Content: Its a Budget hotel in central london, Ideal for tourist as its equidistant to all major tourist attractions, With Russells Square Tube Station within 300 yards. One can be rest assured of travelling conveniently in London

Reviews.Title: “Good, central and cheap”
Reviews.Author: singletravellingmum
Reviews.Content: This was an offer from superbreak: 2 nights plus return rail from York for Â£99 a person. Expected worse due to some reviews on here, but really, it was fine. So breakfast is nothing to write home about, but, if you're hungry, its not inedible! Would definately go back. Its clean and its very central.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe al the bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie-traveller01
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night stay with Thomas Cook through Superbreak for my Mams birthday. We paid only Â£103 per person for 2 nights b&b including rail travel and found this incredible value for money. I was a little apprehensive and not too sure what to expect as I had read all the bad reviews on here. We arrived at the hotel at just before midday on the friday, after a short 10-15 min walk from Kings Cross. The reception area was busy with alot of people however lots of these were just simply hanging around waiting for buses etc. I went to the check in desk and waited no more than 4 mins, I handed over my reservation slip, and was given a card for breakfast and 2 room keys and was told I could go to the rom straight away - I was very impressed as previos reviews advised they couldn't check in till 2pm. The room was very large with 2 single beds and a seperate bathroom and toilet room. Yes the rooms were a little dated and could do with a lick of paint for the price we paid I was very impressed. We walked into theatre land as we had booked a show - it was only a 15-20 min walk away. There is a bus stop right outside with very regular buses into the centre and a tube station just a few inute walk. The room was quite noisy on a night as we faced the main road, however what do people expect it is the centre of London so this didn't bother me. We headed for breakfast early at 7.15am as I had read that people had said it was a free for all, we were greeted by firndly staff and found the breakfast very good and plenty to choose from. There is a sign outside the breakfast room clearly advising people that between 8.30 and 9.30 it gets very busy so to make your stay more enjoyable you may want to think about arranging breakfast around this time. We headed back up to our room about 8am after breakfast and a smoke to find the maids already hard at work, we had clean towels, our beds were made and got more tea and coffee satchets. I had to call reception on the first night as when we arrived from the show and the meal, the room was freezing and the radiators wern't on. A lady was up within 5 mins to turn on the heating - not bad considering 1600 rooms!! -All in all I feel they do a great job keeping the hotel clean, it has 1600 rooms!! -What do people expect for the money?? -Hotel is in a great location - Excellent base, and at the end of the day all we wanted was a shower and a bed! -Good breakfast I will be returning in March on the Superbreal deal as I found it great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: cj83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a mid-week break. The hotel is huge and the lobby is always crammed. We checked in and were given ur room key, only to find cleaners still in the room. I would love to know what they were actually doing in there because the room was awful, with a layer of dust around the skirting boards which looked like it hadn't been touched for months. The bathroom was 1950s style with stains on the toilet bowl and bath, probably from old age! The actual location of the hotel is great, 2 mins from Russell Square station so easy access to all the attractions. The hotel may be cheap but I would not stay there again, there are other cheap hotels that are at least clean!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: boots22
Reviews.Content: Went on a contiki tour which leaves from the Royal National so made sense to stay here the night before and after the tour. We arrived from a very long flight from Australia at around 9 in the morning and came from the airport on the tube. Very easy trip to Russell Square and hotel only a short walk from the tube station. We didn't expect to check in and were told by the uninterested staff that we couldn't check in until the Contiki basement (beside the hotel) was open at 11. Fair enough, we just asked could we leave our bags in storage and were directed to the other desk. We were yelled at by another staff member who said he was tired of young girls leaving their bags and not coming back , he then took us to leave our bags and gave us a dirty look. I do have to wonder why would anyone just leave their bags and not come back but anyway. We went off to explore London. We came back about midday and went to the Contiki basement, got our documents and went back to try and check in. Wouldn't let us again, we had to wait till 2. Ok thats understandable thats when checkin time was but was a little frustrating to have to go out again when we were so jetlagged and tired but off we went to see some more of London. Finally come back at 4 and are allowed to check in. As mentioned in other reviews staff were rude, didn't seem to care and some had some issues speaking english. For this room we were on the 2nd floor and directed to the bank of lifts near reception. We didn't realise how huge this hotel is! Our room ended up being on the second floor in the building opposite reception. We got lost trying to find the room, so many different corridors but finally found the room. The doorknob was falling off the door but the card worked and we got in the room. It was tiny. 2 single beds, tv didn't work, stains all over the carpet, ugh it was bad. It didn't get better in the bathroom, mould everywhere, shower flooded. My friend and I just had to laugh, it was only for one night and we were about to do a contiki tour and felt for sure that there were going to be worse hotels. We stayed again after the tour. This time we were in a different room on the 6th floor. It was much better, no stains, no mould but again only staying for one night so wasn't to fussed. Ultimately I would not stay here again. The only reason we stayed here was because of the tour and if I was to do another tour I would stay at another hotel nearby. The location to russell square tube station was really good. However on looking at some of the photos on the reviews it looks like different parts of the hotel are better then others. It's a gamble but not one that I would take.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, perfectly situated :)”
Reviews.Author: travel_lover_RC
Reviews.Content: I travelled to London for Christmas Shopping last December. The hotel is at the centre of London, just 10 mins away from Oxford Street. Easy to find and easy access. Buses pass frequently and the tube is just few minutes away. as a hotel, we were quite satisfied from the service. clean room, clean sheets and towels. central heating and no problems as regards noise. the only thing that we did not like is the poor variety of the continental breakfast. we did not order the english one as we do not like to eat that type of food in the morning, but the continental breakfast was quite poor, offering only toast, bread, cereals and fruit.... i'd suggest to book english breakfast directly when booking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlett80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with colleagues in January. The hotel was nicely located in Bloomsbury which was close to our conference centre. There were metro stations and bus stops near the hotel so traveling to the city centre (and everywhere else) was easy. There were taxis at the hotel as well. The hotel housed e.g. a souvenir shop and two restaurants. Rooms were pretty clean, although not very large or new. Breakfast was nothing special, but OK. All in all, this was a nice, basic budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant room, poor noise and no english!”
Reviews.Author: lemons22
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a school trip as a pupil, i read some of the reviews on this website and wasnt impressed at all and really wasnt looking forward to my stay, however i was pleasantly suprised. We arrived late on a friday, the outside of the hotel didnt look inviting at all, however the reception was nice, yet not many of the staff spoke english which made it difficult to communicate with them. Next we finally found our room and with much delight it was clean, spacious and quite modern, very impressed compared to the reviews i had previously seen on here, its not the best hotel but surely not the worst. The down side is that breakfast is horrible, no choice unless you pay more for cooked breakfast. And we had a major issue with noise outside, very rowdy and unpleasant when trying to sleep. Also there was a huge safety issue with the windows, they opened fully which ment it was very dangerous and i really think this needs to be improved. Moreover, i do believe overall this was an ok hotel and i would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It was a cheap break in value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bichard
Reviews.Content: The break was Â£99 for two nights bed and breakfast including rail travel so did not expect much from the hotel but it did the stuff. Its location is great and the room was spacious and clean. Breakfast was basic but edible. Down sides were the decor was tired and it was busy with young tourists some of whom were noisey but thats them not the hotels fault. If you are expecting plush then dont go here if you want value for money with easy access to the west end its just right.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe all the bad reviews !”
Reviews.Author: nesterl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a superbreak at the Royal National for two nights, and like others read all the bad reports about this hotel and its 1500 rooms+. We were very pleasantly surprised. The room was larger than expected, clean with a large bathroom, TV and coffee facilities. Check in as quick, we were told you couldnt check in until after 2 and arrived at 11 and were checked in straight away. the hotel is 2 mins from the nearest tube and close to lots of pubs and places to eat. the tube is so quick and easy that we went into the main theatre area of london and found the prices were no more expensive than at home in Leeds (if not cheaper!) pint of beer and a decent glass of wine around Â£7. The breakfast was full english and there was plenty of it, not the best in the world, but certainly have tasted worse. All in all we WOULD recommend this hotel for a mini break if you are on a lowish budget, its not 4 star but certainly worth its 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: aussie87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal National as a pre and post accommodation for a Contiki tour and it did the job we wanted. I stayed with a friend for a 4 nights prior to the tour and found the location to be perfect and only a 20-30 minute walk from the big attractions. The rooms itself was a little worn and the beds were not the best ever but that was not a huge problem for us. Would definatly recommend this property for people looking at doing a contiki as it is so easy in the morning just checking out and walking straight onto the bus.

Reviews.Title: “More than OK Very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: julianana
Reviews.Content: I arrived on December the 13th for 4 nights/5 days trip for my daughter's Bat Mitzva treat/trip.I was with my 3 children on a quatriple room.My expectations were very low since I read some past reviews and actually have been with my husband 14 years ago. But the latest reviews I read here on tripadvisor were actually fine. The location was very very good and central with access to bus stops and the underground station. You can get to and from Heathrew airport but the tube and it is a 5 minute walk till the hotel.There are 2-3 cheap supermarkets nearby open almost 24 hours a day and also a Starbuck's cafe, a Pizza Hut and some other reastaurants for snacks and meals cheap and quick. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the room was very roomy,we had one double bed and 2 single ones.There was a nice bathroom with hot water all the time,a spacious bath tab,lots of towels and we asked in the evening for more and some assistance as well,we got it RIGHT AWAY.The room was warm,we had a kettle and some coffee,tea and milk which I used all the time.The room was sparkling clean !!!There was plenty of room for our luggage.The hotel kept our luggage on the first day free of charge for as long as we needed to get our room ready.On the last day they also kept our luggage for some good 5-6 hours for a simbolic fee of 2 pounds.The only thing that wasn't at our satisfaction was the breakfast.It was very minimal:Just some cereal,jams,butter,buns and toasts,some canned fruit and of course cold and hot drinks.No cheese or ham or some vegetables and/or fruit as we use to consume here in Israel.Of course there was an option of getting an English breakfast platter (all included) for 4.50 pounds which we did twice out of 4.Anyway I think they couls add some kinds of cheese and/or ham and/or fresh veggies and/or fruit.Appart of the breakfast all the rest was really more than Ok. We had a wonderful time with the hotel accomodations as well as our entire trip to London.We will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Only book if you get a cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: stinky1982
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel,think slightly run down travelodge. Breakfast is like a free for all-top tip is to grab a table before you get your food as you will be wandering around for ages looking for one whist you coffee gets cold. Do not pay full price which is Â£93 pounds per night and billed as 3 star which it really is not. Having said that we got a cheap deal through superbreaks and paid Â£99 per person for 2 nights B&B including rail travel from Leeds and the hotel suited our needs as it was really close to Russell Square tube station. But we would have been very pissed off if we had paid full price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful. Just dreadful”
Reviews.Author: drsin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my own from 8th to 11th December for an exam which was happening in the hotel itself. It's the only reason I didn't abandon my deposit and head elsewhere. Arrived early, about 11.30. Granted check in isn't until 2pm, but they couldn't have been less interested when I asked if I could by any chance check in early. "It's not till 2," I was tersely informed. "Baggage room is over there." Would it kill you to say sorry? The hotel is like Piccadilly Circus, bus loads of tourists coming in and out at all times, which makes it uncomfortably busy. Which would be fine, if the drab, run down facade didn't make it seem so cheap that they just bus them in and count the cash. The lobby and dining area is reasonably modern, but that's clearly the only place money has been spent. The rooms and corridors have ancient, fraying carpet, doors and signs circa 1973, no double glazing (a real problem given how much traffic noise there is), etc. No net curtain was a problem as I came in, started getting undressed and realised I was staring into a conference room across the way where everyone could see me! TV didn't work - to be fair I didn't complain about it because I was studying, but it's still shoddy. Shower pressure is good - this is the most positive thing I can say about the bathroom. Towels were soiled, rough, and too small. Two or three packets of soap I can only presume was prison surplus. What to say about the chambermaid service? I had no Do Not Disturb sign in my room. I'm sorry, since when was this code for please barge into my room at bloody 8.30 in the morning without so much as a knock??!!! Yes, I'm still in my pyjamas, get the hell out!! She came back twice between then and 10.30 despite my having told her twice that I was checking out that day. Complaints, again, met with blank stares and a most grudging apology. I work in a large public hospital that does a much better English breakfast than this place offered. Overall, one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had, and I'm comparing it to the depths of Siberia, the Mongolian plains and some true dives in South East Asia. Location may be central but it's just not worth putting up with. Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Tr4vel
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I wanted to write a really positive review about this place. I was sure all the negative comments would be unjustified and first impressions proved positive. Yes there were lots and lots or people from all nationalities milling around and there was a chaotic edge to it, a bit like an airport, but when we got there at lunchtime we were able to check our bags into left luggage quite quickly. We returned at 5pm and there was no queue to check in so again, nothing painless there. Our room took some finding as the place is absolutely huge. The room itself was a good size, pretty functional but was expecting nothing else. Staying positive, the breakfast was nice and there was plenty of it - a full English included in our deal but the foreigeners had to pay for it, which was great as it meant that the queue for the hot food was tiny. Finding a table wasn't too bad but be prepared to sit side by side with strangers, just like in a packed school hall or works canteen. Back to the room... and the negatives. Unfortunately the window, when shut, provided little insulation from the noise outside. I'd even shut the air vent at the top but it made no difference. We overlooked the main courtyard, where there were non-stop comings and goings and it did echo a lot which meant you could hear a lot of noise. On top of this, the hotel hires out conference rooms on the evening and on the Saturday night there was a lot of rowdiness due to a party on the ground floor which went on well into the early hours of the morning. All of those I suppose I could live with but there were other problems which spoilt it for me. The TV didn't work at all which was a shame. But, the biggest thing for me was the electrics. I'm guessing the TV itself was ok but the socket was broken. I was unable to swap it with the only other socket in the room as the plug just wouldnt fit in for some reason. The other socket worked ok at first as we plugged our hairdryer into it but on the last day the socket was dead. Didn't work at all, so it meant we were left with wet hair and no charge in my phone. It's therefore impossible to recommend this place, unless you aren't bothered about making use of an electric socket and in this day and age, who of us aren't? Oh, and there was also the issue of theft. I left a handful of change on the table as I didn't want it weighing my pocket down on the second day but the cleaner obviously helped herself to it. Granted I shouldn't have left it out, but really she had no right to see it as a tip! So... unfortunately all those people who said this place is nothing more than a hostel were right. It's fine for schoolbus loads of foreign students (and there were many of those) and backpackers but I'd rather pay for a hotel where things work.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: brig31
Reviews.Content: Just have to say, nothing wrong with this hotel, just returned from a3 night break and it was fine. Dont know what some people are expecting for what you pay for this place. Room was fine, good size, bit dated but perfectly adequate. Breakfast was fine with plenty of choices and as much as you could eat. Lots of kids around as previous posters have said but all perfectly well behaved. Great location, only mins from the subway. If you are going there, dont be put off by the negative reviews on here, I can assure you, for what you pay its great ( As long as you didnt pay 300 quid per night). Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: 2robertsons
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stay here for 2 nights for a 18th birthday treat and after reading reviews were pleasantly surprised by what we found.not the most stylish looking hotel..(very 70s if you get me) but inside definately better than out.the staff were friendly and helpful,and the recetion and lobby/bar area were clean and appealing.our room was on the second floor facing out onto the road...it was clean and comfortable,2 beds and a seperate bathroom and toilet,both very clean and suitably equipt for there purpose.Bedtime tho was the only downside...because of the location the traffic noise played a major part in a rather sleepless night,single glazing i think,the corridoors were quiet enough tho despite the huge number of guests. We paid for a full engish breakfast and although the restaurant area was busy(understandable in a hotel of this size)the food was very nice...self service hot food,cereals,toast etc,various beverages and plenty to go round,even if you wanted seconds.the restaurant staff were friendly and efficient and the plates were cleared almost immediately.We returned to clean tidy room,thanks to the maid service which was nice. As we were checking out early but had a wait for out train(sightseeing opportunity) we left our bags in a secure room at the cost of 50p per item much cheaper than the Â£8 left luggage charge!! in all i personally think you get MORE than you pay for,we went on a superbreak and paid just under Â£220 for both of us inc train fairs and bed n full engish breakfast.i previously read very bad reviews for this hotel and had to wonder what people were expecting for what they paid....yes the room was quite noisy at night but its central london,this is the only fault i could find and would recommend this hotel in a flash,infact my hubby and i are planning another visit there in the spring. so for anyone thinking of using this hotel i'd say this ,its central 2mins fron russel square tube,its clean and it basically has everything you could want from a hotel of its star rating........i think maybe people wanting more should try paying the huge amount more for the name of the hotel theres always The Ritz lol.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: karenjs75
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a cheap weekend stay at the Royal National. I asked for a quiet re-furbished room and the hotel staff complied with my request. For the price we paid (Â£99 per adult b&b with train travel) I think the Royal National was fantastic value for money. The hotel is the biggest in London, is constantly busy, so you are not going to get 5* personal service, but if you go prepared for a bit of a rush at breakfast, then you should have very little to complain about. I did have one of the re-furbished rooms. It was clean and in good condition. We were on the top floor, so it was quiet (other than the street noise you get in central London) and we had the full English at breakfast which would be well worth the Â£4.50 supplement if your deal includes only continental. Weekend mornings seem particularly busy - Monday was noticeably quieter, so a mid-week stay might be the best bet. I would definitely go back and I will recommend the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, basic but clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: moorpark64
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the reviews. My friends and I have just come back from a 3 night stay and found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. Shower would blow you away. Only complaint - no heating in DECEMBER. Draughty windows - they need replacing with double glazing. We were right on a main road, very noisy. Breakfast was a free for all, by the time you get served and find a table, food cold. Otherwise we got what we paid for. Central for the theatre we were going to see Jersey Boys - not to be missed? a wonderful show. Clean towels in hotel every morning and room tidied satisfactorily. Think If I visited London again though I'd go more central to the attractions. All in all good value for money but busy.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD, BASIC HOTEL, YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR”
Reviews.Author: lynsayk
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of this hotel I was extremely apprehensive about our stay but I stayed at this hotel with my 17 yr old daughter and 3 yr old neice for a weekend in November and we had a great time. The hotel reception staff were efficient but not very friendly. Our room was clean, tidy and more than acceptable. It was cleaned/tidied each day when we were out and we were left clean towels each time. We didnt have breakfast on Sat morning as the queue was VERY long and we didnt want to wait, We had a cooked breakfast on the Sunday and it was very nice. There was a good selection to choose from and all was hot and tasty. The only complaints I have is while my daughter was getting dressed on Sat morning the housekeeping knocked on our door and instantly entered. The chamberperson apologised and left right away. Also, the walls are very thin and we could hear people in the next room coughing.This is a great hotel for a shopping/theatre weekend and my family and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal budget hotel. clean and central”
Reviews.Author: 687008g
Reviews.Content: after reading previous reviews we were concerned about this hotel, however we found this hotel fine for a budget hotel in London, I have stayed in worse 4 star hotels in London! and payed a lot more for poorer service. We arrived at the hotel at 11am our room was ready, it was basic, but clean, the bathroom was a decent size and once again very clean. the hotels public arears were clean and tidy. All the staff I encountered were friendly and well mannered, I did however see customrs being very rude to the staff, in life you give respect to gain respect. Breakfast was fine, a basic English breakfast and a selection of cereals, toast, rolls and jams, fruit segments. we were down for breakfast before 8am and had no queues and a very clean dining area. The hotel has a bar in the south side and a Large London Pub in the North side, both were fine with reasonable priced drinks If you want to feel pampered with luxurious surrondings I suggest you book 5 star in London, howevr if you want a clean, central budget 3 star hotel you cant go wrong with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “you pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: blondie33WildTourist
Reviews.Content: we got a cheap deal at local travel shop 99 train and hotel 2 nights. we arrived to queues which is all day and night. we had 4 rooms between 13 of us 2 family's rooms which was 3 small single beds and a camp bed which the kids refused to sleep in. one room was not cleaned when we got there it looked like someone had been having a party in there we rang down to reception and they said it would be sorted out. Great location for tube and buses 10 mins away from kings cross. we were out all day came back around 10pm the room hadn't been done which when you have 5 kids with you is'nt ideal. breakfast was horrendous like cold rubber the staff are really unfriendly so we went to a nearby cafe for our breakfast the next day which was great. so for the price we paid we did'nt complain but if i was paying the full price of something like 110 per room i would not be happy

Reviews.Title: “Basic warm and good location....”
Reviews.Author: HUG13
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a 'weekend rail deal' and this is exactly what we got - a deal! The rooms are basic and warm. This hotel is closely located to all London's sight seeing exhibits. If you are wanting to book somewhere to impress then I wouldn't reccommend, however, if its only a room to you then book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like jail”
Reviews.Author: keefnyc
Reviews.Content: This was simply a price buy on our part with a good rate for London through BA.com. It's a giant hotel right by Russel Sq, convenient to Kings X and the Piccadilly Line Tube. Other than that, it's pretty much a horrible stay. The single beds are suitable for a chlld under 10, not adults. There is this courtyard in the middle which looked like a jailyard, it was just missing the weights.
