Reviews.Content: we stayed here on the 6th december 2007 and found it to be really ok, the room was on the 6th floor but this was no problem as the lifts were very efficient, the room was clean as was the beds and bedding with plenty of clean towels in the bathroom. the breakfast was eggs, bacon ,sausage, beans tomato toast. there was fruit and cereals tea coffee and juice it was plenty to keep you going. i would stay here again. there was a big queue at check in but it went down quickly and no queue for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “eh, okay!”
Reviews.Author: dubtourist
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay in this property due to the fact that the tour I had booked left early the next morning. I had read the previous reviews here on tripadvisor and thought long and hard before deciding to book it. Due to flight delays, I didn't arrive at the hotel until 12.30am and was up again at 6am, so it was a brief stay. When I arrived, I was greeted by the noise from a pub across the road, although being tired, it didn't bother me at all! I checked in and asked for a non smoking room and the service at the reception desk was quick and efficient. I made my way up to the room and the first thing I noticed was that the corridors were very dated looking although it has to be said that they were clean and well maintained. I entered the room and felt like I had steped back in time! The room was straight out of the 70's. Again however, it was spotlessly clean and was in very good condition albeit old fashioned. This also applied to the bathroom. I would suggest that if anyone is looking for a basic hotel in a central location, this hotel is okay - clean and well kept and I would recommend it if you get it at the right price!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: xoxwickedxox
Reviews.Content: I went to stay in the royal national hotel and had a great time! The rooms were clean and the service was great... My friend and I were there for a night and they very kindly put my in the same room as her as I hadn't booked at the same time as her! The sheets were clean and the bathroom was roomy and clean. The maid was there first thing in the morning (thankfully we were already at breakfast) Alover very good but breakfast was a bit of disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Guudd! A+”
Reviews.Author: Wicked__Elphiee
Reviews.Content: I Think Everyone Is Far Too Fussy! When My Friend And I Went We Had A Lovely Time. Staff Were Friendly And Room's Were Clean. Huever Got A noisy, Wet, Damp, Smelly Room Then Either Maids Werent Having A Guudd Dayy Or Everyonee Is Just Again Too Fussyy. Whyy Cant Peoplee Just Be A Littlee Bitt Gratefull? :O Ending On A Guudd Note Tho! I Went To See Wicked While I Was There And Everything Was Just Amazin' A+++

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and basic”
Reviews.Author: All-around-the-globe
Reviews.Content: Pros - Great location, a 1 minute walk to the Russell Square tube (subway) station (the Piccadilly line), walking distance from many central London's attractions. The bathroom in our room looked like it has been renovated lately. Cons - someone wrote here on tripadvisor.com - "is it a hotel or a bus station"? well, I couldn't agree more. As for the hotel looks - it could use a serious update. seems like time has stopped in the 1970s there. Our room was very basic, like a youth-hostel room (apart from the bathroom which I mentioned earlier). The hotel has over 1600 rooms (this fact is mentioned on their publications), so there are always lines. A line for checking in, a line for checking out, a L-O-N-G line for breakfast, a line for the luggage room, you get the point. The morning we arrived, at about 11 am, we waited for about 20 minutes till we got to the check-in counter. We were told the room isn't ready yet. When we asked if we could at least complete the check in procedure so we could have the room key for later we were told it's impossible and were asked to come back "anytime after 14:00". We left our luggage in the luggage room (not a room, but an unused huge convention hall) and went out. We got back to the hotel at around 15:00. The check in line was SO long we decided to go out again and come back later. Finally, at 19:00, after a (short) 10 minutes line, we got our room. BTW, this was a $150 USD per night room. Continental breakfast was horrible (and I'm not picky with food).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious, Cheap”
Reviews.Author: dippy1257
Reviews.Content: Ok when we arrived it did resemble a check-in queue at the airport! We had to wait about 20 mins to get checked in which when we did it went soomthly, i booked this for myself & 2 sisters. It cost Â£136.00 for us for 1 night! We went to see Dirty Dancing at the Theatre it was a great base for 1 night, we would stay again. The room was clean i was expecting a camp bed for the 3rd bed in the room but was very suprised that there was 1 double & 2 singles in the room with plenty of space! Room was clean so was the W/C room & the main bathroom area. I did find the room cold when going to bed as the heating wasn't on even though it was November, but there is blankets in the wardrobe. Breakfast- It was a buffet style breakfast that you can choose what you have i thought it was very tasty, Staff are friendly & polite. I would stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “I was lucky!”
Reviews.Author: Surprised
Reviews.Content: I was lucky - and quite surprised after reading some of the horrid reviews. - no queue at Reception on arrival or departure (though there were very long queues at other times) - a smiling receptionist who gave me two keys without my asking (my husband was arriving later) - a room quite close to the lift, not along one of the very long corridors - no rowdy people at night (of which I was fearful seeing some of the large groups) - clean room and bathroom that looked as though they'd been renovated/refurbished quite recently The hotel, including the breakfast room, seemed like a cross between a 1970s Moscow hotel and a busy railway station, but it was the cheapest and most convenient place I could find at short notice. It seems a bit down-market even compared with its sister-hotel, the Tavistock, just up the street - where I often stay and, while basic, is OK with quite nice Art Deco public areas .. and it's even a couple of pounds cheaper. A 'basic' - though not a horror - experience for me (and my husband), especially as I'd been expecting the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hygeine, dissinterested staff”
Reviews.Author: theatregoer41
Reviews.Content: The room was damp, mouldy, noisy and uncomfortable. The sheets were dirty and had holes. when we mentioned this to recepetion they offered us a 'comment form' with a mundane tone indicating this was as regular an occurance as offering newspapers. The Duty Manager then blamed housekeeping for not informing them, and us for not telling them sooner (somehow I doubt that much mould and grime accumulated overnight! and we didn't know about the sheets and pillowcases until we were actually undressed and in bed) As many other reviewers have commented, the restaurant (or rather canteen) is very poor. You queue for around 20 minutes on average for a poor quality, luke warm breakfast. There is very little choice, no fresh fruit, grey coffee, watered down juice etc. London is of course expensive, especially in the centre, but if you shop around you can find much better quality for around the same price or less. Don't risk it!

Reviews.Title: “poor service, basic rooms and appalling staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: WillowTheWhisp
Reviews.Content: I recently accompanied my coach driver husband on a trip to London from Lancashire with a party going to see a London show and stayed in this hotel overnight. Upon our arrival, despite the fact that the party organiser had confirmation of the booking, the staff seemed unable to find any record of it and we were left standing in the foyer whilst something was sorted out. I was appalled that there was nowhere to sit, especially as some members of the party were quite clearly having difficulty standing for so long. When one disabled lad was no longer able to stand and slumped to the floor by the side of the reception desk a member of staff came storming out of the door yelling that he had knocked papers off a desk at the other side of the wall and that he'd been 'at it all day'. An impossibility as we'd been travelling down from Lancashire most of the day, but it certainly felt like we'd been there all day. I suggested the fault lies not with the guests but with the poor structure of the hotel 'walls' as the same thing quite clearly happens with other people. Far from being yelled at the lad deserved an apology for having been made to stand there for so long. When we finally did get our keys and found our way to the rooms I was appalled by the state of the room. To say that it was basic is an understatement. I am amazed that the hotel had managed to acquire 3 stars. The furnishings, such as they were, a basic laminated chip board 'dressing table' and laminated chip board panels attached to the wall in lieu of headboards, were dirty and there was mould on the ceiling in the bathroom. Although a kettle was provided in the room it took over 20 minutes to warm up and then switched off before it reached boiling point. It would have been impossible to make a cup of tea. The advertised hair drier was non-existant. My husband, the coach driver, had enquired how long we could leave the coach in the hotel courtyard and was told that it would be OK to leave it there whilst we checked in. We then took it to an overnight coach park at the end of Bayswater Road. The following morning we left the party having breakfast and went to pick up the coach. Some of them had not finished by the time we returned and so we sat at one of the outdoor tables with the party organiser to have a drink of hot chocolate and wait for them. When the organiser went off to look for people one of the staff came up to my husband and told him to move the coach as it shouldn't be left there. He replied that we'd just brought it in to pick people up. The staff member then said that the coach had been there for well over an hour which was not permitted. I pointed out that less than half an hour earlier the coach had been in a coach park at the end of Bayswater Road, whereupon he accused me of lying saying that he had seen it there himself an hour earlier. It had been there well over an hour the previous evening whilst the reception staff kept us waiting for the keys to our rooms, nothing was said about it then. The chap then went off and spoke to a member of our party who informed us that he'd asked her if this was her coach and when she'd replied that it was he told her. "That's your driver over there. He isn't looking after you properly." She knew exactly where the driver was as she'd spoken to us moments earlier when my husband had been asking if she knew how many people had still to finish breakfast. The toilet facilities in the hotel seem to be a bit thin on the ground. The gents toilets at one side were not even working on the Saturday morning and the hand dryers in the ladies were neither use nor ornament. The loo paper was that cheap and nasty variety all hard and horrible. I have never come across such ignorant and offensive hotel staff anywhere in the world. Nor have I come across such a basic hotel which has somehow managed to acquire 3 stars. We certainly won't be returning and will be advising everyone we know to avoid it and the other hotels in their group which presumably are of the same appalling quality. Had the staff been a little more courteous and helpful perhaps the lack of some of the basics could have been overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Going great until one bad night”
Reviews.Author: YFE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and then 6 nights before and after a tour. - the room was clean - good amount space for the price - great location - good breakfast - poor staff service in lobby - good staff in breakfast room - decent breakfast - fairly quiet... except one night where a group of students went on a rampage throughout the lifts/corridors until 4am and security was nowhere in sight even though the ambulance came and picked up an alcohol overdosed kid. The area was filthy the next morning, broken glass everywhere and when i went to check out that morning i was told i should of come down the night before if i wanted any compensation! I was (being alone, female and only 18) NOT leaving my room at midnight with those people running around to complain to reception which may have been closed.

Reviews.Title: “wish i hadnt read the reviews after id paid for the room!”
Reviews.Author: scarlettslim
Reviews.Content: i agree with most of the reviews already held. the bathroom was very clean, although only one towel each and no heat , so it was damp from the night before. the room consisted of two rock hard beds and a camp bed for the 'free' child. unfortunately my free child, although only 13, happens to weigh about 7 stone and is five foot 10 so a small camp bed was far too small. it had a very thin mattress which as bumpy as hell. i know this as i swapped with him half way thru the night. his bed had a cotton sheet and a thin rug for covering and no pillow - he had to pinch one of ours. fitting the 3rd bed in made the room very cramped. breakfast itself, although unexciting, was fairly tasty and filled us up till the evening but the restaurant is like a school canteen and about as noisy. not a relaxing start to a day out. we only stayed one night but have another break for 2 nights already booked and i shall be doing my utmost to swap to another hotel if the tour op will let me

Reviews.Title: “Really bad.”
Reviews.Author: sidsilva
Reviews.Content: I was with my wife by end of September/2007. The hotel is huge with "thousands". The reception staff was friendly but we had to wait as there were too many people arriving at the same time. By the way it is always like this every day. The room was small and more or less clean. It looked old. First trouble: No heating so the room was very cold in the night. We tried to exchange the room but the only one available for a couple had also troubles with the heating. The next day we finally exchange for one room with two single beds so we got a heating. In all rooms the matresses are terrible and old The breakfest is an adventure by itself. You have two different kind of breakfest: The continental and the English. The basice diference is the english has some eggs, beans and sausage. You have to carry all the time a paper that proves the kind of the breakfest you paid and you have to present this paper minimum three times: One in the entrance of the restaurant, one when you take the line (again a line...) and again to the cashier. Just stupid. The people at the restaurant are all arrogant and not friendly. They act like they are doing a favor in serving some food to you. I am sure for the same money you can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Price, Great for the Location”
Reviews.Author: AthensTraveler1971
Reviews.Content: That was the second time for us in Royal National. We arrived late in the evening and surprisingly out double bed room had transformed to a twin one. Their excuse was that they were the same!!!!! (In which world???). They offered to move us in a double one the next day but we didnâ€™t bother in order to avoid the mess. There was a third sofa bed in our room but they quickly removed it on demand. The location is perfect (but there are many more hotels in the Russell sq. area). The price is ok (100 euros/night). Breakfast is plain even if you pay the extra pounds for the â€œEnglishâ€� one. My conclusion: I would stay for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean city hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastAngliaCookie
Reviews.Content: Booked to see Mamma Mia and needed one night stay in London. Booked the Royal National and was pleasantly suprised.. the rooms were clean and quite big, the location was perfect for anyone wanting to be close to all the bright lights of the city.. underground just few mins from hotel. The breakfast room is light and airy, plenty of choice from cereal, toast to the full english if wanted. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joanneba
Reviews.Content: The location of thie hotel is excellent for anyone on a site seeing tour of London. The room was spacious and clean. The staff were extremely polite and friendly, and the tour operators on the buses outside were great! The only fault would be the restaurant - not great but did the trick. We'll be back to finish our site seeing trip of London next year.

Reviews.Title: “horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: shellpen
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night recently and im glad it wasnt one night longer! our room backed onto the hotel square which made it extremely noisy because of the bar outside. there was also a lot of noise from the corridor outside the room and the lift, as our room was right next to it! the food in both the restaurant in the evening and at breakfast was no better than canteen standard and felt more like a university refectory than a london hotel. i dont understand how this is a 3 star hotel, i wont be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Slinkyhalfling
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a place to lay your head, this is it. Superb location - right next to Russell Square tube station and a 24hr Tesco. Hotel is immense, seemed to be constantly busy. Doesn't deserve it's star rating, is really just a Travelodge in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “A bad option”
Reviews.Author: amoreno
Reviews.Content: If you travel with your gang (football, school,..), that hotel will be suitable. But if you look for a comfortable and quite place to stay, think again! This hotel is ugly, noisy and the stuff is rude and incompetent. I have made a reservation for a triple room, they gave me a double with a lousy extra-bed. I have asked for the complaint book and they didnâ€™t give to me. Now, you are able to understand why they want your money in advance! In Russell Square area you have much better for a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “honest review”
Reviews.Author: worldplus
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of hotels and this is the worst 3 star I have stayed in, albeit you have to knock off 1 star for all london hotels. The Hotel is very large, and this in itself is problematic. the Hotel itself reminds me of a military barracks, the size, function and meal facilities. On checking in, it was a massive free for all, no queing, with the Staff appearing to pick and choose who they should see next. There are no ironing facilities available in the Room. Although there is 1 iron and ironing board available for the whole hotel set in a room next to 202. My room was about the furthest from reception, but that can't be helped. Unfortunately the window was jammed open and the noise outside was terrific. So I had to do the trek back with luggage. I had to fight to get seen again and to get another room, also very far away. The room itself was basic, and generally not too bad, but the bathroom needed a lot to be desired. A lot of mould and the showerhead was welded in position facing a wall, so you had to do gymnastics to get a shower. No shower gel was available, merely bars of soap. Only basic tea and coffee facilities, and not much of that. No satellite TV available. Breakfast was awful, even the full english. It was in a cafeteria type setting, with all the tables pushed together, again very reminscent of a military setting. The food was 'dumped' on your plate, no self service. Both beans and tomatoes had run out and the eggs were very weary looking. One tiny sausage was eventually found, hiding underneath a bean. The Tea and Coffee were out of an urn (I told you it was military), although to be fair the Tea was fine. I couldn't find any sachets of Suger, only to find they had dispensers on each table to fit in with the general surroundings. The fruit drinks were watered down, but this is usual practice in many London hotels. Again, at check out, if you wanted them to look after your luggage, it was 50p. Not much, but I have never known any other hotel to make a charge. On return, there were dozens of bags of luggage and I was told to find my own! Check out was prompt and quick. If you are not paying the full rate, and are not staying too long, then this is probably okay for a night, possibly two. However, if you are paying full rate or for a longer period - look elsewhere. I have stayed at some dives worse than this, but paid appropriately less. I doubt if I could bring myself to stay here again. Its sister hotel on the corner is superior.

Reviews.Title: “Good Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Petar17
Reviews.Content: This summer my family and I were on holiday in London. One of the most difficult decisions was to choose a hotel.After hours and hours searching on the Internet, we finally booked a room in Royal National Hotel. It was recommended to as, but we had no idea about the hotel. When we arrived we had to wait until 2p.m. Fortunately, we decided to confirm our reservation which helped later when we checked in. When we entered our room we were amazed, It was clean and tidy. There was a TV and bathroom was the clean. The brekfast was continental or English. The organisation was great. There was even a room when people can leave their luggage. As whole it is an Eropean standart hotel=

Reviews.Title: “little better than a student hostel”
Reviews.Author: WirralMeg
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for weekend in London as it is three stars so should be of a reasonable quality, and is near Euston Station. We also read Tripadvisor reviews, but they did not prepare us for our dreadful experience. I asked for a quiet room and was offered one overlooking the courtyard, which sounded fine. We were allocated a room on the 7th floor, away from the lift. So far so good we thought. The room was small and basically furnished as was the bathroom (the bath mat was badly stained!), but it was all clean and there was plenty of hot water. Little did we know (and we were not informed by reception staff) that 'the courtyard' is populated by bars in which young visitors congregate and drink well into the night - they were still shrieking at 4am on Sunday morning. In addition coaches drive into 'the courtyard' to collect and deliver passengers, as they were at 6.30am this Sunday. The final experience was breakfast. This took place in the huge Windsor room and was 'organised' like school dinners. The food was acceptable - just - but very basic, e.g. dried out bacon, etc.......... and we had to search to find somewhere to sit on both mornings. We would never return and, unless you are mid to late teens or a very heavy sleeper, we would advise against staying at this hotel which is the worst we have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Borofc1
Reviews.Content: If it is the center of London you are after at a cheap price then look no further than the Royal national. having just come back from spending three nights in London. As like most people I read the reviews and was a bit worried, but when we got there it was like most revies stated the hotel is big so therefore check in did take a bit of time, the room we were first given was next to the lifts and was very noisy. I went to reception and asked to change rooms and they could not of been more helpful. If you do have a family then ask for a room on the road facing north tower level 7, very little noise. the rooms themselves are ok but at the price we paid it is what we expected. Breakfast was ok again what we expected, but again you will have to que. Avoid any rooms on the inside of the hotel as the bar is very noisy and is open until 2am. the underground is but a stones throw away and with access to all the major London sites in a matter of minutes. Overall I would say the Hotel is a budget hotel so do not expect the Ritz the staff are very helpful and the location perfect for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and great value”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Eleanor
Reviews.Content: Wow, for Â£68 a night in central London, this hotel was great value. The room was nicely decorated and clean, and everything - booking, check-in, check-out, breakfast, grabbing a coffee with friends - was quick and efficient. A couple of gripes but nothing major. I found a stray hair (not mine!) in the bathtub, which otherwise looked clean. Food and drink at breakfast was fairly basic (no hot croissants here) but at this price I didn't care. The hotel is enormous and it would be easy to get lost but the staff were helpful in giving directions. For example, the hotel is really close to Russell Square tube but you have to choose the right one out of four exits or you could be wandering around Bloomsbury for ages (although the Bloomsbury area is quite nice, I suppose). Lucky I asked the doorman. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel,Good Location but in need of a refurb !”
Reviews.Author: Kezzab67
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (family of 4 105pounds inc breakfast) Great location 5 mins to Euston & Russell Square Tube. Beware this is a HUGE hotel ! Staff were friendly and check in was a breeze. The room was clean(ish) and a good shower but we had a room over the main road, so not much sleep ! The hotel is dated and in need of a refurb! Cases can be left for free prior to check in and only 50p when you depart. We had an English breakfast, the dining room was more like a factory canteen than a hotel, food slapped onto your plate and watered down juice. Anyway - you get what you pay for ! Not bad for a one night stay in a good location, but don't expect a lot else !

Reviews.Title: “one night was enough”
Reviews.Author: smileySydney
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night in this hotel as it was a stop over. I don't think I could have stayed any longer. The staff was friendly and the room was mostly clean, although the shower was a bit dirty . The room was tiny and felt like a prison cell. I was lucky the other bed was empty other wise my suitcase I would have had to put my case half way in the bathroom. My room overlooked the courtyard so the choice was either open the window and be kept awake by the noise or close the window and put up with a very stuffy room

Reviews.Title: “Backpackers nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Travel07Perth
Reviews.Content: Brenda from Perth WA. My husband and I took our grandson on a wonderful 4 week site seeing holiday. The only part of our holiday that was spoilt was our stay at the Royal National. I refuse to call it a hotel as that suggests that its part of the "hospitality trade" and we received NO hospitality from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. On the contrary the staff were rude and ignorant. We booked for 3 nights and only stayed because there was no where else to go. It was Wimbledon week and the Hotels in the metro area were fully booked. We arrived at the Royal National at 9am (our flight got into Heathrow at 6am) after standing in one of the 4 long queues at the check in deck and asking politely if we could check in our cases, I was told by an unsmiling abrupt young woman that I could not check in until 2pm followed by a glare and "DO YOU UNDERSTAND" Well yes I did understand even thought it wasn't me that was speaking in a foreign accent. We returned to the check in deck queues at 2pm and was given the key and directions to the lift in the same manner as before from a different young woman. We had booked and paid for a triple room and was given a very small twin room. I returned to the check in desk and said they had made a mistake. I was told there was no mistake they were bringing a roll away bed to put into this room. When I said there is no room for another bed I was told there is, we always use that room as a triple. Housekeeping brought another bed and even they had great difficulty in squashing it into this room, leaving it so all 3 beds were butted up against each other and we had to climb over the top of them as there was no room around them. My Husband asked to speak to the manager of which there appeared to be none, a supervisor did eventually come out of a room at the rear of the check in deck, only to tell him there are no other rooms available, and if he wasn't happy with the room to contact our travel agent in Australia or go somewhere else. We were shocked but did manage to get the number of the wholesale agent in London who said they would look into it. I don't know if it was the agent or the fact that we said we would contact health and safety regarding squashing three beds into a twin room (making one large bed) that caused them to suddenly find a triple room, your guess is as good as mine. We were told that the triple room had been trashed and had just been repainted, and if we could stand the smell of the paint we could have this room instead. We took the room despite the smell and the tacky furnishings as it was a triple room with some space to move as well as space between the beds. Overall the impolite and uncaring attitude of the staff throughout our stay made the whole situation worse. A little understanding, a smile, a comment of "we will try our best" is all they need to offer any paying guest. This would make a world of difference and let's face it that is what the hospitality trade is all about. "HOSPITALITY" I suggest that the owners and staff learn the meaning of the word or get out of the trade. I agree with the comments other guests have written regarding the noise, breakfast, the shabbiness, and unsupervised behavior of some young guests. Quite honestly I feel even the "Backpackers" should think twice before booking in there. Needless to say we will never stay there again nor will we ever recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SpringLily
Reviews.Content: It was ok, the room was clean (altough the cleaning woman does not work on saturday...) and it is very close to Russel Square tube station, post office and Tesco supermarket. The staff is ok, not really friendly, not even bad...the breakfast is the typical continental breakfast: bread, butter and jam. It's annoying that the cleaning woman knocks your door at 8 am wanting you to go out quickly...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: djartzt
Reviews.Content: This place is ridiculously busy and the rooms are like prison cells...Completely outdated. We paid to stay there, but I couldn't bare the thought so we just left and stayed somewhere else. Horrible. Probably ok if you are 18 and on a strict budget and don't really care about the way the room looks or that there are 100 people at one time in the lobby... Families and vacationers should stay away if you want something nice. This is the absolute opposite of that. Horrible horrible.

Reviews.Title: “just basic but ok”
Reviews.Author: juliablackrun
Reviews.Content: the hotel is huge but its an ideal place if your only going for one night and its a base for u ... we did not spend anytime in the room all we did is get change and sleep there ..the bedlinen is clean and so is the bathroom ... i went with girls but i defo would pay more if it was a romantic getaway and stay somewhere else . so to sum it up if your going for 1night spending most of your time walking around london and then going out in the eve till late and just want a clean fresh bed this is the place for u ... oh yeah breeakfast was bad but we got up early and headed for a starbucks..

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! dont stop here”
Reviews.Author: tracker822
Reviews.Content: Well, its finally happened, I have stayed at the worst hotel, ever! Staying as a group with the girls and booked by a member of family with train and show tickets. check in was fine with a pleasant member of staff, our rooms were not ready, so we placed our bags and checked in later. We retrieved our bags later on and went to our rooms, which were very basic but really clean, bathroom just average ok in the scheme of things, a budget hotel after all, what do you want right? Ok ,so far so good, then, got ready and went to the bar for a drink, at this point you really started to notice how many guests were coming and going, I mean droves of them, by the coachload. We ordered a drink, which were really good value and sat down. We tried to go into an outside seating area, opposite the bar,as it was so busy, it was like being in a departure lounge at an airport I was told they had lost the key, it was hot so we asked a member of staff if the aircon was on, he told us the owners could not afford to put the aircon on and if we were hot to go outside! You have to imagine it was like a carpark with coaches and buses coming and going all of the time. We had one drink and left, on our return, you guessed there was still coaches, by the bucket loads, coming and going. We went to bed and all was well till 0130, when the noise of shouting, screaming woke us up. I looked out the window and loads of people appeared to be having a party, on their own windowsill. They had the window opened wide and were shouting and screaming to each other from one side of the hotel to the other, spanish by the sounds of it. This went on for ages and lasted till around 0330. We tried reception said they had several complaints already and were sending members of staff up but nothing seemed to work. Anyway we got up and went, bloodshot eyed, to breakfast. Think, staff canteen/ on a very bad day with a voucher for either continental/buffet. The chap at the entrance was like a bouncer at a seedy club, putting his arm in front of guests, until they showed him tickets, his mate was walking up and down the full english queue, pulling the unfortunates out if they did not have the ticket! The breakfast was horrible, they could have had mine, the breakfast room was like clapton juntion, that was where all the bus loads went! Unfortunately we had to stop another night, we had more of the same and got woke up with a early call, which we didnt request. The cleaner banged on the door for at least two minutes, when I answered, she asked in very broken english, how long would it be before I left the room, er Hello!! It was a SUNDAY AT 0740! I told her, she gave me a disgusted look and pointed to the do not disturb door hanger, I should have hung it on the door, silly me. We also had to put our bags in the waiting area until it was time to leave, we waited in a queue for 20 minutes, only to get the front and told it was full up so go over the road and put in that one, at 50p a pop. I complained and was told by a flustered member of staff to leave it at the station it I didnt like it, fair do's. So, budget hotel all be it but no excuse at all the everthing else. It was a waste of time complaining, as the staff did not care at all, even the duty manager, he was the one who told me to go the station. Anyway, if you fancy a bit of themed accommodation, ''Concentration Camp'' mini break, this really is the hotel for you guys. Fill your boots.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel... for the price you pay!”
Reviews.Author: Stimplicius
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this hotel just because it's cheap and has a good location. Having these 2 thibgs in consideration i should say it was a good choice. The hotel is clean and it's very central (200mts from the tube, or you can go walking to Oxford Street). The breakfast is awfull, but we were not expecting much for the price we paid. I recomend the hotel if you want something central and not too expensive. But if you want something quiet and calm...avoid it! Too many students and kids. I loved my vacantions! The hotel is....OK!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel's Not the Problem, It's the Teenage Guests!!”
Reviews.Author: RuthHRabin
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 45) and I (age 69) spent nine days at the Royal National in mid-July, 2007. I would like to give our honest assessment of the place. I will start by saying that it is not as bad as most of the reviews. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel and don't mind large tour groups then don't worry. It is very efficiently run and has a large concierge desk with a pleasant staff. It is the only inexpensive thing you will find in London! First, the negatives: there are large teenage tour groups from all over the world, teenagers take over the hotel. They fill up the lobby and the elevators. Don't even think about going into the London Pub! Twice we were kept awake because they were yelling at each other through the windows. I did call down to complain and the yelling soon stopped. The twin bedded room we shared was small. There was an adequate closet but drawer space was limited so that we had to keep some things in suitcases. There were chairs to put these on so we managed ok. Rooms are not air conditioned but it was a cool week so we really didn't need it, opening the window made it comfortable. The room lacked a full length mirror but that is a minor complaint.. Next, the positives: the room and bathroom are perfectly clean. the room was cleaned and fresh towels brought by at least eleven in the morning. The bathroom sink has a counter and plenty of room under it to store cosmetic bags, etc. The plumbing is excellent with a strong shower and plenty of hot water. Whar was wrong with the contintental breakfast? We ate anywhere between seven and ten in the morning and never had trouble finding a seat or having to wait on line to get in. Roles, cold cereal, sliced (canned) fruit , toast , juice, and coffee. What else is there? There was both regular and decaf (brewed) along with skim, whole milk, or half and half, they even had artificial sweetener, nothing to complain about here! There is also a "London Coffee Shop" on the premises if the hotel breakfast doesn't please you, and several other coffee shops nearby, even a Starbuck's. There is also a small travel agency which will book tours and tickets at no extra charge, a kiosk for developing digital pictures, a currency exchange desk, computers charging 1 pound, which is equal to about $2.00, for fifteen minutes. I forgot to menition the buffet restaurant, the food is not that good but it comes in handy if you are in a hurry. There is a quiet bar and cocktail lounge in the back part of the lobby which draws adult patrons. Now for the best part, the LOCATION!!! It is in a lovely area with restaurants and shops of all types very nearby. Five bus lines stop next to the hotel, and the Russell Square Underground station is a block and a half away. The Picadilly Line stops there and that line takes you to just about every main sightseeing attraction either directly or with one change in a matter of minutes. My advice to anyone, this is really a great bargain as long as you don't require luxury, but, unless you are under 25, DON'T GO ANYTIME WHEN SCHOOLS AND UNIVERSITIES ARE ON VACATION!!! (Ruth and Betsy from the New York City area)

Reviews.Title: “All that is said before me is true”
Reviews.Author: Mattellone
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at this hotel (28 Jul - 01 Aug 2007). Having booked it through British Airways' website more than two weeks ago at a rate of Â£75 per night I decided to read other users' comments at TripAdvisor before coming into the hotel and was slightly disappointed with my choice I had made, I even was worried about it: most of the comments were recent and rather negative. Okay, when I arrived at the hotel I realised that almost all that had been said here about it was true. Moreover, I disclosed that the published standard rate for everyone (including those walk-ins) is less than I pre-paid through [--], - Â£68. The hotel itself looks like a big airport with two terminals - a South and a North. Being warned by those who have stayed with Royal National about crowds of Spanish-students-night-loudspeakers I asked at check-in "a very quiet room" and I think I got it. The room is clean, the bed is quite good. The bedroom is rather uncomfortable and is very tiny. I had my continental breakfast only once, yesterday. Cereals, orange juice, plenty of butter, bread and strawberry jam, filtered "American" coffee (even worse that it could have been somewhere in East-Siberia) or tea. So, today I have decided to stay in bed instead of going downstairs for having this breakfast. English breakfast is also available but for a Â£7 surcharge and a long queue is unavoidable. I went out from the hotel and found a lot of nice cafes offering the same for little money and without queueing. The hotel is right in the centre of London and Russel Square tube station is nearby. It is worth if you a walker and if you do not spend much time inside your room. Thus I would recommend to everyone who prefers more comfort and who's got used to nice small luxury hotels, not to stay with the Royal National. Although I cannot say I really suffer from the hotel I would prefer something better rather to experience it again when I am in London. Even if I should pay Â£50 a night more.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull!”
Reviews.Author: elizabethsmum
Reviews.Content: We booked this weekend trip to show the children London, I booked through Thomas cook who had a hard time finding me a family room in London within a few weeks, The price was right so we booked...Well latter that evening I checked the reviews and like others I was worried...We decided that the hotel was only a small part of the trip so we kept the reservations and decided not to expect much. We arrived and was checked in straight away and they let us go to our room early, the front desk staff were polite and the hotel lobby looked fine (busy but it is a LARGE hotel) We arrived at our room which was very basic but ok, Out side our room was a whole in the wall and our room was grubby looking but again we was not expecting much. The window was wide open which I was very concerned about with two small children (we were on the forth floor) We went out for the day and had a lovely day in London after arriving back at the hotel my husband decided to surprise me with a bottle of champagne delivered to our room whilst we went out for our complmentary meal which we got whilst booking this is where the problems began you are pushed back and forth from the concierge and the reception which are at opposite sides of the lobby and then finally we got told to go the the bar/resturant where no one spoke English after 5-10 minuites we finally got someone to take the champagne to the room. I STUPIDLY forgot my wallet in the room but it had no cash in so I didnt give it another thought. For our complimentary meal we were told that the Presidents Hotel (same group) was the best choice for the children which was a three course of dryed up food the staff were friendly. Our deserts were brought to us on a desert trolly that had been out the whole time we were there no refrideration. We went back to the hotel and tried to sleep where I enjoyed my champagne that was sitting in a dirty plastic water jug! The hotel was NOISY!! all you heard all night was screaming and sirens. The next day we got up early to leave and discovered that my wallet was missing I was upset and called down to speak to a manger where I was told there was no manager and there was no security either, My husband went down stairs rto speak to someone and was rudley asked " I suppose there was money and cards in there as well"!! We called the police and reported the incident. We did go out and try and enjoy the day as we were only there two nights, latter that day we went back to the hotel and spoke to a really nice man on the porters desk who tried to be helpfull and was very apploitic, I also spoke to the security guard (who only comes in after 12 in the afternoon, I was given a form to fill out and was again told that there is no manager and no one really has any authority in the hotel. I asked that the champagne be removed from the room and was told by yet another person who didnt speak much English "that champagne was not complimentary" (Neither was my walllett) When I raised my voice I was getting angry I was told " We will call security" and they ran off to the back office. I did try to leave but because it was past 4:00pm they refused to refund my money for that nights stay and I didnt have my credit card and there was no hotel rooms available. to cut this short no one (apart from the porter Fergal) was willing to help, I was treated rudley and disrespectful the whole time there is no manager on duty and no one speaks English, I was willing to overlook the dustfilled room but this was way to much oh and the breakfast if you like dryed up food then you will love it!! My advice stay clear and listen to the reviews I wish I had. One thing I would highly recommend is the spaggitti house down the street it was wonderfull!

Reviews.Title: “worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Maralua
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in May 2007. The hotel is good, 2 stars. Beds are very comfortable, rooms spacious, bathroom is big enough, good hot water. Location is very good, 500 mts from british Museum. If going there take into account check in is after 2 PM, if you arrive earlier they have a good luggage storage place for free. It is true it may be a bit moisy, crowded and full of teenagers, but it is what you get for the price. Also Tour buses depart from its door, so you can star your city tour there and get back after a round trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller09
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. It's a 2 minute walk from Russell Square tube station! To be honest, I would have prefered to walk an hour to the nearest tube than stay here! There are in total about 500 rooms split in to 2 buildings. A north and a south terminal. It felt like an airport! The reception staff were all trainees that couldn't speak a word of english. Ok, we all have to start somewhere, but at least have 1 or 2 fully trained staff members to deal with queries! The staff seemed to enjoy speaking to each other in their own language and then looking at you and laughing. Not very funny! The rooms were small with horrible chip board paper that was peeling off! The bathroom was absolutely tiny. Put it this way, you could have brushed your teeth while sitting on the toilet! The bed was probably the best thing as it was fairly comfortable. There was no hairdryer and only one plug socket. The drawers were all stained and the wardrobe had no coathangers! Having never stayed in a youth hostel, I can only imagine this is what it would be like! The entire hotel/hostel/prison was occupied by mainly foreign students who kept their bedroom doors open and insisted on playing loud music throughout the night. Breakfast was like eating in a run down canteen. You had to queue up with a tray and show your bedroom ticket. You were then given a plate so the grumpy and dirty looking staff could throw the slop on it. You then had to share a long table with everyone else! The only saving grace was that we had a busy weekend and were out most of the time! To finish off our stay, we left our luggage in a room while we went out to lunch. Even though they put a ticket on both cases and my umbrella they still managed to lose it! Not what you need when you need to get a train home! All in all this hotel was horrendous! A weekend in Holloway would have been nicer! Please do not waste your money and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you are catching a Contiki Tour”
Reviews.Author: petert2
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked 3 nights at this hotel due to its location which was 2 nights too long. The rooms were average and bedding/pillows very ordinary however the bathroom was clean and tidy. The reviews regarding being a noisy hotel is spot on - mainly due to a 'bowling disco' being located nearby (this would also explain the 2 false fire alarms - the break glass alarm was set-off twice). The continental breakfast included in the price is a waste - better off getting breakfast at a nearby cafe. The staff are very helpful. This hotel is ok if you are catching a contiki tour the next day however could not recommend this hotel if you are using it as a base for exploring London.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Basics”
Reviews.Author: batlash
Reviews.Content: A travel agent booked us in this hotel and it wasn't until after all was said and done that I discovered all the horrible reviews. My wife and I were mortified! What had we gotten into? We arrived at the hotel feeling very uncertain. So... is it as bad as I'd been lead to believe? No. Is it a great hotel? No. It's basically just bland. It's a huge, impresonal place. It's the hub of much activity (lots of tours coming and going ALL the time). It's ecomonical which certainly accounts for the large numbers of tour groups and student travellers passing through. Our room was clean and comfortable. Being an American who lives in a state that become a sauna in the summer I was worried about the lack of air conditioning in the rooms, but fortunately the weather was such we were comfortable just opening the window at night (even though the street/foot traffic outside was a bit loud). We didn't even bother with the breakfast. The vast number of people just made to crowded, confusing and not worth the effort. We walked down the street to a nice little Costa Coffee shop each morning and had a fine time. My only big complaints: 1) someone pulled the fire alarm twice between 3 and 5 a.m. the morning after the failed car bombs had been found in London, rousting the entire hotel out onto the streets each time. 2) the concierge desk was totally useless. A friend in London left us a phone message. The staff wrote the phone number wrong on the note. When I went to ask for help looking up the correct number they said, "Sorry, we only have phone directories for Central London." I had to go to an internet kiosk and look it up myself! They really should figure out this internet thing. Overall, if you've ever stayed in a mid-range motel (Motel 6, Comfort Inn, etc.) in the US, the Royal National is just like that, only on a huge scale. It's very conveniently located for touristy hopping about the city. If you think of a hotel room as just a place to sleep at night and don't need to be fed free breakfast the place should do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “'free' does not always equate to good value”
Reviews.Author: plucky1
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a massive, impersonal, noisy, down-at-the-heels hotel where you won't feel safe, the Royal National in London is the place for you. We booked our rooms at this unhappy place through a deal with British Airways. Traveling with my two teenage daughters, I called a week before our arrival to make sure that the two nights in a double room and one night in a single room that came free with our airfare could be upgraded to three nights in a triple room. No problem, I was told. An extra bed could be wheeled in for 17 additional pounds. But when we arrived it was a different story. The lobby was a madhouse, the staff at the desk were harried and rude, the hotel had no triples available and Vicki, the reception clerk who clearly wanted me to just go away, informed me that they did not in fact have beds that could be wheeled in to a double to make a triple. Instead, I had to book a single room for my older daughter for the first two nights. On the third night, I'd have to go find a double elsewhere, as the hotel was fully booked. Our rooms were a disappointment. The furniture was cheap and I'm guessing that it was at least two decades old, though in terms of style -- and I use that term generously -- it appeared to be from the '60s or '70s, which was also the approximate date of the built-in push-button panel next to one bed that controlled the TV and lights. No clock or radio in the room. A phone, but local calls were emphatically not free. The bedspreads were faded. There was an electric kettle in each room, and a packet containing a tea bag, beverage whitener (yes, that's what it said) and instant coffee. In the single, the electric kettle was filthy, there was a damp towel in the tub, and an accumulation of dust and hair behind the sliding bathroom door. The curtains in both rooms didn't close completely, and had to be held in place by propping the desk chair against the window sill. The double room (6106) had a view of the offices and classrooms of the University College of London across the street and the homeless people who slept on the sidewalks at the base of the building. The single room (6108) had a view of the gigantic courtyard of the hotel, and even with the window shut and a chair holding the curtains in place, it was extremely noisy at all times, with an endless parade of vehicles, tour guides shouting out instructions to their groups, young adults yelling to one another, pub goers returning in the wee hours of the morning, and tour buses beeping as they backed in at 5 a.m. to pick up people who were going out to the airport for an early flight. Each room had just one towel in it (not counting the dirty one thathad been left in the single room). When I asked for additional towels I was instructed to go to the first floor, find the housekeeping office, and see what they could do for me. I did so, signed for the additional towels, and returned the dirty one at the same time. Our "free" hotel rooms were clearly not a very good deal. But things got worse: at 3:30 a.m. we were literally jolted out of our beds by an extremely loud fire alarm. While ordinarily this might have been merely inconvenient, two bombs had been found in London that week, the country was on high security alert, and as I and my two children were herded down six flights of stairs with hundreds of other guests we were terrified and wondering if we were a target. At the bottom of the stairs we found ourselves in a small, fenced-off parking lot, held in close to the building by an eight-foot chain-link gate. After about five minutes a staff member came and unlocked the gate, so we could go to the assembly area near the courtyard. Eventually we were allowed to climb the stairs back to our rooms.... ...only to have the fire alarm go off a second time shortly after five. We left the hotel again, this time taking a different fire exit so we wouldn't feel trapped in the fenced-in parking area. When we talked about this experience the next morning, we discovered that as we moved briskly down the stairs the three of us were thinking some of the same things. Was there a bomb in the hotel? a fire? When we got to the bottom of the steps, what would we find? Is this the smartest thing to be doing, to be carried along by this massive crowd? Is this happening at other hotels too, to distract emergency services while something truely horrible happens somewhere else? We felt very vulnerable. Shortly after we arrived in the hotel's courtyard the crowd suddenly panicked, and ran out into the street. We followed suit, not running but walking quickly and staying out of the main press of people. I positioned us behind a stairway on the building across the street, not far from where a homeless person was sleeping, oblivious to the thousands of swarming people. The fire alarms were probably just a prank, and certainly weren't the hotel's fault, but they did nothing to enhance our sense of security at the Royal National. And there was no acknowledgement that this might have been inconvenient or unpleasant for the guests. No regrets, no apology. We slept in in the morning, and barely made it to breakfast on time. At breakfast I decided that the Royal National doesn't cater to guests, it processes them. Breakfast was held in a huge, huge room full of tippy tables pushed very close together. The buffet for the full, cooked breakfast, to which my older daughter was entitled, through the single room we'd purchased for her, was on one side, and was closely guarded by staff, who checked tickets and ordered you away if you were only entitled to a continental breakfast. My younger daughter and I were in no mood for meat and eggs anyway, so we ate a lot of toast with butter and jam and drank some orange juice. We had been looking forward to a nice cup of tea, having developed a real fondness for it, but at the Royal National the tea comes from a gigantic urn, which I suspect has never been rinsed out. It was a profound disappointment. Four nice things about the Royal National: 1. We were able to use our little Mac Book in the lobby, thanks to their wireless internet service. 2. We could pick up a free newspaper in the morning in the lobby. 3. The location is pretty good, close to Russel Square, the tube station and the British Museum. 4. At breakfast they give you real milk to put on your stale cereal or in your undrinkable tea, which is a big step up from beverage whitener. It was wonderful to move to a small, quiet private hotel in Cartwright Gardens for the remainder of our time in London. I and my loved ones will never again stay at the Royal National, or any of the properties belonging to Imperial London Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “yuck”
Reviews.Author: sad6245
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. All the negative reviews you will read are 100% true. Nasty staff, dirty rooms, horrible beds, awful breakfast, noisy, noisy...yucky horrible!! Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best.. but not bad..cheaper than most....”
Reviews.Author: Ironingking
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this Hotel...Great for seeing London.. ..Underground and Bus nearby....Not the cleanest... but clean sheets and clean Towels.....very mean with tea and coffee.. The hot shower is really good and a much needed hot bath to soak my feet was very welcome.... overall for the price dont think you could grumble.. full breakfast was not clever (visitors from abroad do NOT think this is the TRUE English breakfast...this is a busy London Hotel breakfast) I can assure you I have had much better in other parts of England.... Staff were very nice and Helpful too... a short stay at this Hotel is ok....

Reviews.Title: “Royal National Faux-tel!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkergal
Reviews.Content: I will begin this review with the only good thing about this hotel, which is its prime location. Just a few steps from the Russell Square tube stop, you can get from here to anywhere in Central London in a matter of minutes. That one, given, convenience aside, this hotel is a dump and you couldnâ€™t pay me to stay there ever again. Upon arriving at the Royal National Hotel, which is gigantic (and not so much in a good way as a college dorm kind of way), my sister and I had high hopes. Sure, there were a lot of kids on school trips with their chaperons but the din of the lobby didnâ€™t bother us much. After killing a few hours before check in (2pm), we were told that the reservation, which we booked through Expedia, was nowhere in their system. Now considering that I had a printed confirmation from Expedia in my hand indicating that I paid in full and that the Royal National had already confirmed our room, I was a little bit surprised but in no way defeated. That was, however, until the person behind the desk told me that it was my responsibility to figure out why. He suggested I buy a phone card across the street, which of course, didnâ€™t work in any of the red phone booths outside or the phones in the lobby, to call Expedia myself to ask them about the agency through which they booked the reservation. I didn't really understand how this was somehow MY responsibility, considering I already paid for the hotel, but we just sucked it up and called Expedia from an American cell phone (Not a good ideaâ€¦ Seriously.) Now if youâ€™ve booked through Expedia, a generally well known and reputable travel agency, please do yourselves a favor and call the hotel in advance to guarantee your reservation. Itâ€™s much better than making a ridiculously expensive call from your American cell phone in London to an ordinarily toll free number, surrounded by your bags and massive swarms of children running around, only to be told that you didnâ€™t pay for your booking (even though you did) and that now you have no place to stay (even though you booked this place months in advance). Eventually, and I hate being the type of person who asks this type of question, I had no choice but to ask if I could speak to a manager. When we did eventually speak to a person higher up, after a miserable TWO HOURS of trying to check in, she pressed a few buttons on her keyboard and told us, in the most non- apologetic tone of all time, that someone at the hotel must have made a silly mistake because the reservation was listed for the day before. Now, only next to my home town of New York, London is my favorite place on earth and I am absolutely devastated that the Royal National Hotel has had the power to in any way taint that. I lived in London for five months and have never come across anything in the UK or elsewhere that can compare to the unhelpful, rude, unaccommodating attitude of this place. Quite fittingly, the rest of our stay at the hotel was just as miserable as its start. The sheets felt as though they had some sort of film on them and Iâ€™d imagine that anyone with allergies to dirt, dust, or strange carpets which look as though they havenâ€™t been cleaned since 1973 might have a problem staying here. The sink has a really hot faucet and a really cold one, so there isnâ€™t much hope for a nice, lukewarm mix. I asked for a smoking room, banking on the chance that we might be a bit separated from the bus loads of kids and teenagers that run rampant throughout this hotel, but it was still sort of noisy as the walls are quite thin. And this is coming from a New Yorkerâ€¦ To top it all off, on our last night, when all we could hope for was a decent nightâ€™s sleep before an early train to Paris, we were awoken at 3:30am by a blaringly loud, almost deafening fire alarm. We, along with the other 314,352,632 people staying here had to then proceed out of our rooms down the stairs and into the rain in our pajamas to be told that â€œsomeone who obviously had too much to drink must be playing a prank.â€� Oh, and as if that wasnâ€™t enough, it happened again an hour and a half later at 5:00am. If you really, truly want to have a good vacation in London, I suggest that you save up your money and stay someplace a little more upscale. Once you get to London and come to terms with that terrible exchange rate, a few hundred dollars will seem like chump change anyway. I hope that nothing like this ever happens to any of you and that your stay in London is as amazing at it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... not good...”
Reviews.Author: Eugene K
Reviews.Content: The excellent choice if you are planning to go to hote just for overnight sleep, the best location, very good prices, it will be terrible if you have noisy neghbours ( thank god i didnt). If you want to eat breakfast, wake up before 8 a.m. Clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “check the fire exits”
Reviews.Author: sumtaylor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend. First night ok but felt very rushed at breakfast and very very busy. Second night 2 fire alarms and evacuations within 2 hours of each other. Both false alarms but took 15mins to get down stairs we were on the 7th floor because of the sheer volume of people. No staff available to comment so please check all fire exits before you enter the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hell in a hotel room ”
Reviews.Author: ScotJac79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hell-hole for 2 nights - 2 nights too many! Checked in by possibly the most rude woman I have ever come across. It would do this hotel good to attend a Customer Service course. Corridors leading to rooms resemble a make-shift prison and rooms are not in the least bit better. Filthy with strip lights! The morning I was checking out there was a fire-alarm. When I approached staff for assistance they refused to help and said they knew nothing. Sheer compromise of safety! Sleep on the streets before you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when you book with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: rassmussen
Reviews.Content: These people are untrustworthy.I had booked a night at he hotel on a website and when I arrived there,they denied all knowledge of it and said their rooms were full!I was roaming the streets for 3 hours before I decided to go to a friends place.The website i booked the hotel with said that it has happenedwith a few other people previously.SO,MY ADVICE_DONT EVEN BOOK THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is great for the visitor!”
Reviews.Author: dancingenius
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were accompanying two American couples and showing them around London as part of a British tour (We have recently emigrated to the USA). We hired a people carrier to get us around and needed a hotel that was central and accessible, and so chose this hotel. I was concerned about the hotel having read the reviews. Having built up a mental picture of a dump, I was amazed at what I saw when I arrived. It was fine. Before retiring I had stayed in many London hotels, and this turned out to be one of the best low/medium priced hotels I has used. It has a cosmopolitan atmosphere with lots of students present, giving a pleasant 'London' feel. All three rooms were very clean and the carpets and decorations looked recently new, and the bathrooms appeared to have been refurbished in the last few months. They were spotless. The tiles, grout and sealants were all unmarked. The beds and sheets were clean and spotless. We arrived and found that there were insufficient coat hangers, so I rang the housekeeping extension and within five minutes a smiling face brought us a dozen more. The breakfasts did not constitute food swimming in fat as some have written. The English breakfast was good. There are two breakfast areas. These are mediocre - the one on the left was a bit like a bus station cafe, but turning right is a larger better facility. Neither are wonderful, but they do the job. There is a problem over privacy. The hotel is configured around a series of courtyards, which means that bedrooms overlook other bedrooms not too far away. The first evening I opened the curtains to look into the bustling area where the coaches arrive, and could hardly avoid seeing two near-naked female students immediately opposite getting ready for a night out. Other guests were coyly looking out of their windows, as the activity in the arrival area is interesting to observe. This problem should not exist and I am surprised that the operators don't have net curtaining as most hotels do, particularly where there is so much overlooking. The hotel is so well positioned. We arrived after a two hundred mile trip from the North and found it so well related to the main road system that we just left the motorway and seemed to fall into the hotel. Parking was fabulous (underneath) and cheap at Â£16 per 24 hour day. Congestion charge was Â£8 for the weekend and Monday. We only paid for the Tuesday, and a machine for the Congestion charge was in the car park but only takes credit cards. There are local newsagents who record the vehicle registration and take the payment so its not a problem. An excellent feature was the convenient walking distance into the centre. We walked into and out of the centre every time, being in Piccadilly Circus in 20 minutes. The walking route is pleasant and not in any way threatening at night. Our friends commented on how 'friendly' the streets were at night. The hotel is great. Ignore the moaners. Even our American friends thought it was fine !!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go”
Reviews.Author: cazdad
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel as a good quality 3* London hotel. The only part of that description I agree with is it is in London. This a a very basic hotel with no comforts at all, old worn out uncomfortable beds, beige walls everywhere not even a print to break the monotony, reminisent of an army barracks. The restaurant tables are laid out in long rows seating about 12 people. food is just awful, frozen vegetables overcooked potatoes,breakfast is like a scrum just don't go. At night on our return large groups of youths sitting on the walls outside reception drinking. If this is your only choice in London go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “good central base”
Reviews.Author: LeicestershireTup
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break at the Royal National Hotel. I had read all the negative reviews on trip advisor and had fingers crossed that it would be OK. Checked in with no problems, we had a family (4) room on the 6th floor. It was clean and tidy with a separate toilet from the bathroom. The view... well there wasn't one, but we were not in the least bothered we were there to sleep. The breakfast was in the other part of the hotel, where you crossed a forecourt into the Windsor room. It was not the best breakfast in the world and the surroundings were 'canteenish', it took time for the tables to be cleaned. All in all, it was a good base, we were not there to stay in the hotel all day, we had better things to be doing. Yes, it was busy and it is an extremely large hotel with all nationalities arriving by the bus load. Would I stay there again, well yes I would as the locality was very good, the breakfast kept us going and the rooms were clean and I felt it was a nice safe area. The car park underneath the hotel was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: Irishclassic
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of this Hotel via tripadvisor.com and was discouraged from staying here by me travel agent, but due to the location and the fact I was really only planning to use the facility for sleeping and luggage storage I figured for $177.00 per night it would be no big deal. We arrived 05/14/07 at 2pm and check in was not a problem. We were booked into room 6256 (this is the 6th floor facing one of the busy streets). When we got in the room I started cleaning it with clorox disinfectant wipes and was really grossed out by what I was picking up off of the counters as well as, pink slimy mold in the shower and the carpets didn't even look like it had been vacuumed let alone cleaned. You could actually see the dust in the halls as they did not look like they had been vacuumed in years. Ambulances and police cars with sirens ran all night at about 15 minute intervals. This hotel really caters to large groups of 20 something kids that like to drink and run screaming down the halls until about 4am. Tried to speak to hotel staff about all sorts of problems but due to the language barrier this was difficult. Not many english speaking employees. Take my advise spend a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “low $$$- good location”
Reviews.Author: hhsol
Reviews.Content: i stayed there a few times - very basic, nice breakfast (you eat in your room), close to the tube, very good for young tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty sheets”
Reviews.Author: Bonik
Reviews.Content: I ran the Marathon of London. I booked via a travel agency . Many runners and supporters stayed here. I stayed in a single room, 2 single beds. When I wanted to go to sleep the first night the sheets were embarassingly dirty. When I checked the other single bed it was also dirty. Staff reacted adequately to my complaint, but also in huge hotel like this logistics on room cleaning should be better than this. Henk

Reviews.Title: “No customer service, not worth the cheapest price.”
Reviews.Author: dixieandspirit
Reviews.Content: We booked through British Airways and were very disappointed. Our triple turned out to be a double with a cot for our 12 yr. old, who barely fit in it and the hotel staff would not change our room, nor would they give us a similar one on the inside court to get away from the very loud street noise. (we ended up buying ear plugs as we were there for 6 nights) We would have left if we had had more time in London but as the first day was spent waiting for our room we felt we had already wasted enough time. Do not expect this hotel to honor the "early check in" offered on BA Holidays, the staff actually sat on the counter at the back of the reception desk and chatted until 2pm exactly, while about 50 customers waited in line to get their rooms. After an overnight flight we were not impressed, nor were the others waiting. In a hotel of over 1000 rooms, they could have accomodated those waiting. The room offered to place your luggage in was not secure and anyway, those coming off of an overnight flight just want to get their room and have a nap. Breakfast was not an asset, toast and cereal or extra for greasy English breakfast and the place didn't have enough seating for the huge number of guests there. We ate out most morinings. The beds and decor were old but the room was relatively clean, the halls however, smelt very bad. Overall, I would spend a little more to get somewhere like the Travelodge or Premier Travel Inn and would not bother with this hotel. It certainly isn't a 3 star, we've stayed in London at 3 star hotels before and this was far below the others.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Worry- This place is perfect for experiencing the UK.”
Reviews.Author: Knutron
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 Adults/15 yr. old) recently spent Easter weekend (4days) using The Royal National for our base of operations. We all thought the place was more than adequate in terms of comfort, cleanliness,and a friendly, very helpful staff. We shared a triple which had plenty of towels, hot water, phone&TV. No problem with getting "knocked up". We just had to tell the maid when we would be leaving the room for the day. Great location! Russell Square just down the street is a Gem! Excellent Park Cafe located within. Coffee Shop located steps away provides the traditional English Breakfast with some of the best espresso and cappucini this side of Milan. The Pub attached to the hotel was perfect and served tasty food. Booking day trips done right at the hotel with a very helpful and patient staff. Tip: Evan Evan's Tours to Windsor, Bath,and Stonehenge was a great time. Special Kudos to Concierge staff for their helpfulness. If you want a perfect spot for your base that won't tear a hole in your wallet, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend The National.

Reviews.Title: “Worst bed of my life”
Reviews.Author: shubbiesmom
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, this is a huge, low end budget hotel, literally swarming with teenage tour groups. I didn't have a problem with the noise or the crowds, but the conditions of the beds were unbelievable. I felt I had impressions in my back from the springs, just barely covered by the cloth of the mattress. Any hotel raking in this much money should be ashamed of having such miserable mattresses on their beds. All three beds in the room were the same. It is probably fine for young people who could sleep on rocks if they had to, but for someone who is 40+, it was a big problem. The room was clean enough, but they should vaccum under the beds occasionally, as we found someone else's socks under one of them. I would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “dirty dirty dirty”
Reviews.Author: Jayfish
Reviews.Content: hav u ever heard the sayin "all fur coat an no knickers" well i think this applys to this hotel. overworked foreign staff, very dirty bedroom, bathroom and toilet (bathroom/toliet not mopped and dirty marks everywhere) grimy dust on light fittings etc, hole in bedroom floor and beds that were probably last used in the ark by brother noah himself !!! Breakfast !!! cattle market springs to mind. We had a bedroom on the front of the hotel and the noise was unbeliavable at night, constant traffic/sirens etc think i got 3 hours sleep over a 2 night stay, which then spoiled the days out because i was so very tired. We hav stayed in 3 star hotels in london before but they were much higher standard of cleanliness and even a free shampoo/bodywash. Definatley go to see The Lion King it was excellent and loved by the whole family as was the Natural History Museum. so much to do so little time but check out the hotel before you go as this can put a dampener on the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad as a base”
Reviews.Author: notlaw
Reviews.Content: This was a girls weekend away to celebrate my 44th birthday. Part of a package booked with Superbreaks including a theatre trip - Sound of Music - which was magical !! The hotel was very basic - we had a three bedded room - which yes was a little cramped but we managed. Bedding was clean and tidy - lovely warm velour cover between the sheet and top cover. We were on the 6th floor and it WAS NOISY (but London is anyway). Little lacking in tea/coffee supplies - horrible powdered milk in sachets uughh - suggest you take your own. We did not make it down to breakfast either of the mornings - there were alot of guests coming and going at all times so we thought there might be a bit of a queue !! We sampled a very nice cafe outside our hotel window which we would definitely recommend (next door to a convenience store). Handy for tube. Only BIG moan was being charged 50p per luggage item for leaving our cases at the hotel before departing later in the afternoon. They were making a killing !!!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the romantic weekend for two!”
Reviews.Author: jae0404
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel as a treat from my husband for a birthday present,complete with tickets for the sound of music,great show by the way and i highly reccomend. The hotel is another matter. After checking in and going to our room we found we had been given a twin and not a double room,went back to reception to change it but to no avail as they were fully booked.they advised us to push thebeds together,bit hard really when they are at opposite sides of the room.so consequently our romantic weekend turn upside down and we were almost sleeping top to tail. The toilet seat was broken and when i went to have a pee i nearly ended up on the floor where it just slid to the side!! We had to put up with wailing police cars,screaming motorbikes and honking cars all night. The most uncomfortable beds i have ever known. Neither of us got much sleep. Breakfast the following morning was an absolute disgrace,do the staff know the minimum temperature that food is to be held at because there is no way that that temperature was reached.What we got was a slop of grease on a plate that you just could not eat.i would not recommend this hotel to anybody,friends or foe alike. Steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting grot hole - Aviod!!”
Reviews.Author: redsrus
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in various hotels all over the world; I can genuinely say that the Royal National is the worst. On arrival the reception desk was manned by a friendly gentleman who spoke no english, making check in some what difficult. Unfortunately he would have sent us to the wrong floor for our room; had the room swipe key not had numbers on! On arriving at our room, it was filthy, the domestic services assistant said that they had not cleaned our room yet. this was at 5pm. At approximately 5.15pm, it was announced our room was ready. The bathroom was vile. Marks and stains on the toilet, including in the bowl, a guest soap clogging the bathroom sink and the sink pedestal marked with what looked like dry blood. We also only had 1 towel plus bathmat for a room with 2 people staying in it.
