On inspection of the room, surfaces where dusty, the carpet filthy, full of bits, and the linen not of a very high standard; infact it was full of holes. The top sheets on both beds were stained with what looked like ink. The kettle was filthy; I would not entertain using it. The hotel in its entirety seemed dirty and mismatched; the corridors are tatty and on more than one occassion it was apparent that a cleaner had burst a bathroom waste bin; the contents of which was then left in the corridor for a number of hours. In order to have breakfast you have to cross a busy courtyard to the other wing; this court yard is frequented by coaches whose drivers show little or no intention of slowing down thier vehicle whilst in this courtyard. making for a dangerous crossing. The english breakfast left alot to be desired,the toast was man handled by all and sundry; poor quality food; topped with dirty cutlery. We stayed at the Royal National as part of a package; I was extremely tempted to check out immediately; but endured the hotel as I had paid for the room prior to staying; and did not want to pay twice for accomodation. Since my stay I have complained in writing, to no avail. In all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone; as quite frankly, it was disgusting and seemed on occasions fit for closure.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this Youth Hostel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisN
Reviews.Content: This so-called Hotel came as part of a 2 night Theatre package with Superbreak and I can honestly say it is the worst hotel experience we have ever had. This is nothing more than a glorifed Youth Hostel. We had a "family room" which was a standard double with 2 beds shoved in so there was hardly any floor space left at all. The room was located near the lifts so we were at the mercy of everyone's late night comings and goings and the noise from the street below was so bad we had to buy ear-plugs for the 2nd night. The worst part, however, has to be the breakfast. There were literally hoardes of people, mostly teenage school groups, queuing for breakfast - we didn't even have a table to ourselves and the quality of the offerings was incredibly poor. We would NEVER recommend this hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for eight nights great location great price”
Reviews.Author: mack53
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 7001. We take two international trips a year and are experienced traveling in all parts of the world. For the price this hotel is prefect. The room was clean and we both slept fine. We had a great stay in London and enjoyed our trip. 15% of our trip cost was the price of the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: Keeper999
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of complaintâ€¦â€¦..I write to inform you of the package weekend we experienced from 23rd February to 25th February 2007 that included a stay at the Royal National, an evening meal on the first night and a night at the â€˜Sound of Musicâ€™. We had read a large number of reviews of the Royal National Hotel on Russell Square, London and went on your break with some trepidation. We were therefore pleasantly surprised to find the room outdated but adequate and clean, although everything else was true to form. The check-in could only be made after 2pm and the queues were very long, unmanaged and chaotic. Many queued up who did not require completing any documentation, and those that did, did not and had to be found, delaying the process. Those having completed check-in merely walked through the other queues to get to the lifts. It could have worked better had a Bank or Post Office style system been employed. Having said that, even though the rooms were not available until after 2pm, I cannot see why continual booking could not have been employed to alleviate the bottleneck. Those that arrived well before time merely deposited their bags with the concierge and went into the city, as we did. We could have booked in and still done that picking up the key on returning after 2pm. We were given a choice of locations for the evening meal and chose the President Hotel around the corner as it was a â€˜Carveryâ€™. The meal was disgusting. The soup was very tasty but cold. The beef , pork and lamb (mutton) was of poor quality, cut into very thick wedges and was tough as old boots and uneatable. The vegetables were in a tureen of water and put on the plate with a spoon that left the plate swimming in water. The roast potatoes were not roasted and were cold. We were not the only ones who thought the same and saw many plates go back with most of the meat still on it, even though the joints had changed. The Hotel itself could be likened to Victoria Coach or Kings Cross stations. It is best described as a Transit Hotel with people coming and going at all hours with no concern for others. The noise throughout the night was horrendous with coaches, taxis and party goers arriving till the very small hours and if you were unfortunate to be allocated a room that overlooked the arrival area (6019) then you were subjected to all the usual noises associated with these arrivals that echoed around and up the square. The bar was an open plan situation just off the main reception and it was impossible to have a quiet drink after returning from the Theatre. After 11pm, there were people arriving who clearly were not resident but found that they could get a drink when the pubs had closed. My wife and I had a room (6058) that overlooked a gardened area near the bar that was locked at 11pm because of the noise it generated. At 1.20am Sunday morning two drunken residents of a room situated above the bar area decided to open their window to its full extent and stand smoking and shouting. This went on till 2.15am. This disturbed many residents who came to their windows and in the end were forced to close them. Security was not in evidence. (The windows should be on a retaining catch to prevent them being opened fully, for safety reasons. It was noticed that many windows in the square were broken or had been overridden) The weekend however was not a complete disaster as the â€˜Sound of Musicâ€™ was excellent and we had booked to see a play on the Saturday evening that was equally good, but we will be very careful in the future in taking a package that includes a hotel like the Royal National. On the 23rd March we received a copy of a reply from Imperial Hotels via our tour operator. The Hotel was surprised by our findings and put it down to a particularly busy weekend but did say that they would pass on comments to their relative departments. Their last comment, for me, put it all into perspective; â€œWe were disappointed to note that he did not fully enjoy his stay with us but feel that he may have been expecting a different style of Hotelâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..Doesnâ€™t that say everything?

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel Perfect for a busy weekend in London!”
Reviews.Author: LottieWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews before staying in the hotel i was really worried especially as i had booked the trip for 5 other people and didn't want them moaning at me. When we got there we couldn't check in as we were early but the receptionist was very friendly and told us where we could store our luggage until check in. We came back to check in later that afternoon again reception staff were very friendly and explained where our rooms where and what time breakfast was from. The bit i was dreading walking into the room was no where near as bad as i had imagined yes the rooms are dated but they were clean and the same goes for the bathroom. The sheets on the bed were all clean and so where the towels and thats the most important thing. If your going to London you really wont be spending much time in your room. People who have written reviews are over the top with these bad comments just ignore them. Everywhere you look in the reception area and outside there are cleaners all the time. The breakfast wasnt brilliant but when there are over 10,000 people to cater for what do you expect. If you want luxury pay for it but if all you need is a basic room just for somewhere to sleep this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Sunshine14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a 60th birthday present for my Mum so you can imagine how I felt after reading some of the reviews. It was a great relief when we turned up on Saturday to find it a clean and pleasant hotel. It was very busy but for the price that is to be expected. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We left our luggage and went sightseeing so didn't get back to the hotel until later that evening. Our rooms were clean,there were no mouldy walls or ceilings, the bedding was perfectly white. It was a noisy night but we were on a busy road so what can you expect! My Mum had noisy neighbours which was a bit disappointing as they had no consideration for anyone else but of course this is not the hotels fault. The next morning we had a very nice English breakfast which you could help yourself to. The area was not busy and we had no trouble finding a table for four. The food could have been a bit warmer but was still edible. Only problem was when I went back to my room and found someone cleaning it at 9am when checkout is not till 11am. Again staff friendly and were able to leave our luggage there for the day. All in all would go back again. A good weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the Money”
Reviews.Author: JSMan
Reviews.Content: We booked through British Airways holidays prior to reading any reviews on the hotel. Given some of the reviews I read subsequently we were a bit apprehensive about the hotel, but in fact our stay was quite satisfactory. The room was reasonably clean and comfortable. The tile bathroom was very nice. Soundproofing was a bit lacking but no worse than the connecting doors which are common between many American hotel rooms. We specifically asked for a quiet room and had no trouble with noise during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dump!”
Reviews.Author: uktrips
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend at this dump and both agreed we need to warn people about it. It was absolutely disgusting how they dare call it a hotel was beyond us, it was more like a back packers. It seemed every body in the hotel was foreign and there must have been hundreds of school trips, from all over the world. When we got into our room it was dark dingy and stank, the only ok thing about it was the white bathroom with very good shower although if you were tall you would have to duck to get under it. The bed was rubbish and we may as well of been given no pillows, they were that flat! I was very wary of sleeping in the bed and convinced myself i had caught something from sleeping in it! the breakfast the next morning was inedible it turns my stomach thinking of it, there was a full english, but it was all swimming in about 6 inches of grease. I thought i would play it safe and have toast but when i saw the man toasting the bread changed my mind (he didn't wear any gloves and lets just say he didnt look the cleanest of people) and the food looked like it had be stood for a while, in school dinner style serve your self trays. We were determined not to let it spoil our weekend and have a good time despite the hotel the open bus tour is a must. We were given the weekend as a present and was booked through Super Breaks which is our next point of call they need to take this hotel of there books!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for what you Pay!”
Reviews.Author: Mudratsuk
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Royal National with my mum and sister for a theatre/shopping 4 day break. Prior to our visit read the reviews and wondered what we were letting ourselves in for. When we arrived we opened the room door with trepidation and guess what! it was fine - 3 single beds in a decent sized clean room. Clean towels (every day) and sheets which we were all happy to use. Breakfast was adequate for the amount you had paid Â£103 for a triple room - what do you want hot buttered croissants and waiter served breakfast - not at that price. We noticed that the hotel was used by a variety of people not just students as seemed to be indicated in a number of the other reviews. To summarise a well located, clean and adequate hotel - We did not go to London to sit in our room - if we had we would have expected to pay 5* prices for a 5* room. All 3 of us are not easily pleased and we are already planning our next theatre/shopping trip to london and we will be checking availability at the Royal National.

Reviews.Title: “Dump!”
Reviews.Author: Beautyladies
Reviews.Content: oh my god, what a dump this place is! we stayed in a triple room 5293. this room includes, mouldy walls, no heating, windows that dont shut, dirty carpet and one of the other guest stayin in another room had dirty bed sheets!! we stayed here on a school trip so pretty much had no choice in the matter! the toast is soggy and fingered by most people in the room, breakfast glasses are dirty and overall disgusting! the lifts close at 12am so if your in later than that be prepare for a long walk to your rooms, with no help of how to get there! reception staff dont speak english and are extemely unhelpfull! overall DO NOT STAY! avoid at all costs if you want an enjoyable trip away!

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine stay”
Reviews.Author: floridagalNaples
Reviews.Content: After seeing previous reviews, I was a bit nervous, but very pleasantly surprised. The room was well furnished and clean. The staff were very polite and attentive. The location is superb with tube stop and bus access very near. Also close to good markets for drinks and snacks. There were several tour groups, some of whom were noisy in the courtyard. It was quiet by 11ish. We did have a fire alarm at 2 am our last night which was not pleasant. Fortunately, there was apparently no fire, and we were soon back in our room. I'm guessing the result of a prankster. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again if you paid me”
Reviews.Author: dorsetmum
Reviews.Content: We booked for a theatre break so just stayed one night thankfully. It really is the pits as far as accomodation goes. My 15 year old daughter was stuck on a tiny pull out bed . The full English breakfast was absolutely appalling and tea and coffee undrinkable. Fortunately the trip to the Lion King was good but I would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not good !”
Reviews.Author: Jo1000
Reviews.Content: After travelling with 2 children for 5 hours it took an hour of queuing to check in !! Once arriving at the check in desk we were told "never mind you are here now" - not even a sorry ! The family room was squashed and basic and had a double, a single and a pull out bed on the floor. We had no room to do anything other than inch around the beds. The bathroom was tiny and the shower head and shower curtain rail were rusty. There are no hairdryers in the rooms, you have to pay a deposit and go and get one. Breakfast was edible but was in a huge hall and felt like you were back at school, the tablecloths were dirty from the people who had used the table before. The worst thing was the noise. Our room faced the street and was on the forth floor and even with the windows shut it felt like we were sleeping on the pavement. The traffic and the sirens and the voices shouting outside only just drowned out the noise of people banging doors and shouting up and down the corridors whilst waiting for the lifts. If you are on a hen/stag weekend then this hotel is great but if you like to sleep at night then avoid it !!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Vetlanda40+
Reviews.Content: Have just return from a two nigthts visit in London. We were three friends 40+ stayed in a tripple room on the fourth floor. I have been in London many times before and always stayed at the Regent Palace hotel Piccadilly Circus but as it just has closed we have to find something else. We arrived at one a clock and there were no problem checking in immediately. No waiting - took 5 minutes to get a room - monday. The room was quite big and got three separately beds, a bathroom with a tub, a whritingdesk, a wardrobe and four chairs. The beds were comfortable much better than Regent Palace. The bathroom was clean and we had lots of towels. They cleaned the room for us when we went out and there was a sign to put on the door if you didnÂ´t want to be disturbed. We got new towels the second day. The continental breakfast includes tea,coffie,juice,milk, cereals, toast and rolls, butter and marmelade. Just what we needed - it would have been nice with some yougurt.... There is a busstop just outside the hotel no91 take you to Trafalgar Square and no 7 to Oxford Street. The tubestation 3 min to walk - piccadilly line. A shoppingcentre with a big foodstore and a great Chinarestaurant just round the corner. I would deffinately stay again and I will recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value based on what you pay!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeeRus
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a Saturday night stop over, whilst meeting up up with a "few of the boys". Did obviously read the reviews but based on location and reason for the trip, felt it would be a good trade off. My wife was here in November last year, for a ladies shopping trip and felt it was decent value but not stunning in any way. To put you in the picture, I'd been in London all week on business and staying in a 5*, so it did a lot of get any pass marks!!! Check in was no more than 2 minutes and we were allowed to do so at 12.30 - good start there. Room was a twin and had all you'd expect as a minimum - we were in the same block as check in but looking inwards, not over the reception area. Didn't return to the hotel till - let's just say the very early hours of the following morning and no bother with noise or disturbances of any description. When down for breakfast around 09.45 and yes we did have to wait but what would you expect at that time? The breakfast, well I think, "filled a hole" would best describe but as I've headed this up - value based on what you've paid ;->). Only real comment and it's not a criticism, we had the maid try and get into the room at least 3 times, so maybe they'd benefit from some system of letting them know the room's still in use! The location, which was the reason for it's selection, is perfect. I'd probably stay here again but you've got to take it as a value accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go if you like to fell clean”
Reviews.Author: FrogsOnTour
Reviews.Content: British Airways needs to seriously review the Hotels it puts forward as recomendations!! Location is good Its as cheap as chips But!! Be prepared, it is just a roof over your head. Ok for a stopover but not for a holiday. We stayed 3 nights and that was plenty. The bathroom had mould all over the ceiling. The floor around the bed looked like it had never been swept and although it was a non-smoking room it reeked of smoke. The staff must have a tough job because there are hundreds of people coming and going. The entrance area is akin to a rail station, it has the feeling that you are not inside the building yet. If you are prepared for the worst you won't be disappointed. It is massive and you do feel like you are in a 1970's hostel but then again it is cheap. However, for a few quid more you can stay in a better hotel. Do be careful of the bed, it is on about 8 castors!! We didnt have breakfast, too scared to be honest. We were able to leave our luggage which at 50p a bag was pretty good and saves you having to lug it all around on your last day. This is definately not the place for a lovely romantic weekend!! Take ear plugs because if you are not kept awake by the constant sirens you will be by the hoards of people trudging through the hallways at 3 in the morning!!

Reviews.Title: “very budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: traveller_at_heart
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the worst hotel i have EVER stayed at. This hotel is ONLY for those on a very tight budget. The rooms are tiny, the bathroom is tiny, there is no airconditioning and the room is set up 70's style....but not even "cool" 70's style. Don't even think about asking for an early check-in if you have arrived an hour or so earlier than the check-in time, because they will not check you in. They won't even check to see if the room is available yet. The staff are not friendly, they simply wish to process you without any hassles, and if you are with a tour group you are made a second priority to the staff. The rooms get extremely hot in summer, and you are forced to keep your window open which is noisy and dangerous, as someone could easily climb into your teeny tiny room. You also cannot make outgoing calls from your room. The only positive thing about this hotel is its location, as it is about 10 mins walk to the British Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be fair”
Reviews.Author: travelhoppy
Reviews.Content: I had not been looking forward to this hotel, booked by a friend for a group of us for a weekend theatre trip. I do read reviews and so I would not have ever booked this hotel myself. Here are my positive and negetive views. Getting to the hotel from Euston was easy, just a short 10 minute walk. If you like individual service, cosy and picturesque then this is not for you as it is a large, concrete building, noisy and filled with coach parties. Check in however was smooth and rooms though small were clean and the bathroom was clean. Shower was fine although the shower curtain was thin and there were no toiletries. TV reception was rubbish but we didn't use it as we didn't go to London to watch TV. Worst part of the room was the paper thin walls, you really could hear everything from the room next door and the traffic noise was horrendous. In two nights I counted 30 ambulance sirens. If you are already booked here ask for an inward facing room as my friends had a room facing the courtyard and slept fine. The beds were actually very comfortable. Staff always replied with courtesy, I encountered no rudeness at all but then I always take the time to chat to staff and wish them good morning or good evening. The free complimentary meal on arrival was OK, though it was of canteen standard. The breakfast, I have to admit was the worst cooked breakfast I have ever had in a hotel and the cup of tea was undrinkable. Take your own teabags and brew up in the room if you are already booked to go. The location of the hotel for sightseeing is good. The Royal National is right next to a sightseeing bus tour stop, near Russell Square tube, 5 minutes walk to the British Museum and 15 minutes walk to Theatre Land. You could take your own teabags and earplugs and eat out for all meals and enjoy a stay here if you got really cheap rates.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok.”
Reviews.Author: DEB42
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel, I read some bad reviews on this website and was not expecting too much when we arrived. My husband and I stayed here on saturday night together with two other couples. We booked adjacent rooms, which we got, which were on the 7th floor. The rooms were small, but very clean and tidy. There was a damp patch on the ceiling, but that didnt bother us.We were awoken at 6am by noisy people coming in , some people show no respect for people that are asleep!! The English breakfast was served in a room in other side of the hotel, this was very busy!! This is a very touristy hotel and you have to expect a lot of people at breakfast. We struggled to get seats and had to sit seperately with other people. We lined up for our breakfast and a woman supervisor behind the serving counter was quite rude, People were asking her for what they wanted on their plates and I heard her saying 'oh my god' to the other girl because one person didnt want everything available. Wouldnt they prefer people to say what they dont want on their plate, instead of wasting good food? I asked for Bacon, egg and toast and got sausage banged on my plate regardless!! The breakfast was good however and there was easy access to juice and coffees etc., All in all, this hotel is ok for a weekend break, but be warned it is very busy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great beginning to the Contiki Experience”
Reviews.Author: hegartyc
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel set up to stay at for my Contiki European Discovery tour in Summer 2006. It was a great stay for someone my age. Not too far from some of the major places to visit in London. The hotel is also very nice because you have your own room and bathroom to get ready in and sleep at! The use of a taxi was the best way to get around to the places you wanted to visit from here, you could also use the tube if you are comfortable with it (don't worry it's really easy to use and figure out!!) Check out the rest of my experience on my tour of Europe with hotel reviews at: http://katedoescontiki.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Worst Than Terrible - Royal National”
Reviews.Author: SUNYWorldwide
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel that we ever stayed at; it was a three star suggestion from British Air. I was so very surprised that BA could provide such a suggestion. I have found BA people, equipment and service to impeccable. This is a true puzzlement !!! The staff performance at this hotel is poor at best. The overall experience was not one to be repeated and should not be one for others. I would not dirty the words third world with their name.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok if you don't expect much of a room.”
Reviews.Author: una_chica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the middle of January for three nights. We didn't expect nothing but a good situation. It was worth the money (not much), room was ok, quite clean and alright beds. Location was excellent, near Russell Square tubestation. Days were so busy being a tourist, so the hotel was meant to be only for sleeping. Hotel staff was friendly (all englishmen seems to be). Only thing to complain was the breakfast, horrible coffee and cold toast, had to had breakfast elsewhere. Enjoyed very much our visit to London, have to visit again, and might even come back to Royal National. If you don't want to spend too much money in hotel, then go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you've gotta be kidding”
Reviews.Author: alamocitygal
Reviews.Content: There's a reason this hotel is not listed in any of the major hotel search sites. We only stayed here one night and it was the worst night in a hotel we've ever had. It felt like we were in a third world country. Room was cramped, smelly and old. No toiletries and only one towel abou the size of a large hand towel. Couldn't sleep because of the noise from the courtyard below, fighting and arguing all night. TV only picked up one station and that one was in and out. There were NO British folk staying here, only unsuspecting tourists. Large tour crowds, noisy and rude. The breakfast was okay. I think the place was overpriced for what you don't get.

Reviews.Title: “Made a great New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: PaulSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed for New Years Eve in a family room with one twin and two single beds paying Â£120 including full breakfast. The hotel is in a good central location, has an excellent well priced bar, friendly staff, easy parking facility (under hotel, Â£15 per day), clean throughout and a tasty breakfast selection. All in all great value. If you want five star go and pay five star prices!

Reviews.Title: “Yuk, yuk, yuk!!!”
Reviews.Author: andrewstuart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a trip to London a few years back, and obviously, judging from recent reviews, nothing has changed. This has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! Rooms were cramped, beds were uncomfortable, and the hotel is so busy that noone knows what they're doing. I woke up on my last day with the flu, unable to move, and dreading the long flight back to Sydney that night. So I arranged to pay for a late check out (half a days rate) so that I could stay in bed and rest. It was bad enough missing out on a last day of sightseeing, but THREE times, the housecleaning staff entered my room, telling me that I had to check out by 11am. Not one of them could speak English either, so asking them to check with Reception to confirm my extended check out arrangement was pointless, and I had to resort to shouting at them, in order to be left alone in peace. Something that cost me 66 pounds (about $AUS 180), which I never got. If you want to enjoy your holiday in London, DO NOT STAY HERE, and pray that you don't fall ill while staying here, prior to a 23 hour flight!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel and very worn down...”
Reviews.Author: Ex-LondonerJayCee
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I arrived to this hotel, seeking cheap and basic accomodation for our celebration of new years eve 2006. We had read the reviews on this page in advance, so our expectations were reasonably low, but that was ok. All we wanted was a clean room to sleep in at an affordable rate. Unfortunately we must now join in with the rest of the dissatisfied with this hotel. It is VERY dirty. Even in the reception area you will find dust, paperscrap and other dirt in the corners, but whatever you do when you get to your room... DON'T move the beds!! We were given a twin bedroom (in spite of having booked a double), so we wanted to move the beds together. We found old cough mints from previous guests, hair, dust and other nasty things that you'd rather not find in your "clean but affordable" hotel room. Other than that, people are fed breakfast in a way that most farmers would envy. Large tables, plastic cups, cold bread rolls... This hotel is cheap, but too cheap... Spend 10Â£ more a night and you will get a LOT more...

Reviews.Title: “Just give us your money”
Reviews.Author: Big_JP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal National before my Contiki Tour and then after. I knew not to expect too much as my sisters before me had stayed there. As I was travelling by myself, to cut costs I chose to share a room. The first night it was fine, you're always aprehenscious a little about the unknown and this was my first big trip. I travelled around Europe sharing a room with a stranger from another country and had no problems until returning to complete my OS holiday at the Royal National. I paid everything up front with my travel agent in Australia so I had no accomodation fees. Trying to check in to my room I found there to be already 2 quite drunken males in there. When I spoke to the staff at front desk and asked for help they said it was my problem and I was to throw the guy out. But the problem was both had vouchers identical to mine with that room number. I tried a few times and the occupants of the room were getting quite angry and the staff at the front desk were of no help what so ever. In the end I had to take a single room and pay an extra $700. I have written to my travel agent, Contiki who inturn have contacted the Royal National. Of course they disagree and tell a very different version of events and needless to say I will not be seeing my $700. Staying at the Royal National was a very disappointing end to a marvellous holiday and I will not stay there ever again or recommend it to anyone even if you are looking for a cheap hotel. You could have put up with the filthyness of the room and the substandardness if the staff had been a little more helpful and friendly. Take a tent or try the Salvos!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep under a bridge, Bathe in the Thames, even that would've been better”
Reviews.Author: fni2
Reviews.Content: Sleep anywhere else, stay any where else. I should have read the reviews before I allowed British Air to book this hotel for a weekend. The rooms are dirty, and the hotel is extremly disorganized. I had to leave 20 pounds for a hair dryer and it would not have surprised me if I was handed linens for the bed at check in. I would never stay there again even if it were free. As for the location, who cares any location would have been just as good. PS: Going back to London, I would stay under a bridge and feel more comfortable. There are a few nice spots available on the Jubilee walk by the Tames.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at any other ILH, just not Royal National”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: Don't stay. If you heed any advice from checking reviews before booking, listen to mine, and most others and book elsewhere. Even any other Imperial London Hotel, I believe there are 5, all very close in Bloomsbury. I must say, I did check the review's before booking, but figured I could tough it out for the price, after all, they advertise a 3 star hotel. I'll start by saying I had a great time in London, the area was fantastic, but the hotel..... 1. Beware of the included breakfast. The workers are SO rude. You must bring a slip with you that show's you have a breakfast included. We went 1 time. In the 1 time, both my boyfriend and me had the slips ripped out of our hands by the staff on over 5 occasions, to check if we belong there. Then, instead of handing it back to us, they threw it on the floor. Instead of wasting your time there, head out of the hotel, and RIGHT across the street, you'll find a wonderful little coffee shop, which serves great food and has very cheap prices. 2. Beware of the beds! I can't stress enough how comical the beds are. We unfortunately got 2 twin beds, and both were so bad, but one worse. There were springs sticking out (no, really) into our back. We got an extra blanket to try to lie over the mattress, but made the mistake of lifting the sheet. Ok, I don't know what happened in this bed, but the stains were disgusting. We stayed 4 nights, and had to alternate who got the evil bed each night. We actually would have been better off sleeping on the floor, had there not been funk all over the carpet. 3. Evil Towel lady. Each morning, yes, early morning, the maid would continue to knock on the door, and by the 3rd time, would yell at us to get up and get out. Then, we further got chastised when we asked for some clean towels. Are we not paying for the room we are in? Very, very strange. 4. The shower. Again, this is not my first trip to Europe. I've been to about 15 different hotels within Europe in the last 5 years. Unless you are a size 0, and can climb 2 feet to get into the bathtub, you'll be ok. Plus, because it's so skinny, the moldy shower curtain sticks to your body, and then you practically fall out when you're done. Oh... and the water switched from hot to cold ever 10 seconds or so. 5. I can live with the 1970's decor, but be aware, that's what you get. And it's not the good retro 70's... Pics included show the room, the bathroom, and the eerie hallway that looks way to similar to the hallway in "The Shining". Please, spend the few extra pounds, so you can wake up relaxed instead of in pain.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnJohn24
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Royal National. The property is huge encompassing a whole city block. Check in seemed a bit messy as there seemed to be a lot of tour groups there but we didnt wait too long. The room was nothing special- very basic accomodations perfect for checking out the city. The room had 2 single beds, a tv, closet, desk, etc. Very clean for the size of the hotel. The bathroom was clean and functional. The only problem I had was the shower ceiling was fairly small as I had to literally bend down to wash my face and hair (but I am 6'4'') It still served its purpose. There is wifi in the lobby as well as a pub and a couple of restaurants. The location is excellent. Russell square tube station is litterally around the corner with trains going to Heathrow. Picadilly and Leicester Square are 3-4 stops away on the tube (also a short 15-20 min walk). The hotel definitely served its purpose and I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Backpacker standard - STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maranello
Reviews.Content: Most decent hotels were already fully booked so we opted for the Royal National despite the previous bad reviews. Its not, as described, a tourist class hotel, its a student hotel. The profile of the person staying at this bed factory is a student and there are coachloads of them. The hotel was noisy all night but it did not matter that much as I was frightened of going to sleep in such a ram shackle place. Everything is worn out and the staff are rude. Its a disgrace at the price they charge. Its not worth considering unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaFreitas
Reviews.Content: I really don't know where to start because everything was so bad... First, let you know that I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for a London sightseeing. I got a room in 5th floor overlooking the rubbish! (see the pics) This is a really big hotel, I don't know exactly how many rooms it has but you feel in trouble when you try to get your room. Even in my 3rd day I had many difficulties to find my room! The rooms are pretty small, the bathroom don't even have shampoo, the towels they provide are really small and there was no AC (i stayed in there in Summer and had to have our window open in the night because i couldn't sleep!). I think in Winter things are even worse because of the cold weather in London. Staff was unfriendly, during the check-in they didn't even looked at us or explain where was our room. The breakfast area is always overcrowed (even at 7am) and you have to pay 4Â£ to have a "English Breakfast". The free breakfast only include bread slices, butter, cereals, milk and a horrible orange juice. There is some restaurants in the area like Pizza Hut, Mcdonald's, etc but i think this is a residencial area because there isn't much people there at night. The only good think about this hotel is the location. It is near Russel Square St where you can catch the bus to everywhere in the city. If you like sighseeing, both "The Original Tour" and "The Original London Sightseeing" companies starts their routes in front of the hotel. Next visit to London i'll certainly stay in somewhere else near Oxford Street. Enjoy London because the city is really great!

Reviews.Title: “Dreaded It......Had A Plesant Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: chocmummy
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I dreaded the trip to London. There was 26 of us and I really wanted to change hotel but it was going to cause too much hassle to the rest of the group so decided to go with the flow. Much to my surprise 1st impressions werent bad at all. Yes its a HUGE hotel with 1640 rooms, but the reception area is clean and tidy. Took us about 10 mins to check in. Plenty of lifts, all working. Room was small with twin beds but very clean. My mum and I went armed with pillowcases after what we`d read about dirty sheets but didnt need them! Our room looked out onto the quieter courtyard, I think if you looked onto the main entrance courtyard then it could be a bit noisey a night but we had minimal noise. Be sure and get down for breakfast by 8am, otherwise you will have to join a long queue. Plenty to fill you up for a days sightseeing....toast, jams, rolls, cereal, fresh juice, tea/coffee and a hot buffet breakfast with bacon, sausages, beans, eggs, tomatos or porridge. We stayed 2 nights and didnt have anything to complain about. My mum and I are clean freaks and were really worried after reading the horrific reviews but please go and have a great holiday!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - not for whingers!”
Reviews.Author: markkz750
Reviews.Content: I booked this last week for a stay on Wed 23rd if I had looked at this website first I would not have done. Frankly, I was worried and seriously thought about losing the Â£66 and booking eleswhere. Well whaddyaknow? It was fine, I've stayed in better and I've stayed in worse, but none come anywhere near the value that Royal National offers. Lets get this straight, it cost me Â£66 inc a breakfast in central London with a car park on site. I cleared reception in 2 minutes, My room (4003) was fine, ok, if I wanted to nitpick I could do without a bed on castors, and the shower curtain was a little grubby at the base, oh, and the TV did not work. But it was clean and it was in the centre of the most expensive city in the world and it cost me Â£66. Reviewing it as a 3 star hotel I'd give my room 4/10, taking into account the cost I'd give it 11/10. I wasn't troubled by noise either, I had a good nights sleep but then I had sampled quite a lot of London's nightlife! I could afford to, did I mention it cost me Â£66 for a room in central London? Breakfast was fine, hot and plenty of it, at 7.30 it was pretty quiet. The staff at breakfast were very helpful (Asian), the staff on the reception (Polish) a little surly, so what? If I was to take my wife to London I would happily take her there but if it was for a special occasion I wouldn't. It is a "ship em in" and "ship em out" operation and as such it is fine, if you had expectations of silk sheets on your bed and elegant reading rooms then you can't have read the website so well or you are a whinger. My guess is that the bad reviews on here are from whingers, cheap whingers at that. The sort of people who complain non stop about an expensive sandwich on a Ryanair flight to Rome that cost them 10p! Did I mention it cost me Â£66 inc breakfast for a great night out in London!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Infested, Rude.”
Reviews.Author: chimpy123456
Reviews.Content: 3 words is all it needs Filthy, lowest levels of hygene. Infested, insects / bugs, the Smell !!! Rude, the hotel staff are obnoxious -----

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, great hotel, would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: globetrottingaussies
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We stayed there twice in December 2005 as we used London as a base to see Europe and the UK. This hotel is very very good value for money. I had no problems at all. The breakfast was great. While only a continental breakfast, the food was fresh and there was plenty of it. In our second stay we were upgraded to a full hot breakfast, which was really nice. It consisted of eggs, bacon, sausages, toast, hot oats, juice and cereals (and more things I've forgotten). The breakfast area was open and clean. Yes this hotel has a lot of rooms and therefore many people, but the noise at breakfast was not a problem (I didn't notice excessive noise at all). In our first night in London, straight off a long haul flight from Australia, we made the mistake of looking for somewhere to eat in the local Russel Square area for our evening meal. We found a local pub a few streets away which didn't use gloves to handle food and the food was substandard. On our second stay we decided to check out the restraunt of the Royal National. Well, I know where I will be eating next time. The meal was really nice, just like home made. It was around 5 pounds for a meal. Great value in London. We had a roast dinner and dessert. This hotel is conveniently located to Russel square tube station. It is only a short walk away. Also, we did a city tour with Big Bus tours which had a stop just outside! The rooms and the hallways are not modern, however if you are wanting to waste money on such things then go for a five star hotel. If you are more intersted in value for money and a comfortable hotel, then the Royal National is perfect!! The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were clean. The whole hotel was clean. Could not recommend it more strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Travelbea
Reviews.Content: Above average for the money!!! We stayed at this hotel on a theatre break. For the money it is a good hotel - fantastic location - walking distance to just about everything. Yes it is noisy but what do you expect for paying bottom dollar. The staff were fine on reception and mediocre everywhere else. The breakfast was great. I have read alot of bad reviews about this hotel and was dreading staying there - no reason to worry - took earplugs and was fine. Had a triple room (shared with husband and son) - quite adequate size and bathroom although basic was clean. This is an old hotel with over 1000 rooms so do not expect the Ritz - if that is what you want then pay for it!!!!! You get what you pay for!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but close.”
Reviews.Author: GirlGenX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to London using a package deal from British Airways. It was around $600 per person and landed us 3 nights in a country we had never been to before. The hotel we stayed at was part of the package, and as we did not plan to be in the room except to sleep, we did not mind taking a chance with hit being a little run down. Now looking back, we would stay outside of the city and look for something a little nicer next time. Overall: The Royal National is a budget hotel in a country whose currency is worth twice that of the US dollar, so unless you want to spend $300 a night on a hotel, your options will be limited to hotels in this class. While they may be dissapointing in their lack of frills, detail and modern styling, they do provide a basic (albeit it small) room with adequate amenities. It's nothing to write home about, so keep that in mind when choosing your hotel. For the price of a hotels in London, this was not that bad. Smoking: The smoking ettiquette in London is so poor in comparison to the USA that is deserves an entire section of commentary on just how bad it is. BE WARNED -- the English smoke everywhere!!! The entire hotel stunk of smoke. People smoked right next to us in restaurants, blowing the smoke in our direction as we tried to eat our meals. Parents smoked and blew smoke into the faces of their small children. There is an utter lack of public decorum about smoking, nor is there any concern about the health risks. IT was just disgusting. We were shocked at how many people smoked in London and how people would chain smoke while eating a meal in a restaurant. The only place we found that had seperate smoking and non-smoking sections was the Indian restaurant on the same block of the hotel (which also had the best food) so we recommend going there). The Room: The room was very small, similiar to what one would expect for a nursery. The single beds were tiny and not particularly brilliant in decor ... the blankets were old looking and my husband did not feel comfortable letting it touch his skin. We tried pushing our two beds together so we could sleep near one another, with little success because the beds shifted apart each time we moved. The TV had four stations: the BBC news, the german channel, the french channel and one with assorted English and US shows. The bathroom: Ours was very clean. There was bar soap and a shower curtain (not all Euro hotels provide curtains for the shower). The only real complaint here was that the toilet lid broke when my hsuabnd sat on it and punctured his buttocks in two places, literally removing a small chunk of his skin in one cheek! The toilet seat cover was so thin and cheap that is gave way when 200 lbs. man sat on it. Rediculous I think. So be warned, do not sit of the toilet seat cover. The Food: Breakfast came in two varieties, continental and full. Since the continental was part of our package deal we had that. It consisted on cold, stale toast that was not particularly tasty; yellow rancid butter (which tasted spoiled -- yuck); watery coffee that tasted pretty bad , tea and assorted cereals and milk. The milk and cereal was actually pretty good and the tea not bad either. If two bowels of cereal and some tea are enough for you, then you will be happy with this option. If not, we recommend walking down to Covenent Garden or to a cafe by the tube and getting a breakfast pastry or sandwich. The full breakfast, which was an addition 6 pounds or $12 US per person offered the addition of scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. We are not meat eaters so this option was not appealing. And even if we were, the meat looked so greasy, fatty, oily and less than crispy and we heard other Americans comment on the less than high quality. But this was the case every where we went in England -- they just do not have the same taste and standards in food as we Americans do. Growing up in NYC I am spoiled with amazing restaurants and great food on every block. In England the best food we found were the potatoe samosas sold in the tube and the pastries and pocket sandwiches sold at the french cafes. Look for them and try. Also, the INdian restaurant down the block from the hotel was excellent. We had both the lunch and dinner buffet, which were both very reasonable in price and had many delicious meat and vegetarian offerings. Oh, and very delicious desserts too. We very highly recommend this place because the setting was gorgeous, the food amazing and the price for lunch was about $12 per person -- which was the cheapest eats we found our entire stay! Site seeing: We took the river boat tour of the tames, which had very commical commentary from the crew. My husband had some difficulty understanding what was said because of their accents, but I was raised on Monty Python and caught every word, joke and line. The views were lovely. We also took a motor coach tour to Stone Henge, Bath and one Windsor Castle. It was wonderful. About $80 per person, and well worth it! Look around for a reputable tour company and pack your own snacks to keep your energy up and reduce the expense of the site seeing, but def get out of the city and see the rest of England. It snowed for the first time in ten years while we were walking around stone henge, which you can imagine made for truly stunning pictures. Shopping: We found great shopping and prices in the towns of Windsor and Bath. It's worth stepping out of London into the surrounding areas and doing your shopping there because you will save a fortune. In closing: My husband and I had a great time despite the hotel being pretty shabby. We made jokes about how bad the hotel was and kept each other laughing, which did add to our enjoyment and help deminish our dissapointment in the room. On our next trip to England we would probably stay outside of the city and look for higher grade accomodations. But if the Royal National is all you can afford, just go and don't worry about it. Be humble in your expectations and try to only stay in the room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and very unfriendly hotel.. avoid this”
Reviews.Author: fun888
Reviews.Content: Very old hotel with over 1000 rooms. There are long lines and hugh noise from everything. I can hear cars and bus all night long. Next door is speaking Germany all night after they return at 3 am. Can hear toilet, water running, shower from adjacent rooms. Continental breakfast is really bad too. Deco is very basic with nothing to offer. Do not stay in this noisy hotel if you want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hutchence
Reviews.Content: It was not my first time at the Royal national so i knew what to expect when i booked it. If you are looking for central location on a budget you might consider this hotel. Being the largest hotel in central London it was no surprise that check in took a while, there were several queues to check in and had to wait abouit half an hour to do it. Got to my room and it was nice, nothing fancy, 2 beds, 1 bathroom, tv, drawers, closet...everything needed for a 5 days of sightseing London and some INXS concerts. The room was clean, sheets were always very clean also. Bathroom was ok, towels were clean but had some spots on it. We got our room cleaned everyday and fresh new towels. The main problem with Royal national is its size and hence the amount of people there, it's almost impossible to have a quiet breakfast and eventually you'll have to share a table with some other guests. Breakfast consists of toasts, cereals, coffee, milk, jam, butter and it don't go any further, very simple. There's also the english breakfast for those who prefer, you must pay some extra pounds. The best thing about the hotel is it's location, perfect, a 3 mins walk to Russel square tube station, wich is Piccadilly line, and you can be anywhere within central London in about 5 minutes, it is close to everything. On a budget i would definitely be back at Royal national.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE! Worst hotel in LONDON”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was, quiet frankly, the worst Iâ€™ve stayed in, ever. The reception area and bar are reasonably well presented but the rooms are stuck in a 1980â€™s time warp. Check in took 45minutes. We booked a twin room expecting two double beds, like many other modern hotels, but we got two single beds, which you could say was our own fault. However, the fact that the beds were soft shabby sponges and the room was so small you could only just fit the beds in was not our fault. One had giant wheels on which meant if you pushed against it or moved around in the night it would roll around the room alarmingly. And has this hotel never heard of Duvets? Who still uses blankets and sheets? Come to think of it, there was a lot missing from the hotel room, like tea and coffee of a branded name, I didnâ€™t dare try the â€œown hotel brandâ€� provided, a hair dryer in the room, not down on the first floor via a deposit. Not that you would be drying your hair after using the shower and bathroom as this was just disgusting, dirty sealant round the sink, dirty grouting on the tiled walls, no complimentary shower gels or shampoos. You could have run a bath and relaxed staring at the mould growing on the ceiling as you watched the room fill up with steam as the extractor fan wasnâ€™t working. Mind you, the mould from the ceiling could easily be removed using the toilet paper it was that hard and abrasive. So the only thing was to try and get some sleep in the uncomfortable small bed, which was impossible due to the noise from the drunken slobs in the courtyard area seven floors below. The noise would have been blocked by some half decent double glazing, but there was none to be found. The Royal National Hotel needs dragging into the 2000â€™s with a major make over and update on all the rooms. That or demolish it and build a new one.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not terrible”
Reviews.Author: makarios_1
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a family trip with my wife, my mom and dad, and my brother because of the good price and the good location. The location is great--just around the corner from the Underground station (Russell Square stop) and not too far from the British Museum. We had breakfast and one dinner included. The food was very good. The staff was friendly. It took a long time to check-in because it's a huge hotel with lots of visitors. We were able to buy tickets for a hop on-hop off bus tour at the desk in the lobby and there is a pick-up point for the bus just outside the hotel. The beds were awful--they were on rollers, so they moved if you even just leaned against the wall. We were kept up by the neighbors, as the walls are not at all soundproof. Overall, I'd say this hotel is not bad for the money, especially because they gave us triple occupancy in one room.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: DMR1
Reviews.Content: Usefully located near to theatreland and Russell Square underground station, this hotel has a number of problems: 1) noise - as mentioned elsewhere, whilst we didn't hear noise from other rooms, (I guess we were lucky) the noise from the central courtyard was amplified up to our room, crashing through the useless windows. We resorted to red wine, night-nurse and cotton wool in our ears in an attempt to sleep! 2) Our triple room turned out to be a small twin with added fold-up bed. No room to move around. You need a Â£20 deposit if you want a hair drier. The room, however, was clean with an excellent shower. 3) Surly staff, especially at reception. 4) Breakfast is a joke. The dining room cannot cope with the number of guests and you will queue for ages for a table and for hot food. The continental breakfast is a non-starter. This is a pile-em-in-cheap hotel; one to which you will never return. Unfortunately, there will always be a ready supply of first-timers, so I guess the hotel will alwys be full. However, there are many international hotel chains represented in London and whilst you may pay a little more to stay at them, the extra is well worth it to retain your sanity. That's what we'll do in future. Lesson learnt!

Reviews.Title: “Boom, boom, boom!”
Reviews.Author: rjbalfour
Reviews.Content: I was doing a Contiki tour so it was suggested to stay at one of the two hotels recommended by Contiki (The Imperial is the other hotel) as there was an early start the next morning. I noticed the busy street that the hotel was on and was hoping that I didn't get a room facing the main road. I was lucky and got a room on the 2nd floor with an amazing view of a gravel terrace with cigarette butts thrown in for free! At least it seemed quiet.......at first. I couldn't hear any street noise at least. Room was kind of dingy. On face value it looked OK but the closer you looked, the more you noticed the dust lying around, small bits of rubbish (cigarette packet plastic) under the bed etc. What everyone is writing in their reviews is correct about this hotel. I stayed on a Saturday night and the nightclub (boom, boom, boom mega bass non-stop) noise went on to about 3am. I had earplugs on and I still couldn't sleep! The walls are paperthin and the windows are worthless. You may as well have them open for fresh air. I had to get up at 6am to start the tour so it wasn't a good start beginning it with complete exhaustion. I was glad to leave this hotel and I will never return. Worst hotel ever! Unless you are stone deaf, I don't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A bit Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: britgirl16_uk
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel was part of a theatre package and I must admit it was ok but not very overjoyed with it. The rooms were clean but there was some rust on the curtain rail. Apart from that the beds were comfortable and cutomer service was acceptable. Breakfast was very nice with a wide selection of English Breaskfast to Continental, however make sure you get up early as you will not find a table! Something that was NOT acceptable was being awoken at 8 am by House-keeping to see when you were checking out! That wasn't satisfactory! The room I booked was to be checked out by 11 am not 8 am! It wasn't bad for a 1 night stay but I think the hotel could do with a great big refurbishment as it looked very run down! Next time I think I will stay at the Russell Square hotel down the road looks a bit nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Pure noise HELL!”
Reviews.Author: Cliff&Rita
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on location. It is close to the underground at Russel Square so fairly easy access from Eurostar and only an hour from Heathrow Airport via tube. The hotel itself looks very nice and modern with a huge inner courtyard. The courtyard has a pub that extends actually into the courtyard itself and this is part of the problem. The pub hosts partyers supposedly only till 11pm but on our stay they were still partying hard until 2am! Our room was up on the second floor facing the courtyard and the noise was horrendous. The biggest problem isn't the partyers at the pub. It's the fact that the hotel is built so cheaply! The windows are only single pane so noise travels right through as if they were open! ARGH! We needed to wake up by 6am and worried with the incredible noise that we wouldn't get any sleep at all. My wife called the desk a few times complaining about the noise and reminded them that there own brochure specifies the pubs closing hour at 11pm. They were apologetic but thats about all. A move to another room wouldnt have been much better because the street traffic noise on the outer part of the hotel would have been just as bad! While the hotel APPEARS to be very modern (and it is very clean and well outfitted) the reality is that it has DEPLORABLE construction allowing every single sound, even mere footsteps, to be heard in the rooms. The breakfast is continental but the staff in the dining area are rude and seemed to be not interested in hearing a polite "Good morning". That was adding insult to injury. When we checked out the front desk employees also seemed to take no interest in hearing neither our "Good morning" nor or complaint about the night before. One chap simply slid a complaint form to us and suggested filling it out. At that point I suggested every employee of that hotel, including all management, stay the night themselves in their own hotel! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU NEED TO SLEEP!!!

Reviews.Title: “royal national hotel is o.k.”
Reviews.Author: amlych
Reviews.Content: stayed here two nights, a little worried before we arrived due to some reviews we found the hotel to be o.k. if you want 4 star or better pay the going rate. after all it is only a budget type hotel and the rooms e.t.c. reflect that. so please dont be put off by some of the reviews. i would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location. Good Budjet hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliedodge81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March of 2006. Loved the fact that very close the Russel Sqaure Tube stop. Took the Piccadilly Line in directly from the airport. ( had to take shuttle to station from Heathrow. Would not want to stay at this hotel in summer, room was very warm needed to leave windows open all the time and daytime temps outside rarely above 50 F. Booked trip through British Airlines very inexpensive. Was concened about reviews on this site, but $864 for 6 nights including air!! Pleasantly surprised very central locale. Arrived at 9 was able to leave luggage at no charge. Although lines were long to check in the wait was not, friendly reception, was able to check in by noon, 3 hours ahead of what we wesite promises. Although somewhat noisy because of the tours ect, was able to sleep soundly.. Twin beds pretty comfortable. Could get to all attractions with 15 20 minutes on the tube using Russell Square stop. I would stay there again no questions. Cannot say how breakfast was did not partake.. Tesco right across the street, picked up Beer, snacks, and breakfast there.. fruit yogurt bottled water ect.. One complaint ..very small.. the tea maker only worked the first day and then stopped wrking.. however it was so warm in the room I really never wanted to make the tea.. This hotel is not the Ritz but allows people on a budjet to enjoy London .. how much time do you spend at the hotel anyway???

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: VikingMen
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my Japanese friends who were staying there. It's pretty much par for the course for an overpriced and dingy British hotel. The rooms are small as others have said. The food is stodgy and boring. The staff are unhelpful and do not make an effort to communicate with people whose first language is not English (i.e. the majority of the guests). One warning is the security deposit boxes which are run, for some reason, not at the hotel desk but by the currency exchage company in a small kiosk near the front desk. When you deposit your valuables you get a receipt which you MUST KEEP because it has your box number on it - the number is not on the key. Also you pay a 20 pound deposit which they are supposed to return when you leave. BUT you must ASK FIRMLY for the deposit to be returned, otherwise they will not give it back. The one good thing about this hotel is that it's huge, so it will probably have a space for a last minute booking, and the location near the British Museum. But there are plenty of other hotels in Bedford Place, nearby and I'd try one of them instead.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: smiffy56
Reviews.Content: having read all the bad reports after booking we booked in to the hotel with some trepidation. Yes the hotel is large, Yes it is full of tourists, yes it does take a while to book in (15mins for us). However staff were efficient and friendly. Twin room size not overly large but quite adequate. (about the same size you would get 3* in Majorca/Canaries etc.) Very clean, plenty of towels in bathroom. The breakfast was poor. Avoid the full english Â£4.00 extra not worth it. The continental breakfast was adequate and filled a whole. The dinning area was very much like a canteen and very busy. Underground car park a real bonus Â£16.00/24hrs. This hotel is ideal for the overnighter with car and ideally situated for the west end theatres. Covent garden 10mins walk. Excellent value for money. For all the moaners out there. What do you really expect for the price in London. If you want Savoy type pay the price. David and Sue Banbury oxon

Reviews.Title: “Hot and Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: KidneyBoy
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms were spartan. Rooms were HOT, and no A/C, so had to have window open. Unfortunately street noise doesn't die down until 0200, and then starts up again at 0600. Good value for budget minded, but if you are looking for a nicer London hotel, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “avoid if you're not a teenager travelling in a group”
Reviews.Author: eleo75
Reviews.Content: Being part of a company on tour the theatre we performed in booked us 30 rooms in this hotel. We can't blame them for having to find such a large number of rooms in London but I'd have had us scattered throughout the city in different hotels rather than having the whole company (director included) stay in the same place. First, the courtyard: this hotel has more than 600 rooms (or so I heard) and the general look is closer to the worse public housing buildings in northern England than the basic London chain-hotels. Then, the lobby: forget any idea you have about 'English-club charm', it looks more like a rail-station hall with youths screaming everywhere. The courtyard hosts a departure/arrival lounge for Contiki tours so many, too many teenage groups stay there. Consequently, you may experience late-hour chasing in the corridor, constant chats just outside your door (paper-thin - as the walls are) about X's or Y's last crush - all this at 1 or 2 am. Earplugs recommended. The rooms are quite small, the one good point is you have a kettle to make your own tea and coffee. Beds are tiny, according to the size of the room, and on wheels (yes, this hotel stands as a 3-star, believe it or not), mattresses are just horribly thin and my sheets had stains (to the reception's credit, they changed them after I complained the following day). The breakfast room is huge (again, the rail-station impression), very noisy and the food quality is just average. The location is not so bad, very close the British Museum. I spent 4 nights there and the first evening was already too much! There is truly an accomodation problem in London for travelers who earn quite a good living but not enough to stay in the luxury hotels and the Royal National is unfortunately an absolute example.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect any Royalty treatment”
Reviews.Author: Sarid
Reviews.Content: A month ago, my friend and I stayed at the Royal National. We knew we shouldn't expect too much out of the hotel because we had a bad review from others but still, it came with the deal, and we decided not to be influenced by others, but to give them a chance. The first night we couldnâ€™t sleep because of the bad mattress, so old that you can actually feel every spring inside, my friend got up with back and neck ache. We ask them to change the mattress and they send us to wait in the room for someone from housekeeping, after 20 min that nobody came, we called the housekeeping who told us not to wait and that theyâ€™ll replace the mattresses anyway, and I'm asking, Why the reservation send us to wait? Couldnâ€™t they tell us that they will take care of that?! When we came back in the evening, we were happy to find out that they have replaced them to much better mattress. In that evening, the water in the toilet was dripping constantly, the noise can be really annoying; we asked someone to check that in the morning, this time, we didn't wait for housekeeping... When we arrived to the room in the evening we found a note that they found a crack in the bathroom that might be dangerous for us and therefore we should approach the reservation. We have, and they told us to switch rooms, after the mattress issue, we ask to check the room before switching rooms, As we thought, the mattress were terrible, so we didn't agree, so they gave told us they can't do anything about it and it's late, therefore we should fill in a complaint form, I asked how it could help me, it's not solving my problems in the room, so they send me to check another room, which 2 lamps werenâ€™t working, and the mattresses were bad as well, no mention of the size of the room who were smaller. at 10:30pm, after checking 3 non reasonable rooms I was checking, instead of going to take a nice shower and go to sleep, I was told nothing can be done cause the staffs going home and all I can do is complain in the morning. The most rudeness was thing was, that they send someone with us to check one of the room, and when we told him that the mattress are not comfortable he was so rude to tell us that they cant do anything for us, cause our problem is with the furniture, we told him they aware of the problem with the mattress cause they replace it in the first room, so he told us no way, we don't to it, hint we are lying. That was the straw that broke the camel's back. Than I decide to fill in the complaint form. And guess what, it didn't help a bit, they came in the morning, ask for the problems, saw the defect in the room but done nothing except of a small â€œcompensationâ€�, they gave us small shampoo small face towel and nylon cap for the shower. At our last morning, at the dining room, they were expecting a group, probably important, cause they cover the tables with tablecloth and flowers, they were so busy with that, that they forgot there are other people in the hotel, who need forks, bread, all they have done is sending people to take bread from another place in the room instead of refill the basket when empty, they staff were rude and told people to get up cause they have to prepare the place. They made people feel like a second degree guest. I love London, I'll visit there again, but there is no way I'll stay at the royal national again, even if it will be given for free.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Bogiboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. Positives. The room and bathroom were both big enough and clean. The location is very convenient to tube and buses. The concierge was very helpful with directions etc, though not very friendly. The price (100 pounds) for a twin was reasonable for London, I guess. Negatives. It's huge and the reception area is just like an airport departure area. The staff were not rude but not really friendly. One 2-minute local call cost me three pounds. I'd stay there again simply because of the number of bad experiences I've had at hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good Group Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: JanBet
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Royal National Hotel on Woburn/Bedford Place in the Bloomsbury area of London and saying "never again", I must write to say how pleased I was with the updated accommodations and food service. I was concerned about the hotel quality after reading postings on Trip Advisor, but I was quite satisfied with the accommodations. Seventeen years ago my group had to take the tray from the room to the service kitchen and get hard rolls, butter, jam and juice. This trip (with a group of 87), we had a full english breakfast each morning. Probably the greatest advantage of using this hotel with a group is the open area between the two sections of the hotel. Our chartered coaches were able to park in the open area for loading/unloading instead of parking streetside. The hotel has two dining areas and a separate lounge. There is free Wi-Fi access in the hotel lobby. The rooms had comfortable beds and the rooms were clean. We had two minor problems and they were corrected within a few hours. Registration for groups was well organized. To anyone travelling to London with a group, I can recommend the Royal National Hotel. Jane

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: UrsaMajor
Reviews.Content: The Royal National Hotel is a reasonably priced hotel with small rooms and minimal luxuries. We had our adult daughter (a student in Britain) with us and a cot with minimal padding (maybe 2 inches thick), was supplied, leaving little room for manouvering about. The 2 single beds were creaky and had mattresses that were a little lumpy. The TV and room lights had crossed wires in the bedside switches. The electric kettle didn't work. There were no face cloths and no shampoo in the bathroom. The bathtub had the smallest width of any I've ever seen - standing sideways in it having a shower my toes started curling up the sides (and I have average sized feet). On the positive side the hotel was reasonably quiet, the room readily accessible by elevator (a little surprising given the hotel's large number of guests), there was plenty of hot water in the shower, the continental breakfast quite sufficient though not of noteable quality, and the location is pretty good for those who like to walk to some of the nearby tourist sites and restaurants and pubs, and is close to the Russell Square underground station and about a 10 minute walk to King's Cross railway station. The 2 double decker bus companies that sell tours both have stops right at the hotel. My most serious complaint about the hotel was the lack of any ... any! ... response by the numerous employees in the dining room to assist my daughter when one of the elderly guests spilled hot tea on my daughter's back causing her considerable pain and distress. One employee rushed over to clean up the spilled tea and said not a word to her and offered her no assistance.

Reviews.Title: “eh, it was part of a package deal”
Reviews.Author: TriumphTR7
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be a reasonably nice short stay as part of a British Airways package deal. Plusses are location (central to main sites of London and the tube) and price. Everything else is a compromise. The breakfast was kind of sad, I'd suggest skipping that altogether and finding a nearby cafe. The room was tiny but clean, if a little worn looking. I might stay again as part of a package deal if I returned again, but I'd be very tempted to find other lodging if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room in the World”
Reviews.Author: T&BG
Reviews.Content: Wow. This the largest hotel with the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. If you don't take the right elevator you will have a hike to your room. The rooms smell musty and the bed is almost on the floor. The location was great for us. This was our first trip to London and the location made it very easy for us to get around. Jewel in Picadilly Circus is a great bar/restaurant. And Billy Elliott the Musical was fantastic. If you loved the movie you'll love the musical! If you're in the mood to splurge on a meal, I highly recommend Spoon. Unreal service and the food, WOW. It's pricey, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Not so royal”
Reviews.Author: taykayTroy_MI
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews online about this hotel and we were a bit apprehensive that we were still going to stay there. Anyways, we booked through British Airways and as part of a package deal we got the room for free. When we arrived it was a bit chilly and we waited for about over an hour for our room in the lobby. We were tired and had a difficult infant with us, so it was a bit trying. While in the lobby we were exposed to second hand smoke. The smoking section is outside, but the door stays open, so the smell travels. Eventually when we went to our room, it was neat and clean, but cold. Housekeeping had left the window open. There was no way to warm up the room. There were 2 twin beds on wheels which is really an accident waiting to happen. The shower was not bad, a bit of a climb into the tub. The faucet did not have a mixer for hot and cold, they were separate. We were only provided with 2 bathtowels- no handtowels or facecloths. Because we had an infant we were required by law to have a crib in the room. The crib took up way too much space in an already small room. Also, no extra blankets were provided for the crib. It looked worn and unsafe, in my opinion. On the plus side we were within walking distance of the British Museum. The hotel restuarant offered excellent Indian dining. All in all we will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Royal National Hotel better than expected”
Reviews.Author: DS1945
Reviews.Content: My wife, Carolyn, and I, and my wifes mum were at the Royal National Hotel on Sunday May 7th and we left on Friday, May 12th, 2006. After reading all the horror stories online, I thought we would have a major problem, but, we were all surprised that things worked out much better than expected. We arrived at the hotel on Sunday, and went right up to the check in desk. Within a few minutes, we had our key card and off to our room for the next five nights. Carolyn is a wheelchair user. She has a spinal cord injury. (L-2) We thought she would have a tough time, but, all in all, it worked out perfect. Carolyn's mum had her own room, right next to ours, which made it easy for the mum to find us. The hotel is located a short walk to the British Museum. And the British Museum is free. Within a few minutes from the hotel, you can walk to the Russell Square tube station, Royal Post Office, and several MAC Machines. A bunch of buses stop right in front of the hotel. You need to know which direction to wait for the bus or else you are going in the wrong direction. The windows in the hotel are old and don't open too easy plus there are no screens in the windows. And like most of London, the hotel does not have AC. Breakfast was in the Windsor Room. Breakfast is served from 7AM to 10AM. The room is huge and there were a lot of tables to pick from. The Windsor Room is on the ground floor, and just a few yards to the hotel registration desk. Here is the selection for breakfast: We had the full English Breakfast, so we could have anything we wanted. The Cont Breakfast is everthing but the hot food. Breakfast included toast, scrambled eggs, fried eggs, bacon, bangers, porridge, baked beans, stewed tomatoes, canned grapefruit and orange sections, orange juice, four different kinds of dry cereal. (Rice Krispies, Bran Flakes, Granola, and Corn Flakes.) Plus rolls and butter and many flavors of jelly. In our hotel room, the potty seat was broken and the inside door handle came off when you opened the door. Both problems were fixed. Lots of hot water and lots of water pressure. A small problem in the bathroom sink. Hot and cold do not come out together. The water in the tub does come out together. The bathtub is long and narrow. The bed and pillows are both very hard. Didn't see any bedbugs but the carpet in the hallway could use a good cleaning or else just replaced.
