Since the hotel is seven stories high, and long hallways, that would cost a small fortune to replace the carpet. The signs posted that Breakfast is served on each floor is incorrect. The only place you can have breakfast is in the Windsor Room on the ground floor. I bought a converter to charge up my camcorder batteries and Carolyn's hair dryer. The converter I came with didn't work. Housekeeping will loan you a three prong plug and hair dryer for a small deposit, which you get your money back when you return what you borrowed. Don't use the phone in the room to make any phone calls locally, or else you will pay a small fortune. The phone in the room is good for room to room calls, or else to the front desk or for a wake up call. There are three pay phones in the lobby. The pay phones take change from 20p up to Â£1. A little window on the pay phone tells you how much time is left. The hotel does not supply you with a wash cloth or shampoo. Within a short walk of the hotel you will find a Pizza Hut, Subway, (not the tube but a Subway sandwich shop), and many Italian Restuarants. We used the same bank of lifts (elevators). Next to the bank of four lifts is a money exchange booth. The hotel is just a few minute walk to the Russell Square Tube Station on the Piccadilly Line. This station does have three lifts, but, you still need to walk 20 steps to the platform. When you leave the Russell Square tube station, turn left. Walk to the traffic light. You will see the Royal Post Office. Turn right and you'll see the Royal National Hotel on the left. In conclusion, the RNH is not the the best place to stay, but, its really in a great location for places to eat, and catch the tube or the bus, You can take the Piccadilly Line from Heathrow to Russell Square without changing tubes. Its around an hour tube ride. A one time ride will be Â£4.00. or an all day travelcard zone 6 to zone 1 is Â£6.30. I bored you enough. This review is done. I'm out of here!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: poms40
Reviews.Content: no big problems, 2 rooms, one triple, one single, perfectly clean, sheets, carpet, bathroom.... enough towels no hangers in 1 bedroom plenty of hot water we asked for a morning call we never had but lost our room key twice and had it made again without comment got a real nice price from the concierge for our taxi to Gatwick continental breakfast ok, nice toasts, wait for the hot ones they come in regularly don't bother having the english breakfast there, 4 pounds, not worth it go elsewhere I will stay there again next time very good location

Reviews.Title: “Its Clean”
Reviews.Author: ron4152
Reviews.Content: Its clean. Motel 6 offers more room amenities. Had to give a $20 deposit for a hair dryer. Three short phone calls cost 9.5 pounds. No shampoo in room. Decent location. There is an internet store down the block with reasonable rates. There is a convenience store near it with prices 1/3 less than hotel. Finally, directly across the street from the hotel is a Greek restaurant that was excellent and very reasonable. We ate there twice. The hotel is strictly a tourist base with a clean place to sleep. I would not stay there again except it was a freeby from British Air.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs were the worst part, along with hair in the tub and sink, horrible mattresses and long lines for the miserable breakfast. Bogus fire alarm at 4:00 AM and rude staff didn't help.

Reviews.Title: “Britsh Airways, Shame on you!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a package deal with British Airways which included this hotel. I read the reviews and was quite apprehensive about staying there. It lived up to its reputation. Rude front desk personnel, dirty rooms, loud partying teenagers, and my personal favorite, a room that smelled of BO that was embedded in the bedspreads. In retrospect, I would have gladly paid 3 times as much for a nicer place since it ruined my holiday. Thanks BA, for a crappy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: refaro
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here 2 weeks ago. Found it to be perfectly adequate. No complaints, other than the crowds of college age people there.

Reviews.Title: “Very OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there from march 31-april 3 with our 2-year old (+my husband and I) and it wasnt bad at all! Yes hotel is bit older and has older furniture but really- who cares about that!? At first our room was normal size ( I mean we didnt book the suite, so we didnt expect it either).. They even added a third bed for our son and we still had enough room and my son had enough room to play. Bathroom was big and nice.. shower-curtain was bit short and floor got wet but dryed off very quickly. Second... room was clean!!! Bathroom was clean.. Floor was clean, carpet was clean...yes one of my sheets had a little stain on it but was changed very quickly after I made complaint. We had 5 hangers in wardrobe and extra blanket, extra pillow and extra towel.Oh and towels were clean as well and I didnt see through them as some other people described here. Third... nowbody knocked on my door in the morning and tried to come to clean it!!! First time when I saw people cleaning rooms was at 10.00 am...and after I told cleaning lady that we dont need cleaning she didnt demand it and asked very politely do I need some more towels, toilet-paper or soap.Also I found all hotel stuff to be polite and friendly and helpful.. About breakfast.. its nothing special as described but we payed 4pounds extra for full english breakfast and that was pretty good. Still I would'nt recommend dinner at the hotels restaurant... it was'nt good at all! Yes hotel is busy and there are lot fo young people ( we didnt hear loud noise tough) but also there were business-men, older people, tourist groups and you can buy all kind of attraction tickets, tour tickets and ext from the lobby, and the location is great as said in other comments. We would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!! My sister and I booked a package on British Air and had no idea what the hotel was going to look like-- we were absolutely horrified when we got there...Rooms are tiny and dirty, service is terrible, noise level from crowds of kid groups is out of control!!! It was worse than Motel 6. The only plus was a convenient location on Russell Square. Do go to London, but never ever stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hi am 18 years old and visited the royal national hotel, the rooms were brilliant, me and my two companions had an ample of room as we were in a 3 bedroom room. yes the hotel was lacking in amineties such as an adiquate suplly of towels. But we had a televison a kettle cups and of course tea bags. the rooms would of benefited a fridge though for the milk. getting to the hotel was easy its just a tube away and fantastic in rush hours as there were many lifts that cated for allthe people and of coure there were stairs that one could take. i realy enjoyed my stay at the hotel however the breakfast was abit of a scandal and the meals were disgusting but again there are many restarunts, and they can accomodate for any budget.

Reviews.Title: “An Adequate Tourist Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoGuy
Reviews.Content: We just completed a two-night stay at the Royal National as part of a package from British Airways. This was our first trip to London, so I can truly offer a tourist's opinion about this hotel. First, yes, the hotel is a bit older and a bit worn. We jokingly categorized it as a youth hostel for adults since it offers basic rooms with average beds, towels you can almost see through and one, tiny bar of soap as your only bathroom amenity! However, we found the room clean enough not to panic (although dusty from an open window with no screen), and the hotel is located in a nice, seemingly secure neighborhood. We had a room facing the inside courtyard which was very quiet (no traffic noise). Fortunately, we experienced a very quiet stay unlike reviews from others on this site. The best thing about this hotel is the fact that it offers a very convenient, safe, tourist-friendly location right across the street from the Russell Street Tube (on the Picadilly Line which will get you easily to any tourist sites you'll wish to visit) and terrific nightly rates for London. Other advantages tourists may enjoy: on-site coffee shop and pub, HSBC (major bank in London) ATM on the corner, money exchange in the hotel with good rates, two grocery stores within a block (one open 24 hours), the British Museum is a 5 minute walk, friendly porters that help with directions and tour information, and London's two major sight seeing bus companies sell tickets and pick up at the hotel's entrance (very convenient). We were also allowed to check in at 1100 when we first arrived from the airport. The hotel is a 1.5 to 2 star property for tourists who want a good rate, a convenient location and a simple place to rest at night. I would not suggest staying here if you plan to spend a great deal of time in the hotel, if you want to impress a travel companion or if you require more sophisticated amenities. Would I go back? Yes, if the hotel is still a bargain. I would not pay more to stay at this hotel; however, what it offers at current rates is adequate for a quick visit. I hope you enjoy London!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, really”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a three night stay at the Royal National as part of a very good British Airways London package. I had been apprehensive because of the reviews I had read, however, we enjoyed a very comfortable stay at the Royal National. Indeed, the hotel is not what you might expect from a new American Marriot or the like. The rooms are small in comparison, and need some updating. However, they are clean and comfortable and quite adequate, unless you are flying to London to spend all your time in a hotel room. There is noise from some younger guests - the hotel seems to be a favorite for school groups and young people - but it quieted down by sleeping time and did not interfere with our rest. Our continental breakfast was simple but most welcome and fortified us for our morning sight-seeing. We found the staff to be most helpful and courteous. The lobby area is very nice and there appears to be a major effort ongoing at fixing up and repairing as we were greeted daily by maintence workers painting, carpeting, cleaning, etc. There is a pub downstairs as well which came in handy one night when we were too tired to go back out. A nice pint of ale, conversation with locals and some fine fish and chips can be had there. The area is directly near the British Museum and is serviced by the tour bus route, underground and surface busses and within walking distance to the heart of London. We'd return for more anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As an aussie traveller and my first stay overseas, I must say that it was absolutley crap at this hotel! We had YELLOW stains in the shower!! The reception didn't help us when we were dying in our room cause the heater temperature wouldn't go down, and the noise of sirens in the area ever 30 minutes was driving me crazy as a was loosing sleep! This hotel turned me off London that I spent a whole day in my hotel and rested. The people were so rude to my friend and they definetly don't know how to serve a lady as they never offered to carry their bags when they had to escort my friend to a taxi! If you want a chaep crappy stay go to the Royal National!

Reviews.Title: “Equal to Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One morning, I happened to notice something on the floor between the twin beds--a pair of women's underwear. Wonder how long it had been there? The overall cleanliness of the hotel would receive a negative number. The clerks at the front desk were above RUDE. If you don't like your job, quit and find something else, but don't take it out on the customer! Would I recommend this hotel--no way! sc

Reviews.Title: “The toilet broke and cut me while I was sitting on it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The shower was too small for two so I sat on the toilet to keep my wife company when suddenly the toilet lid cracked into four pieces beneath me. The sharp thin plastic cut my bottom and thigh in 4 places. I bled. Teenagers screamed in the hall and courtyard all night. The breakfast was cold toast, rancid butter (seriously) and cereal. Our last night there we found several different types of hair wound into the fibers of the bedsheets that did not match us. We could not figure out if the sheets were dirty or if the washers were not strong enough to remove hair. But with the US to UK exchange rate at arund 50%, US visitors would have to spend about $250 US per night to get something nicer. It was close to the tube, restaurants, sites, the park, museums, grocery stores, cafes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Garyow
Reviews.Content: A used glass of cola greeted me on window shelf it had mould growing in it. Informed Concessionaire he said 'people hide these things from time to time', and offered to move us to a different room. On closer inspection the sink had stains which easily came off by a wipe of a finger. Another cup (used) behind telly (these are really hard to find places). Window would not close properly, it felt as if we were sleeping in middle of a dual carriage-way. Next door was same, where my parents were sleeping. Bathroom floor was nicely tiled and the carpet in bedroom looked quite new. Walls in corridors had plasterwork crumbling away, some had been patched in corners by unsightly angle iron. Hotel looks good from outside and reception area is quite impressive. This hotel is desperate for a refurbishment. It has potential to be a great hotel, but seems they do not want to spend unless they really have to. Breakfast is a roll / toast and cereal, unless you go for the full english which is not bad, and we were kindly given free by Concessionaire. All in all the Â£206 spent for two triple rooms did not feel like money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Ewwww!!! What's that on the window?”
Reviews.Author: BoroRach
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a trip with university so didn't have a choice about where we stayed-if I had it wouldn't have been here!!! We arrived in our room to find a used condom on the window sill with an erm...interesting... stain on the window. We then went on to find the bathroom floor hadn't been cleaned properly as it was full of (someone else's) hair. Our room was an OK size but was badly in need of refurbishment. We didn't find that there was much noise but we were probably the ones making it to be fair! :-) The breakfast is best avoided as its cold bread, juice that has a head and grey tea or coffee. There's plenty of places to grab some food in London so stay in bed the extra half hour and don't bother with it. It was in a good location with three tube stations close by as well as Euston train station. Its a shame that the shabby rooms let it down. The staff weren't the nicest we've ever met. Our maid burst into our room one morning and shouted, 'ARE YOU GOING OUT OR WHAT?!' It wasn't the nicest wake up call but nevermind, we still had a great time. Afterall it was a cheap break and you get what you pay for don't you?

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for..”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGta
Reviews.Content: Very basic , the hotel is quite old and it shows, breakfast is cold toasts and juice unless you pay extra, room and bathroom are small but clean, if you get it with a deal and on budget, go for it, but if a nice room is important factor on your trip or you are traveling with young kids, look elsewhere. Pro : Great location in London, great water pressure, can be had for cheap if you buy with a package deal. Con : Old facility, noisy heat, small room. Mostly backpackers type while I was there, younge noisy crowds, not a family hotel and you should not pay more then 35 pounds for a night here.

Reviews.Title: “the price was right and it was close to the 'Tube'.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a big 'budget' hotel. It was noisy on one or two nights, but the rest of the week was fine. Need to watch out for the noisy young crowd though. Ask for a room at the end of a hallway. All-in-all, it's a fair deal. It's close to the metro and many restaurants and attractions in the area. Will stay there again this spring.

Reviews.Title: “Youve been warned!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with ny husband and 2 year son. booked as looked ok in the brochure and cheap but when we opened the door I knew we had made a big mistake. The reception area looks ok but it ends there. There were holes in the wall, 3 single sink in the middle beds, dirty floors and hair covered baths (the hair wasnt ours). The noise from the roads and the other guests kept us awake all night, and the scrambled egg tasted of fish. We would never go back and would rather sleep in our car. Do not stay here unless you like dirt, bad food and lack of sleep. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED !!!

Reviews.Title: “My nightmare...but here are some great tips too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must prefice this review by stating that I lived in the UK for some time, and have stayed in hostels, bed and breakfasts and up-scale hotels (and never had a problem) in London since 1997. This was the first *and last* visit to the Royal National. I will speak to several ideas in detail (including the petty theft). If you're not interested, just go all the way to the bottom and read about the amenities and key points. The concierge are actually *porters*, so do not expect them to have appropriate concierge-esque (?) knowledge. Only about 1/6 of them are kind and willing to help; many just blink at you if your question doesn't relate to where to find the laundrette or pub. Very, very rude. A friend of mine and I had a flight to Dublin at 6am and required a taxi at 4:00am. We confirmed our wake-up call and pre-arranged taxi with the porters TWICE, as well as the operator. Wouldn't you know, the taxi wasn't there and many blessings on my friend's alarm clock that morning... It can get quite noisy at night, especially if your room is on the 'inside,' facing the courtyard (smoking area by the bar). Bring some earplugs -- the walls are thin! Bring your own alarm clock -- phone-requests are either 15 minutes early, late, or never! Room keys become deactivated just about every day, or every other day . . . you will get all the way up to the 10th floor and, "Whoops!" you have to go all the way back downstairs. Since I was staying there for two weeks (with the group; I would have changed hotels if I could have), I did this at least 8 times throughout my stay!!!!!! On the second day of my visit, my laptop, camera and other items were stolen from me in the hotel lobby. I turned my back to put on my coat and when I turned back - they were gone. The security guards (the only kind souls, besides the wonderful housekeeping staff) caught it on video but were not there to assist because they don't come in until 3:00p.m. Interestingly enough, the same two thieves snatched a purse just two days prior from the same place in the lobby, at approximately the same time. Be warned... Breakfast in the morning is every man/woman/child for themselves. :) Go early...toast, cereal, bread rolls and jam/butter are available. There is also a hot-food bar for a fee (sausage/bacon/fruit/eggs/tinned tomatoes). Bring your own coffee or tea...blech! However, the free(included) breakfast was the best part of my stay. :) If you have sensitive skin, be aware that many people have minor allergies to the soap used on the linens. I know this because I was traveling with a college-student group that returns to this hotel twice a year, and many of the students break out in a rash due to the harsh soap. The rooms were quite clean and, as I mentioned previously, the housekeeping staff is friendly and accomodating. Shirin was the housekeeper on our floor, and she was quite helpful (especially when I had to move rather quickly for security reasons after the theft). Remember - washcloths are not provided in the UK; bring your own. There is a tour-booking booth just outside of the hotel, and a theatre-tickets booth inside the lobby. The location of the hotel is BRILLIANT; just 1 1/2 blocks from Russell Square tube station, and across the street from a bus stop. The British Museum is within walking distance (5-10 minutes). A 'Tesco Express' (grocery store) is across the street from the tube stop, and multiple restaurants are nearby. A laundrette (fluff and fold or do-it-yourself) is about 2 blocks away; athough the facility is small and expensive (expect to pay approx. 7-8 pounds for one load of wash and dry), the staff is friendly. An American-Express office is just one block beyond the tube stop on the 'High Street.' A bank and a currency exchange office are just 1/2 block away as well. The Internet cafe is just a couple of shops away, and the price is only 1 pound per 30 minutes! There are printing facilities at the cafe, or go across the street to the Xerox/film developing shop. Purchase phone cards from the post office, which is also just one block away. These cards have the best rate, by far. Don't bother with the 'America First Gold/Platinum Edition' cards from the tobacco/7-11 shop across the street or the internet cafe two-doors down. You'll get about 30 minutes of international calling time for $10 (5 pounds). The post office card gives you two hours or so. **So...in a nutshell, be VERY cautious when staying at the RNH, and if you frequent the pubs nearby as well. I'm an extremely conscientious traveler (money belt and all), but it can happen to anyone. There are signs on the London Pub, etc.. that warn of thefts.** -Be VERY much on guard in and out of your room -Be prepared to pack your own sheets (harsh soap used) -Bring flip-flops or sandals so you don't have to walk on the dirty floors on the way to the pocket-sized bathrooms -Bring your own coffee or tea -Bring your own alarm clock -Call your own taxis, and don't rely on porters for information -Bring earplugs -Convenient location -Get a new room key every couple of days -Wear a money belt -Hairdryers require 20pound deposit -Non-smoking rooms...ha! :( -BYOW - Bring your own washcloth -Hotel internet is unreliable/phone-card telephones in lobby are in high-demand after 6:00pm I understand that the Tavistock and President's Hotels (also owned by the Imperial Hotels - but are around the corner) are much safer/cleaner. The staff was kind when we held meetings in their conference rooms. Their breakfast was much, much nicer than the one at RNH. Good luck, and Mind the Gap!

Reviews.Title: “Barely Tolerable”
Reviews.Author: BCExplorer
Reviews.Content: For Students & Budget Travelers the Royal National is barely tolerable. Anyone looking for luxury should keep looking. The Royal National is close to the Russel Square tube station making it easy to get around London, which is great because you won't want to spend a lot of time in the room. Rooms are small, poorly furnished and poorly kept. We had the fortune of staying in two different rooms (at the beginning and end of our tour) and on one of the nights my bed smelled noticeably odd. The desk staff wasn't helpful and seemed more concerned with chatting with each other - Which was unfortunate because they required that we return the key when we left the hotel and pick it up again when we returned. At first the metal rod that the key was attached to encouraged us to leave it with them but at the end it became such a pain that we just lugged the thing around. This is only suitable for those people want a cheap place to stay with a good location, but donâ€™t care about the condition about their room.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for the price?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also stayed at the Royal National after British Airways (surprise, surprise!) told us 12 of the 13 better hotels on their list were all booked up. The Royal National is exactly like a college dorm: blond wood, thin doors, etc. but we didn't expect anything better for the price. The free breakfast was - free. This ain't the Embassy Suites. I will say it's well-located, though. Since we were there December 25 and 26, everything around was closed.

Reviews.Title: “don't even think of staying here”
Reviews.Author: Elaine.manchester
Reviews.Content: if you like staying in a dirty poorly run youth hostel then this is for you. rooms are filthy, couldn't get a wink of sleep due to noisey corridors and banging of doors. The less said about the breakfast the better. Your better off paying that extra five pounds and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Like A spring Break Hotel in Florida”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here with my wife and 2 and a half year old as part of an airline/hotel deal from British Airways. It was the only hotel that was available in the special BA promotion (a fact that is not made readily known to you until you finish booking the airline ticket - they offer a list of 12 hotels and none were available except this one - but that's BA's fault and not the hotel's fault.) We had booked about 5 months ago (June 2005) for our stay in November 2005. We had requested a cot or crib for our son and had a confirmation that it would be there when we checked in. We checked in around 10 p.m. and were informed by the front desk staff that the housekeeping staff had left for the day and they did not put a cot in the room and no one has a key to the room that has the cots and we would have to contact housekeeping the next day. After letting them know it was not acceptable (and we needed to speak to a manager) they said they would send someone over to remedy the situation. About 20 minutes later two hotel staff members brought a collapsible mattress. We asked for pillows - and they replied "Oh you need pillows too now eh?" WTF? Do British hoteliers train in customer service? This was not an unreasonable request. They came back with some pancake thin pillows another 20 minutes later. The rooms are very compact and had two single beds (we put the collapsible bed between the two). There is a desk, two chairs, a TV, lamp, and coffee/tea-maker also. The bathroom is also very tight. A complimentary small bar of soap is provided. You have to ease yourself into the bathroom close the door then make your way to the toilet. The bathtub us rather high (at least according to US standards and very old people or those with disabilities may have a hard time getting in). Towels are provided, although they feel like they have been around since Margaret Thatcher was in office - they are very rough and do a good job of exfoliating your skin. The lobby area of the hotel was filled with 18-24 year old Europeans and British tourists when we checked in. In the evening these people forget they are in a hotel and are very loud - I'm talking playing club music at a very loud volume and making noise in the hallway loud. We had to call the front desk after a group of them keep slamming their doors after 11 p.m. at night. This was after asking them politely not to. I might add that my 2 and half year old was better behaved and had better manners that most of these 18 - 24 year olds. I donâ€™t think most of them grasped the concept of a hotel - they treated it more like a college dormitory - walking around the hallways without shoes and in their pajamas. The highlight was one night when one young girl (20ish) walked around banging on every door on the 3rd floor because she forgot what room she was in - mind you this was past 11 p.m. at night. Breakfast is provided in the mornings (make sure you have your yellow cards that they give you at check-in) and you are treated to cereal, cold toast, and small packets of butter and jam. Coffee and tea is also provided (they are made in huge batches). The wait staff in the dining area is surly. Silverware and plates are scarce at certain times. If you don't show up at least half an hour before breakfast is over (breakfast is served 7 - 10 a.m) you lose out. The wait staff starts breaking down tables and stop making any more food. For an additional few pounds, you can buy a "hot" English breakfast. Checkout was easy. Although I question their security. My in-laws who were staying in a different room were running late on the day of check out (they went to pick up a rental car) so my wife and I asked whether we could get their bags out of their room (so that they wouldnâ€™t be charged for late check out) and the front-desk staff made a keycard for us without asking for ID or anything. Other: - There is a safe-deposit box and money exchange place in the lobby next to the elevator. - There seems to be wireless internet access in the building. We saw a 20 something in a t-shirt, and shorts and flip-flops sitting on the floor next to the information desk with her Mac power book plugged unto an electrical outlet and chatting away on instant messenger. - There are 24 hour food shops (sorta like 7-11s in the US) across the street. - The noise from the courtyard travels into the hotel rooms. - The tube stop is only a 5 minute walk away. - There is a Tesco nearby. - There are some nice restaurants and bars about a 15 - 20 minute walk away. We liked Rasa Samudra on 5 Charlotte Street, a great South Indian restaurant. I would give this hotel a 2.75 stars out of 5. It was cheap and clean and great if you use it to sleep for about 8 hours (provided the euro club kids are having a party on your floor).

Reviews.Title: “Royal Nation "Disaster"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's stay in London. We are still "cringing" at the thought of this hotel! Aside from the room being micro-mini, they appeared to never adequately clean it! Note: we don't think they ever turned on the vacuums that we saw every morning in the hallways. They also had a tour group of young people who, during one night, began screeming, laughing and "carouzing" in the hallways from 10:30 p.m. to approximately 2 a.m. Calls to the front desk did little to curb this annoyance. It also seems necessary to post signs in the rooms, or perhaps a notice given when people check into the hotel to "please be considerate of other people staying at the hotel and keep voices down when traveling through the hallways." Just because they are awake and out at a particular time doesn't mean that other hotel guests are on the same time schedule!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you can”
Reviews.Author: propertravel
Reviews.Content: Coming from hotel industry; I have never thought a hotel could run so bad ! If you have to stay there ( better option is to stay on a bank at Hyde Park or similar ) try to get the refurbished room, cleaner and better, but you wont avoid the noise whichever section you stay, all loud guests till the morning will give you a party feeling in your room. Reception : There are two parts concierge - worst ever concierge, never get real help, ignorant, rude and unhelpful people. If you would receive a package or message forgat that you will receive anyway. Initial reception, uninterested with guests you may get some help if you are lucky. Breakfast: Try to go out of the hotel and get some decent food to start your day better around the corner caffees. If you pay 4 pounds extra they allow you to get something called English breakfast which would be considered as an insult by original Brits. Continental breakfast, toasted breadlike thin slices, butter and lowest quality jam. Coffea and tea undrinkable. If you have to get your breakfast there at least buy tea bags from the market. Housekeeping; my only positive point they keep your towels fresh but do not get surprised if your bin unchanged or you find your own hair in the bath tube. If you go to housekeepinmg office to get electric adapters or hair dryers against a deposit they are the only people smile at you. Its close to tube station and close to British museum if you want to have a bad experince or treated bad with your own money ! In Turkey if even the cheepest pension not even a hotel would treat anyone and try to serve that breakfast against what you pay would be enough for the owner to loose the licence.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, VERY close to Russell Square tube line. Room size was good. Not so good: no kleenex tissues, no small shampoos, conditioners, handlotions, no hand towels, soap was very tiny and only 2 in the bathroom, no hair dryers, no radio or alarm clock, breakfast area very, very congested - twice we were directed to the Tavistock Hotel breakfast area, reception desk not open before 8:00 AM - not good for early departures. Lobby very congested with massive number tour bus drop-offs. Next time, a smaller hotel but still in the Russell Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyLubeck
Reviews.Content: Must say i was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. When your expections are low, your stay will be ok. Royal National is truly a hotel factory. Front desk is of course always busy, but service and attention is better than ok. Friendly and with smilining faces, believe it or not (which is not common in London generally). Rooms are very basic, but with OK bathroom. Great full screen TV and coffe/tea maker. The Southside bar nest to lobby is nice with great staff. For around 50 GBP per night, this hotel is a bargain!! Will consider this hotel again, and location is superb. Quiet but central at Russel Square with a nice park nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend London Visit with my family,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a weekend stay at the Royal National Hotel at Russell Square. I had read previous reviews and was a little apprehensive about our stay, as a lot of the rviews seemed negative. We have no regrets at all about deciding to saty at this hotel. It is situated just around the corner from Russell Square Tube, which basically means that London is your oyster, remeber to buy off peak family passes (if you have a family, obviously), it works out a lot cheaper! The room we stopped in was clean and warm, and more than adequate as a base, and also relatively quite considering the hotel's location, on a busy road. None of us, including our 7 year old daughter, were disturbed during the night, contrary to some reports I have read about this hotel. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, any quries we had were answered with a smile, which is excellent when you consider how busy the hotal is. There are also numerous restaurants and bars, although we only used the Windsor room and that was for our breakfasts.....which also contrary to other reviews we had read, were more than adequate, the full English is self service which, in our case was included with the package. There is also the option of a continental breakfast, which consisted of several choices of cereals, toast, milk and juices etc. Again no complaints! I think some people expect too much and, it seems, are a bit stuck up! After reading other reviews, I thought I would also be writing a negative review, but as you have read, not so! So if you're thinking of stopping at the Royal National, stop thinking, back your bags and go.....you will have a great time and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to UK with my parents who was going to attend my graduation ceremony. As I was a student I was not able to offer my parents a fancy hotel. The reason for me to choose Royal National is because of its great location, just 2 blocks away from the Russel Square Station. I knew I can't expect too much since its a budget hotel. However, when I checked in, I found that I just started my nightmare...... I made my reservation through a travel agent. By some reason I don't know why my reservation was separated into two bookings handled by two travel agent. The booking still valid, and it seems no problem to the hotel staff at all. They told me the booking was ok and I can keep the same room throughout my visit (I knew that sometime when booking through different source there will be chance that I can't keep the same room even if price are same). However, they told me I have to approach front desk later to do a "re check-in" because of the different booking sources. I started feeling stupid because this situation happened to me few times in different hotel before so I quite undersatnd their operation. In other hotel, to avoid keeping me inconvenience, they will do all the registration process at the same time instead of telling me to bring my voucher and register again. One thing I forgot to mention, I had a situaiton that I wasn't really in the hotel during my stay because I went to Northern England and Scotland for few stays and I only need the room to keep my parents luggage. I explained my situation to them and they said they can do nothing for me and I have to approach them or I couldn't keep my room. Therefore I changed my plan in order to complete the stupid "re check-in". After I checked in, I went to my room and it just seems ok to me. Outside of the room was a bit noisy because the housekeeping keep knocking their trolley on the wall many times. At least the room was neat and clean. I started unpack my suitcase with my parents. Suddenly I heard someone was opening my door and went in. I found that it was a housekeeper used her master key to go into my room without knocking my door. I was unpleased already by the hospitality at the front desk when I check in and now I felt the housekeeper was really rude to me. It was such an unprofessional attitude that can never happen to a housekeeper. I unpacked my suitcase and I went out for sightseeing and had a very nice dinner with my parents and I went back to the hotel at around 20:45. I had a flight at Gatwick Airport in the early morning to Edinburgh so I needed a cab in the mid night. I was not sure about it so I approached concierge desk and wish they could help me to call a cab ready when I depart the hotel. And the concierge staff told me they were not able to call until 21:00 which means 15 mins later. I asked whether they can help me to call when they could call a cab and they just told me to come again after 9pm. I felt that was so ridiculous to went to the concierge desk again so I just ring the concierge desk after 9pm. This time they just told me there were always cabs just outside of the hotel so they didnâ€™t need to make any arrangement. However, when I went down at 4am in the morning, there wasnâ€™t any taxi at all. I felt very angry this time but I had no time to argue with the hotel staff since I had a flight to catch. If I knew that earlier, I probably checked out and found another hotel. I went to Scotland with my parents for few days and I found a very nice hotel to stay with them, friendly and helpful staff, neat room and good location. We had a lot of fun in Scotland and back to London on a late flight. We went back to the Royal National Hotel, I felt exhausted and just wanted to have a hot shower and went to bed. When I opened the room door, I really gone mad this time because I found that my room was never been make up since I left the hotel. I called to concierge desk and tried to ask them to find someone to clean my room but they told me it was not possible because there were no housekeeper on duty. I really felt very angry but I was very tired. So I made my compromise and just asked for the clean towels. I felt that I really canâ€™t stay longer in the hotel and luckily I was checking out the day after. I made my complaint when I check out and I wanted to talk to the manager and express my anger. However they hotel staff â€œclaimedâ€� that the manager wasnâ€™t at the front desk and I could write down my comment and there was nothing they could help me, just like usual. When I went back home, I got their reply after three weeks and the hotel manager insist there was no complaint made by other guest regarding the housekeeping and front desk staff. In the end of the letter, there was not even one word about apologize but insist they are offering a competitive price accommodation at Central London. Is this mean I canâ€™t demand more than a bed to sleep with that price??? (I paid ï¿¡40 per person per night indeed and I had found other hotel at Nottingham Gate which offer much better room, breakfast and service with the similar price) P.S. The breakfast at Royal National Hotel was the worst that I ever had in my life in any hotel, hostel, guest house and motel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews I was worried about taking my family to this hotel. We had booked through a local travel agent and booked here because children stayed Free, only paying for their breakfasts(Â£3.50 each). We arrived early and took the bags to the hotel which was a short walk from the tube station. The bags/cases can be store free on arrival, and only charge 50p per item storage on your departure day, I went to check in to see what time the room would be ready, the staff were efficient and friendly and gave us our room cards. The room was fantastically clean. No dirty beds or towels here. We had a triple room with a very comfy fold down bed for the youngest. No early morning maids next morning, breakfast served from 7am -10am, we had the full breakfasts and certainly no complaints at the buffet style setup,The children had cereal, buns and then the full english. With plenty of fruit juice, water and milk along with urns of tea and coffee there was no rush in the large dining area. Our room was on the 5th floor and faced out onto the street, there was alot of traffic noise, but what do you expect in the centre of a capital city. This hotel is situated in an ideal area for tourists and transport is excellent, so if you don't want to hear traffic at night maybe a nice country hotel in rural Northumberland would be more for you!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel Royal National is classed as as budget hotel and the price reflects this. BUT our recent experience in the hotel was very pleasant. Our room was clean and modern with en-suite bathroom . The full English breakfast that was included in the price was excellent (continental breakfast is also available). The hotel staff were friendly and helpful . The hotel is ideally positioned for both bus and underground services and within walking distance from Covent Garden. For visitors from overseas , a range of sight seeing trips are available from the hotel along with Bureau de change facilities.For visitors arriving from Euston station (and returning) the taxi fare was Â£3.50 and luggage can be left to collect later for 50p per bag. Excellent!! I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: bob327
Reviews.Content: Had a Quad Room through BA, but after reading the reviews I was prepared for the worst. We checked in a day early, in the eveing and had no problem at all. Staff was kind and considerate. Room was very clean, new towels every day and bed linen. Breakfast was good, had both full and continental. The full was better, but the other wasn't bad. Pizza Hut and Subway just down the road. Traffic noise wasn't too bad, and there were several youth groups there, but they were OK. The tube was close as well as the British Museum, just a short walk away. Lots of hot water, cleaning staff never bothered us early. I would stay there again, with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location.....”
Reviews.Author: pujro
Reviews.Content: We stayed the day of the London bombings! What a day...we had to get a police escort back into the hotel in the afternoon as it's between Russel Sq and Tavistock. Despite being short-staffed by the circumstances they managed to keep everything going, bars, restaurant, etc. No problems with the hotel, just remember, don't expect luxury at this price in London, the room was basic, but clean and functional. Breakfast fine. It's very big, can be noisy depending on which floor/side your room is, ours was on the fifth floor and quiet. About 15 minute walk from theatreland, Thames, etc. near to tube and on bus & tour routes.

Reviews.Title: “typical european hotel - not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: canmore77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with Contiki I had no problems with the hotel (with the exception of a fire alarm one morning). The room was fine, I shared with two other girls I didn't know and there was pleanty of room for all our belongings, each had a seperate single bed. Breakfast was breakfast nothing special, cereal coffee bread better than nothing!! I stayed there for a week and really had no complaints the staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Christine_Wong
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Room is not big, but clean and tidy, water pressure is good enough for shower. The attitude of the staff is OK, from my point of view .. they just doing their job, seldom to see a smile on the face! It is the best place to stay when in the winter, becuase the hotel is no air-conditioning. I was lucky that my room was face to the backyard. Her location is perfect .. just 3 mins to Russell Square Station, and 15 mins to the Euston Train Station. Breakfast is OK.. plenty of milk, juice, tea and coffee .. rolls and toast. If you pay a cheap room rate but want to eat a English Breakfast you have to pay GBP4 for upgrading your breakfast. I will stay there again when i visit London .. but only in the Winter time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: maltesedog
Reviews.Content: Small rooms and horibble breakfast. Nothing else can describe this hotel, which due to the number of rooms has corridors which resemble much more a prison than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and Noisey”
Reviews.Author: floridamember_7
Reviews.Content: Clean, adequate hotel, good location close to tube and British Museum. Problem is no air-conditioning and windows which open only three inches. Room was too hot! Also, many rooms face a huge, center courtyard. Noise from the lobby bar spills out into the courtyard and reverberates until the bar closes around midnight. I would consider this hotel during the winter season only, when windows are closed and noise is shut out.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: geordieontour
Reviews.Content: Superb location, basic - but no less than travel inn standards, brilliant full english buffet breakfast. Fantastic facilities. Its no palace, but its a great place to lay your head and be on the doorstep to the best of london.

Reviews.Title: “Royal National”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Royal National in May of 2005. The room was clean, the shower was great (fabulous water pressure) and the location is terrific (only a block and a half from the Russel Square tube station.) The service is abysmal--the "concierge" wouldn't even make a restaurant reservation or call for a taxi. We also had problems with the noise level at night. The hotel caters to the Contiki crowd and 6 out of the 8 nights we stayed we had to deal with very loud groups partying in the courtyard until the wee hours of the morning. Our room overlooked the courtyard and the noise just echoed off the building and the pavement. It was dreadful! The other main complaint was the food at the hotel. Avoid it if you possibly can. We found great breakfasts within a couple blocks at the Day and Night Cafe and Starbucks. There are also a number of very good pubs within a few blocks--avoid the one at the hotel. It's filthy and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and rude”
Reviews.Author: Simsyuk
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a weekend away in London (May 6th to 8th) and stayed at this hotel. As I arrived everything seemed nice, you enter the hotel with two desks one on the left and one on the right. There were no signs to say which desk to sign in. It seemed many went to left desk, and then to be told to go to the right desk (would have been easier if there was a sign). Signed in and asked to be pay up front, then I was given my card key and the instructions as to find my room i.e. forth floor in the north building, that was my instructions. I went in to my room and was disgusted with the dirty room; you could see the dust everywhere, I thought Iâ€™d better check our bed and it had dirty sheets. I then went in to the bath room and noticed black hairs everywhere, I called reception and they said it would be cleaned the next day, I demanded the room to be cleaned immediately. After about 30 minutes someone walked in my room to clean, no knock just walked in using his key. Now I had a twin room for my partner and me, what if we were naked!! After the room was cleaned we felt better. When I tired to speak to the staff, either they didnâ€™t understand English or just didnâ€™t care to speak (the only English staff was reception I felt). In the morning (around 9am) the cleaning man just tried to enter our room without a knock. Even though we had a please do not disturb sign on the door (we made our own as they didnâ€™t have one) he continued to try and enter, luckily we looked the door. He tried to enter many times, and when I finally opened the door he shouted and said â€œI need to clean the roomâ€� I was so angry at this attitude, I shouted back and said â€œcanâ€™t you read the signâ€�, he ignored me and tried to enter my room where my wife was still in bed. Of course I stopped him. The English breakfast was awful, no idea what they tried to serve everyone, the only thing I ate was the toast. I tried the full English but the eggs was horrible and the bacon, well no idea if came from an animal it was more like rubber. The coffee was like water with a little flavour. We decided to try their bar on the Saturday evening, now they had the beer I enjoyed drinking but when I had the bill I thought it was someone elseâ€™s. We meet up with a friend and ordered 3 drinks which came to over Â£8 I was so shocked. After all this I complained to the reception and filled out a complaints form, I doubt that Iâ€™ll hear anything as they probably get many complaints. I beg of you, DO NOT use this hotel. I will never use this company/hotel again. Iâ€™d rather spend an extra Â£20 per night for a clean hotel. Lasting comments, dirty, rude, awful food, un-hygienic and no idea how to have simple signs. I wouldnâ€™t even give it a star.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You cannot expect anything more from a hotel with such a central location(in front of a MAGNIFICENT park -5' walking to Br museum and Starbucks, 8' to Oxford Street) and such a low price. Highly recommended for a london experience Breakfast limited and not edible-paid one excellent(5,-pounds more) Rooms ok - Not that clean(bring your own towels) I would prefer it

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay at Royal National becoz of its convenience location for my Europe trip, and it is not as what I have read from some of the comment about (the not so good one). It was a nice short stay for me & my friend, Underground was just next to it. Cool, nice & clean room we have, & the breakfast too. Got chance to visit London again will definately choose here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Royal National was pleasant. Rooms are small but clean; staff was polite and helpful; breakfast was adequate. For those on a budget who are looking for a clean, quiet, comfortable place in the heart of London (the hotel is 2 minutes from a tube station and 10 minutes from Euston Station) this is the place. The Royal National is not, however, the best value in Bloomsbury. Check the rates for the Royal National with on-line rates from the London Hilton Euston (about a 5 minute walk from the R.N.) for even better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this those during Easter. We arrived at the hotel early morning before 8 am. The hotel won't allow you to check in til 2 pm sharp, sharp even though they have nothing to do. We are smart to lined up by 1:40 or else once at 2 pm the long queque would take you at least an hour. We booked the hotel through our local agent and was given a contract rate. We booked a twin room mentioned already that we'll stay with a 5 years old child. Neither the hotel nor the London agent advised our local agent that a child is not allowed to stay in a twin room. When we checked in a male young hotel staff told us that we can't stay in a twin room. We have to pay for the difference (GBP18 per night) and add a roll-on bed into our small twin room. Since we've paid, and they said the hotel was fully booked, we can't have our money back and they can do nothing. They did call the London agent but the agent rejected to pay the difference. The hotel staff was okay but have made such a mistake and forced us to pay is unreasonable. The London agent said they'll contact our agent and ask them to pay the difference. Our receipt and hotel voucher indicated that two adults and 1 child will be stayed in a twin room. If the hotel won't allow a child to stay, why would they accept our booking? Our local agent didn't make any mistake and of course they won't pay the price. We think the hotel cheat and is so dishonest. Other than that, all the beds in the twin room are roll-on beds (not fixed). When you sleep on the bed, once you move, the bed will move as well. Although the hotel is situated within 5 mins. walk from the Tube, if you can stay at other hotel (there are lots of hotel at Russell Square), book another one!

Reviews.Title: “Pimp my hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has been the worst trip of my young life! Our school told us that it would be a nice hotel but when we arrived we were shocked...it reminded us of the old Elvis-Song "In the ghetto"...We were looking forward to having a comfortable place where we could rest our hurting feet from walking through London, seeing all the important sights which London offers including getting stuck in the tube...but all we got was a run-down hotel with endless corridors which caused us a lot of trouble finding our rooms... the rooms themselves were small and in some of them the heating worked too well, so the inhabitants had to walk around in t-shirts, in others it didn't work at all...we hoped that Xzibit would show up and "pimp" our hotel!!! Everywhere in the hotel we found dirt, dust and unfriendly cleaning service. On the morning we left they knocked at our door until we got out of our beds and then asked if we could leave. Maybe because they wanted to spend the usual 3 hours in our room...Noone knows what they did and I suppose nobody wants to know! Next problem: We all knew it -> continental breakfast! But I can only speak for myself...In my opinion Continental is a little more than dry rolls, butter and one sort of jam...With this luxurious meal we had to start our exhausting day. It was like the last meal before you get executed! And not only this...the service people watched you like a hawk and we felt really uncomfortable! It was like they were spying on us! As this breakfast caused a lot of grumbling stomachs, we went to the next best supermarket! German Salami was very popular! Since we had no fridge we had to find a solution!...it was february...we had a window...so, why not put the salami out on the window sill??? For anyone who finds German Salami wrapped in a plastic bag...we apologize!We simply forgot it when we left! Unfortunately on our last day we hadn't got rooms anymore, so we had to wait until 12.30 at night. We thought:"Well, why not spend the day in the hotel lobby?"One person didn't like our idea...since we don't know his real name we decided to call him "Willibaldbald von Anfang an"! He was a guy from the hotel, black suit, etc. He constantly complained: "You can't eat in here!", "You are not allowed to play cards in this hotel!", "Don't lie on the couch!"! It was very cold outside and we needed a place to stay! BUT IN THE END his unfriendly temper overweighed and he threw us out of the hotel!!!Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Go Again.....”
Reviews.Author: cyclist_guy
Reviews.Content: This review may be a bit dated, as I stayed here in July 2000. However, I don't imagine things have changed dramatically. The rooms were tiny and cramped. My room was lit with florescent lighting (absolutely horrible). Cheap bed linens. No electronic locks on doors (in fact, you couldn't even take your hotel key with you when you left for the day - it was a key on a "pole" that you had to drop off at the front desk every time you left the hotel). The place reminded me of a college dorm. Probably one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. The only good thing is its location - very centrally located and close to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Review from an extended traveler--nice hotel w/many features & great location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Royal National 8-times (2-weeks each stay for a cumulative total of about 4-months) so, unlike the other reviewers, Iâ€™m not writing about a 1- or 2-night stay in only one room. Two stays were in the old section, 5 were in the new. I know the hotel pretty well now and I have never had a significant complaint. This hotel is perfect for those on a budget and are more concerned about experiencing the excitement of the City than they are about the luxury of the hotel. Bottom line: If you don't mind some of the characteristics that are typical of a large, busy, international hotel then consider this hotel. Rooms are clean, neat, and modern, with showers in all rooms. Hot, English breakfast buffet is mass-produced, but the food is good, especially considering the number of guests they feed each day. Consider these other points about the hotel: Good, central location. Two hotel pubs (the â€œLondon Pubâ€� has great food, very popular). The hotel restaurant is open late. Travel agency located at hotel (book your day-trip to Stonehenge or Oxford, Stratford & Warwick!) Ticket booth also at hotel, including tickets for London Eye. Well-stocked gift shop. Open-top tour buses stop outside. Post office steps away. STA Travel 1- block. British Museum next door. Bank 1- block (cash Visa travelers cheques with no commission). American Express office 2-min walk. Safeway grocery store 4-min (good prices, local residents shop there). 2-min walk to Russell Square Tube stopâ€“a direct route to Heathrow. Am looking forward to staying there again in Spring â€˜05.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jimela
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Royal National and have no complaints at all. (2 adults and 2 teenagers). After reading the reviews on this site we were dreading what we would find but decided to make the most of our holiday as we knew we would only be using the hotel for sleeping and breakfast. (I would not have stood for any uncleanliness). On our arrival at 1.00 pm we were allowed straight to our room (there were no crowds in the foyer). The room was clean and so was the bathroom (probably recently refurbished). We were on the first floor facing the main road and it was noisy (I took ear plugs). Towels were changed each day and the beds were made and the rooms tidied. English breakfast was buffet style and consisted of cereal, bacon, sausage, beans, tomatoes, eggs (boiled, poached, scrambled) fruit, toast and jams, fruit juice, tea, coffee, hot chocolate. Comments that breakfast was just bread and marmalade are untrue in my opinion as my daughter chose the continental breakfast - toast, bread rolls, cereals, jam and fruit juice (not great but not just bread and jam). We heard no noise in the hotel itself. On our day of departure we were not leaving until 7.30 in the evening and so stored our baggage in the hotel for which there was a charge of Â£1.00(excellent). The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. I requested extra blankets in the morning and they were on the bed when we returned to the hotel in the evening. We paid Â£255.00 for a family of four for 3 nights and thought that was a brilliant price. Where else could you get a price like that in a centrally located London hotel? We used the hotel as a base ( we were never in the room for more than 1 hour other than for sleeping and breakfast) and it was a brilliant location for accessing most of the main London attractions. Were we lucky or are others expecting too much for the price they have paid? We would definitely stay there again at the same rates.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly Improved”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel 2 years ago, we were surprised to find how much it had improved. We went with a family group and had 3 separate bedrooms. All bedrooms were clean and reasonable size for London. This is a very large hotel and caters to a large extent for school/college groups and bus tours. Even so, on the whole the service was pretty good - there seemed to be more staff on duty. The price that we paid included a full English breakfast which again, on the whole, was pretty good value. The breakfast arrangements had greatly improved from 2 years ago - when queues to be served could be as long as 1/2 hour. We would recommend that you DO NOT eat in the hotel restaurant. We arrived early evening time (15 of us). We all said, without exception, that the food was poor, cold and in most cases, uneatable. This hotel provides a reasonable base for visiting London due mainly to its very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best by all means”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reason we stayed there was because of the cheap deal offered. We were planning on only coming back to the hotel for sleep and food ie.breakfast. After reading some reviews on this site, I was very anxious, dreading the worst. The negative points of this hotel were that the rooms were quite small, if you have a room facing the road it's very noisy at night (drunken people, cars, ambulances, the lot), there were groups after groups of school trip students arriving and was not the most modern hotel I have seen. However, having said all this, the positive points are that it is very very close to Russel Square underground station, the breakfast is quite filling, and is cheap compared to most other London hotels. It is ideal for those planning on staying out in London, but not for those who would like a quiet, relaxing, pampering time. Use the hotel just for sleeping (definitely take ear plugs) and it's just the right place for that.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: drtee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here some years ago. I dropped a wet towel on the carpet, and when I picked it up (in about one second), it was absolutely filthy.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: ALICE JZ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed for 2days at this hotel at Easter,which in my opinion, don't deserve to be called "royal".When we arrived,we were received by an unpleasant woman,who told us we had to wait till 2pm.At 2pm there were so many people in the lobby, that we had to wait for more than an hour to check in.Later,we found a lot of problems in our room: it was terribly hot; the bathroom was extremely old;it didn't go out hot water from the shower, but just air.The housekeeping staff began to knock at our door from 8am and they didn't stop doing it until we left the room.We went to have breakfast and when we went back to our room, we saw that they had removed the towels,so we didn't have any to have a shower.We asked for some towels to a member of the unkind housekeeping staff, and he told us he couldn't give us the towels then and he just gave us a very small piece of cloth similar to a tiny towel.I had some medicine on the basin,but they considered it was rubbish,so I didn't see it again.The reception staff was formed by incompetent people,who laughed at the guests.In conclusion,I don't recommend this hotel to anybody,because we have suffered too much.And it's similar to a prison,in my opinion, and extremely noisy,too.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Bigger Royal National Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christian_Austria
Reviews.Content: Definitely the largest hotel we've ever seen. 1600 rooms and "millions" of corridors! But this is not the problem 'cause you get used to it very quickly. What makes me rating this hotel with only 2 stars, is that it was a bit noisy during the night ( people smacking doors / shouting in the corridor - but hey, what do u expect in such a large hotel ). When we arrived, the room ( which is well-sized ) was not particularly clean ( wash-basin with hairs in it / toilette not cleaned / hairs on table / dustbin not empty ). We communicated the problem to the front-desk and rooms were perfectly cleaned the next day. So all in all the room was okay for the price ( 41 Euros p. p. and night ). The thing that bothered us the most was the breakfast. You know the parking attendants in a shopping-center who show you the way to your parking-lot? It's like that in this hotel! When we finally reached our "parking position", we were placed in a room that looked like a seminar-room. Really, really uncomfortable! Breakfast was loveless, the toasted-bread ugly and orange juice out of a plastic-cup is not the exaltation. Next day we decided to eat elsewhere! The conclusion: If you don't mind such a large hotel with noisy people during nighttime and if you don't care about a proper breakfast, it's the right place to stay ( location is good, rooms should be clean - guess we were unlucky ). But if you prefer a good start in the day with a hearty breakfast and a hotel that offers friendly atmosphere, than spend a few bucks more for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: VacationerHouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the RNH when in London during the second week of January 2005. I had read mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, but they sounded overall positive. We had a good rate through a British Airways air/hotel deal. It is a hotel used mostly by tours--the lobby seemed to always be full of people and the computers in the lobby were always out of order. Surprisingly it was very quiet in our room for so many young people (seemed like college and high school groups). The room was spacious but not very well lit. The mattress was lumpy. The room was always too warm so we had the window open all the time (as did other rooms we could see from our window) which then made the room comfortable (but what a waste of electricity). The blow dryer we borrowed from the hotel stopped working but we had no problem getting another that worked great (with a $20 deposit we got back when returned). The bathroom was very clean, the staff friendly. The location was great--right on the bus line with the Open Tour bus stop right outside; a couple of blocks from a grocery store and restaurants; within walking distance of the British Museum. A ticket office for various tours was located in the courtyard and a post office just down at the corner. This is a huge hotel and I imagine the rooms vary greatly--ours was fine for what we paid (US$89/night). The breakfast got boring after a few days, but you could buy scrambled eggs, sausage, etc. outside of the complimentary cereal, toast, rolls, juice, and milk.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Queenofbees
Reviews.Content: When first arriving at the Royal National, I was shocked to see the number of teenagers running around in the lobby. But when there was no line to check in, and the staff was very kind, I felt at ease. Our room was nice and big, and all was well, until about 11:00 p.m. Apparently we were put in an area of the hotel with ALL tourist teenagers, who ran around the halls until 3:30 in the morning...or later, we weren't sure, because we asked to be moved. The staff was understanding and put us in a quieter area. Again, all was well, until the construction that began outside our room every day at 5:50 a.m. exactly. Not the hotel's fault, but still annoying. Once we got used to that (two mornings), the housekeeping staff decided to start knocking on our door for the following three mornings starting around 8:00 a.m., and knocking every half hour to an hour until we finally got up and answered. No "Do not disturb" signs in the hotel. So our five days were survivable, and the second room we got was nice, as well...except for the broken sliding door for the W.C. But I don't plan to stay there again, as I enjoy peaceful rest after my long days out.

Reviews.Title: “Great price. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Rhinne
Reviews.Content: My two children my wife and I spent four nights in this Hotel for 104 euros per night with a decent continental breakfast included for the four of us. To find such a deal in London is practically impossible no matter the number of stars of the hotels you look for. We made the reservation through British Airways Holidays. The Hotel has good connections with all over central London: for instance to Victoria Station bus number 73 from Euston Station, just 7 minutes away from the Hotel; to Kensington, with a bus stop by Harrods in the way, bus number 10 also at Euston Station. Underground (Russell Square) is just 100 meters away and you can reach almost any place in London with it. Just in front of the Underground Station there is a Tesco Express supermarket. One block away from the Hotel there is a new indian restaurant where you can eat nice indian food as much as you want for just 9 pounds. The hotel although it is quite big is clean enough and offer a certain number of basic services. If you have problems sleeping better ask for a room not facing the street. Rooms facing the street are a little noisy at night. If I come back to London I will not have any problems in going back to this Hotel, although is not the best hotel you can find in London obviously it is though the Hotel that has the best relation price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: okrokay
Reviews.Content: I too became worried after booking this hotel through British Airways and then reading the reviews. Maybe those reviews were the reason that I was pleasantly surprised! We had booked a non-smoking quad room with early check-in. The non-smoking part was easily confirmed, but like others there is a problem with early check-in. As it turned out, we did not need the early check-in as we were very late getting out of Heathrow but then found no line at check-in and pleasant and courteous assistance upon our arrival on March 1. We had room 7054 and although it couldn't have been farther from the lift, we found the room to be quite comfortable and large even by American standards. Fortunately, a map of the rooms shows this to be one of the largest rooms on each level! The room was very clean and not shabby in the least. We planned to spend very little time in our room but my husband got the flu and spent 1.5 days there! He had no complaints! My teenage daughters didn't complain once about breakfast. Our favorite part was its proximity to the Russell Square Tube station thus making siteseeing extremely convenient. Being so close to a stop on the Piccadilly line, makes travel to Heathrow very convenient and affordable! We will certainly be back as it offered everything that we could need or want at a resonable price--No small feat in London!

Reviews.Title: “Fair for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in February, and although it is clearly not the best hotel in London, I didn't think it was all that bad for a 3* budget hotel. The room was basic but clean and very warm, with the heating on already when we arrived in our room. The queue to check in was pretty long when we arrived at 2pm due to the fact that a couple of bus loads of students had just arrived, and this queue was only marginally shorter when we returned at 10:30pm. But you have to take into consideration that this is a massive hotel and is obviously extremely popular with student and group trips as it is so cheap. Breakfast was included with our stay and there was a good wide choice of cooked food, cereals and fruits. My only real complaint would be that there was no hair-drier in the room and although you could hire one from housekeeping, you had to pay a Â£20 deposit, which I thought was a bit steep! After reading some of the other reviews about the place I can only say that you get what you pay for. If you want 4-5* luxurys, you have to pay for them. Just don't whinge about not getting them when you stay in a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: H2Otstr
Reviews.Content: Four travelling ladies from Marylnd, USA took a 4 night trip to London & stayed here as part of British Airways trip. We arrived early and the front desk staff would not even consider checking to see if our room was ready. Instead they told us to check our luggage in the big luggage room and then we took off to see the city. We arrived back around 4 pm and the check in line was small. We checked in with no problems and went to our rooms only to be pleasantly surprised to find a nice, clean, newely renovated room. We had read manyof the previous postings and came with some reservation. We felt fortunate that the room was as nice as it was. Needed a hairdryer and had to pay 20 pounds deposit to use it but got that money back when checking out. Breakfast was not full English but just toast, cereal, juice & coffee. Went across the street to the local market and bought our own banannas for the cereal. Breakfast room clean & neat. Found out too late for us to use, but there is a ticket booth across from the gift shop that sells transportation tickets and show tickets. Went to the adjoining pub for lunch & dinner. Lunch was nice but dinner was like walking into a huge cloud of smoke. Again, went across the street to the local market to but some deodorizing spary to spray our clothes. This hotel is very good place to get around to various sites. 1 block from the tube and 1 block from the bus line. There is also a very good Italian restaurant a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is horrible. We stayed with a group but if you pay the full price you can get a MUCH MUCH nicer place in London (try maybe the Comfort Hotel Kengington?) for the same price! The rooms are old and smoky and musty. The staff are completely unhelpful and rude. We had to wait on a huge line to even check into the hotel. The place is huge and overrun with people, just not a nice place. I would safely call it a dump. They don't even give you a bath mat or shampoo or wash cloths! Stay elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “There are no words....”
Reviews.Author: morjem911
Reviews.Content: To describe how much I hated this hotel, but I will try! I stayed in this hotel with my parents, daughter, and brother. We had two rooms. First, we had to wait hours in a smokey lobby (I smoke & it even bothered me) to check into our room. When it became clear that we wouldn't have a room anytime soon, we asked if we could leave our bags so we could go eat. They charged us per bag to leave them there. When you finally get a room, make sure to draw yourself a map back to the lifts, it's like a dingy maze, god help you if there is ever an emergency! When we got to our room, my brother, daughter and I had three cots (smaller than regular twin) lined up in a row, and not much else. I was so tired by this point I didn't even care, but when I pulled back the blankets on the bed, I saw little black things scurry! I thought my eyes must be tired, and told my brother to check his bed, and sure enough, bugs in it too! The staff were nice enough to offer to change the bedding, but were put out when I said I wanted a new room. A few more hours of waiting, and we finally got a new room. The worst part about this stay though, was I got sick soon after arriving. One morning, I stayed in the room while everyone else went out. When the cleaning staff knocked on the door, I got out of bed, and told the MAN standing outside the door, that I didn't want the room cleaned, I just needed clean towels. He would not go away, and tried to push his way past me into the room. I put the chain on the door, and he still used his key to open it as much as he could and yell at me to let him in to clean. Really scarey! For the record, I'm not a "Hotel Snob", this last trip, we stayed at the Tavistock, which is a cheaper sister hotel of the Royal National and I loved it (see my review). The Royal National, however, was just filthy, and had the worst staff I've ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. Location is good, right near Russell Square tube, breakfast is fantastic, staff are helpful. Ignore the hotel snobs who say otherwise - it's clean, the bathroom was very big & nice and the room was fine, European hotel rooms are usually small but this was actually one of the bigger ones. We were here for 6 nights in December 04 and would definitely come back. We were worried at first because it's a Contiki hotel, and yes there are kids coming and going but there was no noise and the hotel is so large that they keep all the Contiki people separate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal National for a few days in November. It was a serviceable home base from which to explore the city and very convenient to the tube. Having requested a non-smoking room, we changed rooms the first night from one that opened onto the courtyard and smelled like smoke to a similar room facing the street. The bathroom was clean and relatively new and the breakfast was basic but appreciated. It's a busy, budget hotel, but it met expectations and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I will gladly return!”
Reviews.Author: Sindrhien
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before and after a contiki tour. I was quite pleased with the hotel in general. Although the bell boys and the cleaning staff were very rude at times.
