The front desk staff were fairly helpful but no one went out of their way to be pleasant! The location is fantastic. Walked to Oxford street and British Museum many times. Bus tours and airbus transfer is right outside. A large grocery store is about 1 block away and a nice little deli/shop is practically next door. The room was totally fine, t.v., kettle in room were great. Hotel is very big and all hallways look alike so don't get lost. It's a great cheap hotel in London. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, but smallish rooms and okay service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're used to big American hotels, you'll be in for a shock. Small, small rooms, no frills, very institutional, and basic breakfasts. But a fine location nonetheless. Rooms are clean, and the hotel is reasonably quiet. You can do much worse in London.

Reviews.Title: “Royal National Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal National Hotel was a great location! I booked my room through British Airways website. When I booked, I thought I was only getting a continental breakfast, but we actually got the full English breakfast. It was the perfect way to start the day, so much so most times we didn't need lunch. The only draw back was that the beds were truly terrible. I solved this problem, by folding the extra blanket over the mattress so that the springs no longer dug into my back. Several tours made pick up from this hotel. The British airways web site is wonderful. I planned and booked most of my trip ahead of time. I used this website to get reviews of the places I was thinking about going to.

Reviews.Title: “PAy the extra money elsewhere - it'll be worht it”
Reviews.Author: 123travelChicago
Reviews.Content: I have been to london both biz and pleasure about 20x and would not recommend this hotel. We stayed there with a BA special. Athough the location is very good, I agree with others the staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. And on two occasions, we witnessed someone trying to break into our room (many rooms are not entered through main hotel) and the hotel brushed it off as if it were nothing until we got the police there on our own. The rooms are very small, and I thought they were clean, but my roommate got bed bugs from the sheets. So if you can spare another 75-100 dollars, I would definately say it would be worth it to go to another hotel. There are plenty in the area (note Tavistock and royal imperial also ownd by BA right nearby - not sure if they are the same.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: membra
Reviews.Content: The Royal National has to be the worst hotel I've ever been in. The room smelled, the walls needed a coat of paint, and the carpets needed to be shampooed. Although checkout was at 11, the maid knocked on our door every 20 minutes starting at 8!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Royal National Hotel, served its purpose. A place to sleep, shower and to store your belongins. Well situated. Close to the British Museum, tube station (Russell Square), sightseeing buses, post office, a mini-market and Oxford Street. It's also close to Picadilly Circus. I chose to walk from the hotel and reached every point within an hour or so. My point of reference was always the Centre Point bldg, which is located at New Oxford and Charing Cross Road. A word of advise to my fellow American travelers. The hotel won't let you check in until 14:00 hrs. (2 O'clock) So if you arrive at 9:30 in the morning like I did, you will have to seat in the lobby and smoke everyone else's cigarrettes like I did (I don't smoke) Also if you happen to be the unlucky one to see two buses pull up, be prepared to see 40 or 50 teenagers all smokers and ill mannered and you'll have to wait until they all check in, about an hour or so. I wish the hotel prohibits smoking in the lobby. But other than that I do recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Royal National Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathyscr
Reviews.Content: I booked this room from British Airways at a great price (the cheapest I found without sharing a bathroom). I am a traveler that likes to go from morning to night and my toom is where I sleep and bathe. The room was clean and utilitarian which is what I require. The tub was nice and I used it to soak my weary legs. Breakfast was included and adequate as well. There is a Tesco close to the hotel where I could buy sandwiches and fruit. If you like to see the city and not spend your money on lodging and eats, this is the place to go. The evening concierge is the only sour note. I tried to get directions to a Guy Fawkes celebration and he refused to bother with me. If he doesn't get a commission, he will not help.The hotel operator saved the day, however. The staff is very helpful with few exceptions. By the way, Speakers Corner and the open air markets are a great taste of local color.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, for first time tourest, clean, staff is very helpful. Rooms are small & they do not furnish wash cloths. coffee & tea in room. Above average continental breakfast. The underground system is right there, and gets you most anywhere. We spent 7 nights here, and it was great. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of money to sleep on a camp bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: lynz770
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a two night stay at this hotel. On only my third visit to London it disappointed me greatly. As we had booked in as a large party and requested triple rooms I was shocked to find we were given twin rooms with an extra camp bed in each room! The sheets were clean but the blankets dirty, dust lay in large clumps on the side boards and the damp, stale smell was shocking. The bathroom was the only plus point and appeared to have been recently refurbished. We stayed in the North side of the hotel and some of my friends rooms smelt heavily of smoke (like most of the hotel) and another group's door did not even lock! If this is supposed to be a three-star hotel I would hate to stay in anything lower as this was bad enough! The location is quite good, however, and the bar in the restaurant is very accomodating for large parties although finding your way around the place is very difficult. The lack of stairs (only lifts) caused problems for those of us who are chlostrophobic also. Overall, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and advise other travellers to look around as other, nicer places are available for the same price elsewhere in London.

Reviews.Title: “An O.K. Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan999
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews here, I had some trepidation about going to this hotel, but having spent 6 nights there, I can say that a lot of the negative things written here were unfounded and exaggerated. The Hotel is HUGE. There are over 900 rooms, and thus check-in and check out is going to take a long time should you do it at the same time as everyone esle. They have FREE luggage storage if you are checking-IN, and my advice is to simply store your baggage there, and come back as late as you can. There is a two pound fee for storing your bags on check OUT, but all in all, it is a pretty reasonable service. The rooms: I arranged my rooms through a travel company back in Toronto. They were average rooms. A single traveller, I rec'd a room with 2 single beds--always nice. The room was clean, roomy, and the washroom was clean as well. When the battery failed in my remote for the TV, someone came up within a few minutes after I spoke to housekeeping. A word to the wise however: The rooms facing the streets can be VERY noisy. If you are not used to sleeping in an urban environment ( cars driving, sirens, people chatting, etc), request a room INSIDE. As I AM used to that kind of environment, the noise was just like at home, and posed no problems. I did not partake in the continental breakfast so I can't comment on that. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from Russell Square Underground Stn, which itself is on the same subway line to Heathrow Airport. By taxi, it is UNDER 10 pounds to Paddington Station--where you can get an express to Heathrow Airport. So, location-wise, it is very convenient. There is a small supermarket with AMAZING prices called Tesco's nearby--an absolute lifesaver. To sum up--for what I paid for, the service was great, the rooms were average to above average, and the location excellent. The few problems I found were easily handled without any real inconvenience. All in all, a great hotel, and I wouldn't have any problems staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price......and great location”
Reviews.Author: Dianecarole2000
Reviews.Content: What does everyone expect for such a low price? I have stayed in much worse hotels for a much higher price. The rooms were basic but comfortable, centrally located with helpful and friendly staff. I really couldn't complain, it was great for a cheap weekend of shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Dorm room”
Reviews.Author: Mykell
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminds me of my dorm room back in college. If you look outside, it looks plain and non-descriptive. I can't say much of the room as well. BUT, and I emphasize the word BUT, it serves it purpose. Hotel is only for sleeping. This is my 3rd stay at this hotel and I like it. Close to the Underground which the Picaddily Line takes you directly to Heathrow airport (saves me 50 pounds). A supermarket 2 blocks down the road. British museum is a walking distance and "The Big Bus Tour" right at your door step.

Reviews.Title: “What are yous all talking about...the hotel was.......”
Reviews.Author: Carlie--x
Reviews.Content: ...great!!! I have just come back from my london holiday yesterday and i thiught the hotel was nice and comfy. ok, i admit, after reading some of the reviews on the net, i got a bit worried, but i thought the hotel was fine, the bar had a plasma screen t.v which you could watch anything on (i was watching the olympics 2004 on it) and there was a gift shop there with sweets abnd souveniours. the hotel rooms were quite bigish but the bathroom was kind of small, the doors were sliding ones, which made it quite difficult to open. The beds were ok to sleep on though my back hurt a little. There was a nice t.v sitting above the drawers so everone could see it, there was only channel 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and itv2 and cnbc. but i got to watch that great movie-coyote ugly. The breakfast there is just an ordinary english meal - eggs, bacon, toast, beans, tomatoes, jam, butter. of coarse you have to pay for either an english meal or a continental meal. The hotel is very big! it has a north side and a south side. there is also internet use there, Â£1 for 10 minutes, there is msn there and email acounts there. The hotel is situated near the underground, but you need a pass to get there and a weeks pass to go underground costs about Â£7 if you are under 16. plus you need your pic taken aswell. The metro is really fast and can take you anywhere. but the hotel is near a busy road, so its a bit noisy, but you can always shut the window and you can hardly hear it, then you will easily fall asleep straight away. Overall it is a great hotel if you want to stay somewhere in london!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: RedEyedTreeFrog
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel--we had just spent 3 months on a tour of the UK and had stayed in both good and bad hotels so were prepared for the worst, however, I was quite satisfied with our accomodations. Although very basic, our room was clean, of decent size (for the UK), and had everything we needed. I felt safe in the area and in the hotel in general. Most importantly, it is situated in an excellent location, close to everything. As long as you just need a decent place to sleep on your trip and plan to spend a lot of time out and about, this hotel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other peoples reviews after booking my stay, I must admit I was quite worried. When we arrived at the hotel we were early so we were advised to leave our luggage which was safely put away and advised what time we could check in. I requested a low floor and was pleased that this was honoured. The rooms were clean, beds a little uncomfy. All facilities in room were in good working order. All staff were courteous and helpfull. Breakfast was fine, choice of either continental or english, cereals for kids. I would definately use this hotel again as the price was fantastic for London. My price for a quad room which is hard to find was Â£88 per night. If booking please take note of this nothing to worry about...

Reviews.Title: “Experience for family of three”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here is our June 21-23, 2004 experience. We have booked the room for 2 adults and one child for 103 GBP. First we were suggested room on second floor towards the main street. After I've asked for something quite I was told that according to hotel design (?) all rooms for 3 persons are on main street side. However, got six floor instead. The room: clean but very basic. Definitely the worst room in my life for $200. We could not close the window tightly and it was extremely noisy during both nights. We had trouble to sleep even after busy day. It would be much worse to stay in this hotel during wormer weather. Our coffeemaker did not work and we could not turn on TV until we complained to room service end they brought us remote control from other room. We needed hair dryer: we were asked to go and find room service on first floor and bring 20 GBP security deposit. One girl needed it as well but since she had only 5 GBP she was sent back to find the rest. THE MOST UNPLEASANT EXPERIENCE: we had English breakfast included. You would probably prefer to go out and pay for better one. Most importantly - my wife put her shoulder bag on a chair next to our table and went to pick some food for our son. TWO MINUTES LATER THE BAG WAS GONE!!! We have tried to complain to hotel personal but they were not in hurry to help us or even to file a report. The day of our departure when we asked them again they have suggested to wait for security officer who should be in ~ 1 hour after our departure to airport. It would be difficult to classify the hotel's personal as a friendly one. The location is the biggest plus. Nevertheless I would not recommend to anybody to stay Royal National.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: emerald444
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very big and you might get lost at the begging. Rooms are nothing special, not very clean nor dirty. Breakfast is included, but it is just burned toasts and cereals with milk. If you want English Breakfast you have to pay. I would only reccomend this hotel if your are travelling on a very small budget. Tube is 5 - 6 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “The complete guide to RNH”
Reviews.Author: ArianaUP
Reviews.Content: After reading so many of the reviews about the royal national I have a few things to add. It seems like most people writing the bad reviews are just too spoiled and dont realise how lucky they are to find a hotel with a price of 85 pounds for a double room . London is one of my favourite destinations and I have stayed in Royal National hotel 3 times. I must say people who are traveling to London have to start preparing themselves for a shock upon arriving to London hotels . Most of the smaller/budget hotels have tiny rooms , outdated design and sometimes lacks facilities that seem to many to be neccesary in an hotel room . A lot of those hotels are operating for a very lond time and are not refurbished very often. So its not just the Royal National Hotel that seems to be a bit dodgy from time to time (for instance try to find a hotel room for 50 pounds for a double room per night... Im pretty sure if you feel the RNH is lacking facilities/services/basic hotel feature and whatever, you will be very shocked of the outcome) I have to say that although the prices for this budget hotel are quite high , it is one of the most valuable hotels in London and here are the reasons : The hotel is very centrally located , I rarely used the Russel Square tube station but instead preferd to take long walks in the days I was visiting the city center. Getting to Tottenham court road, Covent Garden , The Soho and Oxford street took less then 20 minutes of walking . Also the A1 bus from Heathrow airport stops at the entrance to the hotel . The neighbourhood itself is very nice and safe , especially because there are other big hotels around the square so you can see people and tourists walking around almost all hours of the day. Also there are plenty of grocery stores and resturants in the area . As for the hotel itself : Dont be intimidated by the size of it , it looks like a big old office building but the inside of the hotel is quite OK , for a budget hotel . The reception area is usually crowded at hours of check in and check out times because there are more than 800 rooms in this hotel . The staff is quite friendly and helpful , although sometimes find it hard to cater for 100 people who try to check in at one time . After all the service by the staff is quite ok , i've seen worst in other hotels which are smaller and more expensive. The rooms are seperated into two areas, the older and the newer . I dont think there is a difference in price for the rooms I guess its just a matter of luck so i'm not sure asking for a room upgrade will help. The newer are rooms have electronice keys, you can see they have been renovated but there isnt much difference between the old and the new rooms. I have stayed in both sections of the hotel and apart from the old 70's looking design in the older section I couldnt find much difference. Every room has a kettle and sachets of coffee tea and milk powder. Dont expect anymore than that cause there are a lot of London hotels that wouldnt offer even this. Also the rooms i've stayed in were quite standard in size , clean , with all the basic facilities you need when you stay in London (as there is no reason to come to London if you are planning to spend your whole days in an hotel) . A few other details you should know. There used to be a breakfast service on every floor the last few times i have been there. So it save the hassle of running down to the crowded breakfast room. Just ask the receptionists about this. The breakfast service on the floor offers almost the same as you would get in the breakfast room. So after reading all the reviews about dirty, stinky, badly decorated , small rooms , bad service etc etc . I have to say from my three experiences in this hotel is that its all pretty good for the price you pay ! You would hardly get more than that in central London hotels for this price (did i happend to mention the hotels with shared bathrooms/toilets ?) . And one last thing , if you come to London and stay in this hotel and very unhappy about it , at least try to enjoy yourself and realise that you are very lucky to stay in a centrally located hotel that offers you almost all of London by walking distance. For me this is the most important thing when visitng London.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Royal National Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and Daughter and I stayed at the Royal National for 10 nights recently, April 27th to May 7th 2004. The room was very comfortable, clean although we missed having a clock in the room. The service from the staff of the hotel was excellent, they responded to all requests and questions with a smile and in a timely manner.The location is very central, and many major attractions are within walking distance. In spite of the many large groups constantly arriving each day, the staff seem to keep cheerful and work very efficiently. I would stay there again if ever we returned to London.

Reviews.Title: “Hairy Beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely fine untill, the first night came and we were just about to get into bed. I pulled the covers back got in and there was a massive clump of hairs, right in the middle of the bed. My friend who I was staying there with looked under her pillow and there was some there too. Minging!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our home near Russell Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After an endless search for a hotel in a good area at a good price, my sis and I finally chose the Royal National. We were very happy to come home each night to a clean room and warm place to sleep. Russell Square, we believe, is the best tube station in London. A neighborhood grocer across the street, a nice Italian restaurant, post office, pub, and the British Museum. We ended up making a little home and were sad to go. The only complaint I had was the food in the Pavillion, go somewhere else. Otherwise, we were quite content and would recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable, affordable, and quiet location in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm from up north in England, and having previously visited London as a child I was not particularly looking forward to another visit. However, my most recent visits indeed proved me wrong. I have stayed in the Royal National twice, both stays were for two nights or more. And I had an excellent stay. In fact I have been very surprised to read about the bad stories of this hotel. I can only presume they come from people who like complaining. Fair enough, this isn't a luxury hotel by any means, but you'd have to pay a lot more money if that's what your looking for in London. London is an expensive city, and the hotel is actually great value for London prices. The hotel is apparently one of the largest in central London, and I found staff to be very friendly and helpful. The reception area does look rather kitsch, with the souvineer shops and patterned carpets, and there may be a faint smell of smoke since the hotel bar is situated round the corner, but hey, welcome to London! I found the rooms and bathrooms to be clean and well fitted with all the basics you need. The TV has satellite and radio, and the beds are made everyday, and new packets of coffee and tea are put out for you. I have stayed in various hotels all over Europe with my family as a child, and not being the richest of people, we've never stayed in luxury hotels, just somewhere clean with the basics. And to be honest, that's all you want when you go to London. Unless you want to sit in your room watching TV all day! London is an amazing city, and the Royal National is situated so as to gain easy access to all of it. I viewed the hotel as a great stopping point, since all day and some of the night I was out enjoying the bustling London life! Also, there are numerous shops and restaurants surrounding the hotel. One Thai restaurant down the street, a few Italians. And plenty of grocery shops for picking up essentials. The restaurants are pretty reasonable in price. Go to Covent Garden for more variety though, and if you want to spend a bit more money on something nice. I reccommend the Rock Garden restaurant, a bit pricey but beautiful food and cocktails! So all in all, the Royal National would be my choice of hotel to stay in London. Breakfast is suffice, unless you'd like to pay a few pounds extra for a hot Full English (very nice, especially if you've been enjoying London's nightlife the night before)! The bar is open until 1am, which is great if you don't want to go out, or perhaps want a drink there before you go out. Also, many nationalities of people stay there. We met a lovely group of Australians, and are still in touch. So I think all these bad reviews are perhaps from people who are stuck up, and thought that Â£85 would buy them a room complete with butler and jacuzzi. Not in London I'm afraid! But that's reality. Yes London is expensive, but well worth a visit! And a great place to stay is the Royal National.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what people are complaining about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through British Airways, I decided on going to the Royal National rather than a hostel because it was only about $10 more expensive, and I got my own bathroom. After booking, I read some bad reviews on some websites, so I got a little worried. However, I think that these worries were unfounded. The hotel is obviously not a luxury hotel, you aren't getting a Sheraton or Marriot, but for the price and the fact that it has such a great location, it's an excellent deal. The bedroom I was given was nice and clean, it even had two beds, even though I asked for a single. The bathroom was clean and well kept, and the room came with a TV. I have no complaints, and I think it was an excellent value. Being that I am a student, I would stay there again if I had to visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Semi-Royal National”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading reviews on the Royal National AFTER making my purchase but found the hotel quite convenient, very clean and not at all sub-standard as I had expected by reading other reviews.The Royal National is a short one-minute walk from the tube station and conveniently located to the National Museum. The rooms are a little smaller than Holiday Inn, but we weren't really in London to experience a hotel room. I had been led to believe by other reviews that the bathtub would be terrible to climb in to. This was not the case, though the tub was raised higher than normal. You just had to take a step up to climb in. I definitely wouldn't recomend this to an older person, but if you are reasonably strong and healthy it should not be a problem.Unfortunately, the staff was every bit as sour as I had expected after reading the reviews. If you expect a personable staff who will help you find your way around in London, or even call a cab for you, the Royal National should NOT be your choice.If however, you are looking for a place to stay that is reasonably priced, clean and convenient don't be afraid to stay at the Royal National.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For North Americans, this hotel may not for your general hotels you may expected. At least I was. It is good valued for money but Do not- I am stressing out- DO NOT expect you will get general amenties you would get if you check into name brand hotel in America. Although staffs are very friendly but obviously they are overworked. There are many students stay in this hotel during holiday season so be aware. Most of them behave good. Room floor are quite but can be noisy depend on who is your neighbor. Lobby always anti smoke free enviorment. So if you are non smoker like me, stay absolute away.Breakfast is not fancy but eatible. Instant Coffee, tea, juice, roll, butter, jam, 2 kinds of cereal. That will be all. No egg, no hot food. You must pay for those. I suggest you eat outside if you prefer hot English breakfast.Room's floor. I warn you that they are not properly vaccume because I once lie on the floor for ab crunch. I saw various rubbish nearby heating duct. Well..they can't really suck those garbage from there but It was really discusting.Bathroom. Some room updated some are not.again Don't expect marble floor or anything like. They are very funtionalble but not fancy.Bed. Some beds are old some are ok. If you are sensitive where you are sleep, look for other hotels.Overall, it is totally valued hotel form money.I didn't expect anything since I also read all those negative feedback. So I wasn't surprise. I have been stayed from shack to ritz carlton. I say this hotel is below average than you normally find in motel type hotel(ie motel 6, red roof inn)

Reviews.Title: “After your stay at the RNH you'll learn to appreciate Russia... (h-e-l-p.... h-e-l-p... he.......)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to the package deal we got with BA, my partner and I stayed at the RNH - twice. Upon arrival on March 13th and prior to returning to Canada on March 20th. The first time, we were supposed to stay for 2 nights. Prior to arrival, after reading out loud all the horrendous critiques by guests staying there before us, I had this ah so sinking feeling and luckily, was able to reduce our stay for 1 night each time - to spend one more day on the beach in sunny, hot Southern Portugal... Where do I begin: for the record, I dislike people whiningabout everything. We, spoiled North Americans, are great at that. Nevertheless, I, as someone who travelled the East Block extensively, must state: this hotel is a close runner-up to some of the worst I had the dubious pleasure staying at in Moscow, Russia during the heyday of perestroyka. In the lobby, stink, smoke galore. The room we stayed at - ditto. Bathroom, very clean and updated, though. However, one cannot help thinking, the rooms must have served as office rooms before. My take, the whole building may have been a government building at one time (Perhaps, Ministry of War?). Our room's floor was so dirty and unvacumed that I did not step on it without my shoes. The endless corridors - rather labyrinths - are so confusing that, in the case of a fire, God save all within its premises. A double room retails 85 Pounds (a mere 200 Canadian $). An outrage, I say. Luckily, by booking via BA we only paid CDN $ 118 - a great deal less. As to location, indeed, it's great - if the weather would not have been as miserable as it was - both times - upon arrival/departure from London. Yes, it is an exciting city, great culture, civilized people - once you understand their accent - and vice versa... However, it is sooooo overrated. Upon checking in the second time, we arrived at the hotel just before midnight. The next morning we asked if we could check out one hour past the obligatory 11 AM (!!!???) check-out time? The answer was brief: nyet (NO). Long live Portugal, where CDN $ 2 buys you a litre (!!!) of very good Vino Verde. In London Town? You pay 91 Pounds (CDN$ 225) to get from downtown to the airport via cab - due to trains regularly breaking down/being serviced - with no alternative offered to stranded passengers. But, as Monsieur Kippling used to say, that is an entirely another story - shall we?My fellow Canadians, I say, thank God for Canada!!! We are so spoiled!! Go, visit London!! You'll see... Have a pleasant stay!HJB Vancouver, British Columbia CanadaP.S. My partner and I, both fairly educated people, wonder: why is that that the British pound is much stronger than the US $ - or, 2.5 times stronger than the Canadian currency? We've seen no evidence of British superiority - when it comes to infrastructure or quality of life. Nothing close to what we are used to here in Canada. Please, don't you come and quote me culture and theatre now - there is only that much I can take. After that, I may need to take a cab - which cost me 12 pounds (30 CDN $) for a 10 minutes ride from the hotel to London Liverpool Street Station. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Cheap Price”
Reviews.Author: MickeyDrexelHillPA
Reviews.Content: Must admit, after reading reviews from others prior to my trip Mar 10-14, 2004, I did not expect much. Glad to say, expectations met and exceeded. No, not top of the line; No, not classy; Yes, there are better, but for the money, this was a good deal. Downside was the odor of smoke once you entered the lobby, but the room was one of the remodeled rooms (small), clean and smoke-free! Staff was friendly and courteous at front desk even though it was always busy. The "Continental" breakfast was nothing to write home about but you could get a cup of coffee, tea and juice to get you started. How bad can toast be??? Offerings were limited and not posh but they were enough to get you started as you went out and began your days. I'd stay there again. If all you are looking for in a hotel is a clean, comfortable place to lay your head at night, then the Royal National Hotel, with it's great location to the sites, is the place to go. If you want to be pampered, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal National on 31st January 2004 & I must say after reading all the other reviews I wasnt looking forward to our break ( we even looked the night before on the web about changing our hotel!) When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised, the lobby was large with a lot of amenities such as several cafe/bars, restaurants, hairdressers & even an authentic London Pub! We had a very speedy check in & found our rooms with ease. The rooms were very clean, kettle in room, adequate sized bathroom with a powerful shower, tv etc. Breakfast was served in a bright & airy dining room on the ground floor & was of good quality, our package included the full english breakfast although most were on continental but for a Â£4 supp you could have a hot meal. Our only complaint would be room service, avoid ordering hot food, ours was flat cold, oh, & the Â£1.50 service charge is per item not per order as stated on the menu! But it was 1am on a Saturday night & we were not in The Ritz so I dont suppose you could expect much more. Overall, fantastic location, clean rooms, plenty of amenities & at the end of the day its very reasonable priced for a central London hotel. I am a travel Manager from the UK & we are very well travelled people we have stayed in 3-5* hotels all over the world and I would NOT rate this in the bottom half. I would stay there again & for a short break away would recommend it to my clients. Its not 5* luxury but is well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok if you like dungeons...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel is like staying in a huge, over used college dormitory that hasn't seen a lick of paint or care in years. It resembles a prison or a state hospital. The bedspreads in my room didn't match. The TV and phone were bolted to the furniture. The day I checked in, there were over 300 people waiting to check in before me, and most of them were students with backpacks from everywhere. Needless to say, the hotel is very noisy. A few of the elevators were broken when I was there, so that was another problem. Apparently, the newer section has better rooms, but they wouldn't allow us to upgrade to them. We were allowed one towel per person per day. God forbid you should want to wash your hair and need another towel, because when I politely asked the housekeeping staff (who according to other messages on this site are soooo wonderful...) for another towel...they told me NO. Just NO, I could NOT have another towel. And the joys of your continental breakfast...You need to leave your room and walk down a few halls (apparently we were quite a distance from the breakfast room). Once you get there they check your room key. If by chance, you left it with your roommate in the room, you'll need to trek back to get it, because they won't give you your rolls and coffee without one. Apparently they think that someone would try to sneak into their hotel to make off with the "delightful" breakfast. Oh yes, another thing. If you get to the room early, you'll get the decent rolls, if you get there later, you get the ghastly rolls from god-knows-where. Then you get to trek back to your room and attempt to enjoy your repast in the confines of your room. One last thing, The hotel was clean. Not spotless, mind you, but I can't complain about the cleanliness. Hey, if you're a student, and/or don't care about the decor, then this place is for you. But it's definitely not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: anonymousreviewer047
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal National Hotel in November. As other reviewers, I found the hotel through British Airways. I don't understand why BA would want to be associated with a nightmare like this. My main reason for not recommending the RNH is the staff. The housekeepers are pleasant, but the front desk clerks are beyond rude. In ten years of travel on four continents I can honestly say I have never encountered such unpleasant people. They act as if the guest is the enemy: snapping answers to questions, ignoring guests who have come to the desk, providing grossly incorrect information. They couldn't care less about you, and why should they? There will always be some gullible tour group that doesn't know any better to book their rooms. Quite honestly, you could find a B&B or another hotel in London that will provide similar (or better) standards for the same price. Stay somewhere else where you will be respected and treated like a human being.

Reviews.Title: “Miss Your College Dorm? Then Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We ended up here on a British Airways Package. The place is huge, with Soviet-style bleak architecture and a "new" wing where you will feel like you're at Summer Camp. If you must stay here, stay in the orignal hotel.The breakfast room has all the charm of an airport coffee shop- if that. This is a huge tourist machine that has lockable doors on the rooms, a surface to sleep on and hot and cold water. That's about all I could say about it. If you like this place you'll want to spend alot of time in Eastern Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my stay here during the Christmas break of 2003. As others pointed out, it is definitely noisy if you get a room with windows onto the quadrangle. Ask for a room that has windos on to one of the streets. Other than that, the staff at the front-desk as well as housekeeping were very courteous and friendly. The place was quite clean, and is in a good location. Less than five minutes walk to the British Museum. The Brunswick shopping center is three minutes walk, and has a Safeway store.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad but quite noisy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have been there for 3 nights a couple of years ago. London hotels are among the most expensive in the world and this is probably one of the cheapest hotels in London, surely is the cheapest offering in-room bathroom, so do not expect a first class 5 star luxury accomodation. Furnitures are old and "salvation army" style, walls dirty and stained, it's quite noisy and breakfast must be taken in the room. Nevertheless rooms and linen are clean, nothing to except. In-room bathroom is a great plus for me so I would probably return there if I have the same budget but definitely choose another hotel if I have some more pound in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during Christmas Vacation 12/25 - 12/29/2003 with my husband and two young children. The service/front desk staff were very friendly, the room/maid service was responsive and friendly. The rooms were clean, and the hotel overall was decent and definitely a good buy. This is not someplace you'd go on your honeymoon but it is definitely worth staying here if you're on a mini vacation and out doing the tourist thing most of the time. I'd put it in the medium category of a U S hotel, something like a new and well kept Holiday Inn, or Comfort Inn. It isn't fancy but it's in a good location, it's clean and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “One More Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Royal National on three occasions, I found it comfortable & I love the Russell Square neighborhood. I must say it's not the best I've stayed in in London but for the price & my time in the hotel itself, it's wonderful. Everyone on each stay has been kind & helpful...I'm stay here again this coming March 2004!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in the first week of December and I have to say I was very pleased with it. I went to London woth my University, there was a total of over 100 of us staying there. Before I went I read the reviews and I have to say I was very apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. But I was pleasantly surprised. To look at from the outside the hotel is nothing, but inside it is clean and tidy, and all the rooms our group had were immaculate, warm and spacious. The breakfast wasnt great, but there was plenty of toast, fresh rolls and cereal. My room had a T.V and coffee making facilites and the bathroom was great with a bath and shower, although the bath would be quite hard to get into if you aren't very mobile as it's quite high. If you want something cheap, clean and comfy in the centre of London, go here!!! P.S, It wasnt at all noisy, even with all 100 of our 18 year olds!! And I don't think they let people smoke there anymore, because it wasn't smoky at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a one night stay with 8 other people in my party. The least I expected was some long-life milk for my tea in my room. Instead there were some disgusting powdered milk sachets. They provided no shampoo and the soap was contained inside paper. Classy or what?? The room was cold as the radiator had been turned off and the television was not working. Bad enough.hmmmm the following morning breakfast time was like a guessing game. Where everything was, was a complete mystery. The tea and coffee urns were hidden in an alcove, with NO tea pots or coffee pots available AT ALL. It was while searching for cutlery I actually came upon them. And the milk jugs had cereal particles all over the spouts.Mind you ! the fried eggs come recommended, stay away from this overpriced shabby excuse for a 3* hotel. AND I AM NO SNOBBISH PERSON,JUST WORKING CLASS AND WILL NEVER, EVER BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “The Service Sucks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the lobby is filled with people from the tour group. We have to wait for quite sometime to get hold of the receiptionist. The stay made you feel like you are in some kind of camp. The hotel is full with people all the time, and it made the stay so uncomfortable. The breakfast is bad. Hot breakfast is provided at extra cost, and the line is quite long, as there are a lot of guest in the hotel. The so called "concierge" desk does not seems to know anything, unfriendly, ignorant and useless! How can these people work in hotel line? We will never come back to this hotel again! For 85 sterling pound per nite, I think you can get better place elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE stay away !!”
Reviews.Author: drpixie
Reviews.Content: the housekeeping is the only thing that is polite and efficient otherwise the hotel is badly managed and the people at the front desk are rude. no matter how much you think you are saving, totally not worth the experience. They had a bad attitude. I came off a 8 hour flight, fatigued, with a baby. Despite the fact they assured me over the phone that i would have a swift check in, and my reservation was on their system, they made me wait 6 hours before they gave me a room (insane !!), didnt tell me where the room was, when i got to it, it was dingy place, there were loud gurgling noises coming from the pipes in the wall and i couldnt sleep. To top it off, we got sick off the food. The homeless on the street of london have more class than the management at this hotel. They are too big, and they can't thier volume. stay far away, there are far more accomodating places to stay !!

HotelInfo.Name: Royal National Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Bedford Way at Russell Square, London WC1H 0DG, England
